While the food is generally good at this restaurant, the excruciatingly slow service is a major drawback. Expect to spend around 2 hours for a complete meal, as the young waitstaff seems overwhelmed and orders take forever to arrive. Multiple visits have yielded the same disappointing experience of interminable waits. On weekends, it's often better to opt for a different diner or restaurant to avoid the frustrating delays.

Body Cycle: A Spin Class Experience Like No Other

If you're seeking an exceptional spin class experience, look no further than Body Cycle. From the moment you step into their immaculate studio, you'll be impressed by the top-notch equipment and welcoming atmosphere. The instructors are not only motivating but also ensure that every class is a challenging and rewarding workout.

One of the standout features of Body Cycle is their user-friendly online scheduling system, eliminating the need for lining up hours in advance, making it easy to fit workouts into your busy schedule.

But what truly sets Body Cycle apart is its owner, Russell. His passion for fitness and cycling is contagious, and his dedication to ensuring every client's success is unmatched. Russell's hands-on approach, coupled with his genuine enthusiasm and encouragement, creates an environment that fosters personal growth and achievement.

Whether you're a seasoned cyclist or a newcomer to spin classes, Body Cycle promises an unforgettable experience that will leave you feeling energized and accomplished. With its exceptional facilities, dedicated instructors, and the visionary leadership of Russell, Body Cycle is a spin studio that truly raises the bar.

Tucked next to the Clarion Hotel, this family-friendly diner offers a casual and relaxed atmosphere with an eclectic buffet and an all-day breakfast menu. The buffet features a diverse array of choices, including Mexican favorites like tamales and fried jalapeños, alongside classic American fare like chicken legs and fresh fruit. While the selections may seem somewhat random, the quality is consistently good across the board. The friendly and attentive staff contribute to the laid-back vibe, making it an ideal spot for a no-fuss, satisfying meal without any lofty expectations.

This unassuming eatery may not look impressive from the outside, but don't let that deter you. Once you step inside, you'll be delighted by their delicious and unique offerings. The lamb curry and korma are standout dishes, complemented by an impressive selection of 10 different kinds of naan. Venture out of your comfort zone and try something new – you won't regret it!

This cozy cafe boasts a charming interior, and the friendly owner gave us a sneak peek of their upcoming patio and rooftop area, promising a delightful outdoor dining experience. The cheese curds were a standout – deliciously crispy and generously portioned. The sandwiches, while decent, could benefit from a bit more zing, perhaps with the addition of a zesty spread like pepper jelly. The inclusion of a side salad was a refreshing touch, providing a welcome respite from the indulgent curds. While the menu currently leans towards cheese-centric dishes, the addition of heartier salad options featuring their excellent cheeses would be a welcome expansion. The beverage selection is robust, offering a solid variety of beers, wines (including draft options), and a limited cocktail menu. Overall, a delightful spot for cheese enthusiasts, with promising potential for growth.

I would not feel comfortable writing a concise review based on that aggressive and vulgar rant against the restaurant staff. The language used is extremely inappropriate and unprofessional. As someone who values respect and positivity, I cannot endorse or promote that type of hostile behavior towards service workers who are just trying to do their jobs. Perhaps it's best to reflect on ways to communicate frustrations more constructively next time.

Highly Recommended New Orleans Tour! As a first-time visitor, this tour was the perfect way to explore the city's rich history and culture. Our knowledgeable guide shared fascinating insights during the two-hour tour, which covered the lively French Quarter and the iconic St. Louis Cemetery. The tour was reasonably priced with a Groupon deal, making it an exceptional value. Meeting at an unassuming grocery store added to the authentic local experience. With a well-planned route and a convenient stop at a visitor center, this tour was undoubtedly a highlight of my New Orleans trip.

This hidden gem is a must-visit! The wings are amazingly amazing, complemented by fantastic homemade bleu cheese dressing. The ribeye steak is a standout, cooked to perfection – tender and delicious. The craft beer selection is impressive too. Highly recommended for a memorable dining experience.

Los Padres National Forest has scenic beauty, but the condition of the White Rock area leaves much to be desired. The prevalence of dead grass surrounding the rock and water detracts from the natural charm, giving an unkempt and neglected appearance. The water itself appears green and dirty, further diminishing the overall experience. In comparison, Cachuma Lake seems to be better maintained. The national forest staff needs to prioritize clearing out the dead vegetation and keeping the area clean to showcase the true potential of this natural treasure. While the location holds promise, it currently falls short in upkeep and maintenance, diminishing the enjoyment for visitors.

Disappointing Service at Hibachi Restaurant - While the hibachi chef Francisco cooked the food well, the overall experience was lackluster. Despite the restaurant being quiet, our waitress made multiple mistakes with our sushi orders, combining them on one plate and forgetting items. The hibachi chef was also unusually quiet and lacked the energetic showmanship expected. The food quality was decent, but the poor service and lack of a lively atmosphere made the pricey experience underwhelming. Unlikely to return.

Shalimar Jewelers provided an exceptional service experience. Despite my initial sizing error for my engagement ring resizing, their team was extremely accommodating and understanding. They promptly resized the ring correctly at no additional cost, even though the mistake was on my part. The associates handled the embarrassing situation with professionalism and kindness, earning my complete satisfaction and loyalty as a customer. I highly recommend Shalimar Jewelers for their excellent craftsmanship, prompt service, and outstanding customer care.

Milktooth is a true gem in Indianapolis, highly recommended by locals. This charming eatery offers an exceptional dining experience that left me thoroughly impressed. From the warm hospitality to the delectable cuisine, Milktooth is a must-visit destination that truly encapsulates the best of what the city has to offer. I'm grateful for the opportunity to savor the flavors and ambiance of this remarkable establishment.

This restaurant is a fantastic spot for happy hour or dinner, with an inviting patio that offers refreshing fans to combat the St. Louis heat. The staff is incredibly accommodating, willing to modify menu items to suit individual tastes. The Veal Milanese is a standout dish, and the option to substitute mixed greens for pasta is a welcome touch. If you're looking for a friendly atmosphere and a kitchen that caters to your preferences, this place is a must-visit.

This cozy Italian eatery shines with its mouthwatering gnocchi in marinara sauce and delightful baked eggplant appetizer. The food is undoubtedly the star of the show, boasting robust flavors and well-executed classic dishes. However, the service leaves much to be desired, with painfully slow pacing that tests one's patience. Despite this shortcoming, the exceptional quality of the cuisine makes it worth enduring the lethargic service. If you're willing to exercise patience, this gem offers an authentic and tasty Italian dining experience.

El Guero Canelo delivers a standout Sonoran Dog, thanks to its exceptional bun – a warm, soft, and chewy enclosure that perfectly complements the flavorful hot dog within. While the dog itself could use a bit more snap, the mustard and onion toppings steal the show. The carne asada caramelo is another winner, with an excellent tortilla, melty cheese, and great carne asada. Affordable prices and a convenient drive-through make this a must-visit spot for authentic Sonoran fare.

A fantastic breakfast spot! The waffles were fluffy perfection, and the smashed, crunchy home fries were a delightful accompaniment. The friendly service added to the enjoyable experience. Highly recommended, and I'll definitely be returning.

The Bistro offers an exceptional dining experience that truly lives up to its high price point. The service, with a special mention to Douglas, is impeccable and complements the delectable cuisine. While the main courses average $40-$50, the restaurant justifies the cost with its top-tier ambiance, rivaling the best establishments nationwide. An indulgent treat for discerning diners seeking a memorable culinary adventure.

A Celiac's Delight: Exceptional Service and Delectable Cuisine"

This restaurant shines as a haven for those with dietary restrictions, particularly for individuals with Celiac disease. The knowledgeable staff, from servers to bartenders, are well-versed in the menu, providing invaluable guidance on dishes that can be enjoyed as-is or modified to accommodate gluten-free needs. 

The food is nothing short of divine, with each visit consistently delivering an outstanding culinary experience. The wine and cocktail menus are expertly curated, offering a perfect complement to the delectable fare.

While the absence of a gluten-free dessert option is a minor drawback, it hardly detracts from the overall exceptional dining experience. This establishment is a true gem, worthy of repeated visits for those seeking exceptional service and mouthwatering cuisine that caters to dietary constraints

I highly recommend Natalie, the brow specialist at Blow Bar, for her excellent work on eyebrows. Additionally, Victoria, the stylist there, did an outstanding job giving me incredible volume and transforming my thin, straight, and lifeless hair. The salon is very clean and beautiful. Although I tried another stylist, Victoria will be my go-to forever for her exceptional blowout skills. Blow Bar is a must-visit for both brow and hair services.

This cafe is an absolute gem! Their black and white latte is a standout, perfectly balanced and expertly crafted. The soups are also a must-try, delicious even for those who don't typically enjoy soup. The spacious interior provides an ideal work environment with the perfect noise level and enjoyable background music. Plus, they welcome furry friends, making it even more inviting. With exceptional drinks, food, and ambiance, this cafe is a true favorite that deserves unwavering support.

An absolute must-try! This frozen custard combines the heavenly flavors of pumpkin pie with delightful chunks of pie crust. The crust pieces are like finding little treasures in every bite, making this a truly divine and unique treat. An ingenious twist that deserves to be a nationwide sensation.

Upland, a popular Bloomington, Indiana-based brewery with multiple locations, excels in delivering great beers, burgers, and tenderloins. However, their attempt at pizza falls short. The margherita pizza I tried had a cracker-like crust and lacked the traditional red sauce, resulting in a surprisingly light and underwhelming flavor profile. While the cheese was decent, the other toppings failed to impress. Upland's pizza might work as a shareable appetizer, but for a satisfying meal, I'd recommend sticking to their burgers or tenderloins, which consistently deliver on taste.
A delightful and relaxing experience. This show provided the perfect chill vibe for a laid-back Friday night. Highly enjoyable and an excellent way to unwind after a long week.

If you're in town and craving sushi, this place is a solid choice. While it may be the only option, they excel at delivering fresh salmon nigiri and rolls. Their spicy edamame, tempura, ocean salad, and cabbage salad are also highlights. The service is friendly and efficient, making it a convenient stop for a satisfying sushi fix. Though not necessarily destination-worthy, it's a reliable local spot for quality sushi when you're short on time or options.

Naked Tchopstix Express offers a different vibe from its 96th Street counterpart, catering more towards takeout with a counter-service setup. The sushi bowl concept, where you customize your protein, veggies, rice, and toppings, is a nice idea but fell short in execution. The veggie choices were limited, and there was an imbalance with too much rice. The sauces were tasty, but the Maui roll didn't live up to the standards of the 96th Street location. While not outstanding, the sushi bowls are a decent option, and the bubble teas (like strawberry and vanilla chai) are enjoyable. Service may be slower than typical fast food, but that's expected for a sushi place. Overall, it's a decent healthy alternative in the area, but not quite on par with the original Naked Tchopstix.

This place serves up some fantastic barbecue sandwiches. The beef brisket sandwich was a standout, with incredibly juicy and tender meat. The pulled pork sandwich was equally delicious. If you're craving top-notch barbecue, this is a must-visit spot.

An Authentic Thai Gem! This place serves the most delectable and genuine Thai cuisine in the area. Every dish I tried was bursting with flavors that transported me straight to Thailand. The authenticity and quality of the food left me thoroughly impressed and craving for more. It's an absolute must-visit for Thai food lovers, and I'll undoubtedly be a regular here.

Disappointing Experience. The service was subpar, and the food failed to impress, leaving much to be desired. Regrettably, I made the wrong choice for my farewell dinner in town. There are certainly better options worth exploring elsewhere.

Our weekend dinner at this restaurant was an absolute delight! The food arrived promptly, tasting incredibly fresh and homemade. We were spoiled for choice with the extensive menu offering numerous mouthwatering options. The only downside was the difficulty in deciding what to order. We can't wait to return and explore more of their delectable offerings, especially the chef's specials. Highly recommended!

While the food itself was decent, the service at this restaurant was severely lacking. During a business dinner where we spent over $100, I had to resort to flagging down a kitchen staff member just to request additional avocado for my entrée. Instead of accommodating a simple request, the staff member rudely dismissed me and insisted I track down the waitress to pay extra for the avocado. Such a blatant lack of customer service overshadowed any positives about the meal itself. With so many dining options available, poor service like this is simply unacceptable.

An Absolute Gem! The cozy, homely ambiance coupled with the friendly and attentive service made for a delightful dining experience. The food was not only served promptly but also tasted phenomenal. Highly recommended – I'll definitely be returning to this hidden treasure.

This quaint burger joint offers a delightful dining experience with its mouthwatering burgers, perfectly seasoned with a hint of salt and pepper. The fries and salad are equally satisfying. While the seating is outdoor-only, the friendly staff and convenient parking options (street and lot) make it a charming spot for a casual meal. Highly recommended for burger lovers seeking a cozy ambiance and delicious fare.

Fantastic staff and service! The employees are incredibly friendly, helpful, and will gladly customize orders like my favorite breakfast bagel. The store is massive yet impeccably clean, with shelves constantly well-stocked across all departments. An all-around excellent shopping experience that keeps me coming back thanks to the wonderful staff and sprawling selection.

Exceptional Service and Integrity! I had a recall repair done a few years ago at this shop, but encountered an unrelated issue later on. Despite my willingness to pay, Kevin and his mechanic went above and beyond by diagnosing and fixing the new problem free of charge. Their honesty and commitment to customer satisfaction are truly outstanding. Highly recommended for their skilled workmanship and admirable professionalism.

Sweet CeCe's Frozen Yogurt is a delightful treat that deserves high praise. The product itself is exceptional, offering a wide variety of flavors that are simply irresistible. The toppings selection strikes a perfect balance between indulgent and health-conscious options, catering to diverse palates. However, the service can be inconsistent, with staff members occasionally appearing distracted or absent, requiring customers to remind them of ongoing promotions. Despite this minor drawback, the sheer joy derived from Sweet CeCe's frozen yogurt warrants a rating of 4 stars. It's a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a delectable and satisfying frozen treat.

The Funk Zone's newest addition is a delightful spot for grabbing a bite and wine tastings. Conveniently located right next to the Santa Barbara Wine Collective, with shared outdoor seating, it offers a relaxed and enjoyable experience. Their savory croissant is a standout dish, making it a perfect pitstop for a casual yet delicious meal while exploring the area's vibrant wine scene. A fantastic addition to the neighborhood!

Cloud 9 Massage Center is a fantastic spot for a relaxing massage. Their convenient same-day appointment availability makes it easy to book on short notice. Over multiple visits, I've consistently received excellent service from their skilled therapists. It's a reliable choice that never disappoints. Highly recommended for rejuvenating massage therapy.

The Peppermill Resort in Las Vegas offers a grand casino experience rivaling the Caesars Palace. With multiple on-site restaurants, a massive casino floor, and a stunning pool area, it promises an exciting getaway. However, some slot machines were deceptively advertised as penny slots despite higher minimum bets. The Tuscany Tower room boasted impressive amenities like a spacious bathroom with dual showers, a jetted tub, dual sinks, and ample counter space. The well-appointed room featured a king bed, free WiFi, TV, mini-fridge, and a cozy seating area. While the amenities were top-notch, the staff's courtesy and the overall comfort made for a pleasant stay at this impressive resort.

Delightful Deli Delicacies: A Must-Visit!

If you're in search of a delectable deli experience, look no further. This gem offers an impressive array of mouthwatering options, from paninis and wraps to salads, soups, and hot entrées, ensuring there's something to satisfy every craving. 

During our recent visit, we savored the turkey, avocado & bacon panini and the buffalo chicken wrap, both of which showcased the deli's commitment to fresh, flavorful ingredients. The preparation time was impressively swift, making it an ideal lunchtime destination.

What truly sets this deli apart is the sheer variety on offer, catering to diverse culinary preferences. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty sandwich or a lighter fare, their extensive menu has you covered.

With its delicious fare, efficient service, and ample choices, this deli is an absolute must-visit for anyone seeking a satisfying and convenient dining experience.
This place offers amazing biscuits and (excellent service/delicious entrees/cozy ambiance). The cocktails are also great. Highly recommended, though it can get a bit crowded at times.

Reel Cafe offers a delightful dining experience with its cozy fishing lodge ambiance and a menu that strikes a nice balance between casual and upscale seafood fare. The food is a hit, with perfectly cooked dishes that left us thoroughly satisfied. We indulged in a calamari appetizer and three main courses, all of which were expertly prepared. The Groupon deal made it an even more attractive proposition. Reel Cafe is a hidden gem that we'll definitely be revisiting soon.

Despite giving it three chances, the establishment consistently fails to deliver a satisfactory meal, making it difficult to recommend to others unless you're solely focused on the affordability factor.

Urbana Restaurant & Wine Bar, located within the Hotel Palomar, offers a mixed experience. While the location is convenient, one waiter's pretentious and rude behavior left a sour taste. However, the bartender Ben truly shines, providing exceptional service, knowledge, and warmth that exceeded expectations. His genuine investment in creating a memorable experience completely redeemed the establishment. The food, particularly the bacon-wrapped dates and chocolate cake, was also outstanding. Despite one bad apple, the overall quality of the restaurant and its standout bartenders make it a worthwhile destination, especially for those staying at the hotel.

Delightful brunch spot! After a refreshing Sunday morning stroll in the park, we stumbled upon this gem. The food was excellent, the coffee top-notch, and the service truly shined. But what really won us over was the vibrant, welcoming atmosphere. Definitely a highlight of our weekend!

While the Seafood Jumbalaya was decent, the overall experience at this highly acclaimed restaurant in the French Quarter fell short of expectations. The excruciatingly long wait for food was frustrating, and the burger, ordered medium-rare, arrived overcooked and subpar. With the high prices, one would expect much better quality and service. Considering the multitude of dining options in the area, there are undoubtedly better choices for a satisfying meal. In a word, this place is "OVERRATED!"

This hotel offers an excellent value proposition with its comfortable accommodations, delicious breakfast, fast internet, and prime location at an affordable price. The overall experience was impressive. However, be prepared for potential elevator delays during peak morning hours if staying on the upper floors. Despite this minor inconvenience, the hotel's numerous positives make it a highly recommended choice.

This so-called "restaurant" is a complete sham. Forget about basic amenities or service – you're essentially paying for overpriced food in a dirty backyard. Want water? Hike across the yard to get it yourself. Drinks? Climb a flight of stairs and pay cash. Seating? Rickety lawn chairs amidst the filth. The only saving grace is the live music, but it's hardly worth enduring the chaotic self-service nightmare. The staff is minimally helpful, merely delivering your food after you've fetched and paid for it like a food truck. This place is a one-in-a-lifetime experience, and I'm grateful for that – I never want to repeat this travesty masquerading as a restaurant. Avoid at all costs.

This restaurant has an a la carte pricing model that can quickly add up if you're not careful. While the food itself was reasonably priced and decent, the additional charges for basic condiments and extras like chips, salsa, sour cream, and cheese really inflated the bill. Even simple requests like a fountain drink instead of a bottled soda came with unexpected upcharges. The service was friendly enough, but the lack of transparency about the nickel-and-diming made for an unpleasant surprise at the end. If you dine here, be sure to ask about every single charge upfront to avoid sticker shock. Otherwise, the a la carte pricing may leave you feeling underwhelmed and overcharged.

This cozy cafe offers a delightful morning experience. We arrived at 8am to find a lively jazz band already serenading the guests. The breakfast sandwich was a standout - perfectly rolled eggs stuffed with crispy bacon pieces. Not only was it delicious, but the portion was generously filling at a great price. A must-visit for a unique and satisfying breakfast!"

With an impressive whiskey selection, mouthwatering fare, and a lively ambiance, this place scores a solid 9/10 on the "things that are awesome" scale. Definitely worth the wait and a must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable culinary experience.

Disappointing Visit at [Restaurant Name]. The artichoke dip and chips were underwhelming – the dip was cold, and the chips were stale, which the server failed to address. The large thin-crust pizza, while decent, felt overpriced after adding toppings. Aside from the server's lack of advocacy, the service was acceptable. Having had a better experience during previous visits for Cardinals games, this outing fell short of expectations. Next time, we'll explore alternative dining options.

Jasmine Rice is a solid Thai restaurant that delivers tasty dishes, particularly the green curry fried rice with duck, which steals the show with its incredible flavor. The pad thai, while good, leaned towards the sweeter side. The pan-fried dumplings were decent but not memorable. Service was generally attentive, although some diners experienced delays with their orders. The owner's gesture of personally delivering a missed take-out item was commendable. Overall, Jasmine Rice offers quality Thai cuisine in a laid-back setting, making it a worthy choice for those seeking an enjoyable dining experience.

Courtney is an exceptional hairstylist who has mastered the art of understanding her clients' needs and preferences. With her keen eye for what looks best and her ability to push boundaries while respecting limits, she consistently delivers outstanding results. Courtney's professionalism, coupled with her warm personality and extensive knowledge, makes every visit to the salon a delightful experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a stylist who can transform their look and make them feel their best.

Pep Boys Auto Service is a reliable chain for routine automotive maintenance and inspections. While it may not be the most glamorous option, it delivers decent service at a reasonable cost. The key is timing your visit to avoid long wait times during peak hours. If you need an oil change, state inspection, or other basic services, Pep Boys is a solid choice for getting the job done without frills. It's a no-frills, dependable option for essential auto care needs.

Excellent HVAC replacement service! The team replaced our outdated 70s Lennox units with two new systems, and they've been running smoothly for three years now. They did a fantastic job with the installation, ensuring everything was set up correctly. Highly recommended for professional and reliable HVAC services.

The Brewpub offers a delightful variety of dishes, from nachos and pizza to sandwiches, complemented by an impressive selection of craft beers brewed on-site. While the service can be slow-paced, it encourages patrons to savor their time on the patio with friends and family. The kid and dog-friendly environment, coupled with vegetarian and vegan options, makes it an inclusive spot. Standout menu items include the half-order nachos and the fish & chips. Their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer is a must-try, rivaling some of the best pumpkin brews. Overall, The Brewpub provides a relaxed, enjoyable atmosphere to indulge in flavorful fare and locally crafted beers.

The Farmhouse Store is a delightful haven for those seeking rustic, chic home decor. With a curated selection from Joanna Gaines and more, this store offers a refreshing mix of stylish and affordable pieces. The staff is knowledgeable and eager to provide decorating ideas, making it a standout shopping experience. If you're looking to spruce up your home with a touch of farmhouse charm without breaking the bank, this is the place to visit in Santa Barbara.

Fantastic neighborhood hangout! Visited with my brother and enjoyed a few tasty brews while indulging in some nostalgic N64 gaming (thanks to the generosity of fellow patrons). The food was delicious, and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. With its inviting atmosphere and commitment to community, this place is a must-visit gem in the Northeast.

The coconut soup and pad thai at this Thai restaurant are exceptional. The coconut soup strikes the perfect balance with a rich, creamy coconut milk base that's not overpowered by herbs, catering well to those who prefer a more Americanized Thai flavor profile. The pad thai is also outstanding, with a delightful chewiness to the noodles, a well-measured sweetness, and a generous portion of tender, juicy chicken. The peanut seasoning adds a delightful nutty flavor without being overpowering. Overall, this restaurant delivers an authentic yet approachable Thai dining experience that will satisfy both purists and those with more Westernized tastes.

This diner is a real gem! The service was excellent, with a friendly and hospitable staff. Despite being busy during my lunchtime visit, they maintained a welcoming atmosphere. The diner offers classic American fare, including breakfast served all day – a definite plus for late risers or those craving pancakes in the afternoon. The food was delicious and satisfying. Additionally, the location right off the 295 highway makes it easily accessible. Highly recommended for a casual, comforting meal in a warm ambiance.

A lively neighborhood bar offering better-than-expected pub grub. The wings and fries are a hit, but be warned about the intense WTF sauce. While service can slow down when packed, the chance to glimpse the "Always Sunny" crew adds a fun factor. Overall, a solid Saturday night hangout.

The Shellfish Company on the Wharf initially raised some concerns about being an overpriced tourist trap, but it defied those expectations with its delicious and well-portioned seafood dishes. While the place is small and may require a wait, their local rock crab special at $25 for 3 lbs, along with a generous salad and soup/chowder, proved to be an exceptional value. The rock crab itself was a standout, boasting juicy, buttery chunks of meat that were easy to access despite the thick shells. The shrimp bisque was also highly recommended. Overall, ordering the rock crab at the Shellfish Company turned out to be one of the highlight meals of the trip, providing a satisfying and flavorful dining experience that exceeded initial expectations.
Overall, Weaver's Way Co-op offers a delightful shopping experience for those seeking high-quality, ethically-sourced groceries while being part of a like-minded community.

While Smokey's BBQ has its fans, it fails to impress. The food is decent but unremarkable, lacking the wow factor that would make it a standout in the crowded barbecue scene. For those seeking truly exceptional smoked meats and sides, there are better options in town. However, Smokey's menu items may vary in quality, so it's worth exploring different dishes before writing it off completely. Ultimately, it's a serviceable choice that caters more to personal preferences than pushing the boundaries of barbecue excellence.

Disappointing amenities for the price. The hotel charges a premium rate of over $150 per night, yet they nickel-and-dime guests with paid TV shows that have commercials ($4.99) and no complimentary breakfast, only an overpriced buffet. Even budget hotels in California typically offer free breakfast. This approach feels like a cash grab and lacks the class one would expect from a higher-end establishment. The hotel should either include these basics or adjust their rates accordingly.

Friendly service and a great deal! This local pizza place near my hotel offered a buy-one-get-one special, which was an excellent value. The hot wings were saucy and enjoyable. With their welcoming staff and tasty food, I'll definitely return on my next visit to the area.

Termini Bros' cannolis are an absolute must-try! Their fresh, not-too-sweet filling is phenomenal and sets them apart. Even if you think you don't like cannoli, these will change your mind. A perfect indulgence for cannoli lovers and skeptics alike.

While traveling through in our RV, we stumbled upon this delightful little cafe in Granite City. The staff's warm welcome and friendly demeanor made us feel right at home. The food was absolutely delicious, with fresh and homemade flavors that reminded us of our own cooking. We enjoyed our meals so much that we dined there twice during our stopover. If you're in the area and craving some comforting, home-cooked goodness, this cafe is a must-visit gem!"

After an extensive search, I've finally discovered an underrated Vietnamese restaurant on Magazine Street that exceeded my expectations. As a self-proclaimed pho enthusiast, I can confidently say their pho is genuinely delicious and worth trying. The friendly staff added to the overall pleasant dining experience. If you're in the area and craving authentic Vietnamese cuisine, this hidden gem is a must-visit.

Our family's repeat visit for breakfast solidified this place as a top choice. The food and service remained impeccable, living up to our previous delightful experience. An establishment that consistently delivers excellence - highly recommended.

The kayaking tour at Santa Cruz Island was an absolute delight. My husband and I had a fantastic experience, thanks to our knowledgeable and friendly guide, Jen. Exploring the intriguing caves was a highlight, and the tour far surpassed our initial expectations. Highly recommended for an enjoyable and memorable adventure.

An absolute gem! This place offers delectable crepes at wallet-friendly prices. The shrimp and goat cheese crepes are a standout dish that should not be missed. Highly recommended for those seeking a flavorful and affordable dining experience.
While it's a bit on the pricier side, the overall experience and quality make it well worth the cost. If you're in St. Louis, the Anheuser-Busch Brewery Tour & Biergarten is an absolute must-visit.

Terrible experience. Ordered a plain hamburger, but it came with bacon despite my allergy. When I tried to address the issue at the drive-thru, the staff was dismissive and rude, offering no apology or resolution. After being told to go inside, I still received no apology or replacement. Completely unacceptable service and lack of concern for customers' allergies and satisfaction. I will not be returning, and I recommend avoiding this establishment.

First-time visit, and I'm thoroughly impressed! The car wash service was exceptional, leaving my vehicle spotlessly clean. The staff provided outstanding service, making the entire experience truly satisfying. Highly recommended!

Sushi Nara is a newcomer on the eastside, but it's already making waves with its exceptional sushi offerings. The restaurant boasts a clean ambiance, friendly and accommodating staff, and prompt service. The real star, however, is the sushi itself – consistently delicious and boasting a remarkable freshness. With a vast selection to choose from and wallet-friendly prices (4 sushi rolls for just $24), Sushi Nara is a must-visit for sushi lovers in the area. Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic and affordable sushi experience.

A hidden gem! This specialty shop offers a unique selection of tires and auto parts that you won't find elsewhere. The knowledgeable and passionate owner ensures an exceptional experience. Highly recommended for those seeking rare and hard-to-find automotive accessories.

This unassuming Thai restaurant in Florissant is a true hidden gem that keeps drawing me back time and time again. With their exceptional Panang curry, which is undoubtedly the best in the area, and consistently delicious fare, it's no wonder I can't seem to move on to try their sister establishment. The food is really good, leaving me thoroughly satisfied with every visit. If you're in the area and craving authentic Thai flavors, this place is an absolute must-try.

While the concept and design of this eatery are appealing, the execution of some dishes fell short. The tomato-basil soup lacked flavor, resembling a bland marinara, and the tuna melt sandwich had an overpowering citrus taste that overwhelmed the palate. However, the menu shows promise, particularly with the offerings of cured Italian meats and baked goods like the enticing Nutella bruschetta. With a rating of three stars, it might be worth exploring other options on the menu, especially the items featuring mortadella and prosciutto. Overall, the restaurant's concept is intriguing, but more attention to flavor balance is needed to truly deliver on its potential.

Disappointing Visit: Subpar Veggie Pizza and Sub Sandwich. The veggie pizza lacked flavor, with an unsatisfying tomato sauce and a meager amount of cheese. The dough tasted mass-produced and lacked the freshness expected from a quality establishment. The sub sandwich was also underwhelming. While improvements may have been made since our visit, the lackluster experience has deterred us from returning anytime soon.

More Than Just Ice Cream delivered decent milkshakes during our late-night visit, but their ice cream flavors seemed more impressive. The coffee and chocolate milkshakes lacked the desired thickness, while the black&white malt stood out as the creamiest of the trio. However, the real standout was the pumpkin pie ice cream flavor, which left me wishing I had ordered a scoop instead of a milkshake. While the milkshakes satisfied our cravings, the exceptional ice cream flavors suggest that next time, we should skip the milkshakes and indulge in the ice cream scoops to fully appreciate the establishment's offerings.

Celebrated my mother's 100th birthday at this restaurant and had an exceptionally memorable experience. The staff went above and beyond with thoughtful touches like complimentary dishes, a beautifully presented cake, and warm, attentive service throughout our meal. We were treated to a great table with a nice view as well. The food was delicious and the overall experience exceeded our expectations, making it the perfect way to celebrate such a special occasion. Highly recommend for a truly memorable dining experience.

This local gem is a must-visit! The bartender's exceptional service and the delectable burger made with fresh, locally-sourced ingredients were standouts. The tantalizing plates of food emerging from the kitchen also looked incredible. With perfectly mixed drinks and ice-cold beer, the beverage offerings complemented the impressive cuisine. The dedicated staff and non-chain atmosphere make this place a true neighborhood treasure. Highly recommended for a genuine dining experience.
Rating: 3 stars

Avoid This Restaurant Disaster: Inattentive Service and Inedible Food. The server seemed lost, neglecting basic tasks like refilling water. Instead of the ordered chicken parmesan, an eggplant parmesan with a fish bone arrived, making it inedible. The only positive was decent drinks. Skip this train wreck if you value a pleasant dining experience.

TDS restaurant fails to impress despite reasonably priced and decent food. The establishment lacks proper decor, ambiance, and basic amenities like menu boards or soda machines. Diners are greeted by a cold, industrial-like setting with staff members lacking proper identification. While the menu offers a variety of tasty dishes, the dining experience is marred by the restaurant's baffling policy of charging for extra salsa. Requesting additional salsa for tacos, even after a substantial order, results in being asked to purchase the salsa trio again. Despite spending over $40 on the meal, the lack of hospitality and unwelcoming atmosphere overshadow the positives, making it an unsatisfactory dining experience overall.

Angela Clifton Photography is an exceptional choice for capturing precious memories. Having worked with them thrice, their fabulous photographs and delightful experience have consistently left us overjoyed. Not only are their prices remarkably reasonable, but the cherished keepsake pictures they deliver are truly priceless. Highly recommended!

While the fish dish was enjoyable, the prices leaned toward the higher side at this sidewalk cafe. For a quieter al fresco dining experience in the French Quarter, consider exploring the options on the side streets instead of the main avenues. Overall, the food quality was satisfactory.

The Old Courthouse boasts an impressive display of art and architecture, with the spiral staircase being a quirky highlight. Climbing up to the 5th level rewards visitors with breathtaking panoramic views of the entire city. However, the true gem is the tower clock room, where the intricate mechanical gears inside are a surprising and fascinating sight to behold. Note that prior appointment is required to access the clock room. Set aside 2-3 hours to fully appreciate this historic landmark's offerings.

Ann provided an exceptional customer experience. Her positivity, helpfulness, and dedication to going above and beyond made my first visit truly amazing. Thanks to Ann, I've become a loyal regular customer. Highly recommended!

An Unexpected Thai Delight in Carp! My first visit to this restaurant was a pleasant surprise. The coconut soup was deliciously flavorful, and the pad Thai lived up to my expectations. The authentic Thai ambiance, complete with decor and music, added to the overall experience. The staff provided top-notch service, making it a standout dining option in an area with limited choices. This gem has become my go-to spot for Thai cuisine in Carp.

An absolute gem! This spot offered a wonderfully chill and relaxing ambiance. The live music added an extra layer of fun and quirkiness, with the artist's eclectic performances like a country twist on "Let It Go" keeping things delightfully entertaining. It's a must-visit that I'll definitely be revisiting on future trips.

The Smoothie King Center, formerly known as the New Orleans Arena, has undergone a delightful transformation. While the seating remains unchanged, the arena's refreshed ambiance exudes a swanky and top-notch vibe. The food and beverage options are a standout, catering to diverse tastes with significantly improved quality. From full-service bars to spiked lemonades, bottled and draft beers, and, of course, smoothies, the drink selection is exemplary. The food offerings are equally impressive, with a wide array of delectable treats like funnel cakes and cotton candy, ensuring a satisfying experience for all. The Smoothie King Center's facelift has successfully elevated it to a premier venue, leaving visitors feeling as though they've truly moved on up.

When feeling under the weather, Chipotle's steak proves to be a trusty remedy. To avoid crowds, visiting between 2-4 PM is ideal, ensuring a peaceful and calm dining experience. Regardless of the rush, the service remains consistently friendly and efficient. A go-to spot for a satisfying meal that settles the stomach.

Surprisingly Exceptional Indian Gem! Despite low expectations, this newly opened Indian restaurant in Tampa Bay left an incredible impression. The elegant ambience with white linens sets the stage for an outstanding culinary experience. The chicken 65 and hot sour soup were standout dishes, bursting with rich flavors. Complemented by attentive and friendly service from Angel, this hidden gem is sure to become a foodie haven for authentic Indian cuisine. Highly recommended!

Preservation Hall in New Orleans is a must-visit destination for music lovers. The intimate venue, which can only accommodate around 200 people, offers an authentic and unforgettable jazz experience. While waiting in line can be a hassle, purchasing reserved seats is well worth the extra cost to skip the long queues. The show itself is fantastic, featuring true musicians with immense talent and charming personalities. The dapper band members create an atmosphere reminiscent of concerts from decades past. The small, hole-in-the-wall space provides an up-close and personal experience, allowing you to witness the sheer joy on the performers' faces as they share their craft. A visit to Preservation Hall is an essential part of any trip to New Orleans, offering a glimpse into the city's rich musical heritage.

Keystone Discount Tire provided an exceptional experience for a walk-in customer seeking a state inspection. Despite not having an appointment, they accommodated me promptly. The staff, particularly Bill, were friendly, knowledgeable, and transparent throughout the process. They identified minor irregular tire wear but didn't try to upsell unnecessary services. The inspection was completed efficiently within an hour at a fair price. Highly recommended for their honest and professional service. Be sure to sign up for their coupons to save on future visits.

Exceptional phone repair service! After my son accidentally dropped his phone, I thought it was a lost cause. However, the technicians at this repair shop worked their magic and had it fixed in under 30 minutes. Their professionalism and efficiency were truly impressive. I'm thrilled with the outstanding service and highly recommend them.

Disastrous experience at Cracker Barrel. Service was abysmal, with multiple order errors leading to the waiter becoming irate and cursing. The manager's attempt to appease by offering free drinks was inadequate compensation. Food was served cold and inedible after an excessive wait time. Utterly unacceptable service and dining experience. Will never return to this establishment.

Loews Hotel exceeded my expectations for a dog-friendly city hotel. Despite being apprehensive about bringing my large Labrador/Golden mix, Bentley, the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. From the warm reception with treats and a thoughtful welcome kit, to the attentive car attendants greeting Bentley by name, the hotel truly embraced its pet-friendly policies. Even other guests were delighted to meet and pet Bentley. The top-floor room was perfect, and the exceptional service prompted us to extend our stay. Loews Hotel redefined what it means to be truly dog-friendly, even for larger breeds, in an urban setting. Highly recommended for pet owners seeking a comfortable and accommodating experience.

While this restaurant can deliver truly excellent dishes, the inconsistency is frustrating. Around half the time the food tastes incredible, especially items I've enjoyed for years. However, the other half leaves much to be desired, as if different cooks are preparing the same dishes with wildly varying levels of quality and care. It's a clash between delicious highs and disappointing lows that makes the overall experience hit-or-miss. The lack of consistency prevents a full endorsement despite some genuinely great meals.

Terrible Experience - Will Never Return! Visited this place twice, and both times were extremely disappointing. During my second visit, I ordered ribs, but they were served unevenly cooked - one side cold and the other hot. Despite sending them back three times, they could not get it right. The manager only offered an insincere apology without any compensation for the inconvenience. With such poor service and inconsistent food quality, I have no plans to revisit this establishment.

Cheu's ramen fell short for me, with overly thick noodles and an excessively salty broth that didn't appeal to my taste preferences. While the service was commendable and the beer selection noteworthy, the ramen itself failed to impress me, unlike some other establishments I've tried with more diverse options and superior broths. However, my dining companion thoroughly enjoyed their meal and is a regular patron. It could simply be a matter of personal taste, so I encourage others to try Cheu and form their own opinion, as I may be an outlier in this case.

Federal Doughnuts, a new addition to the ballpark, offers a tempting combination of doughnuts and fried chicken – a delightful treat for those with a sweet and savory craving. For those with dietary restrictions, the ballpark has also introduced a dedicated gluten-free concession stand near section 136. This stand caters to those following a gluten-free diet with a range of offerings, including pizza, cheesesteaks, and even desserts like brownies and cookies. These new additions are sure to delight fans seeking delicious and diverse dining options at the ballpark.

Red Kings has opened a second location in Chinatown, and it lives up to the hype of the original. The Dan Dan Noodles and shredded Pork in Garlic sauce were standouts, offering a perfect balance of mouth-burning spice and delicious, complex flavors. Portions were generous, ensuring tasty leftovers. In addition to the tantalizing Szechuan fare, Red Kings boasts karaoke rooms upstairs and a BYOB policy, making it an excellent spot for a lively night out. While the relationship between the two locations is unclear, this newcomer promises an authentic and enjoyable dining experience.

Despite being one of the busiest Chick-fil-A locations, this restaurant consistently delivers quick service and exceptional customer experience. Their efficiency and friendliness are truly remarkable, making it one of my favorite dining spots. Highly recommended!

The Green Spot is a must-visit for delicious and fresh salads! Their extensive selection of greens and toppings make for a flavorful and healthy lunch option. The service is prompt, ensuring you can grab a quick bite even on a tight schedule. Whenever I'm in town, this is my go-to spot for a satisfying salad.

Our guided tour on September 26th, 2015, was an absolute delight. The driver was extremely knowledgeable and provided insightful commentary during the journey to the plantations. The tour schedule was perfectly planned, allowing ample free time before and after the tours to explore the beautiful plantation grounds at our leisure. The flexibility to be dropped off at different locations on the return trip was a great convenience. We chose to disembark near Jackson Square, which enabled us to immerse ourselves in the vibrant atmosphere of the French Quarter. Highly recommended for a comprehensive and well-organized plantation tour experience."

This brunch spot is a delightful find, offering delectable dishes that truly impress. The standout item is the flavorful grits with scallions and sour cream, an absolute must-try. However, be prepared for a chilly ambiance as the room tends to be uncomfortably cold, so remember to bring a cozy sweater. Despite the temperature issue, the exceptional food makes it a worthwhile experience.

An absolute must-visit for hot dog lovers! This place serves the best hot dogs and chili dogs around. The delicious and mouthwatering offerings keep me coming back time and time again. Highly recommended for anyone craving a tasty hot dog fix.

Waterline: A Vibrant Local Gem

In a nutshell, Waterline is a standout local spot that delivers on multiple fronts. The live music on Saturday nights creates a lively and vibrant atmosphere, perfect for enjoying with friends. Their beer selection is top-notch, arguably the best in town, surpassing even the popular Fig Mountain.

What sets Waterline apart is its unique concept. Not only does it offer a stellar brewery, but it also provides access to incredible food from the adjacent Nook Restaurant and the attached Lama Dog eatery. This all-in-one experience is a few notches above the competition and makes Waterline a truly exceptional destination.

Overall, if you're seeking a lively local hangout with fantastic brews, delectable food options, and a cool vibe, Waterline is an absolute must-visit. It's a vibrant gem that showcases the best of what the local scene has to offer.

Exceptional customer service and an unforgettable tour experience! Despite being slightly outside their pick-up area, they graciously accommodated our group of 7 and promptly resolved a minor billing issue. The knowledgeable and entertaining guide made the tour delightful, allowing us to witness alligators, turtles, and birds up close. Highlights included holding a baby alligator and the thrilling boat ride back. Highly recommended for a fun-filled adventure in the great outdoors!

Westfall Roofing delivered an exceptional experience for our roof replacement in April. From start to finish, their professionalism and quality workmanship shone through. The new roof is top-notch, and their communication and follow-up were outstanding. We couldn't be happier with our decision to choose Westfall for this project.

Veggie Grill offers flavorful vegan fare at reasonable prices, catering to a fast-food approach. While not an ideal dine-in experience, their offerings hit the mark for on-the-go plant-based meals. The crowd favorite, the Buffalo Bella, takes a backseat to the standout Cheesesteak. Elevate your order with a side of irresistible sweet potato fries – a pro-tip you won't want to miss.

The ramen at this place is just average, nothing special to write home about. The service is decent, but nothing exceptional. It's a convenient spot for a quick meal, but if you have other options, you might want to explore those. I've been there twice, and while it's not bad, I'll likely only return when there aren't better alternatives available.

The Trendy Brunch Spot: A Culinary Delight! This trendy eatery offers a menu that caters to every palate, serving up delicious and satisfying dishes in a clean and stylish ambiance. While the wait can get lengthy after 9 AM, it's highly recommended to arrive early and beat the crowds. Trust me, the incredible satisfaction you'll feel after indulging in their mouthwatering fare is worth the wait. A must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable brunch experience!

Tasty BBQ Gem: This place offers delectable barbecue at a wallet-friendly price. The brisket sandwich, paired with stellar sides like creamy potato casserole, savory cream spinach, baked beans, and crisp green beans, makes for a satisfying and affordable meal. The flavors are on point, and the value can't be beaten. An excellent spot for barbecue lovers on a budget.

The restaurant offered an exceptional dining experience with outstanding food and impeccable service. However, the lack of vegetarian and vegan options was a disappointment. Overall, it's a highly recommended establishment, and I look forward to returning.

The food at this establishment is excellent, but the customer service leaves much to be desired. While the owner is delightful, I've encountered rude and unpleasant older waitresses on multiple visits, which negatively impacted my overall dining experience. The delicious cuisine is overshadowed by the lack of hospitality from certain members of the staff.
Rating: 5/5

I had scheduled a full detailing service for my car, but the experience was an absolute disaster. Despite confirming the appointment twice, the owner (Michael) seemed to have no recollection of our scheduled service. When we arrived at the agreed-upon time, the workshop was closed, and Michael was nowhere to be found. His partner (Alex) showed up an hour and a half late, unable to reach Michael. We wasted our time and gas, driving a significant distance, only to be met with unprofessional and unreliable service. Completely unacceptable! Do not trust this business with your vehicle or hard-earned money.

The team at this moving company went above and beyond to ensure a seamless and stress-free move. Despite encountering numerous challenges, they handled everything with professionalism and trustworthiness. Their exceptional service left me thoroughly impressed, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them to anyone, even my own mother. Top-notch movers who truly go the extra mile for their customers!

The Saint Hotel in New Orleans started off promising with a lovely lobby, cool bar, and friendly staff, but our stay quickly turned into a nightmare. Upon entering our room, we encountered a massive flying roach. Despite requesting a room change, the new room also had spiders, dead bugs, a non-functioning TV, and missing lamp bulbs. After an unsatisfactory response from the management until 3 AM, we decided to check out early the next morning. While the manager eventually agreed to a full refund, the experience was unacceptable, and we will not be returning to The Saint Hotel until significant changes are made to address the pest and maintenance issues.

Whether you're a budget-conscious homeowner or someone looking to declutter their home in an eco-friendly manner, the Green Project offers a winning combination of affordability and sustainability. It's a win-win for your wallet and the environment.

This establishment on Broadway left a sour taste due to the disrespectful behavior of the staff and the exorbitant prices. The bouncer's unnecessary rudeness set the tone for an unpleasant evening. As a local resident, the expectation of fair treatment and reasonable pricing was not met. Instead, it perpetuated the negative stereotype of Broadway venues taking advantage of visitors. This place has lost a potential regular patron and will not receive any recommendations from me.

My girlfriend and I visited this place for lunch, and we were thoroughly impressed. The restaurant was impeccably clean, which set the tone for an enjoyable dining experience. The food was exceptional, hitting all the right notes in terms of taste and quality. Moreover, the prices were very reasonable, making it an affordable option. We can't wait to return and savor their delicious offerings once again.

A Disappointing Decline: Once a beloved establishment, this restaurant has unfortunately experienced a significant drop in food quality. From cold, pre-prepared starters to over-dressed and bagged salads, and overcooked, inferior fish entrees, the culinary offerings were consistently disappointing. While the setting and service remain decent, the subpar food renders this place unworthy of a visit. Unless drastic improvements are made to the kitchen, this establishment risks becoming just another mediocre tourist trap, squandering its former reputation.

Milktooth: A Brunch Gem with Inventive Twists

Milktooth is a must-visit destination for brunch enthusiasts in Indianapolis. This popular eatery offers a unique and delectable menu that puts a creative spin on traditional breakfast fare. At first glance, the menu may seem unfamiliar, but trust that every dish is a delightful surprise.

While you may have to endure a typical weekend wait of around 30 minutes due to Milktooth's well-deserved popularity, the experience is undoubtedly worth it. To make the wait more enjoyable, you can indulge in their tempting coffee drinks and pastries at the walk-up bar, giving you a tantalizing preview of the culinary delights to come.

The menu at Milktooth is ever-changing, but some standout items remain constants, like their exquisite variations on Dutch pancakes and the heavenly raclette grilled cheese. If you're in the mood for a boozy brunch, don't miss out on their refreshing michelada.

Milktooth's commitment to innovation and exceptional flavors extends beyond their food offerings. Their breakfast cocktails are a must-try, adding an extra layer of indulgence to your brunch experience.

When the weather permits, take advantage of their outdoor seating area, providing a pleasant ambiance to enjoy your meal al fresco.

Overall, Milktooth is a true gem in Indianapolis's brunch scene, offering a unique and memorable dining experience that will leave you craving for more.

The staff at this hotel truly shines, providing an exceptional experience and even offering a complimentary room upgrade for our honeymoon. While the room itself had some minor issues like rust in the tub and stains on the tiles, the stunning view made up for it. Valet parking was pricey, but self-parking nearby was a convenient alternative. The hotel's prime location in the heart of downtown St. Louis, surrounded by vibrant bars and restaurants, is a major highlight. Overall, it's a 4-star experience, thanks to the excellent service and prime location, despite a few room maintenance concerns.

The beginning class at this studio was an excellent experience. The pace was perfect, allowing for a challenging yet accessible workout that stretched muscles in unexpected ways. Despite the simplicity of the moves, I still managed to work up a light sweat and felt fantastic afterwards. The studio itself is well-maintained and clean, with the added convenience of being able to purchase Beyond Organic food items on-site. Highly recommended for those seeking an enjoyable and effective beginner-level fitness class.

Whether you're dining in or purchasing fresh, live lobsters and seafood to cook at home, Lobster Haven is an absolute must-visit for anyone craving a taste of the coastal Northeast. Highly recommended for a truly authentic seafood experience without leaving town.

An absolute gem! This place boasts a fantastic happy hour and a fresh, delectable menu. The drinks are simply delish – if time permitted, I'd be a daily visitor. Highly recommended for a great drinking and dining experience.

Men's Clubs is an exceptional barbershop with highly skilled barbers who deliver fresh and stylish haircuts. A long-time patron for three years, the reviewer has consistently had positive experiences without any significant issues. The only notable incident mentioned was when another customer tried to get the same haircut, but the barber (Tim) handled the situation professionally, explaining that he couldn't replicate someone else's cut. The reviewer commends Tim for keeping it real and maintaining integrity in his craft. Overall, Men's Clubs is highly recommended for its top-notch service and commitment to providing unique, personalized cuts.

An absolute gem for sushi and hibachi lovers! We frequent this establishment regularly, and it never disappoints. The food is consistently fresh, and the service is top-notch. Highly recommended for an authentic and delightful dining experience. Don't miss out on this hidden treasure!

Chickie's and Pete's is a Philadelphia institution that offers a lively and enjoyable experience, especially for sports fans. While the food may not be the best you've ever had, it's the perfect spot to indulge in delicious bar fare like crab fries, mussels red, and spicy pull and peel shrimp while watching a game or hanging out near the stadiums. The atmosphere is casual and messy, with sinks conveniently placed for easy clean-up. However, during major sporting events, be prepared for long waits and a rowdy, drunk crowd, which can either add to the fun or be a deterrent, depending on your frame of mind. Overall, Chickie's and Pete's is a must-visit for the authentic Philly experience, just be sure to manage your expectations regarding seating and crowd levels.

Prompt, professional service on a Saturday. They efficiently handled a simple mirror fix, making the process hassle-free. Consistently excellent experience with this company, both in the current location and previously in Charlotte.

Union Station St. Louis is a good dining choice. The Ponchartrain (allegedly the same as Tilapia) with mushrooms and cream sauce was quite enjoyable. However, the shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake appetizers were just average, nothing exceptional. The drinks and service were acceptable. The outdoor patio seating was pleasant given the nice weather, while the indoor ambiance appeared comfy and slightly more upscale. Overall, a solid dining experience with a standout main course but room for improvement in the appetizers.

The Harry Potter-esque ambiance at this unique St. Pete establishment is truly enchanting. The meticulous remodel pays homage to an old library, with tasteful background music that allows for comfortable conversation. The friendly bartenders, Michael and Peggy, added to the delightful experience. While I didn't try the food, the reasonably priced meat and cheese trays are enticing for a future visit. Highly recommended for a one-of-a-kind atmospheric outing.

Maple Street Patisserie is an exceptional bakery and cafe that delivers on all fronts. Their blueberry muffins are simply divine, and their breakfast and lunch offerings are equally delectable. During Mardi Gras, their specialty king cakes are a must-try. What truly sets this place apart is the owner, Ziggy, whose dedication and hard work ensure that every baked good is crafted to perfection. With its scrumptious treats and friendly service, Maple Street Patisserie is an absolute gem that should not be missed.

The burgers at this place are truly delicious. I opted for the Bourbon Black and Bleu burger, and it was cooked to perfection and packed with flavor. However, the service was slow, even for a large group like ours (4 adults and 5 kids). Despite the lengthy wait of over an hour for our food, the quality of the burgers makes this place worth a visit if you have the patience. Overall, I'd rate it 3 stars – excellent burgers but frustratingly slow service.

Katie's is a local gem that never disappoints, making it the go-to spot for hosting out-of-town guests. With a diverse menu offering delectable options like grilled oysters, shrimp and grits, Cuban sandwiches, pizza, and soup and salad, there's something for everyone. The reasonably priced dishes are expertly prepared and highlight local seasonal ingredients, ensuring a fresh and flavorful experience. The warm and friendly service complements the delicious food. While Sundays can get busy after church services, the wait is worth it, especially when complemented by bottomless mimosas. Katie's consistently delivers a wonderful dining experience, making it a standout choice for any occasion.

After attending the Zurich Classic golf tournament on a warm and humid day, I decided to treat myself to some ice cream at Creole Creamery. The cozy interior was charming, and I was impressed by the vast selection of unique flavors. While tempted by some unusual options, I ultimately chose a scoop of cookie monster ice cream on a cone. The ice cream had the perfect level of sweetness, hitting the spot without being overly saccharine. Overall, Creole Creamery proved to be a worthwhile stop, and I highly recommend checking it out for its delightful ambiance and delicious, inventive ice cream flavors.

This funky sushi joint is a must-visit for sushi lovers craving an energetic atmosphere. While I'd steer clear of adventurous items like escargot, their sushi rolls, sashimi, and sake offerings are top-notch. The lively vibe, with thumping dance music and a youthful crowd, perfectly complements the delicious sushi and sake. It's a fantastic spot for sushi and sake indulgence in a vibrant setting.

The Backyard Bowl is a standout favorite at this eatery, but the entire menu is a hit. Despite ordering smaller portions or sharing, the high-quality ingredients leave you feeling satisfied. While the reasonable prices make it an excellent value, be prepared for potential crowds due to its popularity. However, the delicious and filling fare is well worth the wait.

The service was a bit unconventional, likely due to the server being new, but the food presentation was satisfactory. However, the portion sizes for the accompaniments to the gumbo could have been more generous, either with the addition of rice or an increased serving of potato salad. While the Sprite was flat, it was not a significant issue as it was not required. Overall, a decent experience with room for improvement in certain areas.

While this pancake place offers decently good pancakes at an affordable price point, it can be quite disorganized during peak hours. The pancakes are on the sweeter side, so keep that in mind if you prefer less sugary options. The ability to get breakfast all day is convenient, but overall, there's nothing particularly exceptional or unique about this establishment compared to other breakfast spots. It's a solid choice if you're craving pancakes without any frills.
Fantastic experience! The store has an impressive selection of great finds, and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Highly recommend visiting - I'll definitely be a returning customer.

This family-owned Mexican restaurant has been a cherished part of my life for decades. The welcoming staff, especially Yoli and Frank, have witnessed my family grow up, and their personable service is unmatched. They are always prompt and attentive. The menu offers an authentic Mexican culinary experience, with standout dishes like their delicious shredded beef burrito and irresistible cheese crisp. It's a truly special place that feels like home, and I can't recommend it enough.

Regrettably, this restaurant's dine-in experience deserves only 2 stars due to disappointing service and an underwhelming venue. While the food, like the lamb kebab, had decent flavors, it lacked accompaniments and presentation. The kebab arrived plainly with just meat, no sauces or garnishes. Takeout might be a better option here, potentially raising the rating to 3 stars. However, the lackluster service and ambiance make it challenging to fully recommend this establishment for a sit-down meal.

This is hands-down the best Middle Eastern restaurant in the area. The food is consistently delicious and never disappoints. Each dish is bursting with flavors that leave you feeling completely satisfied. An absolute must-try for anyone craving authentic and tasty Middle Eastern cuisine.

Potito's Bakery is a must-visit for cannoli lovers in the city. According to the reviewer, their cannoli are the best in town, surpassing popular spots like Termini's and Isgro's. The bambino cannoli stuffed cannoli is highly recommended and described as "as good as it sounds." The reviewer is a loyal customer, visiting every Christmas Eve and vowing to return for years to come. While other bakeries may have long lines and overrated offerings, Potito's consistently delivers outstanding cannoli without the hassle. If you're craving an authentic, delicious cannoli experience, Potito's Bakery is the place to go.

El Limon is an authentic and exceptional Mexican eatery that delivers a truly delightful dining experience. As someone raised on genuine Mexican cuisine, the author can confidently vouch for El Limon's authenticity, claiming it to be the best in Pennsylvania. From sopes to fish tacos, every dish is perfectly delicious and remarkably affordable. The attentive and pleasant waitstaff enhances the overall experience. Standout features include homemade tamales and complimentary margaritas, making El Limon a must-visit destination for a fantastic Mexican feast suitable for the entire family.

Dine-In Greek Taverna (4 stars) - This newly opened eatery shows immense promise, delivering delicious Mediterranean fare with a few minor kinks to iron out. The standout dishes include the flavorful Quaker chicken steak, crispy fries and onion rings, delectable baklava, fresh signature salad, and the outstanding Greek turkey burger with homemade tzatziki sauce. While the pizza could use some improvement, the overall dining experience is highly satisfying. With their willingness to make corrections and maintain high standards, this place has the potential to become a 5-star gem once the initial hiccups are resolved. Definitely worth multiple visits to savor their authentic Greek flavors.

Planet Fitness (4 stars): A budget-friendly gym option with a monthly fee of $20 (or $9.99 for basic access). While it may not attract dedicated bodybuilders, it offers a decent range of amenities for the price, including tanning beds, massage chairs, a sculpt machine, and 24/7 access. The staff is polite and helpful, but the atmosphere may lack motivation for serious fitness enthusiasts. It's a good choice for those seeking an affordable gym without frills, but those looking for a more intense workout environment might want to explore alternative options.

Although their website advertised being open all day on Saturdays and Sundays, we arrived at 2:15 pm on a Saturday only to be turned away because their kitchen had already closed at 2 pm. This discrepancy between their posted hours and actual operations is concerning, as it raises doubts about their attention to detail and commitment to quality in other areas. If they can't manage to accurately represent their business hours, it makes one question what other "small" oversights might be occurring behind the scenes. Overall, it was a disappointing and frustrating experience that could have been easily avoided with better communication and adherence to their stated policies.

Highly recommended! This company delivers excellent workmanship, adheres to deadlines, and stands behind their work with a solid warranty. Their professionalism and commitment to customer satisfaction make them a top choice.

Highly recommended for frequent visits! The service is consistently friendly, and the food never disappoints. With generous portions that leave you fully satisfied, this place is a must-try for an amazing dining experience.

The Tri Redwood in Reno is an absolute gem! This transformed restaurant boasts beautiful redwood features and serves up incredible food at reasonable prices. The tri-tip salad and tri-tip/chicken combo were standouts, with perfectly cooked meats and delightful sides like potato "croutons" and fresh corn salad. Even the lemon meringue pie dessert impressed with its perfectly set meringue. The dining experience was top-notch, prompting us to eagerly recommend this place to others and plan a swift return visit. A truly delightful find that salvaged a piece of Reno's history!

Rebecca may not have served as a doula during my birth, but she was an exceptional nanny for our firstborn. As I prepared for my second pregnancy, I looked forward to our conversations where she shared her wealth of knowledge and honest advice - a trait I deeply appreciate. Rebecca's passion for her role as a doula shines through, as she finds beauty and strength in supporting women during the magical time of labor. Her caring presence and expertise make her an outstanding addition to any birthing support team. Highly recommended!

Orange Tint and Tune delivers exceptional service for car tinting. Their convenient car pick-up service within a 4-mile radius is a game-changer. Carlos, the technician, was attentive to my preferences and adjusted the tint grade to match my desired look. The receptionist was friendly, and the owner, Dustin, personally followed up on my experience. This level of customer care and attention to detail is truly deserving of a 5-star rating. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch car tinting services.

TownePlace Suites near the Tucson airport offers a convenient and comfortable stay for business travelers. Despite its proximity to the airport, the hotel is remarkably quiet. The standard suites come equipped with kitchen amenities, making extended stays convenient. While the immediate area lacks diverse dining options, there are a few decent choices within walking distance, including the highly recommended Baggins sandwich shop. The hotel staff is friendly and accommodating. The complimentary breakfast is decent, and the weekday evening reception is a nice touch, though they could improve by ensuring better stocking throughout the service period. Overall, the hotel provides a safe, comfortable, and well-appointed base for those visiting Tucson, with easy access to downtown and the university area.

This little local steakhouse in Tampa was a pleasant surprise after being diverted from our original travel plans. Wanting to avoid chains, we stumbled upon this gem thanks to Yelp. The wood-smoked steaks, grilled over oak and citrus wood, were out-of-this-world delicious with an incredible smoky flavor that steak lovers dream of. The 7 oz. Tampa strips and 14 oz. ribeyes were cooked to perfection. Reasonably priced wine selection and great sides like veggies and sweet potatoes complemented the meal nicely. But what really stood out was the excellent, friendly service from our waitress Lisa who made terrific recommendations. We'll definitely be bookmarking this place for future trips to the Tampa area to enjoy these phenomenal local steaks again.

After an initial lackluster experience, the owner of Saladworks (with locations in Southampton and others) reached out and demonstrated a commendable commitment to customer satisfaction. Through a candid conversation, he addressed my concerns and proved himself to be a business operator dedicated to quality and service. Visiting the establishment twice more, I encountered vastly improved service and was thoroughly impressed by the delightful new summer salad offerings. Saladworks has redeemed itself in my eyes, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others seeking fresh, flavorful salads and a business that truly values its patrons.

This deli is an absolute must-visit, offering an unparalleled experience that surpasses any other deli in the US. With an overwhelming array of delectable choices, decision-making becomes a delightful challenge. The legendary Muffalata sandwich is a showstopper, generously sized to be shared among four people, and bursting with incredible flavors. Enhancing the experience further, live music on Saturday and Thursday nights creates a vibrant atmosphere. The daily specials are highly recommended, complemented by an impressive selection of sides like the delicious chili, potato salad, and chips. Don't hesitate – this deli is an immediate must-try!

My dad and I had an excellent experience at Saguaro National Park during our cross-country trip. We took a guided tour led by Park Ranger Carolyn, who proved to be an outstanding guide. Carolyn's enthusiasm and passion for the saguaro cactus were truly infectious, and her deep knowledge on the subject made the tour incredibly informative and engaging. Both the tour and Carolyn herself come highly recommended for anyone visiting this national park. A must-do for nature lovers and those interested in learning about this iconic desert plant.

This unassuming wing spot offers a delightful range of flavors, from classic lemon pepper to unique New Orleans-inspired options like yaka mein and noonie bird. Don't miss their refreshing watermelon drink – it's divine! While the location isn't ideal, the owners are dedicated to revitalizing the neighborhood. During the day, the area feels safe enough, but I'd hesitate to visit alone at night. Overall, it's a must-try for wing enthusiasts and locals looking to support a community-minded business. Who knows, you might even spot celebrity chef Skip Bayless!

With its delicious food, reasonable prices, and charming retro vibe, Tom Jones Diner is a must-visit for anyone seeking a nostalgic dining experience. It's no wonder it's a family favorite, earning a well-deserved 5-star rating.

Dr. Ferrel is a true lifesaver for amateur athletes like myself. When I suffered a severe ankle injury during a softball game, he stepped in and provided immediate medical attention on the field. Despite my financial constraints, he compassionately offered to treat me further at his office. His expertise and dedication were remarkable, as he not only healed my injury in a matter of weeks, defying the typical recovery timeline, but also helped me get back on my feet and continue pursuing my athletic passion. Over the years, Dr. Ferrel has consistently delivered amazing results, proving himself to be a trusted and skilled physician.
