He will forever be my hero for his unwavering commitment to my well-being and his exceptional medical care.

The Venue offers a delightful experience with their entertaining shows and relaxed atmosphere. It's the perfect spot for a good time, complemented by tasty food at reasonable prices. Highly recommended for an enjoyable night out.
Rating: 4.5/5

Cindy's offers an exceptional Mexican dining experience. The authentic cuisine, prepared fresh with high-quality ingredients, stands out from the competition. The friendly staff enhances the overall ambiance. Highly recommended for Mexican food enthusiasts seeking genuine flavors and excellent service.

Trust Me BBQ left a lot to be desired during my recent visit. While some items like the BBQ sauce, macaroni salad, and pulled pork were decent, the overall experience was marred by poor service and inconsistent food quality. The staff member behind the counter was completely disengaged, failed to listen to our order correctly, and served subpar sides like dry chicken and lackluster mac and cheese. Additionally, the long wait times and lack of attention during our previous attempt to dine there were concerning. With superior options like Down to the Bone BBQ available, I cannot recommend Trust Me BBQ and will not be returning. The outstanding BBQ sauce and a couple of tasty items were not enough to make up for the overall disappointment.

Hidden Gem with Delicious Thai Food! While in town, I stumbled upon this unassuming little eatery. The pa nang chicken was absolutely excellent, perfectly spiced at the requested one-star heat level. Service was prompt, and the dish arrived quickly. An authentic and flavorful experience that left me eager to return on my next visit to the area. Highly recommended for those seeking tasty Thai cuisine.

While not strictly a Mexican eatery, this place nails the festive Cinco de Mayo vibe with their delectable margaritas, sangrias, and indulgent fried delights. The menu artfully blends diverse cultural flavors, resulting in unique and mouthwatering dishes. Highlights include the perfectly balanced, rock salt-rimmed margaritas and the house-made white and red sangrias – a true treat! Adding to the allure, they've recently opened a wine bar next door for overflow seating and specialty bottles. If you're seeking a lively, flavorful experience, this spot is definitely worth the visit.

Uncle Yeu's Donut Bakery is a hidden gem located in one of Hermitage's oldest shopping centers. Despite the early morning hours required for fresh donut making, the owner Yeu serves up a delightful array of treats beyond the usual suspects. From bacon-topped donuts and apple fritters to pigs in a blanket and kolaches, there's something for every sweet tooth. However, the real star is the doughssant—a delectable fusion of a donut and croissant that's worth the trip alone. What's more, the prices are incredibly affordable, with doughssants costing only $1.99 and regular donuts around $0.60 each. This bakery has become a go-to for treating school teachers, who can't get enough of these sweet delights. With coffee also on the menu, Uncle Yeu's Donut Bakery is a must-visit for anyone craving a fresh, innovative take on classic baked goods.

The venue offers an incredible experience for various events like concerts, basketball games, and more. The atmosphere is lively and fun-filled, making it a blast to attend events here. Additionally, the food options are top-notch, featuring delicious local favorites that enhance the overall experience. Highly recommended for an enjoyable time.

An exceptional dining experience! The menu boasts a diverse array of appetizers and entrées, all of which were meticulously prepared and deliciously executed. The prices are fair and the service is attentive, making it a highly recommended establishment worthy of frequent visits.

This place has unfortunately declined in quality. While we were once frequent patrons, the poor service has driven us away. The staff is slow and inattentive, often forgetting about customers completely. It's a shame because we used to enjoy coming here, but now we've found a better alternative elsewhere.

False Advertising and Unhealthy Disaster! Despite being marketed as a 'healthy' option, this chicken and rice dish was a greasy disappointment. Despite asking for no sauce, the container was swimming in an excessive amount of oil, easily 5-7 tablespoons worth. Not only was this contrary to the request, but it also made the meal utterly unappetizing and a far cry from anything remotely healthy. Their claims of offering wholesome choices feel like a complete joke after this oily debacle. Avoid at all costs if you're seeking a genuinely nutritious meal.

Excellent experience at Sears for new appliance purchases. Despite mixed reviews, I encountered a great selection, knowledgeable staff, and timely delivery. The salespeople went above and beyond, providing honest feedback, answering all questions, and ensuring the best price within my budget. Highly recommended for a hassle-free and satisfactory shopping experience.

An excellent dining experience! The food is delicious, the service is prompt, and the staff goes above and beyond to create a welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommended for a pleasant meal with friendly service.

After much anticipation, I finally had the chance to visit the recently remodeled restaurant, and I must say, they did an outstanding job with the renovations. The highlight of my dining experience was the mushroom cheese steak, which was absolutely delightful. The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the quality of ingredients shone through. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a fantastic dining experience in a refreshed, inviting atmosphere.

The Espresso Lounge is a true gem for coffee lovers. Their espresso is top-notch, making it my go-to spot for a perfectly crafted Americano. The staff is friendly and welcoming, creating a mellow and inviting atmosphere. While there are no power outlets available, the unlimited wifi access is a plus. The cleanliness of the bathrooms and overall space is impeccable. If you're in search of an excellent espresso experience, this place is a must-visit.
Overall, the experience fell short of expectations, and the highly rated reputation seems undeserved based on my visit.

Village Whiskey's Whiskey Burger is a indulgent treat, albeit pricey at $26. If you're a fan of juicy, grease-dripping burgers, this one delivers with its super tender patty, crispy bacon, and generous size. The Duck Fat fries complement the burger perfectly with their rich, decadent flavor. While the price tag may give some pause, the quality and taste make it a worthwhile splurge for burger enthusiasts. Just be prepared for a belly-busting experience.

The $80 spent on family dinner at this Asian restaurant was absolutely worth it. The food was piping hot, and the orange chicken was simply the best I've tasted in a long time. This place has definitely become our go-to spot for delicious Asian cuisine!

This laundromat is a true gem! It's a clean, well-lit, and secure facility with a welcoming atmosphere. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the washers and dryers are incredibly efficient, allowing me to complete 8 regular loads in under 2 hours. With amenities like flat-screen TVs, magazines, Wi-Fi, clean bathrooms, and vending machines, it's a comfortable and convenient place to get laundry done. There were plenty of available machines, and the overall environment was never overcrowded. I'm thrilled to have discovered this exceptional laundromat and highly recommend it to anyone seeking a hassle-free and pleasant laundry experience.
For those seeking a more reasonably priced and satisfying dining experience in St. Louis, it might be wise to explore alternative options.

I'm already planning my next visit, aiming for a less hectic weekday lunch to fully savor the Haven experience without the game-day rush. If you're a burger aficionado, Haven Burger is undoubtedly worth braving the crowds.

The vermicelli bowls at this restaurant offer a decent portion size and fair pricing. While I haven't tried their Pho, the vermicelli dishes are a solid option, especially if you live in the Alberta Ave area. The service is efficient, with orders typically ready within 15 minutes, even on busy Friday nights. A convenient choice for a quick and reasonably priced meal.

While the restaurant boasted a great atmosphere and live music for dancing, the food was a major disappointment. The Chicken Marsala was tough, dry, and flavorless, with undercooked pasta that stuck together. The lasagna lacked flavor and had only a thin layer of pasta. Adding insult to injury, one diner's unfinished meal was prematurely cleared, though a replacement was eventually provided in a doggie bag. For the exorbitant prices charged, the subpar food quality was unacceptable. The ambiance and entertainment could not compensate for the lackluster culinary experience.

An Authentic Indian Gem – This BYOB restaurant is a true hidden gem, boasting an inviting ambiance and a prime location near the Broad Street line with ample street parking. The menu is a delightful fusion of flavors, with standout dishes like the chaats, beef short ribs, lamb vindaloo, beet salad, and mouthwatering breads and pickles. Don't miss the rich and decadent chocolate cake, a must-try for dessert. With the option to grab takeout beer from the nearby corner bar, this place offers a complete dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic Indian culinary adventure.

An absolute must-visit! This restaurant offers an outstanding dining experience. The ceviche, a personal favorite, is an absolute delight with its delicious flavors. The lively atmosphere and exceptional service make it a truly enjoyable venue. Our server, Alex, deserves special mention for his friendly, attentive, and thoughtful approach, ensuring a memorable evening. Highly recommended!

N-JOY is a delightful store that offers a fantastic salad bar with fresh ingredients and an exciting array of ethnic cuisines to explore. It's a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts and anyone seeking a delicious and diverse culinary experience. Highly recommended!

This Mediterranean eatery delivers a delicious chicken shawarma wrapped in a pita bread. The generous portion of flavorful chicken is a standout, and the prompt service ensures a hassle-free experience. The food was ready upon arrival, making it a convenient option. Overall, it's a satisfying meal that warrants a revisit whenever in the area."

This restaurant is an absolute gem! The delectable cuisine, coupled with the inviting ambiance and friendly staff, makes it a highly recommended spot for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The food is a standout, showcasing exceptional flavors that will leave you craving for more. The pleasant atmosphere further enhances the dining experience, making it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure.

Despite a slow start with the service, this place delivered with delicious Cajun fare like the flavorful gumbo and tasty chicken and waffles. The friendly staff and prime Bourbon Street location made for an enjoyable people-watching experience. Worth the wait for the quality food and lively atmosphere.

Earl's, a grab-and-go airport restaurant, offers a decent selection of sandwiches, including turkey, tuna, and Hawaiian options. However, the standout is their roast beef sandwich. The sandwich features a generous portion of sliced beef cooked beyond medium, complemented by cheddar cheese and a delightful horseradish sauce. The absence of lettuce and tomatoes enhances the overall flavor experience. With its convenient location near the security checkpoint and Delta SkyClub at the top of the D gates, Earl's is an excellent choice for a quick and satisfying meal to enjoy at the gate or on the flight.

An absolute gem! This place nails it with top-notch food, exceptional service, and a welcoming atmosphere. The cheese curds with red pepper jelly were a delightful start, followed by flavorful fish tacos and a delicious beer brat. Generous portions at reasonable prices. The attentive server was knowledgeable and made us feel right at home. The manager's visit and insights about game day deals and weekend brunch added to the excellent experience. The staff's warm hospitality, right down to the complimentary rootbeer candy, left a lasting impression. Highly recommended for a fantastic dining experience and a great spot to catch the game or enjoy brunch.

This restaurant exceeded my expectations! Despite my reluctance to order burgers when dining out, their burger was an absolute must-try – I'll definitely be getting it again on my next visit. They also boast an impressive beer selection and a welcoming staff that made me feel right at home. My order was prepared precisely and served promptly, complemented by a pleasant ambiance and clean restrooms. Overall, a delightful experience that left me thoroughly satisfied!

The Gaylord Opryland Hotel is an impressive and huge property, but its massive size and location far from downtown Nashville present some major drawbacks. The rooms themselves are nice, especially if you get a good group rate on a suite. However, be very cautious when booking - there were issues with being misquoted rates and having to pay exorbitant charges. The on-site dining is overpriced for mediocre fare, and there are limited options nearby since it's by the airport. Getting around the vast hotel is time-consuming. Checking out was a nightmare with long waits for carts and valet parking. While the hotel itself is attractive, the inconvenient location, pricing issues, and lack of surrounding amenities make staying downtown and commuting a better option for the value and convenience.

Ava's offered a mixed dining experience. While the ricotta cheese appetizer had excellent flavor, the portion size was disappointingly small. The pizzas, though tasty, seemed to be missing the advertised rosemary. However, the grouper entree with Israeli couscous was scrumptious. For dessert, the zeppoles (sugared donuts) were amazing, but the cherry tart's dense crust and candied cherries didn't appeal to everyone's taste. Despite some misses, the in-house made pastas sound promising, and the overall experience warrants a return visit to explore more of Ava's menu.

First Visit Delight: A Stellar Sushi Experience! This sushi spot shines with its impeccable cleanliness, friendly staff, and exceptional sushi craftsmanship. The sushi was incredibly fresh and reasonably priced, while the service was attentive and on-point. An absolute must-visit for sushi enthusiasts, and I can't wait to return for another delightful meal.

If you're a fan of delicious and perfectly cooked chicken, this place is an absolute must-visit. The name says it all – they truly deliver on their promise of serving up some of the best birds in town. While their chicken dishes are the stars of the show, be sure to try their unique and tasty fried corn on the cob as well. With an excellent menu and a lively atmosphere, this place is a real gem for anyone who appreciates quality comfort food.

A disappointing experience at this overhyped breakfast spot. The pancakes tasted like a frozen, processed version, the 'homemade' maple syrup was watery and artificially flavored, and the hash browns were greasy and bland. The bacon was overcooked and chewy, indicating it had been sitting for too long. The food lacked inspiration and authenticity, failing to live up to the restaurant's outdated reputation. With numerous better breakfast options available in Nashville, this place is skippable.

Indulge in an exceptional dining experience at this establishment. The budget-friendly lunch option, with its tempting prix fixe menu, delivers outstanding value. My wife's prime rib po'boy, an upscale interpretation featuring gruyere and a remarkable horseradish sauce, paired with the delectable tomato fennel soup, left us thoroughly impressed. My seafood jambalaya and seafood gumbo were arguably the best I've ever tasted, showcasing the chef's mastery of flavors. Whether you opt for the budget or indulgent options, this restaurant guarantees a memorable culinary journey.

Pure Design exceeded expectations for a large event. Their team consulted closely to offer unique floral arrangements within the desired budget. On the event day, they transformed the space with stunning arrangements that guests raved about long after. The flowers remained fresh for days, and Pure Design allowed the arrangements to be taken home - a rarity with some florists. Their expertise, professionalism, and gorgeous work make Pure Design highly recommended for major events.

This bar is a hidden gem that caters to an older crowd looking for a lively atmosphere. The server was incredibly welcoming and knowledgeable, guiding us through their impressive selection of beers and liquors. While the bar food menu is limited, it packs a flavorful punch. We were hesitant about trying the pork belly sliders, but they turned out to be an absolute delight – a must-try! The tapas offerings could use a bit more variety, but the quality is undoubtedly top-notch. The staff's warm and engaging demeanor made our visit all the more enjoyable. We can't wait to return and highly recommend this spot for those seeking a fun, adult-friendly hangout.

Overpriced and Underwhelming: This hyped-up burger joint falls flat despite its attempts to be unique. While the bison burger caught my interest, it was overshadowed by unnecessary toppings that ruined the overall experience. The lack of inclusion of fries with the burgers, coupled with the exorbitant price for a shared large order, left a sour taste. With a bill totaling around $37 for just two burgers, a shared fry, and drinks, the value proposition is severely lacking. The forced quirkiness comes across as gimmicky rather than genuine. In the end, this place tried too hard to be different but failed to deliver a satisfying meal worth revisiting.

While our server LaToya was awesome and attentive, the overall dining experience was marred by a disturbing and poorly handled incident. The black bean burger was disappointingly dry, though the sweet potato fries were decent. However, the main issue was the unsettling arrest of a food delivery person that occurred right in the dining area, with police rushing in and handcuffing the individual in full view of customers. The manner in which it was handled, with the manager pointing out the target and a lack of concern for the disturbance caused to diners, was highly unprofessional and insensitive. The managers disappeared afterward without addressing the situation or acknowledging the unease it caused among patrons and staff. While the reason for the arrest is unknown, the establishment should have handled it more discreetly and provided better care for their customers' dining experience.

These sliders are an absolute treat! The perfect bite-size allows you to indulge in multiple flavors. The fried chicken, BLT, Monte Cristo, and Cuban varieties were all delightfully delicious. Don't forget to grab some donuts to go for a sweet finish to your meal!

This was my third visit to the restaurant after they reopened under new management. They offer daily specials at a great value of $7.95, which includes a plate, iced tea, and soup. On the day of my visit (Friday), the specials featured Carne Asada with rice and beans, fried fish plate, and chicken enchiladas with rice and beans. I ordered the Carne Asada plate, and they kindly accommodated my request to substitute the rice and beans for a salad. The steak was cooked well and enjoyable. The specials seem to change daily, offering a variety of options at an affordable price. Overall, the food was satisfactory, and the service was attentive. A solid dining experience at a reasonable cost.

Sweet Divas is a delightful spice shop that tantalizes the senses with aromatic spices wafting through the air. Its extensive range of high-quality spices, salts, sugars, and powders sets it apart. The knowledgeable staff provides excellent guidance in choosing the perfect spices for any culinary adventure. The products are not only flavorful but also remarkably fresh and long-lasting, making the reasonable prices a worthwhile investment. With its inviting atmosphere and superior offerings, Sweet Divas is a must-visit destination for any spice enthusiast or home chef seeking to elevate their cooking game.

Highly recommended! Steve and his partner offer an excellent selection of demo racquets, making it easy to find the perfect fit. Their competitive prices and vast inventory cater to players of all levels. If you're serious about your game, this is the go-to place for all your racquet needs.

Despite being more packed than expected on opening day, Chick-fil-A in Reno delivered an impressive experience. Although the line extended outside, the efficient staff ensured a wait time of only 8 minutes. The food arrived swiftly, within 5 minutes of finding a table. Even amid the chaos, the smooth operations and attentive service stood out. A minor order mishap was promptly rectified, and the staff proactively checked on refills and food quality. Despite the opening day crowd, Chick-fil-A upheld their high standards, ensuring a positive dining experience.

An exceptional winery offering an outstanding wine tasting experience. The wines are top-notch, with an impressive selection at great prices. The service is excellent, enhancing the overall ambiance of this beautiful spot. Highly recommended for wine enthusiasts seeking quality wines and a delightful tasting environment.

Overall, Beck's Restaurant shines with their signature gator gumbo, which is a must-try for any visitor. The savory flavors and well-balanced spices make it a standout dish. However, their pasta offerings leave much to be desired, with the chicken alfredo being dry and forgettable. For the best experience, stick to the gator gumbo, and you won't be disappointed.

Despite initial concerns after reading reviews, my experience was excellent. The wait time was reasonable, and the staff was friendly and accommodating from the moment I entered the lobby until I left the office. Their courteous service made for a pleasant visit overall.

Despite numerous recommendations, The Taint failed to impress. The apathetic atmosphere and the unsavory clientele from the Garden District left much to be desired. Instead of a hipster haven, it felt more like a dirty-headed crapfest. Avoid this establishment if you're seeking an enjoyable night out. Boo."

Overall, the new Chick-fil-A location in Bloomingdale delivers the brand's signature hospitality and tasty staples, making it a welcome addition to the area. While the fries fell slightly short, the exceptional service and beloved Chick-fil-A favorites make this spot a solid choice for a satisfying meal.

This cozy bakery on Germantown Ave is a true gem for those with a sweet tooth. The tempting display of cookies and bars immediately catches the eye, but the real standout is the "cake scrapple" – an assortment of delectable cake flavors and icings, likely made from leftover baked goods. The Red Velvet with cream cheese frosting was a heavenly choice, moist and flavorful. Complementing the cake was an M&M cookie, soft and chewy with a delightful crunch from the candies. Enjoying these treats on their outdoor bench on a pleasant day made for a truly enjoyable experience. If you're in the area and craving something sweet, this bakery is a must-visit for its unique offerings and undeniable deliciousness.

This establishment has undergone significant enhancements, creating a much more inviting ambiance. While the seating could be slightly more comfortable for extended periods, such as watching an entire football game, the overall improvements are commendable. It's a notable step up in providing an enjoyable experience.

While the food itself is good, the slow service at this restaurant deserves only three stars. They need to hire additional staff to handle orders efficiently, especially during peak hours when the waiting area gets crowded. Utilizing the kiosk ordering system can help bypass the long lines, but management should consider increasing the front-of-house team to provide a smoother overall experience.

When this establishment first opened, their limited menu offering of a single flavor failed to impress. The overpriced dishes lacked substance, leaving our group of three unsatisfied despite spending a considerable $70-80. The sauce's peculiar blend of buffet-style and fish sauce flavors was a letdown for those expecting authentic Cajun-style seafood. While the restaurant shows potential for improvement, there are currently better dining options available. A modest rating of 3 out of 5 reflects the underwhelming inaugural visit.

The Ybor Walking Tour with Raymond as our knowledgeable and friendly guide was an absolute delight! Over the course of roughly 3 hours (with some delightful chit-chat diversions), we gained fascinating insights into Tampa's rich history, culture, and the vibrant Ybor district. The tour included tantalizing food tastings, with the Cuban sandwich from Stone Soup Company being a standout. Whether you're a visitor or a long-time resident, this informative and enjoyable tour is a must-do. Plus, with over 5,000 steps logged, it's a guilt-free way to indulge in the delicious local fare. Highly recommended for a fun and flavorful adventure!

Franzone's is a classic pizza joint that delivers on its staple sweet spiral plain pies. While the plain pizza is a can't-miss classic, the white pizza with onions is a pleasant surprise that adds a flavorful twist to the traditional offering. The onions provide a delightful complement to the pizza, enhancing the overall taste. For those familiar with the Bridgeport location, this Franzone's maintains the same quality and authenticity that many have grown to love. Whether you opt for the trusty plain pie or venture into the white pizza with onions, Franzone's is a solid choice for satisfying your pizza cravings.

Avoid this place at all costs. My 18-year-old daughter received a misdiagnosis and ineffective treatment for her severe sore throat. Despite being the only patients there, we waited over an hour. The staff seemed robotic and unfriendly, even asking me to leave while I was still there. The experience was confusing, unpleasant, and unprofessional. It's better to have a reliable primary care physician instead of risking a visit to this poorly run clinic.

Amidst the industrial surroundings, this eatery stands out for its phenomenal chicken sandwich. A culinary gem in an unexpected setting, it offers great food that defies the area's industrial vibe. If you're in the vicinity, make sure to stop by and savor their exceptional chicken sandwich.

The online booking process for this horseback riding experience was straightforward and hassle-free. We opted for a 2-hour side-by-side ride, and our guide Matt was excellent – knowledgeable, friendly, and made the experience truly enjoyable. The trail offered stunning views, and we had a fantastic time overall. Highly recommended!

The Neighborhood Bar is a fantastic spot for unwinding after work or grabbing a quick bite. Their Happy Hour offerings from 4-7 PM daily are an absolute steal, with $3 wines and drafts, $5 pizzas, and $4.50 appetizers. For those on the go, their to-go dinners and lunches are not only reasonably priced but also served promptly. However, what truly sets this place apart is the warm and friendly staff, making every visit a delightful experience.

Disappointing Experience: Despite the friendly service from the waiter, our meal was marred by unappetizing finds. Both the appetizer and my friend's noodle dish contained hair, which completely killed our appetite. To make matters worse, the restaurant didn't rectify the situation by providing a fresh meal or compensating us in any way. Needless to say, we won't be returning due to the lack of attention to food quality and poor handling of the issue. A regrettable dining experience.
Overall, ITV is a terrific establishment that offers some of the best culinary experiences in the city, making it a must-visit destination for food lovers in Philadelphia.
An absolute gem! This place offers fantastic hours, immaculate cleanliness, and a truly relaxing ambiance. Highly recommended for those seeking a delightful experience.

Buckingham Pizza is a must-visit pizza parlor that serves the best pizza in town. Their plain pizza and cool ranch specialty pizza are standout offerings that shouldn't be missed. While the restaurant offers entrees like chicken piccata, the real stars of the show are their delicious pizzas and sides. Skip the fancy items and stick to what they do best – order a few pizzas and some sides for a truly satisfying dining experience. With their exceptional pies, Buckingham Pizza is a surefire way to satisfy your cravings for delectable pizza.

Cafe Beignet is a standout spot for an exceptional iced latte and delightfully fluffy beignets. The live music adds a delightful ambiance, elevating the experience above the more touristy Cafe du Monde. With attentive service and rarely any lines, Cafe Beignet offers an enjoyable and hassle-free indulgence in classic New Orleans treats. Highly recommended for a memorable beignet experience.

Captain Bill's is a delightful waterfront gem with a laid-back vibe, offering a front-row seat to watch the bustling passersby and playful dolphins. With a diverse menu catering to varied tastes, from picky eaters to seasoned foodies, the restaurant delivers fresh, hot meals precisely to your liking, even accommodating special requests. The attentive service and reasonable wait times ensure a seamless dining experience. Whether you're a local or a visitor, Captain Bill's is a must-visit spot at John's Pass, where great food, warm hospitality, and scenic views converge to create a truly satisfying culinary adventure.

This sushi restaurant in Valrico is an absolute gem! Their sushi creations are both innovative and delectable, with standouts like the must-try peanut avocado roll and the amazing Volcano roll. The service is equally impressive, with a friendly and attentive staff. Despite being a bit of a drive, this place is well worth the trip – you won't regret making the journey for some of the best sushi in the area.

La Cubana Restaurant offers a decent Cuban dining experience, neither exceptional nor disappointing. As a convenient lunch spot for nearby workers, it presents a rotating selection of daily specials prepared fresh. While the food may not stand out as extraordinary, it's a suitable option to explore the flavors of Cuban cuisine during the midday hours. Worth a visit for those seeking a satisfactory and reasonably priced lunch in the area.

The experience at this restaurant was a mixed bag. While the pepperloin meal was enjoyable and the service was good, the shrimp kabob dish left much to be desired. With only four overcooked and tiny shrimp, it was a disappointing offering, especially considering the restaurant wasn't busy at the time of our visit. If you're craving a steak, it might be worth a try, but the seafood options are best avoided.

The personalized service shines through, with the staff seemingly able to read minds and deliver exactly what you crave. Whether you're a local regular or a first-time visitor, this deli offers a delightfully unique experience that satisfies both your taste buds and your sense of wonder.

Heather's new hair salon is a delightful addition to East Passyunk. As a longtime client, I can attest to her exceptional talent as a colorist and her ability to craft personalized looks with creativity and flair. The salon's relaxed and welcoming atmosphere is a testament to Heather's warmth and her knack for making clients feel at ease. Not only is she a hair wizard, but her staff is equally trustworthy, making it easy to recommend them to friends and family. Beyond hair, Heather's passion for cactus houseplants and vintage bikes adds to the salon's charm. It's a refreshing gem in the heart of the neighborhood.

Sally's Beauty Supply is a great destination for hair enthusiasts, offering an unmatched selection of products in the area. The friendly staff and well-stocked shelves make it an ideal spot for experimenting with new styles and treatments. However, the store's cramped aisles, dimly lit interiors, and lack of cleanliness detract from the beauty shopping experience. While the employees could benefit from more product knowledge, the wide variety of options available makes Sally's a go-to choice for hair care needs. To elevate the overall experience, management should prioritize improving the store's appearance and ambiance to match the trendy vibe of other beauty retailers.

Rodney Mitchell Salon (RMS) is an absolute gem! After being disappointed by haircuts elsewhere, I decided to give RMS a try based on a friend's recommendation. The owner, Rodney, was incredibly accommodating in setting me up with Allison when my friend's stylist wasn't available. Allison is a sweetheart and an excellent stylist. She listened carefully to my preferences and delivered the cutest shaggy bob haircut that exceeded my expectations. The salon offers great discounts for first-time clients, students, teachers, and referrals, making it an affordable option for frugal clients like myself. With Allison's skills and the salon's customer-friendly policies, RMS is now my go-to place for haircuts. Highly recommended!

While the ambiance and staff are pleasant, the persistent loud music and unsatisfactory tea service can be deal-breakers for those seeking a tranquil coffee shop experience. It's a shame because the venue has so much potential, but the noise and tea presentation issues ultimately drive customers away sooner than they'd like.

Spice n Grill serves up some of the best Indian fare in St. Louis. The beef nihari, palak paneer, and naan were standouts – perfectly spiced, adequately spicy, and absolutely crave-worthy. While the in-restaurant seating isn't great, the friendly owner and the exceptional take-out options more than make up for it. Formerly the owners of 'Indian Food,' this new establishment is a must-try for anyone craving delicious, authentic Indian cuisine to-go.

However, for a purist like myself who values authentic, real flavors, this place falls short. It's decent, but could definitely be better. If you're in the area and craving boba, it's worth a try, but don't expect the same level of quality as you'd find in California.

Silver Mine's has been a disappointing experience over the past 4-5 years, with progressively worsening service. Despite charging for extras, they often fail to include requested additions or free sides. Delivery times are excessively long, and the overall service is worse than what one would expect from kindergarteners. Given the numerous other dining options available, this establishment is an embarrassment to the industry and a waste of space on University Blvd. Avoid ordering from Silver Mine's at all costs.

After accidentally damaging my new bike shortly after purchasing it from this shop, I was pleasantly surprised by their exceptional service. They promptly fixed the mangled front basket and adjusted the gear shifter, all free of charge. The entire process took less than half an hour, saving me from leaving the bike for days. The staff, including the owners, salespeople, mechanics, and even the friendly shop dog, were incredibly welcoming. I couldn't be happier with my decision to buy from this shop, and I highly recommend their outstanding service.

While the prices may be on the higher side, this store is an absolute delight for adults. It's like stepping into a wonderland, with an inviting atmosphere that encourages exploration and discovery. Even if you're just browsing, the experience is truly magical. An absolute must-visit for those seeking a whimsical and enchanting shopping adventure.

Pag's in Doylestown is an underrated burger gem! While the menu may not seem overly appealing at first glance, their cheeseburger is a standout. It tastes like an elevated Big Mac with a perfectly sized patty, well-balanced bun, and a delightful sauce. The wine bar ambiance is cozy and adult-friendly, though the staff was accommodating to our child. If you're craving a quality burger in a nice setting, Pag's is a must-visit spot in Doylestown.

Fantastic Indian fare with delightful service! This cozy restaurant is a regular haunt for us, offering an incredible dining experience at reasonable prices. While weekends can get crowded, the wait is worth it for their mouthwatering Indian Pancake and succulent Hainanese or Curry Chicken dishes. With an extensive menu of delectable options, every visit is a treat that never disappoints. Highly recommended!

Disappointed with the poor service and lackadaisical attitude towards environmental responsibility at this highly-rated diner. Despite its prime waterfront location, the staff seemed indifferent, and the outdoor deck was littered with trash that could easily blow into the ocean. While the food itself was decent, the slow, unfriendly service and lack of concern for the marine environment left a sour taste. A simple addition of a screen or fence would mitigate the littering issue, but until changes are made, I cannot recommend this establishment.

The food is not extraordinary but reliable, making it a dependable standby option. Despite slightly steep prices, the contemporary ambiance and excellent service make up for it. Overall, it's a solid choice for an enjoyable dining experience without breaking the bank.

China Palace offers a standard Chinese restaurant experience with a familiar menu, but what sets it apart is its convenient and efficient service. While the food itself is nothing extraordinary, their lunch specials provide good value. The real highlight is their prompt order fulfillment, ensuring your food is ready for pick-up without any unnecessary wait. If you're looking for a reliable and hassle-free option for traditional Chinese fare, China Palace delivers on convenience and timeliness.

Bustling Ambiance, Delectable Fare! This cozy eatery boasts an eclectic menu brimming with creative flavors. The onion tart and veal meatballs were standouts, with the latter's red gravy reminiscent of homemade goodness. The citrus short ribs with fat noodles and veggies were a delightful special, though portion sizes left us delightfully stuffed. Despite the cramped quarters, the warm, welcoming vibe made for a delightful dining experience. We can't wait to return and explore more of their intriguing offerings.
Angelina's is a true hidden gem, offering a genuine Italian dining experience that feels like home. We can't wait to return and savor more of their mouthwatering dishes.

An absolute must-visit dining destination! The restaurant boasts an incredible view that perfectly complements the outstanding cuisine. The lobster mac and cheese is a true standout dish, bursting with rich, decadent flavors. An unforgettable dining experience for any occasion.

This ice cream parlor is an absolute gem! The portions are incredibly generous, and the flavors are unique and delightfully tasty. It sets the standard for what an exceptional ice cream store should be, and others would do well to follow its example. Highly recommended!

While the drink specials are enticing, this establishment falls short in terms of atmosphere and operating hours. The food is merely average, and the lack of crowds, even on a Friday night, is concerning. The most disappointing aspect, however, is the inexplicably early last call at 10:15 PM. This premature closure essentially forces patrons to seek alternative venues, defeating the purpose of a night out. Unless you're seeking a quiet drink before dinner, it's best to explore other options for an enjoyable evening experience.

If you find yourself with a late-night case of the munchies, this place has got you covered. Their menu offers a variety of satisfying options to curb those insatiable cravings, no matter the reason wink wink. Indulge without judgment - they understand the urge for some serious snacking after certain...activities. Discreet service and tasty bites make this a solid choice for your next midnight munchy mission.

Value City Furniture fails to live up to its "value" promise, offering overpriced and mediocre quality furniture. While they have a few modern pieces, most of their selection consists of unknown brands with inflated prices comparable to high-end retailers like Rothman's. The entertainment centers and TV stands are limited and expensive, while the clearance section offers minimal discounts on damaged items. Sectionals average around $1,000, and dining sets are nothing special but still overpriced. The staff tends to be unhelpful, congregating in cliques instead of assisting customers. The 5% military discount is a meager gesture. Overall, Value City Furniture disappoints with its lack of genuine value, and shoppers would be better off exploring other furniture stores or waiting for significant holiday sales before considering a purchase.

Franzone's is a delightful local establishment that stands out for its warm hospitality and quality fare. The owner's presence and genuine care for the products they serve create a truly pleasant dining experience. While their sauces may lean towards the sweeter side, which may not appeal to all palates, their cheesesteaks and fries are well-executed and satisfying. Overall, Franzone's earns high marks not just for its tasty offerings but also for the inviting atmosphere fostered by the friendly staff, making it a neighborhood gem worth visiting.

Bab Cafe is a delightful addition to Reno's culinary scene, especially for Asian food enthusiasts. The friendly staff guided us through the menu, and we relished the flavorful Jeyuk Top-Bab (spicy pork), which is unparalleled in the area. The sauce bar allows for customization, and the included miso soup is a nice touch. The fresh and enjoyable meal offers great value, and the convenient downtown location makes it easy to dine in, take out, or have it delivered. Bab Cafe is a must-try for those seeking an exceptional and unique dining experience.

Seafood Delight in New Orleans: Despite not being a fan of seafood and lacking much of an appetite, the $15 lunch special at this establishment proved to be an unexpected gem. The seafood stew, brimming with oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish, was a harmonious blend of flavors and textures. The perfectly balanced spice level, velvety consistency, and tender meat made it impossible to resist devouring the entire dish. Complemented by a surprisingly thoughtful salad, this meal is undoubtedly worth trying for its exceptional value and taste.

Biscuit Love delivers a delightful breakfast experience despite the long wait. The vegan grits and biscuit were incredibly flavorful, and the other dishes pleased the entire group. Be warned that the bloody Marys pack a spicy punch. The service was excellent, with a well-organized process ensuring a swift line and prompt food delivery. Overall, Biscuit Love has perfected their craft, offering a delicious and seamless dining experience that's worth the wait.

Ichicoro Ane is a Japanese restaurant that truly captures the essence of an authentic Izakaya experience. With its inviting ambiance, coupled with an impressive selection of dishes and whiskeys, this establishment ticks all the right boxes.

The menu boasts a delightful array of options, with the katsu (breaded and fried cutlets) being a standout choice for those seeking a hearty and satisfying meal. The bao buns, particularly the fish variety, offer a lighter alternative for those with a more modest appetite. While portion sizes can vary, the knowledgeable servers are more than happy to guide patrons through the menu, ensuring an informed and enjoyable dining experience.

The cocktail selection at Ichicoro Ane is a true highlight, with a special emphasis on Japanese whiskies. The Japanese Old Fashioned, albeit a bit pricey, is a testament to the quality and craftsmanship that goes into each libation.

Dining at Ichicoro Ane is best enjoyed in a group setting, allowing patrons to sample a wider range of dishes and truly immerse themselves in the Izakaya experience. The restaurant captures the essence of Japanese pubs visited by the reviewer in Japan and Korea, making it a must-visit for those seeking an authentic and memorable culinary adventure.

This bakery is a weekend morning gem! They serve up delicious breakfast sandwiches, fantastic coffee, and mouthwatering donuts. It's a favorite spot for my friend and me to kick off our weekends in the best way possible. Highly recommended for a tasty and enjoyable breakfast experience.

This cozy spot offers an impressive whiskey and bourbon selection, making it a haven for spirit enthusiasts. While the seating arrangement for larger groups could be improved, the culinary highlights truly shine. The burgers, especially with the decadent fried egg topping, are downright heavenly and rank among the best I've encountered. The standout, however, are the irresistible duck fries – an absolute must-try. With its charming ambiance and delectable fare, this establishment warrants a revisit.

The Black Rose boasts an inviting English pub ambiance and expertly crafted cocktails, but be prepared for inflated prices and a potential struggle to snag a seat. While the cozy, intimate setting and skilled bartenders are major draws, the $7 price tag for a standard mixed drink may give some patrons pause. Overall, it's an enjoyable spot for those seeking a traditional pub experience, though the limited seating can be a hindrance.

Cozy Ambiance, Limited Drink Options: This quaint spot offers a cozy atmosphere with vintage glassware, perfect for catching up with friends. However, the drink menu felt restrictive, with most cocktails featuring a similar ginger, lime, and honey flavor profile regardless of the spirit. The noise level also quickly became deafening as more patrons arrived, despite the abundance of fabric decor. Service was attentive without being overbearing, though refills were not proactively offered. The bacon-wrapped dates were a disappointment, overly sweet and almost inedible. While the ambiance holds promise, the limited drink selection and uneven food quality detract from the overall experience.

A quintessential fall experience! This place never disappoints, offering a delightful array of seasonal activities year after year. From the classic hayrides and pumpkin picking to various other engaging events, it's a surefire way to embrace the autumn spirit. Highly recommended for families and anyone seeking a memorable autumnal outing.

I called this dealership to inquire about service information for my 2015 AMG, which was a substantial $110K purchase. Despite having a vehicle under warranty, I was informed that since I didn't buy it from their dealership, I would have to pay for a loaner car during any warranty work. This policy seems unreasonable and unfriendly towards non-original buyers. As a result of this experience, I will be avoiding this dealership and taking my business elsewhere.

This little natural grocery store is a hidden gem in the city, offering a modest yet diverse selection akin to Whole Foods. From a salad bar and juice bar to fresh produce, it's a one-stop shop for healthy eats. While compact, it boasts a parking lot and is conveniently situated just a couple of blocks away from clothing stores, making it an ideal stop for a quick grocery run or a bite while out shopping. If you're seeking a quality natural grocer without the crowds of a larger chain, this cozy spot is worth checking out.

An absolute gem! This place offers a delightful outdoor ambiance, accompanied by an exceptional wine selection that sets it apart from the typical offerings. The live music on a weekday afternoon was a delightful surprise, adding to the vibrant atmosphere. Indulge in a delectable cheese and wine pairing, and prepare to be thoroughly satisfied. The regular menu is a true celebration of culinary craftsmanship and artistry. With its captivating ambiance and tantalizing flavors, this establishment is a must-visit for anyone seeking a truly memorable dining experience.

This place offers excellent service for smog checks on vehicles. The staff is friendly and upbeat, making the experience more pleasant than most other places. Highly recommended for your automotive smog needs.

An exceptional dining experience! This place shines with its diverse menu offerings, catering to various dietary needs with delectable gluten-free and vegan choices. The salad, pizza, and root beer were impeccably prepared, leaving a lasting impression of pure culinary delight.

An excellent dining experience! Our group of 6 thoroughly enjoyed the burgers, which were delicious and satisfying. The restaurant itself was very clean and had a nice ambiance. The sweet potato tots were a standout side dish and a must-try. Highly recommended for a casual yet tasty meal.

This establishment offers an exceptional dining experience, with outstanding lighting and a delightfully quiet ambiance. The environment is inviting and pleasant, further enhanced by the attentive and friendly staff. While the food is quite good, it falls slightly short of perfection, leaving room for slight improvement. Overall, it's a highly recommended spot for those seeking a comfortable and enjoyable dining atmosphere complemented by quality cuisine.

While it may lack the ambiance of a traditional restaurant, this convenience store deli delivers delicious made-to-order sandwiches that surpass expectations. The Cuban press and breakfast sandwiches were standouts, showcasing fresh ingredients and fantastic flavor. With its waterfront seating overlooking the ocean, it offers a pleasant dining experience despite the casual setting. For those seeking a tasty and affordable meal, this deli outshines the more popular breakfast spot in the same area. A solid 4 out of 5 stars.

My second visit to this restaurant was even better than the first. It seems they've ironed out some of the initial kinks from their grand opening, such as having more bottle openers and improved portion sizes for the garlic noodles. Although some tables still appeared drafty, we were seated at a comfortable spot this time. The food remained amazing, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit! We had no trouble getting a table on a Saturday evening at 5 pm. It's a fantastic addition to the local neighborhood.

While Skyline Chili's delicious cheese coney hot dogs are a beloved favorite, their Clearwater location leaves much to be desired. Plagued by frequent shortages, malfunctioning equipment, and excruciatingly slow service, this particular restaurant fails to live up to the brand's standards. Despite the cravings for Cincinnati-style chili, the disappointing experience at this establishment makes it difficult to fully enjoy the meal. Here's hoping the management can address these issues and restore Skyline's reputation for quality and efficiency.
Rating: 2/5 stars

This place is a must-visit for anyone craving delicious Mexican fare. The tacos and nachos are absolutely outstanding, and the margaritas are top-notch. The lively atmosphere adds to the overall experience. Don't miss their triple special day on Wednesdays, which offers unbeatable deals. Whether you're looking for a casual dining spot or a vibrant night out, this restaurant delivers on all fronts.

Overall, the experience was marred by poor service, hidden fees, and misleading information. I would not recommend this rental car company and suggest exploring alternative options that prioritize customer satisfaction and transparency.

Todd and Roberta from [Company Name] truly exceeded expectations! Their carpet and upholstery cleaning service left my home spotless, eliminating even tough pet stains with remarkable efficiency. The fresh, chemical-free scent and quick drying time were impressive. Moreover, their friendly demeanor and valuable home care advice added to an excellent overall experience. Highly recommended professionals who deliver exceptional results at a fair price. I'll definitely be a repeat customer!

This place is a true gem! The sips mocha is an absolute must-try, and the friendly staff adds to the delightful experience. The convenient drive-thru option is a lifesaver for those with kids in tow. Don't forget to indulge in their incredible cakes – they're simply amazing! Highly recommended for a fantastic coffee shop experience.

Chateau La Vin is a delightful wine bar that has evolved from its humble beginnings as a wine store. The transformation has been impressive, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere where guests can enjoy an extensive selection of wines, accompanied by cheese and crackers. The addition of live music from local artists enhances the ambiance. For those preferring beer, there is also a nice variety available. The owner's willingness to share their wine knowledge adds to the experience. Outdoor seating is available, and guests can order food from nearby restaurants, some of which offer delivery. Overall, Chateau La Vin is a fantastic spot for wine enthusiasts and a great place to unwind and savor the pleasures of good wine and company.

The Hollander Hotel provided an exceptional experience for our wedding festivities. From the charming decor and welcoming atmosphere to the cozy accommodations and convenient location, every aspect was truly delightful. The Tap Room served as the perfect after-party venue, and the delectable brunch on the beautiful patio was a highlight. What truly sets The Hollander apart is their outstanding management team and staff, who treated us like family and ensured every detail was perfect. Nick, Will, Zach, and the entire team went above and beyond, making our special day absolutely unforgettable. We can't recommend The Hollander Hotel highly enough for any occasion – it's simply perfection!

Utterly disappointing experience at this establishment. The gyro 'platter' was a complete letdown – dry, bland, and nothing like a deconstructed gyro should be. The so-called 'vegetables' were an insult to the term, resembling and tasting like excrement. With numerous superior lunch options available in Fairmount, there is no justification for subjecting oneself to such a unappetizing and unacceptable meal. Avoid at all costs if you value your palate and dining experience.

The Brewery boasts an inviting ambiance with the brewery onsite, creating a delightful atmosphere for enjoying their well-crafted beers. The knowledgeable and friendly service from the waiter further enhanced the experience, making it a must-visit destination for beer enthusiasts and those seeking a pleasant evening out.

An unforgettable dining experience in New Orleans! This restaurant exceeded expectations with its mouthwatering signature dishes like the BBQ shrimp and heavenly bread pudding. The fried green tomato appetizer was a delightful start to the meal. Outstanding ambiance and top-notch service complemented the delicious food. Highly recommended for anyone visiting the city in search of an exceptional culinary adventure.

An exceptional shopping experience with an unparalleled selection and outstanding customer service. The only drawback is their absence in Ft. McMurray, leaving locals yearning for their presence. Highly recommended if you have the chance to visit.

Stay away from this tanning salon chain! Their advertised online coupons and promotions are nothing but bait and switch tactics. The staff at the Chippewa location outright denied honoring a legitimate $15 unlimited tanning week coupon for new customers, providing one excuse after another. They falsely claimed it was only for students, then said it expired, despite being live on their website and Yelp. They even refused to honor another advertised $45 for $75 coupon. When I called the Creve Coeur location, they confirmed the original coupon was valid but required visiting the same location each time. This dishonest and deceptive behavior is unacceptable. Steer clear of this tanning salon chain that lies and tries to take advantage of customers. Don't waste your time or money here!

With its outstanding food, efficient service, and helpful staff, this establishment is undoubtedly a must-visit for anyone craving a delightful Indian culinary adventure. Prepare to be enchanted by the flavors and leave with a yearning to return for more.

El Sabor Poblano may not look like much from the outside, but this unassuming South Philly Mexican spot delivers when it comes to authentic and delicious tacos. The fish tacos are a standout, featuring an entire filet of flaky, non-fishy fish in each tortilla, though the option with tortilla chip-crusted fish also sounds intriguing. The chorizo tacos are another winner, with super crispy filling devoid of any gristle. While the toppings lean more American, the friendly staff seems happy to accommodate requests for traditional fixings like cilantro and onion. Despite its humble appearance, El Sabor Poblano is a hidden gem worth seeking out for a satisfying Mexican feast in an unpretentious setting.

Despite a recent burglary incident, this locally-owned establishment impressed with its friendly service, cold beer, and tasty wings. The bartender was attentive and prompt, ensuring a pleasant experience. The owners' welcoming presence at the Italian Fest added to the appeal of supporting this non-franchised spot. The cozy ambiance and convenient location near home and work make it a great neighborhood haunt. Highly recommended for its warm vibe and commitment to quality offerings from a local business. A definite must-visit for fellow Yelpers seeking a comfortable and authentic dining experience.

This hidden gem, discovered through Yelp's recommendations, truly lives up to its stellar reviews. The sandwiches are undeniably delicious, making the wait in line absolutely worthwhile. Despite the queue, the service is prompt and friendly. Within 15 minutes of ordering four different sandwiches and grabbing our beverages, our meals were promptly delivered to our table as we sat down. Overall, it was a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience, and this place is highly recommended for those seeking a tasty and efficient sandwich spot.

The theater boasts incredibly comfortable recliners, though you'll need to put your feet down for aisle access. The cozy lounge and in-theater drinking privilege are definite perks. However, the concession stand experience was disappointing, with disorganized service and burnt popcorn during peak hours. Next time, it's advisable to eat beforehand and enjoy the bar instead.

An Exceptional Hotel Experience: This hotel truly stands out as one of the best I've encountered. Impeccable cleanliness, coupled with courteous staff and impressive amenities like a beautiful pool and grand entrance, make this property a true gem. I can't wait to return next year for another outstanding stay.

A Disappointing First and Last Visit. This restaurant failed to impress from the very start. The quality of the food was subpar, and the taste left much to be desired. The overall experience was so unsatisfying that I have no intention of returning. I cannot recommend dining here.

While the location and ambiance of this brewery seemed promising, our recent Sunday afternoon visit left much to be desired. With limited food options available, we settled for sampling their beer selection, which proved to be utterly average and unmemorable across the six styles we tried. Additionally, the staff's unprofessional behavior, openly arguing behind the bar within earshot of patrons, put a damper on the overall experience. Despite the cool venue, the lackluster beer and poor service make it difficult to recommend a return visit, especially given the superior options in the nearby area.

After being limited to the meager options at terminal F, I settled for Tony Luke's, renowned for their Philly Cheesesteaks. Excited to try an authentic version in the city of its origin, my anticipation was quickly deflated. The sandwich bore little resemblance to the tantalizing display overhead. More egregiously, the meat tasted akin to dog food – an unpalatable experience hardly worth the $10 price tag. A disheartening letdown from an establishment with such a storied reputation.

Hidden Gem in Creve Couer! This 9-hole course is an absolute delight. The affordability makes it accessible to golfers of all skill levels and budgets. The friendly and helpful staff enhance the overall experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a enjoyable round without breaking the bank. Don't miss out on this best-kept secret in the area!

First visit, and it was a mixed experience. While the food itself was good, the service left much to be desired. The employees seemed indifferent and lacked hospitality, and there were long waits due to slow service. If you're willing to overlook the poor service for decent food, it could be worth a try. However, with so many dining options available, they may lose customers if the service issues persist.

The service at this establishment leaves much to be desired, but the food is the real star. Don't come here expecting top-notch service; instead, be prepared to indulge in delicious fare that outshines the lacklustre service. Despite its dive bar vibe, the kitchen serves up consistently great and tasty dishes that make it worth the visit. If you're willing to overlook the subpar service, you'll be rewarded with a satisfying culinary experience.

The Indianapolis Museum of Art is an absolute gem, boasting an impressive collection spanning African art, modern works, and an enchanting outdoor sculpture garden – all accessible for free! Despite the minor mishap with photography restrictions in the modern art section, I was thoroughly delighted by this hidden treasure. The museum's architecture and ambiance are equally captivating, making it a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts and casual visitors alike. Highly recommended for a culturally enriching experience without breaking the bank.

On the positive side, the food was enjoyable. I ordered the turkey Reuben and salad combo, requesting extra sauerkraut (for a $0.50 charge), but the portion of sauerkraut was disappointingly small. However, the sandwich itself was delicious. My friend's sunrise chile rellenos looked tempting, and I would consider ordering that on a future visit with a smaller party. Overall, the food was satisfactory, but the long wait and seating issues dampened the experience.

The Shop is an exceptional co-working space that truly impresses. With its meticulous attention to detail and outstanding services, it offers an unparalleled experience. The versatile layout provides ample opportunities for both private meetings and productive workspaces, making it an ideal choice for professionals seeking a well-designed and functional environment.

An Unforgettable Anniversary Celebration!

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at this exceptional restaurant, and it was an absolute delight from start to finish. The culinary masterpieces crafted by the talented chef were simply divine, with each bite melting in our mouths, leaving us craving for more. The flavors were exquisite and perfectly balanced, showcasing the chef's incredible skill and passion for their craft.

But the experience wasn't just about the food – the impeccable customer service added an extra layer of charm to our evening. The attentive and friendly staff ensured that our every need was attended to, making us feel truly special on our anniversary.

Overall, this restaurant exceeded our expectations in every way, and we can't wait to return for another unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a night of gastronomic indulgence and exceptional service.

Terrace Lounge at Peppermill fails to deliver a great cocktail experience. The bartenders seem undertrained, with one not even aware of the new cocktail menu. The cocktails are poorly made, weak and watery, using low-quality liquors. The service is spotty, with four bartenders struggling to handle a modest crowd of 45 customers. The lack of an actual bar area makes it difficult to engage with the bartenders. The venue attracts a crowd of typical casino gamblers more interested in slot machines than quality drinks or socializing. Smoking is allowed, leading to unpleasant secondhand smoke. Overall, Terrace Lounge disappoints with subpar cocktails, untrained staff, and an atmosphere catered more towards gamblers than discerning drinkers. For a superior cocktail experience, the reviewer recommends Cin Cin, which excels in craft cocktails and maintains a machine-free environment.

The Red Lion Pub offers an exceptional dining experience. The service, led by the delightfully witty Amanda, is top-notch and will keep you entertained throughout your meal. The staff is incredibly friendly, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The food is delicious, and the beer is served perfectly chilled. Whether you're seeking a lively night out or a relaxing evening, The Red Lion Pub is a must-visit destination.

This nail salon is an absolute gem! Having been a loyal customer for years, I can confidly say it's my top pick in the city. The tranquil ambiance provides a much-needed escape from the hustle and bustle, while the courteous and skillful staff ensure a seamless experience. Moreover, the $25 pedicure rate in this southern locale is an unbeatable bargain. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a relaxing and affordable pampering session.

This classic New Jersey diner delivered an exceptional breakfast experience. The taylor ham, egg, and cheese sandwich on a fresh hamburger roll was a standout, expertly crafted with perfectly layered cheese and delicious home fries with peppers and onions. The fluffy blueberry pancakes were also a hit, though the pre-packaged syrup was a minor letdown. The friendly service, attentive refills, and great coffee added to the overall enjoyment. Despite the minor syrup quibble, this diner's commitment to quality ingredients and preparation makes it a must-visit for anyone craving an authentic Jersey diner breakfast.

While our server was attentive and friendly, and the maple wings were delicious, our experience was marred by an extremely offensive and inappropriate performance by the "piano guys." We had requested specific songs to be sung for a birthday celebration, but instead, they subjected the birthday girl to an obscene, explicit rendition filled with vulgar sexual references. Despite being asked to stop, they continued with the disturbingly lewd lyrics, causing embarrassment and discomfort to the entire group, including family members present. What should have been a joyful celebration was completely ruined by their appalling lack of professionalism and decency. Moreover, we paid $35 for this "service" but received only a brief, undesired performance. Overall, the deplorable behavior of the entertainers overshadowed any positive aspects of our visit, leaving us deeply dissatisfied and unlikely to return or recommend this establishment.

One standout feature of the University City location is the option to order lunch portions, which are smaller and more affordable than dinner servings, making it an excellent choice for solo diners or small groups during the midday hours. The layout and ambiance further enhance the dining experience, elevating this Han Dynasty above its Olde City counterpart.

Carisma Restaurante is a standout dining establishment that has become a go-to spot. The food is excellent, with dishes like paella, salmon, and filet mignon cooked to perfection and served piping hot. The service is also top-notch, with the friendly owner Jose making an effort to visit every table and ensure customer satisfaction. Additionally, the family has opened a café in front of the restaurant serving delicious baked goods and coffee. Carisma offers a refreshing change from typical Mexican fare, with good, fresh food prepared and served by nice people. It's a dining experience that will not disappoint.

This unassuming African eatery on Woodland Avenue may not catch your eye at first, but it offers an authentic taste of Senegalese and West African cuisine. The Thiboudienne, a national dish of Senegal, is a highlight, though served without the traditional tomato sauce. The Jollof Rice, considered the mother of Jambalaya, is another must-try. With limited seating at a few high-top tables, this hole-in-the-wall spot is perfect for a casual dine-in or takeout experience. Despite its modest appearance, the friendly service and flavorful dishes make it a hidden gem for those seeking genuine African flavors.

My experience with the falafel wrap at this establishment was extremely disappointing. While my previous visit a few years ago left a decent impression, my recent order was a complete letdown. The falafels and pita bread lacked any discernible flavor, leaving me craving for some seasoning or spices. The tzatziki sauce, which should have been the saving grace, was a thin, tasteless concoction that resembled nothing close to the tangy, refreshing sauce it's supposed to be. The only redeeming elements were the fresh diced cucumber and tomato, but they were unfortunately overshadowed by the underwhelming sauce. Overall, this falafel wrap was a flavorless and unsatisfying experience, and the tzatziki sauce was a poor excuse for the real thing.

The perfect blend of elegance and laid-back vibes, this place caters to both the well-heeled and the casual crowd. Whether you're rocking a designer bag or lounging in yoga pants, you'll feel right at home sipping on their delectable cocktails. Indulge in a few rounds and let the ambiance sweep you away.

Craving a culinary adventure, our group of six ventured to this unique eatery, and we're delighted with our decision. My wife and I indulged in the special, a generous sampling of their diverse offerings, which proved to be an excellent choice. The standout dishes were the succulent chicken, flavorful steak, and delightfully seasoned rice and beans. While the egg didn't appeal to my taste, the yuca and plantains were pleasantly surprising. With its inviting ambiance and an array of tempting options, this establishment is a must-visit for those seeking a memorable dining experience outside their comfort zone.

The smokehouse bowl with pulled pork, sweet potato casserole, and red beans and rice was a delightful lunch experience. The red beans and rice packed a flavorful spicy punch, while the sweet potato casserole offered a delightful contrast with its yummy sweetness. The star of the show, however, was the smoky, juicy, and plentiful pulled pork, making this a must-try dish for any barbecue enthusiast.

I had neglected my car for months, leaving it in a filthy state. However, the executive detailing service from this company transformed my vehicle back to a pristine condition. The thorough cleaning process left my car looking like brand new. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a top-notch detailing job that can revive even the dirtiest of cars.

The club's convenient location next to a mall is an added bonus. Overall, we highly recommend considering this Lifetime club as a potential second home, especially if top-notch service and attention to detail are priorities.

The Smokehouse BBQ offers a decent but unremarkable barbecue experience. While the pulled pork had a nice smoky flavor, it was a tad overdone and dry. The sides, including green beans, mac and cheese, and cornbread, were mediocre. The original BBQ sauce leaned towards the sweeter side. Overall, it's an average option if you're in the area and craving barbecue, but not a destination worth seeking out if there are better alternatives nearby.

Conclusion: This seafood restaurant failed to impress, with mediocre food and subpar service. The seafood boil might have been a better choice, but the overall experience was underwhelming, leaving diners wishing they had opted for a simpler meal elsewhere.

While the quality of the haircuts may be satisfactory, the poor handling of this situation and the lack of respect for customers make it difficult to recommend this establishment, especially for those who value principles and customer service.

This popular Chinese restaurant lives up to its reputation. The spicy and flavorful dishes are perfect for sharing among large groups. With an impressive selection of crowd-pleasing options and consistently delicious fare, it's no wonder this eatery has amassed a loyal following. A surefire crowd-pleaser that won't disappoint.

The diverse menu and pleasant environment draw a wide range of patrons, from hipsters to families with kids. Even when it gets crowded, the food, drinks, and service remain excellent. Bricks of Ybor is highly recommended, and it will be my first stop on my next visit to Tampa.

An absolute must-try! The crepes are truly outstanding, and the grits, which can often be hit or miss, were surprisingly delicious. Even the pancakes, sampled from my partner's plate, were fantastic. Well worth the wait for this exceptional dining experience.

While the burgers and sides were fairly decent, the overall experience at this restaurant was marred by multiple service issues. From the inaudible hostess to the confusing waitstaff situation, lack of attention, and excessive wait times, the service left much to be desired. The blaring TV and a family still awaiting their food long after we received ours further highlighted the operational shortcomings. Despite reasonably good food, the subpar service is likely to deter a return visit. An establishment can ill afford to neglect the basics of customer service and smooth operations.

The food at this restaurant was decent, but heavily overpriced. The guacamole and Mojito were highlights, while the peach pork medallions lacked flavor. The corn cakes with Barbacoa were pretty good. The atmosphere had a hip, inviting vibe. However, the parking situation was a major drawback. With limited spaces and no valet service, patrons may have to park several blocks away and walk, which can be frustrating, especially in hot weather. Overall, the mediocre food and parking woes don't justify the high prices, making it difficult to recommend this establishment enthusiastically.
Rating: 4/5 stars

While the wines themselves were fairly average, the location of this winery on the pier is simply stunning, with a wonderful outdoor patio providing an idyllic setting for wine tastings. The staff deserves high praise for their exceptional service and friendliness. However, the wine club falls short, with its exorbitant cost and stingy benefits. Unlike most wineries that offer complimentary tastings or glasses for members and their guests, this winery imposes strict limits on the number of passes provided per quarter, making it impractical for frequent visits, especially with guests. Overall, it's a beautiful spot to enjoy a tasting, but the wine club is best avoided in favor of other options on the Urban wine trail.

After getting a disastrous cheap haircut, I visited Domenick's in New York for a fix. Robert did an excellent job, leaving me looking presentable again for upcoming job interviews. The service was great, but at $35, it was a bit pricey for my liking. However, I'd still give Domenick's a solid 4 out of 5 rating for helping me look human again after the previous botched cut. Not sure how the prices compare to haircuts in Philadelphia, but it was worth the cost to avoid looking like a "crazy chimp" chewed my hair.

Overall, a disappointing experience that led to the loss of a young, loyal customer due to poor customer service, dishonesty, and a lack of effort to resolve the issue properly. The customer is now seeking a new vehicle and has ruled out Bergey's for future purchases.

This charming bakery offers an impressive selection of mouthwatering treats, from delectable homemade breakfast tarts and savory chicken pot pies to exquisitely crafted sweets that are almost too beautiful to eat. While some items may seem slightly pricey for their petite sizes, the premium quality justifies the cost. The friendly and engaging counter staff enhances the overall experience. It's a must-visit destination for locals and well worth the trip for those traveling from afar. Highly recommended for its delightful offerings and inviting ambiance.

Sweet Maple Cafe is a popular breakfast spot, but the hype may not be entirely justified. While the pancake varieties (raspberry, sweet potato, san antonio, and sugar and spice) were acceptable, they were described as a bit dry and nothing exceptional. The experience was marred by a 30-minute wait despite arriving before 8:30 am. If the line is longer, it's recommended to skip this place and head to nearby Fido instead, which offers insanely good coffee and great breakfast fare. While Sweet Maple Cafe is not bad for a standard breakfast, it fails to live up to its hype, especially when factoring in the long wait times.

The service at this Honda dealership has taken a significant downturn since the departure of Kelly and her team. The current service advisors are the worst, providing subpar customer service. Unfortunately, the convenient location is the only redeeming factor, making it an option for quick oil changes when other dealers are not accessible. Unless they improve their service team, it's hard to recommend this dealership over others in the area."

Tucked away in a cozy setting reminiscent of a Korean home, this restaurant offers the best soon-dubu (soft tofu stew) in the city. The stews are meticulously prepared in dol-sot pots, making each order feel like a custom-made creation. With options ranging from beef, seafood, mixed meats, mushrooms, and plain tofu, there's something for everyone, including vegetarians. The spice level can be adjusted to suit individual preferences, and the extra hot with hot temperature is an absolute must-try for those who love a fiery kick. The accompanying rice, served in a dol-sot as well, develops a delightful crispy shell when left for a while. For non-tofu enthusiasts, Korean BBQ meats cooked in the back and other soup/stew items are available. This hidden gem is a true culinary delight that will leave your taste buds craving for more.

This motel offers a decent value for the price. It's clean, comfortable, and well-managed, making it a solid choice for a reasonably priced overnight stay. While the breakfast buffet is nothing special, the spacious and comfortable lobby area compensates for it. However, if you're looking for a pool to swim laps, this might not be the ideal option as the pool is on the smaller side. Overall, it's a reliable choice for those seeking a moderately priced, clean, and comfortable place to rest.

While expressing frustration over the unkempt condition of an older, out-of-sight area of the columbarium, the staff member was uncooperative in providing contact information for the owner to address the issue directly. Despite repeated complaints, there was no acknowledgment or willingness to improve the situation.
