Additionally, the request to replace disintegrating plastic vases on the niches was dismissed, even though it seemed like a reasonable and respectful gesture. Overall, the lack of empathy and customer service from the staff member left a negative impression, and the facility appears to be neglecting proper maintenance and upkeep in certain areas.

This local deli is a gem! From the welcoming staff who quickly learn regulars' names to the delicious and affordable menu options, it's a fantastic spot. The vegetarian breakfast sandwiches, like the veg sausage with havarti on an everything bagel, are a standout and available all day. The fresh ingredients used in their sandwiches, like the veggie club and chicken cheesesteak hoagie, make for tasty and satisfying meals. The staff is incredibly helpful and accommodating, ensuring a great experience. Don't forget to indulge in their tempting snack selection, including decadent chocolate bars, refreshing drinks, and addictive hi-chew candies. With its fast, delicious, and attentive service, this deli is a must-visit for anyone craving a tasty and enjoyable dining experience.

This brunch spot exceeded our expectations with its delectable offerings. The 3 meat hash, turkey sandwich, and bagel with salmon were standouts, showcasing excellent flavors. While a tad pricey, the quality and friendly service made it worthwhile. We would gladly return when in the area.

Cigar City Brewing is a hidden gem at the far end of Terminal E in Tampa International Airport. This locally-inspired bar offers a cozy ambiance with limited seating, TVs for catching the game, and reasonably priced food and drinks. The appetizers ($5-$10) and sandwiches (mostly $12) look amazing, although I didn't try the food. The drinks are tasty, with a 22oz Jai Alai beer for $8.50 and a delicious $11 Manhattan. Prices are not outrageous for an airport bar. The staff is attentive and friendly, making it an ideal spot for Delta flyers to relax before their flight. Just note that you can't take alcoholic beverages into the terminal.

The Depot Burger is an absolute must-try! The juicy patty and flavorful shishito peppers make for a delectable combination. The ambiance is inviting, and the drinks perfectly complement the delicious food. An all-around exceptional dining experience.
Until Giant improves its quality, selection, and customer experience, I'll be taking my business to more reliable supermarkets like Wegmans.

Don't let the unassuming location fool you – this modern, romantic restaurant is a true culinary delight. Celebrated my birthday here with the prix fixe menu, and every course was exquisite. The foie gras was a standout, while the short ribs and caramel tart left me craving for more. The atmosphere is inviting, and the service is impeccable. An absolute must-visit for a memorable dining experience!"

For a restaurant receiving so much hype, the experience fell embarrassingly short of expectations. The lack of basic service and attention to detail for a celebratory meal was simply unacceptable. I rarely write negative reviews, but this place left me no choice but to warn others about wasting their money here until drastic improvements are made.

An exceptional value! The tender steak and perfectly cooked shrimp were delightful, making it a must-visit spot. The quality of the dishes surpassed expectations for the price point. I will definitely be returning for another enjoyable dining experience.

While Tako Sushi had positive reviews on Yelp, our experience was far from satisfactory. The service was slow, with our appetizers taking 45 minutes to arrive. The edamame was overcooked and mushy, while the spring rolls looked unappealing, almost as if they were frozen. The sushi, which sat on the bar for 15 minutes before being served, was decent but not exceptional. Adding insult to injury, the staff failed to provide a chill bucket for our bottle of white wine. Overall, the sluggish service and mediocre food quality make it challenging to recommend Tako Sushi, especially for the appetizers. If we were to return, we would skip the starters altogether.

This local gem, recommended by a neighborhood resident, serves up a delectable Southern-style lunch buffet. The standouts were the mouthwatering catfish, succulent chicken, rich gumbo, and indulgent mac & cheese – all piping hot and fresh. An absolute must-visit for anyone craving authentic, flavorful comfort food in a welcoming atmosphere.

While mail orders are available through their website, those living near the International Plaza Mall can conveniently purchase See's Candies without worrying about shipping costs, savoring the freshness and quality of these delightful treats.

R2L, a swanky restaurant on the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place, offers breathtaking city views and an upscale dining experience. During Center City Restaurant Week, their $35 three-course prix fixe menu showcased creative dishes like crispy risotto balls, a hearty Butcher's Filet with braised short rib and bean chili, and a decadent milk chocolate-hazelnut pudding with salted caramel and coffee. While not all tables faced the windows, the ambiance was classy, and the attentive service elevated the evening. R2L delivers an impressive combination of inventive cuisine, stunning vistas, and a sophisticated atmosphere, making it a worthwhile splurge for a special occasion.

Becca's bar is a gem for happy hour enthusiasts! With fantastic drink specials like the classic Land Shark, it's a great spot to unwind after work. While the food menu could use some expansion, the outstanding service from bartenders like the awesome Becca more than makes up for it. Here's hoping this local haunt continues to thrive and attract a loyal crowd from the neighborhood.

Disappointing first visit. Employee claimed to have given me change when she didn't, no utensils provided, and the burger seemed made with old ingredients. The food tasted okay, but the overall experience was subpar. Unlikely to return.

If you're looking for a family-friendly dining experience with great value for money, this restaurant is a fantastic choice. The family-style ordering option offers excellent prices, making it an affordable option for larger groups. The pot roast, ordered for takeout, retained its quality and warmth even after a 30-minute drive, a testament to their excellent packaging. The portions were generous, easily satisfying a family of four. A standout dish was the amazing green beans, which added a delightful touch to the meal. While the restaurant might not be regarded as a fine dining establishment, it delivers a solid, satisfying experience for families seeking good, no-frills cuisine. Highly recommended for those seeking a reliable and affordable family dining option.

Disappointing Drive-Thru Experience: Ordered a simple Caramel frappe, but the wait was excruciatingly long. Despite only two cars ahead of me, it took an astonishing 30 minutes to receive my order. Unacceptable service and poor time management led to a frustrating experience.

This bakery is a true gem, offering an incredible selection of pizza cookies that are simply out of this world. The Peanut Butter and Oreo varieties are absolute perfection, arriving hot, soft, and insanely delicious. While the prices may be a bit steep, the quality and the convenience of being open until 3 AM make it worth every penny. An absolute must-try for any cookie lover looking to indulge in a unique and craveable treat.

Tucked away in Philadelphia, this hidden gem of a restaurant is a true culinary delight that has finally won over this former Chicagoan. From the moment the addictive tahini and fresh bread hit the table, it's clear that the chef has a masterful touch. The organic beef shishkabob, cooked to perfection with caramelized onions, and the garden-fresh purslane salad are standout dishes that linger in the memory. The flavorful chicken dish with its fragrant spice blend is a testament to the kitchen's expertise. Even the pistachio crème brûlée, a delightfully light yet rich custard, leaves an indelible impression. With attentive service that anticipates every need, this restaurant is a true Philadelphia gem that deserves to be savored repeatedly, no matter the expense.
Disappointing Experience: Served a frozen pizza and skunked beer. Poor attention to detail and lack of quality control. Avoid at all costs. 1/5 stars.

A Disappointing and Unpleasant Experience. After dining at this establishment, our entire family fell ill, likely due to food contamination or poor food handling practices. The frozen yogurt appeared visually appealing but lacked flavor and was ultimately unsatisfying. Given our unfortunate experience, I cannot recommend this place, and we will not be returning. Avoid at all costs.

An absolute gem for authentic Indian street food! This place nails every dish, from the flavorful bhel puri and delectable pav bhaji to the perfectly deconstructed samosa and mouthwatering aloo tikki. The dabeli and kulfi are equally impressive. Everything is made with exceptional quality and true to its authentic roots. I wish I had discovered this culinary treasure sooner, but I'll certainly be a regular from now on.
Just remember to keep your wits about you and your head low (quite literally, if you're tall) as you navigate this dive bar dungeon.

An absolute delight for the whole family! The food here is not only delicious and fresh but also meticulously prepared. Their Wonton Soup, a kid-favorite, is a testament to the time and care they put into their cooking. Highly recommended for those seeking a tasty and thoughtful dining experience.

The food at this restaurant was great, but the hospitality left much to be desired. Despite arriving at 9:15 PM, well before their stated 10 PM closing time, we were denied dine-in service and offered only takeout. This was particularly disappointing as we had two pregnant women and a child in our party, and our home was an hour's drive away. Despite explaining our situation, the staff remained inflexible and unwilling to accommodate us, forcing us to make the long drive back home before we could eat. Such disregard for customer satisfaction, especially for those in vulnerable situations, is unacceptable. The delicious food is overshadowed by the lack of basic courtesy and empathy from the staff. I cannot recommend this restaurant until they improve their customer service and hospitality.

This steakhouse is an absolute gem! The steak quality surpasses any other steakhouse I've visited, making it a must-visit for meat lovers. The impeccable service, orchestrated by a well-coordinated team including the delightful hostess Mallory and attentive waiter Max, adds to the exceptional dining experience. From start to finish, the seamless flow and attentiveness leave nothing to be desired. This place has earned a permanent spot on my list of favorites, and I can't wait to return for another amazing meal!

Dr. Dinh and the staff at this practice provided an outstanding experience. The service was friendly, with Dr. Dinh addressing my concerns during the exam with kindness. The frame selection was impressive, even for a picky customer like me. The receptionist deserves praise for their patience and helpfulness throughout the process. Overall, it was a great experience, and I will definitely return for my yearly exam.

Terrible experience. The pizza was disappointingly small for the price. The delivery was excruciatingly slow, and the delivery person was rude, refusing to return the correct change and falsely claiming it was a tip. Furthermore, the change provided was entirely in coins, which was inconvenient. Highly unsatisfactory service. I would strongly advise against ordering from this establishment.

While the highly recommended Sonoran hot dog wasn't a personal favorite due to its numerous components, Beny's Kidz offered a satisfying dining experience overall. The guacamole was a standout, and the chicken and carne asada tacos from the combo were very good, though the cabeza (head meat) fell short with its slimy texture. The self-serve salsa bar was a nice touch, allowing diners to customize their toppings. Service was efficient, with food arriving promptly despite the weekday lunch crowd. Despite the mixed bag in terms of dishes, Beny's Kidz provided a solid meal and a chance to sample local specialties like the Sonoran hot dog.

While the cuisine was decent, the poor service and lack of transparency regarding the wine pricing detracted from the overall experience. The management's inflexibility and seeming dishonesty about table availability also left a sour taste. Considering the numerous options available, it's advisable to explore other dining establishments in the area."

An exceptional Indian dining experience! With fresh, flavorful dishes like the outstanding palak paneer and biryani, this restaurant delivers authentic and delicious Indian cuisine. The friendly and attentive staff, coupled with a clean and welcoming ambiance, make it a top choice for anyone craving excellent Indian fare.

An outstanding café with the most delectable smoothies you'll ever taste – they're truly out of this world! The fresh bread is another highlight, boasting an amazing flavor and texture. Top it off with a knowledgeable and friendly staff, and you've got a winning combination that's sure to impress. Highly recommended!

Bell Meade's exceptional service, curated selection, and warm ambiance have earned it a well-deserved five-star rating from me. It's a must-visit gem in Nashville that I will undoubtedly make a point of returning to on my next trip to the city.

While the wait can be long, even on a weekday afternoon, the friendly and attentive service from the waitstaff, like the cool waitress who ensured ample iced tea refills, adds to the enjoyable experience. The free parking, though a bit of a walk, is a nice perk. Overall, this seaside gem offers a fantastic fresh seafood experience with a stunning view, making it a must-visit for seafood enthusiasts.

Overall, this establishment fails to provide a satisfactory dining experience, with subpar food, unprofessional staff, and questionable practices. It is strongly advised to consider alternative options for a more enjoyable meal.

My first experience with Nola food at this restaurant was disappointing. Despite understanding the staff's workload during the busy Mardi Gras season, the service was lacking with forgotten drink orders and mixed-up plates. My shrimp po'boy lacked flavor and had minimal toppings, while the fries were soggy. Although it seems we may have caught them on an off-day, the overall experience was lackluster, and we did not return. Hopefully, it was an isolated incident, but our visit left an underwhelming first impression of New Orleans cuisine.

This comedy club is in dire need of renovations. The overall ambiance feels run-down and uninviting, making it an uncomfortable experience, especially for families with children. While the service is passable, the tired and dreary atmosphere overshadows any potential for an enjoyable night out. The venue lacks the vibrancy and cheerfulness one would expect from a comedy club. On a positive note, the parking and location are convenient. However, the owners should seriously consider investing in a much-needed facelift to revive this establishment's appeal and provide a more welcoming environment for patrons.

This accommodation felt more like an apartment rental than a traditional hotel room. The spacious unit had a fully equipped kitchen, desk, living room, and king bed - perfect for my needs of studying and entertaining guests. While windows couldn't be opened, the place was blissfully quiet, making it ideal for focused work. Check-in was handled by a guard who provided keys, but little other assistance. Parking was limited but free on weekends. Overall, I loved the ample space, updated amenities, and peaceful atmosphere. With no disruptive maid service, it offered a home-like experience well-suited for longer stays. I would happily return for another comfortable and convenient visit.

While the location and service have kept me coming back to this establishment for over 15 years, the inconsistency in the quality of their steaks is a significant drawback. Instead of making excuses, the restaurant should take responsibility and ensure they source high-quality meat. I'm willing to pay a premium for a great steak, but blaming the supplier is unacceptable. If they can address this issue, it could be a stellar dining experience.

This dealership's unethical practices and complete lack of communication have caused me immense frustration and financial hardship. I strongly advise against doing business with them, as they will lie to your face and leave you in a nightmarish situation. Avoid this dealership at all costs!"

If you're seeking a lively, upscale dining experience, Desi Village KOP may not be the place for you. But if you prioritize exceptional Indian fare over ambiance, this gem is definitely worth a visit. We'll be returning for the delicious food, even if the venue itself could use a facelift.

What started as a disappointment turned into an amazing discovery! After the initial barbecue spot ran out of food, we stumbled upon LA Smokehouse in Mid City. The friendly staff explained the process, and we were blown away by the delicious food. The wet pulled pork was perfectly sauced, and the mac and cheese was incredible. The grits had a unique smoky flavor, and the potato salad was refreshingly crunchy. The portions were generous and reasonably priced. The owner himself brought out our food and ensured we were satisfied, adding a personal touch. The casual atmosphere was comfortable, and the overall experience was a breeze. Despite the unexpected detour, we found a new BBQ favorite that we'll gladly make the trip for again. LA Smokehouse turned a letdown into a delightful surprise, and it's now on our list of go-to barbecue spots.
Whether dining solo or with a large group, Iris is a must-visit gem that delivers an exceptional culinary experience in every way.

Thai Garden offers a delightful ambiance with its inviting decor and attentive service. While the lunch Pad Thai was a satisfying option, the dinner menu left room for improvement. The chicken satay appetizer was disappointing in quantity, though the flavor and peanut sauce were commendable. The Panang Curry with chicken was a tasty main course, served with a generous portion of rice. However, the absence of Pad See Ew on the menu was a letdown. Despite a few misses, the exceptional customer service and overall experience make Thai Garden a worthwhile visit, with potential for further exploration of their menu offerings.

Petra Restaurant is a hidden gem for delicious Middle Eastern cuisine. While the location may not seem promising, the interior is inviting, and the food is truly fantastic. Don't miss their special fried rice (with an Indian twist) offered on Fridays and Saturdays, paired with succulent lamb dishes. The menu offers a wide range of other tasty options, and the service is attentive. Despite being a random find, Petra Restaurant has become a family favorite for its authentic flavors and friendly atmosphere.

The Pearl: A Gem of a Dining Experience! Celebrated my birthday at this restaurant, and it was an absolute delight. From the exquisite food and wine to the impeccable service, every aspect was flawless. Even after closing time, the attentive staff allowed us to linger and chat without any rush, making the evening truly memorable. Highly recommended for a special occasion or a night of indulgence.

Albertsons is a solid neighborhood grocery store that offers a clean and well-organized shopping experience. The wide aisles and ample parking make it a convenient stop for grabbing snacks or doing a full grocery run. Their selection is impressive, featuring a good bakery section, fresh flowers, and all the usual grocery items you'd expect. What sets them apart is the inclusion of locally made treats like California Kettle Corn and Taco Works, catering to those seeking unique regional flavors. They also carry a decent variety of specialty chips that can be hard to find elsewhere. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the availability of Diet Coke near the checkout is a nice touch for grabbing a quick beverage. Overall, Albertsons is a reliable and enjoyable option for grocery shopping in the area.

Disappointing Downfall: Once a beloved establishment, this restaurant has sadly deteriorated under new ownership. The food and service have both taken a nosedive, transforming a previously delightful dining experience into a double whammy of mediocrity. It's a true shame to witness the decline of a place that once held fond memories. Avoid until improvements are made.

Dr. Gloudemans is an excellent physician – knowledgeable, friendly, and proactive in her approach to patient care. She stays up-to-date on the latest research and strongly advocates for vaccinations, which is commendable. Her approach to addressing potential issues is balanced and sensible, favoring watchful waiting initially before exploring specialist referrals if necessary. However, the office's billing process seems to have some hiccups, as evidenced by erroneous past-due notices despite timely copay payments. While these billing issues were eventually resolved after follow-up, the occasional billing confusion is a frustrating aspect of the overall experience.

In summary, the Homebuilders Association of New Orleans provided an excellent dining experience with delectable dishes, a welcoming ambiance, and attentive service, making it a highly recommended spot for those seeking authentic local cuisine.

The Frist Museum Cafe offers a decent Cobb Salad, which is a reliable gluten-free option. While not exceptional, it's a convenient choice for a quick and reasonably priced lunch, especially on dreary days when you don't want to venture out. The salad can be customized with extra protein, and the oil and vinegar dressing is a good accompaniment. However, be prepared for crowds during peak times like weekends and Senior Mondays, when the cafe tends to get quite busy around lunchtime. Overall, it's a serviceable on-site dining option for museum visitors and local employees seeking a hassle-free meal.

Ghini's is an absolute gem for French breakfast lovers. Their eggs provencale, a unique dish featuring two basted eggs with sliced tomato, thyme, garlic, and herbs de Provence, is a standout and highly recommended. The baguette toast and hashbrowns are excellent accompaniments. However, the real stars are the crepes, both sweet and savory varieties. The spinach and Swiss crepe is a personal favorite. With a wide array of delectable French breakfast options, Ghini's is a must-visit for those seeking an authentic and delicious morning meal.

A vibrant and artistic gem offering delectable Mediterranean fare with a twist! This place truly stands out with its graffiti-adorned walls and innovative hummus flavors. The Greek steak pita paired with the guacamole hummus was a delightful combination, and the portion sizes were generous, especially for the reasonable prices. An absolute must-visit for a unique dining experience!

Prep & Pastry is a fantastic brunch spot that offers excellent food and exceptional service. The ability to add your name to the waitlist before arriving is a game-changer, making the process seamless and convenient. The breakfast sandwich stands out as a highlight, but all of their brunch offerings, including the sweets, are delicious. Their iced tea is refreshing and one of the best you'll find. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall pleasant dining experience. If you're in the area, a visit to Prep & Pastry is highly recommended for a delightful brunch.

One of the highlights is the gourmet mini donut truck tucked away near the farmer's market, serving up heavenly treats. Whether you plan to catch a show or simply wander around, the Fringe Festival provides ample opportunities to savor delicious food, shop for unique crafts, and immerse yourself in the electric energy of live entertainment. With its fantastic location and meticulously organized schedule, this festival is an absolute delight for visitors of all ages. Don't miss out on this beloved Edmonton tradition!
Rating: 2/5 stars

While their quote was the highest among the three plumbers I consulted, their prompt communication was impressive. Although I went with another option this time, I would consider hiring them for future jobs as they seem reliable. You often get what you pay for, and their higher pricing may reflect superior quality and service.

El Mariachi is undoubtedly the best Mexican restaurant in Florida. From the moment I first tried their delectable dishes, I was hooked. The authentic flavors and fresh ingredients keep me coming back time and time again. If you're craving top-notch Mexican cuisine, El Mariachi is an absolute must-visit!

This Thai restaurant offers authentic and flavorful dishes, particularly their soups and curries. The curries pack a punch with their excellent flavors, but the consistency may seem a bit runny for those unfamiliar with traditional Thai curries. While the eggrolls might not be their standout item, the veggie option seems to be a hit with some diners. If you love bold and spicy flavors, be sure to request extra heat. Overall, it's a great spot for those craving genuine Thai cuisine prepared to your desired spice level.

Jump on the School Bus provided exceptional service for our winery and brewery tour, as well as wedding transportation in the Goleta area. Darin and Sierra were highly communicative throughout the planning process, accommodating our needs with flexibility and attention to detail. Our driver was knowledgeable about the region, offering valuable suggestions. Darin even went the extra mile by meeting us at a winery to ensure everything was running smoothly. We couldn't have asked for a better experience, and we highly recommend Jump on the School Bus for any tour or transportation needs in the area.

With its exceptional burgers, creative milkshakes, and a vibrant atmosphere, Bailey's Range is a must-visit destination for both visitors and Chicago natives seeking an unforgettable dining experience.

An absolute must-try! This breakfast sandwich is arguably the best I've ever had. Served on a delightful biscuit, the flavors are simply outstanding and will leave you utterly satisfied. An incredible culinary experience that will have you exclaiming in delight. Highly recommended!

I frequent their Oracle and Wetmore location regularly, but after this dreadful visit, I'm taking my business elsewhere. Silver Mine has lost a loyal customer due to their incompetence and lack of customer service. Avoid this location at all costs.

My first visit to this salon was a delightful experience. Grace, the stylist, did an outstanding job with my challenging, long and thick hair, leaving me with a fabulous hairstyle. The salon itself boasts a modern and clean ambiance without any pretentiousness. Moreover, the pricing was extremely reasonable. I highly recommend this salon for anyone seeking a top-notch hair service in a welcoming environment.

This cozy, no-frills eatery offers a delightful Sunday Buffet that feels like a homemade meal at grandma's house. With a spread of comforting Southern classics like fried chicken, greens, smothered steak, corn, and cabbage, the food quality exceeded expectations. The fair pricing and high recommendations from locals make it well worth the wait. While not a fine dining establishment, the warm, inviting atmosphere and hearty fare make this a hidden gem for those seeking authentic, homestyle cooking.

This refreshing blend of passion fruit, bananas, pineapple, mango, papaya, and a touch of raw cane sugar is a true tropical escape in a cup. The Passion Passport smoothie lives up to its alluring name, delivering a delightful burst of fruity flavors that transport you to a sun-drenched beach. Perfectly balanced and utterly refreshing, it's a must-try for smoothie enthusiasts seeking a taste of paradise. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Carrie's private tour at the Battle of Franklin memorial was an absolute delight, despite the rainy weather. Her profound knowledge and contagious passion for the Civil War era made the experience truly captivating. The memorial itself serves as a fitting tribute to this significant battle, and Carrie's expertise brought the historical events to life. Highly recommended for history enthusiasts and anyone seeking an insightful and engaging tour.

Exceptional service and value! This auto glass company surpassed my expectations with their friendly and professional treatment from the initial phone call. Their competitive pricing of $165 for a windshield replacement was significantly lower than the $200 quoted by a competitor. They accommodated my urgent need for the same day and went above and beyond by providing a thorough cleaning of my vehicle's interior. The welcoming waiting area with complimentary refreshments added to the pleasant experience. I highly recommend this business for their superior customer service and commitment to making clients feel valued.

TD Bank's new undisclosed overdraft policy is outrageous. Without any prior notice, they allowed my account to overdraft and charged me a whopping $220 in fees. When I called to inquire, I had to endure a 45-minute hold time, only to be informed about their terrible policy after the fact. The representative's nonchalant attitude added insult to injury. TD Bank's lack of transparency and customer-friendly practices are unacceptable. I am switching banks immediately and advise others to steer clear of TD Bank's predatory fees and poor communication. As a final act of frustration, I even flipped off their ATM cameras upon depositing cash to cover the overdraft.

The Four Points hotel provided a pleasant stay during our 3-night business trip in November. Check-in was smooth, and we secured a great rate through Sheraton/SPG membership and AAA discounts, which included complimentary breakfast. The hotel's proximity to the airport, about a 5-minute drive, was convenient. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and the room met our needs. We appreciated the easy parking and quiet surroundings at night. Overall, it was a good experience at this nice hotel.

Conveniently located right at the Union Station Metro stop, this hotel offers a great deal on weekends but prices spike during the weekdays catering to business travelers. The room was clean with a super comfortable bed and ample pillows, along with a spacious bathroom. However, the in-room coffee machine was subpar, and the thin doors allowed noise from the hallway to seep in, disturbing sleep. While the lobby is commendable, the overall experience loses a star due to these drawbacks. Still, it's worth considering if you're in the area, especially for weekend stays.

This place serves some of the finest Mexican food around. The fried fish taco is a standout, and all the other dishes are equally delightful. However, the lack of air conditioning can be a drawback, especially during the hot and humid monsoon season, despite the ceiling fans. Still, the exceptional food makes it worth braving the heat. My only regret is not taking home their mouthwatering red sauce and birria. Highly recommended for authentic and flavorful Mexican fare.

Endurance House is a runner's paradise. With an extensive selection of shoes catering to all types of runners, this store stands out for its personalized service. The knowledgeable staff takes the time to analyze your stride and provide recommendations for the perfect shoe to maximize comfort and prevent injuries. Not only are the prices competitive, but the overall experience is exceptional. From the warm welcome to the expert guidance, Endurance House ensures that every runner leaves with a great pair of shoes tailored to their needs. Highly recommended for anyone seeking quality running gear and unmatched customer service.

HipCity is a game-changer for vegetarian and vegan dining. While initially skeptical as a meat-lover, the flavorful plant-based options like the buffalo bella and crispy hipcity ranch sandwiches, paired with refreshing drinks like the green lemonade and groothie, have become standout favorites. The friendly staff keeps things running smoothly, even during busy times. However, the small space can get overcrowded and disorganized when there's a line, making navigation awkward. Overall, HipCity offers a delicious and satisfying meat-free experience, but the cramped quarters during peak hours are a minor drawback.

Disappointing experience. Despite the posted hours showing a 10 PM closing time, I walked in at 8:30 PM, only to be immediately told that the kitchen was closed and they were covering up the grill and fryers. It's unacceptable to close the kitchen over an hour and a half before the stated closing time, especially without any prior notice or warning. If the kitchen was going to close early, the doors should have been locked to prevent customers from entering. Poor planning and lack of communication from the management. I won't be returning.

This unassuming eatery truly shines as the undisputed champion of Chinese cuisine in the area. The owners' warmth and hospitality are matched only by the exceptional quality of their dishes. While waiting for your takeout order, you're treated to complimentary wontons that tantalize your taste buds, leaving you eagerly anticipating the main course. With its delectable fare and welcoming ambiance, this gem is an absolute must-visit for anyone craving an authentic and satisfying Chinese dining experience.
With its exceptional cuisine, inviting atmosphere, and outstanding service, Rosemary's Grill has rightfully become a favorite Saturday night spot and a true gem in the local dining scene.

The friendly staff and pleasant atmosphere make for an enjoyable experience at this establishment. While the crowd was surprisingly light on my two visits, the real highlight was their $3.50 margarita special after 4 PM on Tuesdays – a great deal for a pretty good cocktail. If you're looking for a relaxed spot with affordable drinks, this could be worth checking out.

This restaurant failed to deliver a satisfactory version of the classic General Tso's dish. Despite the late hour and limited options, their attempt at this popular Chinese-American fare was subpar and didn't come close to meeting expectations. Skip this place and head to East Cuisine instead for a better experience with their General Tso's and other offerings. The disappointing meal makes this an establishment I won't be returning to, even in desperate circumstances.

While the food at this restaurant, particularly the blueberry lasagna and chocolate confection dessert, was good to great, the overall experience was marred by the pretentious and haughty attitude of our waiter. Instead of providing friendly recommendations when asked for a wine suggestion, he responded dismissively. Throughout the meal, he remained aloof, failing to crack a smile or accommodate preferences without condescension. This snobbish behavior is precisely the kind of attitude that drives people away from certain dining establishments. The food quality alone cannot compensate for such poor service. Unless you're lucky enough to avoid this particular waiter, the overall dining experience here may leave a sour taste.

The gelato flavors at this establishment are a true delight, offering a delightful array of unexpected and delicious combinations. The Bananas Foster, Pear Champagne Sorbet, Blueberry Fig Sorbet, and Cassis sorbet were all excellent, with the Cassis being a standout – its subtle initial taste gradually gave way to a rich, flavorful experience that only improved with each bite. The gelato is so enjoyable that it's well worth gathering friends and returning to sample more of this frozen happiness.

This place serves undeniably the best pizza around. The friendly owners, a former hockey player and his adorably tough wife, add a delightful touch to the experience. Their homemade sausage and mozzarella elevate the already fantastic pizzas to new heights. Be sure to savor every bite, including the crust, which is so good you'll want to dip it in their olive oil and vinaigrette. A must-visit for any pizza lover!

The sales staff at this dealership were incredibly friendly, especially Mike. He went above and beyond by taking us for a test drive in one of the Razors, which was a great experience. Mike's helpfulness and the enjoyable test drive have us seriously considering purchasing one of these vehicles. Highly recommend this dealership and Mike for an excellent sales experience.

This cozy eatery has become a monthly staple for me. The food is delightfully good, complemented by attentive service. Their zucchini muffins are an absolute must-try – I always make sure to sneak a few into my purse for later cravings. The prices are budget-friendly, and their frozen yogurt bar with unlimited toppings is a delightful treat. A true gem that promises a fun and satisfying dining experience. Yum indeed!

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. Despite advertising an all-you-can-eat deal, we were completely ignored by the servers for over 30 minutes before getting our order in. Servers prioritized other tables over us, which was frustrating. Additionally, some rolls contained unlisted ingredients like sweet mustard sauce, ruining the experience. The only positive was that once our orders were finally taken, the food didn't take too long to arrive. Overall, poor service and surprising ingredients made for an unsatisfactory visit.

The Cozy Charm: This quaint restaurant boasts a beautifully decorated and immaculate interior, setting the stage for a delightful dining experience. While the fried green tomatoes were a standout dish with perfect seasoning and a delectable sauce, the timing of their arrival left something to be desired. However, the chicken salad, fried bologna sandwich, and cheeseburger received rave reviews from our group. The peach cobbler dessert, especially when paired with ice cream, was an absolute must-try, leaving us thoroughly satisfied. Overall, the charming ambiance and flavorful dishes make this a highly recommended spot, despite the occasional hiccup in service.

While the food itself was satisfactory, the cafe's poorly maintained and unsanitary conditions overshadowed the dining experience. The dirty environment is a major deterrent, and I cannot recommend this establishment unless significant improvements are made to cleanliness and upkeep.

An absolute gem! This place truly delivered on flavor and portion sizes. The chicken parmesan was a standout dish, bursting with deliciousness. With such a satisfying experience, we can't wait to return and explore more of their mouthwatering offerings. Highly recommended!

This burger joint delivers a tasty experience with perfectly cooked bacon, a nicely toasted bun, and satisfying accompaniments like fries and a chocolate shake. However, the burger patty itself lacked juiciness, the portion size was underwhelming for the price paid, and the lingering greasy smell after leaving was a bit off-putting. While there are some high points, the drawbacks prevent it from being an exceptional burger spot.

While the restaurant had decent sit-down dining options, the pizza fell short of expectations. The place was quite empty, which should have been a warning sign. After an underwhelming experience with the food, I ended up going to the much livelier Charlie's across the street. Their redtop pizza was an absolute game-changer, making me regret not visiting Charlie's first. If you're looking for a casual sit-down meal, this restaurant could suffice, but for truly remarkable pizza, Charlie's is the clear winner.

Having been a loyal customer since the Wild Oats days, I've noticed a positive change after the merger with Whole Foods. This location excels in its produce, seafood, and cheese selections, but the real standouts are the natural personal care section and the salad bar. During cooler months, their soups (like Carrot Ginger, Split Pea, and Corn Chowder) paired with salads or the deli salad sampler plate make for a satisfying post-yoga lunch. Other highlights include the curried tofu salad, sushi to-go boxes, and the everything cookies. My latest discovery is the unique and relaxing lavender soda. With its diverse offerings and apparent improvements, this Whole Foods location remains a favorite.

The Mediterranean chicken quesadillas are an absolute must-try! With a delightful fusion of Greek flavors and the comforting familiarity of quesadillas, these treats are truly an awesome sauce. The freshness of the ingredients shines through, making it a highly recommended dish for anyone who appreciates authentic Greek cuisine with a creative twist.

The shop boasts an impressive variety of juices, mods, and atomizers, catering to every vaping preference. The tasting bar is a delightful addition, allowing customers to explore new flavors and find their perfect vape. Whether you're a seasoned enthusiast or a curious newcomer, this vape shop is an absolute must-visit. The combination of a welcoming atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, and top-notch product selection make it a truly exceptional destination.

Overall, [Restaurant Name] is a remarkable spot for breakfast, offering a diverse menu that caters to various taste preferences. Just be sure to steer clear of the overpriced monte cristo and arrive early or plan accordingly, as the restaurant does not accept reservations.

My visit to this butcher shop was marred by poor customer service and a botched order. Despite clearly requesting a deboned duck the previous night, they provided a whole stuffed duck instead. When I called to rectify the situation, they offered no compensation or resolution other than a trade-in option, which was inconvenient given the shop's distance. While their food quality may be good, the lack of attention to detail and disregard for customer satisfaction left a sour taste. I cannot recommend this establishment based on my experience."

An absolute gem! The hiking trails at this preserve offer a delightful nature experience, teeming with wildlife and well-marked paths. The bird of prey aviary is a standout attraction, and the learning center provides an educational and refreshing respite with its engaging exhibits and air-conditioning. Don't miss the opportunity to see the birds up close during the afternoon demonstrations by the knowledgeable handlers. The friendly staff and volunteers enhance the overall experience. Highly recommended for outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.

If you're in North Wilmington and craving diner food, this place might be your only decent option. The menu offers standard diner fare, nothing exceptional but not terrible either. It's a decent spot for a casual meal, especially after local events or activities. The food is totally ordinary, neither particularly good nor bad. Overall, it's a serviceable diner that gets the job done without leaving a lasting impression.

Stellar Dining Experience at [Restaurant Name]! From the warm welcome to the delectable food, our visit was a delight. The manager's hospitality set the tone, and our server Christina provided top-notch service. The beer selection impressed, and the chicken rabe sandwich on focaccia bread and the well-done pepperoni pizza were standouts. While the lack of a children's menu might be a concern for families with picky eaters, the overall experience was exceptional. We'll definitely be returning to this hidden gem.

Aveda Institute offers an affordable and educational experience for getting haircuts and styles, particularly for those with long, fine, straight hair. While perfection shouldn't be expected from the student stylists, the cuts are overseen by instructors and come with a thorough service including wash, massage, cut, and style. Expect the process to take around 2 hours due to the learning environment. The student stylists are professional and committed, making up for any inconsistencies in skill level. Overall, it's a reasonable option for budget-conscious individuals seeking an attentive hair service at a student salon.

This place offers delicious food and friendly service in a lively atmosphere. The portions are generous and reasonably priced. While it can get crowded at peak times, the outdoor seating is a great option for a more relaxed dining experience. Overall, it's a solid choice for a satisfying meal with a welcoming vibe.

An exceptional dining experience! The food was absolutely fantastic, with the Monte Cristo crepes being a standout dish - truly amazing. The menu offers a great variety of options. Equally impressive was the friendly and welcoming service. I'll definitely be returning for more delicious meals in this delightful eatery.

Café Beignet offers a delightful alternative to the iconic Café du Monde, serving beignets that are equally delicious, if not better. The real standout, however, is the absence of the infamous long lines that plague its famous counterpart. This cozy establishment on Bourbon Street provides a tranquil oasis, especially in the early morning hours when the street is relatively quiet. While the crawfish omelet and Cajun hashbrowns were nothing exceptional, the true star of the show is undoubtedly the beignets, which seem to justify the café's moniker. If you're looking for a hassle-free beignet experience without sacrificing quality, Café Beignet is a solid choice.

Mixx Sushi: Quick and Affordable, but Not Exceptional

Mixx Sushi might not be the pinnacle of sushi excellence in the city, but if you're looking for a quick and inexpensive sushi fix with a wide variety of options, it's a great choice. While the preparation may not be the best you'll find, the restaurant excels in delivering a speedy service and an extensive menu at reasonable prices. If you're in a hurry and on a budget, Mixx Sushi is a solid option for satisfying your sushi cravings without breaking the bank.

Terrible customer service and unprofessional behavior. I received a quote over the phone for a battery and brakes that seemed reasonable. When I called back to schedule an appointment, the person I spoke to was extremely rude. He accused me of making up the quoted price, refused to let me speak to someone else, and hung up on me. I will never go to this auto shop again after being treated so disrespectfully. There are many other options that offer better customer service.

This dealership severely lacks in customer service and follow-through. Despite promises to resolve issues like removing tinted windows before purchase, they failed to do so, requiring multiple inconvenient trips from the customer who lives 45 minutes away. The sales team is overburdened with handling customer service inquiries, leading to poor communication and unresolved problems. Even simple warranty questions are met with unhelpful responses and the expectation for the customer to bring the vehicle in despite previous negative experiences with their service department. Management seems indifferent to addressing these shortcomings. Overall, the frustrating processes and lack of a dedicated customer service department make this an unpleasant dealership to work with. Investing in proper customer support channels could vastly improve their reputation.

An absolute gem! This family-owned restaurant offers a warm and welcoming atmosphere, with a delightful play area for kids. The standout dish is the mouthwatering bacon pizza, which is an absolute must-try. The owners' hospitality and the delicious food make for a truly enjoyable dining experience.

This Asian restaurant is an absolute gem! The fried rice is an absolute standout – flavorful, perfectly cooked, and visually appealing. With its reasonable prices and delectable offerings, it's undoubtedly one of the best Asian dining establishments in town. Highly recommended for an exceptional culinary experience.

Harry's Blue Bell: A Cozy Local Spot with a Few Highlights

Harry's Blue Bell is a quaint bar tucked away in a shopping center, making it easy to overlook. However, its popularity among locals is evident from the bustling atmosphere. While the interior is charming but cramped, the real draw lies in the impressive beer selection and reasonable pricing.

The food menu offers standard bar fare, including the BBQ pulled pork and chicken and honey mustard wrap we tried. The pulled pork was well-executed, with a nicely toasted bun, but the overly sweet sauce was a slight letdown. The chicken wrap was fresh but unremarkable. The standout item was the fantastic yet small portion of kale slaw.

Service was decent, and the overall experience was satisfactory. While Harry's Blue Bell may not warrant a special trip, it's a solid option for those in the area seeking a casual dining experience with a good beer selection.

Rating: 3 out of 5 stars

Kajuns Bar and Grill has addressed a major concern for patrons with smoke sensitivities. After initially struggling with cigarette smoke accumulating inside, they have installed effective smoke eaters that significantly improve the air quality. Customers can now enjoy themselves without being overwhelmed by smoke or suffering from headaches. While the smell may still linger on clothes after leaving, the improved indoor air quality showcases Kajuns' dedication to enhancing the customer experience. Kudos to the staff for taking proactive measures to cater to diverse needs.

Brio's in St. Louis is a true gem recommended by local food connoisseurs. The atmosphere is delightful, with a beautiful setting that adds to the overall charm. The service is exceptional, further enhancing the dining experience. The menu is a highlight, offering delectable complimentary bread and chips, along with standout dishes like bruschetta, pasta, and salads. Brio's ticks all the boxes for a fantastic dining experience, making it a must-visit for anyone in search of a memorable meal.

This restaurant in Tucson had the potential to be a great dining spot, but unfortunately, it fell short on multiple fronts. The cold food and rude service were major letdowns, despite the establishment seemingly having the right concept or idea. While the intentions may have been good, the execution was severely lacking, resulting in an unsatisfactory dining experience overall. Visitors would be better off exploring other dining options in the area until significant improvements are made to the food quality and customer service at this particular establishment.

Gennaro's is a must-visit for pizza lovers. Their thin-crust pizza boasts a delectable sweet and rich tomato sauce, complemented by fresh mozzarella cheese. The meatballs are also a standout, earning high praise. Beyond the excellent food, the vintage and adorable decor adds to the overall experience. With consistently satisfying meals, Gennaro's is a surefire hit that never disappoints.

The Neighborhood Spot is a lively and welcoming establishment that offers a great dining experience. Despite being quite busy on a Monday evening, the friendly and attentive bartender ensured excellent service. While the well-stocked bar caters to drinkers, the real star here is the food. The Pear Gorgonzola Melt sandwich is a must-try, with an impressive array of delicious ingredients packed into one plate. The diverse clientele spanning all ages and backgrounds adds to the vibrant ambiance. Overall, The Neighborhood Spot is a fantastic choice for a tasty, reasonably priced sandwich (around $10) and a chance to catch up on sports matches in a lively atmosphere.

While the atmosphere was great and the service friendly, the food at this Philly restaurant left something to be desired. The prices were reasonable, but the dishes lacked flavor, coming across as bland. It filled the void after a long drive, but wasn't particularly enjoyable. We likely won't return due to the underwhelming food.

The bar at this establishment offers a welcoming atmosphere with friendly staff, making it an excellent spot for grabbing a drink. However, the cleanliness of the premises leaves something to be desired, raising concerns about the dining experience. While the drinks are enjoyable, I would be hesitant to recommend the food unless the establishment improves its overall cleanliness.

This Greek-owned pancake house offers a delightful alternative to the larger chain restaurants. Dubbed a New Year's Day tradition, the friendly staff and energetic owner effortlessly accommodate large groups, swiftly serving up delicious, love-infused breakfast fare. From their playfully patriotic 'Freedom Toast' and 'Freedom Fries' to their scrumptious pancakes, this cozy establishment outshines its corporate counterparts with its attentive service and superior quality. An excellent choice for a hearty, flavorful breakfast in a warm, inviting atmosphere.

What was once a beloved spot for great service and quality products, my recent experience at Fresh fell short of expectations. Despite being a regular patron, I was disheartened by the lack of acknowledgment from the staff upon entering. The Vienna Latte, which usually delights, was one of the worst espresso-based drinks I've ever had, and the $7+ price tag for a coffee drink was outrageous. While I've praised Fresh in the past, this visit was one of the worst experiences I've had there. The subpar service and overpriced, lackluster product have left me questioning my loyalty to this establishment.

Overall, the restaurant offers a decent dining experience for large groups, with notable strengths in their side dishes, presentation, and Ramadan buffet. However, the main protein dish (lamb kebab) falls short, requiring improvement in preparation and marinating techniques. Timing a visit during the Ramadan buffet is recommended for a more enjoyable and diverse culinary experience.

The Birding Center is a delightful spot for avian enthusiasts and families alike. The friendly staff and opportunity to observe a variety of birds make it a great Sunday morning destination. Highly recommended for those seeking a peaceful, educational outing surrounded by nature's feathered friends.

This establishment appears to be an old club that transforms into a dining spot during the day. The sashimi plate and burger were both satisfactory, providing a decent culinary experience. However, the service left much to be desired. We had to request basic items like plates, sauce bowls, napkins, and even a drinking glass for our 5-year-old child, which should have been provided without prompting. The staff seemed inattentive and forgetful, marring an otherwise decent meal. While the food was reasonably enjoyable, the lackluster service dampens the overall experience. Unless someone else is treating, the subpar service makes it difficult to recommend a return visit at regular prices."

Cuenelli's Peruvian Style Rotisserie Chicken is an absolute must-try for anyone looking to experience truly authentic and flavorful pollo a la brasa (rotisserie chicken). This chicken is clearly made with love and pride, marinated to the bone in aromatic seasonings and cooked in a unique rotisserie oven with a charcoal/grill component that imparts a delicious smoky flavor. The constantly rotating birds baste in their own drippings, resulting in tender, fall-off-the-bone meat with a perfect combination of crispy and moist skin. The chicken is served with an herbaceous, slightly spicy chimichurri sauce and a garlicky, lemony aioli for added flavor dimensions. The accompanying sides like the cilantro rice, spicy pinto beans, and sweet, caramelized maduros (fried sweet plantains) complement the chicken beautifully. Wash it all down with the unique Inca cola or the Christmas-reminiscent chicha limena drink. Cuenelli's rotisserie chicken redefines what this dish can be - a flavor-packed, love-infused experience you must taste to believe.

This place nails the essentials - a delicious medium-rare burger with perfectly cooked and seasoned meat, making it worthwhile even without the extras. The salad was decent, nothing fancy but well-dressed. The real standout, though, was the bartender's impeccable service and excellent sazeracs that complemented the meal beautifully. While feeling a bit odd eating the burger with utensils, the overall experience was a satisfying early birthday treat. I'd gladly return to try their more elaborate burger options, as the quality of the meat alone warrants a visit. A solid establishment that delivers on good food, drinks, and attentive service.

Lunch at this place was a delightful experience. Visiting on a Monday during the lunch rush, I was impressed by the prompt service at the bar. The carne asada taco lunch special I ordered exceeded expectations, with tacos that were better than average. Overall, I was more than pleased with this restaurant and would happily recommend it to others.

Tony and his team are fantastic! When I had a flat tire, they fixed it promptly and charged me less than their initial estimate. Tony's helpfulness and honest pricing are highly appreciated. Definitely recommended for reliable and affordable service.

My hairdresser's attention to detail and excellent communication skills made for a truly satisfying experience. She took the time to understand my desired hairstyle and checked in frequently throughout the haircut to ensure I was happy with the results. I left feeling delighted with my new look. Highly recommend!

This restaurant offers delectable Chinese cuisine, with the sweet and sour chicken and chicken chow mein being standout dishes. The chow mein, in particular, features flavorful chicken cuts that elevate the dish. While the sushi selection is also enjoyable, it's worth noting that the overall prices lean towards the higher end. However, the quality of the food justifies the cost, making it a worthwhile culinary experience.

After being a loyal Comcast customer for 14 years, my monthly bill skyrocketed to $250. Despite multiple attempts to negotiate a lower rate, Comcast consistently responded with "Nothing we can do." It was only after canceling and switching to Verizon that Comcast suddenly offered a more reasonable $140 rate. However, this offer came too late, as their lack of concern for retaining a long-term customer had already driven me away. Comcast's inability to provide quality customer service or value customer loyalty is unacceptable. Verizon, on the other hand, has impressed with their efficient installation, excellent customer service, and overall superior product. Comcast's disregard for customer satisfaction is a major disappointment, and their practices make it difficult to recommend their services.

If you're seeking an affordable, hearty meal in a cozy and quirky atmosphere, B's Diner is a must-visit hidden gem. This hole-in-the-wall joint, adorned with antiques and humorous posters, offers a delightful diner experience enhanced by the warmth and personality of their staff. Not only does B's Diner serve up delicious comfort food, but they also make a positive impact on the community, making it a worthy cause to support. The eclectic crowd, ranging from bar staff to hipsters and musicians, adds to the lively and entertaining ambiance. While the Elk sausage and perogie poutine comes highly recommended, the true charm lies in the diner's unique character and the passion infused into every dish. Prepare for a hunt to find this hidden treasure, but the search is well worth the reward.

A once decent buffet joint has taken a nosedive in quality. The food is now appallingly salty and poorly prepared - the pulled turkey was tough, fish tasted like meat tenderizer, and veggies were overcooked to mush. Only the corn pudding, mashed potatoes, and mediocre desserts were remotely edible. While service remained attentive, it couldn't salvage the dismal culinary experience. Avoid this place until they regain their former standards.

This was our second and unfortunately last visit to this establishment. Despite being the only customers, the service was incredibly slow, with a 15-minute wait just to place our order. The small pizzas took an astonishing 45 minutes to arrive, and I had to relocate to the bar area due to a loud and unprofessional waitress complaining incessantly while our waitress was sweeping. Adding insult to injury, my pizza was barely warm after the extended wait. With such poor service and quality, this restaurant has firmly cemented its place on my list of places to avoid at all costs. Save yourself the frustration and steer clear.

Fellini's Cafe in Newtown Square is a charming BYOB restaurant that delivers large portions at reasonable prices, ensuring you won't leave hungry. The romantic ambiance and dimly lit interior create a cozy atmosphere, though it can get quite loud. Service can be inconsistent, with some staff members being attentive and enthusiastic, while others lack basic courtesies. The food is generally delicious, with standout dishes like the tagliatelli with mushroom cream sauce and tortellini pasticiatti. However, minor details like warm plates for salads and undercooked frozen peas in entrees can detract from an otherwise excellent dining experience. Despite some hiccups, Fellini's Cafe remains a solid choice for an affordable Italian meal, especially appreciated for the manager's willingness to accept an expired gift card.
Overall, The Catbird Seat was overpriced and forgettable. The stuffy ambiance and mediocre food and drinks made for a disappointing dining experience that failed to live up to its reputation.

Stitch-It Tailors delivered excellent service and results for tailoring my intricately designed evening gown in a rushed timeframe while visiting Nashville. Despite the complexity of working on the sequined, lace and sheer layered bodice, they accommodated me quickly. The hotel's in-house tailor wisely declined altering the bodice. Stitch-It's staff was courteous and professional. My tailor, Maggie O'Neill, did an amazing job getting the perfect fit. The premium fee was well worth it given the tight turnaround and quality work. If I lived locally, I would absolutely use Stitch-It regularly based on this excellent experience exceeding my expectations. Highly recommended for intricate tailoring needs, especially for formalwear.

An Exceptional Experience at This Salon! Visited for a Brazilian wax and blow-out, and the skilled staff made me feel completely at ease. Jenne deserves special praise for her outstanding service and creating a relaxing atmosphere. The technicians' warm personalities and comedic talents added laughter and joy to the visit. I cannot recommend this salon enough – prepare to leave feeling pampered and refreshed. An absolute gem!

If you're anywhere near Camden or even New Jersey, make it a point to visit Santana's Bakery for their exceptional breakfast and pastries. Their coffee is unparalleled, putting major chains like Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts, and McDonald's to shame. The pastries are simply incredible, rivaling those you'd find in Puerto Rico. Locals frequent this establishment daily, a testament to its deliciousness and authenticity. Santana's Bakery is a hidden gem that should be on every food lover's radar when in the area.

This restaurant offers a unique dining experience with reasonably priced and delicious dishes. While their escargot could have been prepared more traditionally, the plating was visually appealing. For an additional $50, adventurous diners can opt for a spooky experience by dining alone in a cold, dungeon-like room with the alleged ghost of the former mansion owner who tragically took his own life on the second floor. Overall, it's a memorable spot for those seeking both culinary and paranormal thrills.

Tucked away in a humble setting, this unassuming burger joint serves up some of the best burgers in Philadelphia. Don't be fooled by its modest appearance – the creative and fully customizable menu, along with the expertly seared and juicy burgers cooked on a flattop, make this place a must-visit. The hand-cut fries are perfectly crispy and salty, complementing the burgers perfectly. Pro tip: Download the SPOT app for rewards and coupons, including free fries. If you're in Philly and craving an exceptional burger experience, this low-key gem should be on your radar.

Highly recommended! The locksmiths at [Business Name] provided excellent service for getting replacement transponder keys for my car. They were thorough, making test copies before cutting the blanks I provided to ensure a perfect fit. Even after cutting the new keys, they double-checked that both worked in all doors and the trunk. Their cautious approach and great attitude were much appreciated, especially since dealership keys can be extremely pricey. My mechanic's referral was spot on - they took great care of me. Reasonable pricing and top-notch service.

With an unwavering commitment to excellence, this salon offers a truly exceptional experience. Whether a local or a visitor, you can trust your tresses in the capable hands of Doug and his talented team. Highly recommended for those seeking a luxurious and transformative salon experience.

Reno's culinary scene is expanding with the addition of Bab Cafe, a delightful Korean restaurant downtown. Despite the lunch rush, the service was prompt, and the menu offered a great variety. The Dak-Galbi Bibim-bab (teriyaki chicken) was a standout dish, featuring flavorful meat, fresh veggies, and delectable sauces. The potstickers were also a hit, irresistibly delicious. The only downside is the limited parking options in the downtown area. Overall, Bab Cafe is a welcome addition to Reno's dining scene, offering authentic and tasty Korean fare.

Mr. B's Bistro in New Orleans is a must-visit brunch spot. The Brandy Milk Punch is a standout alcoholic milkshake that's worth the trip alone. While the trio of appetizers is small, the duck spring roll with tangy sauce is delightful. The shrimp and grits, with bacon-wrapped shrimp and authentic Southern grits, is an absolute highlight and highly recommended. The blackened Mahi Mahi also received high praise. With excellent drinks, appetizers, and entrees, Mr. B's Bistro offers a fantastic brunch experience in the heart of New Orleans.

Polished Looks Salon provides an exceptional waxing experience with a clean, professional ambiance and friendly staff. The hard wax used by the skilled esthetician Despina made the armpit and bikini waxing virtually painless, even for thick, coarse hair. The prices are very reasonable, with armpit waxing costing only $16. The salon operates by appointment only, ensuring personalized attention. The client was delighted with the outstanding service, pleasant atmosphere, and the ingrown hair treatment product purchased. Despina's expertise left such a positive impression that the client plans to return for a full bikini wax soon. Highly recommended for top-notch waxing services in a welcoming environment.
Gus's Falafel Cart is a true gem in the food truck scene, offering an unforgettable dining adventure that lives up to its legendary status.

SRS Management Company stands out as an exceptional property management company. Their commitment to customer satisfaction is evident in their willingness to accommodate even the most specific requests from clients. Their team goes above and beyond to ensure that each client's unique needs are met, making the experience truly remarkable. With their outstanding service and accommodating nature, SRS Management Company comes highly recommended for anyone seeking a top-notch property management solution.

Fresco Pizza is a must-visit gem in Tucson, offering delectable fresh and tasty pizzas at reasonable prices. The friendly staff, led by the passionate young owner, takes pride in using high-quality ingredients and ensuring a clean and inviting ambiance. Their meat-special pizza, loaded with chunky chicken, sausage, pepperoni, ham, and bacon, stands out with its perfect balance of crispy and tender crust, abundant toppings, and flavor that will have you reaching for multiple napkins. Fresco Pizza's commitment to serving the best quality food shines through, making it a highly recommended dining experience worth revisiting.

While the atmosphere and service were great, the spice level could be toned down to cater better to families with varying heat preferences. Overall, a solid choice for a post-marathon meal with a large group.

While not typically a fan of fast food, this Zaxby's stood out for its exceptional service and tasty chicken fingers. The employees exuded pride and enthusiasm, going above and beyond to ensure a great experience. The chicken fingers were juicy and moist, though the Texas toast was a bit greasy. The sauce variety was enjoyable, but could benefit from the addition of spicy BBQ and blue cheese options. Despite a few minor issues, the overall experience was a solid 4 stars, made even better by the affordable pricing. This Zaxby's delivers a satisfying southern twist on the beloved Buffalo-style chicken fingers.

Sugar Coated bakery is a true gem! Their baked goods are consistently outstanding, with each item bursting with flavor and boasting the perfect texture. The level of attention to detail in their decorative work is phenomenal, showcasing the time and love poured into every creation. Standouts include their signature cream cheese frosting, which is incredibly delicate and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Whether you're craving classic cupcakes, cakes, pies, or cookies, Sugar Coated is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking exceptional baked treats.

Despite the unique location and quality products offered, this particular store falls terribly short when it comes to customer service. The wait times are excessively long, and staff members are rarely available to assist customers. During the busy Christmas season, getting a simple gift wrap service is an arduous task that requires endless waiting. Even after leaving items at the store to be wrapped at their leisure, the staff failed to complete the task within a reasonable timeframe, despite assurances of timely service. This lack of efficiency and disregard for customers' time constraints is utterly unacceptable. While the brand's products are appealing, the subpar service at this specific location has driven this customer to cancel their loyalty program membership and resort to online shopping instead. It's a shame that such a reputable brand fails to deliver a satisfactory experience at this particular store.

The staff at this establishment is a mixed bag. While a couple of the ladies are incredibly friendly and go above and beyond to assist customers, there's one particular employee who is downright unpleasant and confrontational. Tread carefully around her, as her attitude can quickly turn sour if you're not cautious. It won't take long to identify this problematic individual, but it's best to steer clear and seek out the more approachable members of the team.

Hendricks in St. Louis is a standout barbecue joint that's an absolute must-try. Their meats, sauces, and sides outshine most other barbecue places in the area. Highlights include the massive onion rings and the finely shredded, tasty coleslaw. While the service is friendly and attentive, be prepared for a bit of a wait for your meal – but the unique decor provides ample distraction during the wait time. If you're in the mood for top-notch barbecue, Hendricks is a solid choice that delivers on flavor and ambiance.

Red Robin proved to be an excellent choice for a late-night dinner with kids. The variety of food options was impressive, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure a top-notch experience. Our waiter, Eric, was exceptional – friendly, attentive, and accommodating with special requests, delivering service worthy of a high-end restaurant. The grill station staff also deserves praise for their thoughtfulness in addressing my pepper allergy concerns. While we wish we had a Red Robin closer to our home in upper PA, this visit was truly memorable thanks to the outstanding service. Highly recommended for families seeking a delightful dining experience.

While the servers were friendly and the tables were kept clean, this coffee spot fell short of meeting my expectations. The lack of a menu and the unconventional service of providing hot tea with a cup of ice when I ordered an iced tea were minor inconveniences. However, the real downside was the loud environment, which made it difficult to study or focus despite wearing headphones. The artsy vibe and excellent people-watching opportunities may appeal to some, but for those seeking a quiet study spot or a more conventional coffee shop experience, this place may not be the best choice. Overall, it wasn't a terrible experience, but not one that would compel me to return regularly.

This enthusiastic review raves about the exceptional service and delicious food at Milk and Honey restaurant. The reviewer gives a major shoutout to their waiter Kyle, describing him as chill and deserving of a raise for recommending the standout honey hot sauce. The hot sauce was some of the best the reviewer had eaten in ages. Kyle clearly made a lasting positive impression and the reviewer declares "Kyle from Milk and Honey changed my life." The biscuits also get rave reviews as heavenly good, so much so that the reviewer admits to stealing one from their friend's plate because they were irresistible. Overall, this is an effusive recommendation to visit Milk and Honey, specifically requesting Kyle as your server. The reviewer misses Kyle already and hopes for a reunion soon.

Conveniently located near 30th Street Station and Drexel University, this Philadelphia pub offers decent fare in a casual setting. While the service was sufficient for dinner, the dishes were hit-or-miss. The mac and cheese appetizer lacked flavor despite its appealing presentation. The cheesesteak egg rolls, though inventive, were inconsistent, with some bites lacking filling. The chicken pot pie featured a generous serving of vegetables and white meat, but the crust was uneven in texture and doneness. Portion sizes for desserts were generous, but the bread pudding and brownie failed to impress, lacking in taste and texture. Overall, the experience was average, with the convenient location being a major plus.

Pete's Saloon is an excellent spot for bachelorette parties and milestone birthday celebrations. The lively atmosphere, featuring an energetic cover band, attracts a boisterous crowd of revelers. Arriving early is highly recommended, as the place gets packed by late evening, with lines stretching down the street. While their signature cocktails are tasty, they come with a hefty price tag. Overall, Pete's Saloon is a fun destination for special occasions but may not be ideal for a casual night out due to the potential for overcrowding.

This BBQ joint is an absolute gem! The pulled pork was hands down the best I've ever had - incredibly tender and bursting with smoky flavor. The mac and cheese was wonderfully creamy, and the walnut brownie dessert with ice cream was a delightful end to the meal. Service was prompt and friendly, adding to the overall excellent experience. An outstanding find that BBQ lovers must try!

Copabanana was a complete disaster. Despite attempting to dine outside during restaurant week, we were constantly disturbed by loud children playing football near the tables. Moving inside didn't help either, as the food was terrible. The steak was fatty, overcooked, and had to be sent back. The replacement chicken was rubbery and inedible. The mashed potatoes were not fresh either. The only positive was the attentive waitress, who agreed the steak was poor quality and tried to rectify it. Overall, the dining experience was so unpleasant that I will never return to this restaurant. 1 star for the service, but the food and atmosphere were unacceptable.

An absolute must-try for shrimp and grits in New Orleans! The shrimp and grits here are simply divine, with perfectly cooked shrimp and creamy, flavorful grits that will leave you craving for more. The fresh juices are an excellent accompaniment, offering a refreshing and healthy twist to your meal. My fiancé's second visit in two years speaks volumes about the consistent quality and deliciousness this place delivers. Highly recommended for seafood lovers and those seeking an authentic taste of NOLA's culinary delights.

At last, Nashville has a solid tapas contender! This newcomer boasts a welcoming atmosphere with an open kitchen, friendly service, and, most importantly, delectable small plates that will have you eagerly anticipating your next visit to explore more of the menu's delightful offerings.

This no-frills seafood spot is a hidden gem! The delicious seafood dishes and fantastic sourdough bread are standouts, but the nostalgic 80s music playlist adds an extra layer of charm. Unpretentious and satisfying, it's a must-visit for seafood lovers seeking a lively, retro vibe.

Dr. Curtis Dechant's ophthalmology practice is top-notch. His warm and personable chair-side manner puts patients at ease, establishing a great rapport. The office itself is inviting and equipped with cutting-edge technology, making eye appointments a breeze. Additionally, the practice offers an impressive selection of stylish eyeglass frames, and the staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. Highly recommended for all your eye care needs.

This charming establishment offers delightful cuisine and a fantastic ambiance at reasonable prices. Highlights include the delectable pear cider beer and the attentive, friendly service. A delightful dining experience overall.

Seasons is a delightful little restaurant that excels in desserts, particularly their unique shaved ice offerings like the hula and koko loco flavors. Their boba tea selection is also noteworthy. While primarily a dessert destination, they serve up delicious modernized interpretations of traditional dishes, with standouts being the flavorful quail and the highly praised five-spice chicken wings. The bright, modern ambiance is kid-friendly, and the service is consistently friendly and efficient. Located conveniently at the end of a strip mall with ample parking, Seasons is a must-visit spot for those seeking a sweet treat or a tasty meal. With its inviting atmosphere and quality offerings, it's a place worth returning to time and again.

Overpriced and Underwhelming. While the cafe has an adorable concept, making it a decent spot for meetups, the offerings fall short. The coffee is subpar compared to homemade brews, and the prices are too high for the quality. Some improvements to products and pricing would make this place more appealing.

An absolute gem for seafood lovers and happy hour enthusiasts! This place offers an incredible deal on fresh oysters for just 75 cents each during happy hour. The cheesy grits were also excellent, making it a fantastic spot for indulging in delicious Southern-inspired fare. With its lively atmosphere and budget-friendly prices, it's a must-visit for anyone seeking a great time and a satisfying meal.

An absolute gem! This farm-to-table restaurant is a must-visit for anyone in town. The organic, locally-sourced ingredients ensure that every dish is bursting with freshness and flavor.
