With an extensive menu featuring a variety of delectable options, it's hard to go wrong. Carly's breakfast, with its perfectly cooked avocado, fried egg, and sweet potatoes on sourdough toast, is a standout. Highly recommended for a truly exceptional dining experience.

The burgers at this establishment are a true delight, bursting with incredible flavors. The El Mariachi burger, in particular, stands out as a must-try. While the portion sizes may be on the smaller side, as noted by previous reviewers, the burgers more than make up for it with their outstanding taste. Additionally, the homemade-style salted caramel ice cream is a delightful treat, and the rooster sauce is highly recommended as an accompaniment. Overall, a flavorful and satisfying dining experience.

Unexpectedly Delightful Sushi Experience! This unassuming sushi joint offers an excellent value for your money. Despite dining late on a Sunday evening, the sushi was remarkably fresh and flavorful. For just $13, I enjoyed a generous portion that left me thoroughly satisfied. The friendly staff added to the enjoyable ambiance, creating a welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommended for those seeking quality sushi without breaking the bank. I'll definitely be a repeat customer!

In summary, this establishment falls terribly short in every aspect, from the greasy and overseasoned main dishes to the subpar desserts and beverages. It's a disappointing mess that leaves an unpleasant taste and feeling of regret. Avoid at all costs unless significant improvements are made.

Disappointing stay due to several issues. The non-smoking room had a lingering smoke odor and ashtrays, despite paying for a smoke-free environment. The shower drained excruciatingly slowly, and the lumpy pillows caused an uncomfortable night's sleep, resulting in a migraine. On the positive side, the room was clean, and the staff was friendly. However, the free WiFi failed to connect, further adding to the frustrations. While there were some upsides, the multiple problems overshadowed them, making it difficult to recommend this accommodation.

Disappointing pharmacy experience. Staff came across as unfriendly and gave inconsistent estimates on prescription wait time, quoting 15 minutes initially but then saying 30 minutes later. Poor service if you need your medication promptly. The neighboring Walmart pharmacy may be a better option for timely prescription filling.

El Camino is a vegan restaurant that excels at their seitan offerings, particularly the seitan wings and seitan nachos. The seitan dishes are absolutely delicious and the main draw of the restaurant. However, the service can be excruciatingly slow, with instances of customers waiting an unreasonably long time for their food. On one occasion, the nachos took so long that they were comped. Other menu items like the fried pickles are disappointing and not worth ordering. The margaritas are a decent accompaniment to the seitan dishes. Overall, El Camino is worth visiting for the outstanding seitan options, but be prepared for potential service issues and avoid the fried pickles.

B13 is an exceptional tattoo parlor. Having gotten two tattoos done there, I can confidently say that the artists are highly skilled and accommodating. Even with a group booking at short notice, the owner was able to provide us with great sketches and service. While all the artists seem talented, I've particularly admired Amanda's incredible artistry. If you're looking for a top-notch tattoo experience, B13 is definitely worth considering.

The restaurant was busy on a Friday night, but the wait time was reasonable at 20 minutes. However, the service was inconsistent and lackluster, despite our server's efforts. The food was merely acceptable, nothing special or memorable. Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and I have no plans to return. There are likely better dining options in the area.

Twisted Twig is an excellent choice for floral arrangements, especially for weddings. Jen, the florist, provides exceptional service with her friendly demeanor, responsiveness, and genuine effort to understand her clients' visions. She works closely with customers to create stunning arrangements within their budgets, using her expertise to select the perfect flowers. On my wedding day, Jen exceeded expectations by delivering a beautiful bouquet and floral decor, even adding a thoughtful surprise touch. Her attention to detail and commitment to making the day special were truly remarkable. I highly recommend Twisted Twig and Jen's services for any floral needs – you won't be disappointed!

While the food quality was decent, with highlights like the fresh sashimi, tasty seaweed salad, and unique Banzai roll, the service was disappointing. The waiter came across as unfriendly and made assumptions about the order, failing to clarify preferences. The salad dressing was also described as unusual, resembling carrot purée. Overall, the lackluster service and questionable dressing detracted from an otherwise solid dining experience, prompting a one-star deduction from the rating. ⭐️⭐️⭐️

Tucked away in my own neighborhood, this charming eatery was a delightful surprise. The honeybee crepe and almond croissant were so mouthwateringly good that I cleaned my plate, much to my friends' astonishment. While seating is limited, the cozy atmosphere adds to the charm. Arrive early for groups to snag a table. Perfect for small gatherings seeking exceptional brunch fare. An absolute must-visit that will have me returning again and again.

An absolute must-visit for donut lovers! This place boasts the best location and serves up insanely delicious, freshly made donuts after 5 PM. Be prepared for piping hot treats that will leave your taste buds dancing. Even the next day, these donuts retain their irresistible flavor and quality. Don't miss out on this heavenly donut experience!

This charming and eco-friendly establishment is an absolute gem! The warm and attractive staff, coupled with their extraordinary food and coffee offerings, make it a must-visit destination. Highly recommended for those seeking a sustainable and delightful experience.

Abysmal experience with this restaurant. The food was overpriced and inedible. Delivery took an excruciatingly long two hours, and the staff was rude when inquiring about the order status. An utter disappointment and a complete waste of money. I will never order from this establishment again.

Evan, the door guy at OMALLZ, is simply outstanding. He's an incredibly awesome person who makes the experience at this place truly enjoyable. His friendly and welcoming presence is an integral part of what draws people to OMALLZ. Without Evan, the place just wouldn't be the same. He's the best!

Disappointing Experience - This place is a major letdown. The food was subpar, with a bland burger on a soggy bun and overly salty, greasy fries drowning in truffle oil, which failed to elevate the dish. Despite the exorbitant prices, the quality was akin to fast food. The long wait only added to the frustration. Overall, it's an overpriced and unsatisfactory dining experience that leaves no desire to return.

This cozy Taiwanese spot is a pleasant surprise in Reno, conveniently located near the city's hotels. While the menu can be daunting for the uninitiated, those familiar with Taiwanese cuisine will find authentic dishes done right. Don't miss their delightful boba tea selection either. A solid option for those craving a taste of Taiwan in an unlikely locale.

A total disappointment and rip-off. Having dined at this establishment twice, the experience was so abysmal that the corporation itself refunded our meals both times due to the appalling quality. Overpriced and mediocre food coupled with clueless management and service. An utter waste of money - avoid at all costs unless you want to throw away your hard-earned cash. There are far better dining options that provide value for your money.

Despite its meat-centric appearance, this St. Louis establishment pleasantly surprised me as a vegetarian. Their veggie burger was excellent, complemented by a terrific selection of local microbrews. What's more, they even make their own ice cream, adding an unexpected sweet touch to the experience. I would highly recommend it and will definitely return on my next visit to the city.
Overall, Zaika lives up to its name, offering an authentic and flavorful taste of Indian cuisine, with fresh ingredients and a chef dedicated to ensuring each dish comes together harmoniously.

Despite being a busy establishment, this restaurant provided excellent service. We were offered complimentary coffee while waiting for our table, which was ready promptly. The server was attentive and accommodating, offering tailored suggestions to suit our dietary needs. The shared salad, entree, and special grits were not only delicious and beautifully presented but also reasonably priced for a downtown location. Overall, it was a delightful dining experience, and we highly recommend this restaurant.

This place is an absolute gem! The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating, making it a fantastic spot for families with kids. The food is phenomenal, with standout dishes like the delicious hash browns and the option to add tasty sides like tomatoes and grits. On top of the excellent service and delectable fare, the prices are very reasonable. Highly recommended!

Gelato Letdown: While the gelato itself is delightful, the service at this establishment leaves much to be desired. My friend and I encountered rude and unprofessional behavior from the night staff, who seemed disinterested in providing a pleasant experience. Even the young manager joined in their discourteous behavior, whispering and laughing at our expense. It's a shame, as the service was reportedly better in the past. The tasty gelato is overshadowed by the disappointing and unwelcoming atmosphere created by the staff. Unless improvements are made, I cannot recommend this place despite the quality of their frozen treats.

Fantastic outdoor destination with well-maintained trails for hiking, biking, and running. The scenic views and shaded areas make it perfect for enjoying nature even in hot weather. However, the failure of some owners to follow the leash rules is concerning. Unless the off-leash issue is addressed, the park may have to implement stricter pet policies, which would be unfortunate. Overall, it's a great spot, but pet owners need to be more responsible.

This unassuming gem delivers a delightful dining experience with high-quality, comforting fare at incredibly reasonable prices. The crab cake appetizer, boasting generous portions and a refreshing dill sauce, sets the tone for a memorable meal. The equally generous portions of chicken tenders exemplify the restaurant's focus on wholesome, unpretentious goodness. While service can be stretched during busy times due to limited staff, the overall ambiance is inviting. A lovely option for those seeking delicious, well-executed dishes without the fuss or exorbitant prices often found elsewhere.

This sushi restaurant truly shines with its exceptional service, delicious food, and incredible value. The friendly staff, frequent promotions, and fresh, high-quality fish make it a standout dining experience. The perfectly portioned rolls allow you to sample a wide variety of flavors, making it our favorite sushi spot in town.

Jesse's is a steakhouse located in the Brandon area. The restaurant was packed on the Saturday night we visited, but we were seated promptly. Our server Nikki was attentive and knowledgeable, making sure our drinks were never empty. The crab stuffed mushroom appetizer had good flavor but an oddly small mushroom. The French onion soup was tasty and the right temperature. Salads and bread were served with good pacing. The bread lacked flavor. Steaks were cooked perfectly but my filet had too few sautéed mushrooms, while my boyfriend's Delmonico continued cooking on the hot plate which he disliked. Sides like broccoli and sweet potato were decent. Despite a few misses, Nikki's excellent service made it a positive experience overall. We'll likely return to give Jesse's another try.

This establishment offers a warm and welcoming experience, with friendly staff members who make you feel at home. The selection is impressive, providing a good variety of choices to cater to different tastes and preferences. Moreover, the prices are fair and reasonable, making it an excellent value for your money. Highly recommended.

The Praline Connection in New Orleans had a promising ambiance and pleasant service staff, but unfortunately the food was a major letdown. The appetizers were shockingly bad - the BBQ oysters tasted like cheap ketchup with a gooey texture, the garlic bread was stale and cold, and the chicken wings were undercooked and the sauce was unappetizing. The entrees ordered by others in the party were also unanimously disliked. While the restaurant interior was clean and nicely decorated, the poor quality of the food makes it impossible to recommend. Unless significant improvements are made to the kitchen, The Praline Connection should be avoided despite its inviting atmosphere. A hugely disappointing dining experience overall.

Terrible McDonald's location - avoid at all costs. The food is consistently bad, often cold or with incorrect items. Service is excruciatingly slow, even for McDonald's standards. Most employees don't speak English, making communication and ordering a frustrating ordeal. Unless you're fluent in Spanish and have ample time to waste, steer clear of this poorly-run McDonald's and find another location.

Excellent breakfast spot conveniently located near our hotel. The crepes with fruit were delightful, and I would happily order them again. However, the tea had an unexpected fennel seed flavor, which may not be for everyone's taste. Overall, a solid choice for a satisfying morning meal.

Holy Mole! deserves high praise. As part of a Yelp Elite event, I had the opportunity to sample their diverse menu, and every dish exceeded expectations. The specially crafted cocktail was fantastic, even for a non-cocktail drinker like myself. The manager and staff provided exceptional service, displaying attentiveness, knowledge, and friendliness. This event served as an enticing appetizer, leaving me eager to return for a complete dining experience.

Dinardo's Restaurant is a major disappointment. Despite a friendly hostess, the run-down and unclean interior fails to provide a charming ambiance. The overpriced menu items fail to deliver on quality, with underwhelming dishes like puny mussels in an unimpressive sauce, overly salty and bland soup, and mediocre broiled flounder and seafood imperial. Adding to the unpleasant experience is the snarky and mean-spirited server. Overall, Dinardo's offers an "ick" vibe and subpar food that does not justify its high prices. For good seafood, there are far better BYOB options in the area. It's a wonder how this lackluster establishment remains in business.

As a treat I allow myself once a week, Starbucks is a guilty pleasure that I crave every day. This particular Starbucks location stands out with its friendly and welcoming baristas who prepare drinks accurately and efficiently. For those who prefer coffee without the intense coffee flavor, their Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate, Mocha, and White Mocha are excellent choices. During the summer, their refreshing iced teas are perfect for quenching thirst. The baked goods, especially the Cranberry-Orange Scone, are delightful. While the drive-thru line can be excessively long, it's often quicker to go inside and place your order directly. Overall, this Starbucks location is a fantastic spot to indulge in your favorite caffeinated or non-caffeinated beverages and delectable treats.

This diner exceeded all expectations! The charming decor created a warm and inviting atmosphere. The food was outstanding, with the cheesesteak being a standout dish that surpassed the famous Geno's. Excellent service from our attentive and friendly server rounded out the delightful experience. My wife and I were thoroughly impressed and highly recommend this diner.

Don't judge a book by its cover! JB Dawson's may look like any other chain restaurant, but it's far better. The experience from start to finish was awesome. The friendly staff, prompt service, and delicious food made for a delightful dining experience. The twisted shrimp appetizer surpassed expectations, and the entrees, including the four cheese mac and cheese and fish tacos, were excellent. The only letdown was the limited craft beer selection, which lacked variety and focused heavily on IPAs. Despite the knowledgeable waiter's efforts to accommodate, the beer menu fell short, especially given the abundance of great local craft breweries. Overall, JB Dawson's is a hidden gem worth visiting, but beer enthusiasts may want to bring their own selections.

Tucked away on a residential street, this unassuming eatery serves up an unexpectedly delightful Mediterranean fare. The Greek salad was a standout, boasting fresh, perfectly seasoned ingredients and a dressing that elevated the flavors. The generous portion could easily make a light meal on its own. The vegetarian plate was equally impressive, with pan-fried vegetables bursting with flavor, fluffy rice, and a tantalizing tzatziki-like sauce. The freshly baked pita bread added an authentic touch. Despite being tempted to overindulge, the reasonable pricing and generous portions made it hard to resist cleaning the plate. An absolute gem, this hidden treasure offers a truly satisfying culinary experience that belies its unassuming location.

This local pho shop deserves a 5-star rating for its outstanding food and service. With a loyal, eclectic regular clientele, it's clear that this restaurant excels in delivering a consistently great dining experience. The reviewer praises the freshness of the ingredients and the friendly staff. Although they opted for the bun beef instead of pho due to not being "phongry" (a clever play on words), they highly recommend stopping by this pho shop. The vibrant atmosphere and delicious cuisine make it a must-visit spot for anyone seeking an authentic and enjoyable meal.

Authentic Mexican Gem! The carne asada tacos are a delightful taste of home, with their flavorful and tender meat. The restaurant's atmosphere is inviting and adds to the overall enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking genuine Mexican flavors and a cozy ambiance.

Review:

While the establishment boasts an impressive beer selection, the consistently poor service from the complacent and unfriendly bar staff is a major letdown. Despite the allure of the extensive beer offerings, the unpleasant experience with the disinterested bartenders who seem to resent interacting with patrons ultimately makes this place unworthy of recommendation. The owners' focus on curating a fantastic beer menu is undermined by the lack of attention to providing a welcoming atmosphere and quality service. Patrons are better off visiting the owners' brother's establishment, Brickside Grill, which not only offers good beer but also excellent food and consistently friendly and engaging staff, creating an overall enjoyable dining experience.

The Cantina offers a laidback, college-town vibe for casual Mexican fare and drinks. We ended up here on a Monday afternoon when many other spots were closed. The pulled pork tacos and burritos were decent but nothing extraordinary. It's a serviceable option for a casual meal and margaritas, though the youthful atmosphere might not appeal to all diners, even during off-peak hours. Overall, a standard stop for reasonably priced Tex-Mex in a relaxed setting.

Delicious Designs and Leigh Anne delivered an exceptional wedding cake and cupcakes with short notice. Despite planning the wedding in just two months and initially not needing a cake, Leigh Anne stepped up and created the exact two-tier lemon cake envisioned, with no decorations. She even accommodated a last-minute request for vegan chocolate cupcakes. The cake was not only beautifully executed but also deliciously yummy. The customer was highly impressed with Leigh Anne's service and the overall presentation, deeming Delicious Designs an absolute must for any bakery needs in Reno. The experience was truly remarkable, exceeding expectations.

Grant Nails (formerly Tropical Nails) was a reliable nail salon for me for years, but recent experiences have been disappointing. My long-time nail technician, Amy, left a couple of months ago, and I had to switch to the owner, Angela. While the first manicure with her was acceptable, the subsequent gel polish applications lasted only a day or two before chipping, despite my complaints. After multiple failed attempts to correct the issue, my nails now look unsightly. Regrettably, I can no longer trust the quality of service at Grant Nails and will be seeking a new nail salon.

An absolutely disastrous dining experience at Sake House. Despite being one of the only customers, we faced excruciatingly slow service, with our orders taking nearly two hours to arrive. The staff seemed disorganized and inattentive, serving other tables while neglecting us. As a single parent with a hungry toddler, the lack of consideration and poor service was unacceptable. No effort was made to rectify the situation or offer any compensation. Avoid this place at all costs - the shockingly bad service and wasted time make it an establishment to steer clear of.

While the venue boasts an impressive stage setup with lights, sound system, fog machine, and a sizable dance floor, the food service leaves much to be desired. On two separate occasions, the dining experience was utterly disappointing. During the most recent visit, despite arriving well before the stated kitchen closing time, service was rudely denied. Shockingly, the same staff member who turned down the request then proceeded to seat and serve other patrons who arrived later, leaving a bitter taste. The inconsistent and discourteous treatment towards customers is unacceptable, especially when it comes to something as simple as serving french fries. While the entertainment aspect may be top-notch, the poor food service and lack of professionalism from the staff significantly tarnish the overall experience.

After struggling to achieve the desired A-line bob hairstyle for over a year, the author finally found success with Jenna Moore, a hairstylist recommended by a friend. Jenna's exceptional listening skills and clear communication ensured that she understood the client's vision, and she delivered outstanding results. The author is thrilled with Jenna's work, which has put them on the path to achieving their hair goals. Jenna's expertise in hair healing and growth is highly praised, and the author wholeheartedly recommends her services.

This taco joint offers delectable carne and guacamole, complemented by an outstanding dulce de leche soft serve ice cream. However, the inability to customize taco toppings, overly thick tortilla chips, and limited seating with slow table clean-ups detract from the overall experience. While the food shines, improvements in customization options, chip texture, seating availability, and prompt table service could elevate this establishment.

CURED Nail Spa offers an impeccable, upscale experience with a chic and classic French decor that feels like stepping into a Restoration Hardware magazine. Their high-end polish options, including Chanel, are a delightful surprise. The service is prompt, and the extended massage is a treat. The salon prioritizes cleanliness and safety, with brand-new, sterilized tools. The nail trimmer tools with cute gold tips add a touch of elegance. The gray toes and OPI Funny Bunny gel nails are outstanding choices. CURED is a welcome addition to Nashville, providing a high-end yet comfortable and low-key atmosphere, perfect for bridal parties and photo opportunities. The pricing is competitive with other notable salons in the area. While parking was initially unclear, the upcoming businesses next door suggest improved parking options in the future. Overall, CURED is a delightful discovery and a must-visit, especially paired with a lunch at the nearby Local Honey.

As a frequent visitor to this Philadelphia eatery, even after relocating to Colorado, I can attest to its enduring appeal. The extensive menu offers a delightful array of delectable options, with generous portions and wallet-friendly prices. My personal favorite, the Indian Mee Goreng, is an absolute must-try – a dish so irresistible that I find myself craving it on a daily basis. If only I could persuade the manager to share the recipe, I'd indulge in this culinary delight even during my Colorado stays. An undeniable gem that keeps drawing me back time and time again.

While the service was commendable, the pizza failed to impress. Having been accustomed to the quality offerings from renowned establishments like Stella and Trenos, my expectations were unfortunately not met. The pizza lacked the desired flavor and overall appeal. Regrettably, this experience has left me with no desire to revisit this establishment."

The staff at this Starwood hotel was excellent and truly superior. However, the room insulation, particularly the connecting doors between adjoining rooms, was incredibly poor. Unless you book adjoining rooms with your family, you can essentially hear every sound from the neighboring guests - conversations, coughing, fights, barking dogs - as if they're right in your room. This made for a very unpleasant experience, with only 2 out of 7 nights of decent sleep after the post-holiday crowds cleared out. Starwood needs to address the subpar materials used for the connecting doors to resolve this noise issue. Otherwise, it's an average hotel with outstanding staff."

Disappointing Visit: The jalapeño cheese bread was stale and lacked flavor, while the tomatoes and cucumbers were mushy due to being overripe. The sandwich was a letdown, though the staff remained friendly as usual. Typically, this place offers better quality, but today's experience fell short of expectations.

The Reel Experience: A Perfect Blend of Cinema, Drinks, and Delectable Eats! This movie theater/bar/restaurant is a true gem, offering a unique and enjoyable experience. The impressive drink selection, paired with friendly and attentive service, sets the tone for an enjoyable evening. Additionally, the delicious food options make it a complete package. Highly recommended for a night out with friends or a casual date night!

The iced mocha and iced white chocolate mocha from this establishment were utterly flavorless and underwhelming. Despite requesting an additional shot of espresso in an attempt to salvage the drinks, they remained devoid of any discernible coffee or chocolate taste, leaving us with watered-down, lackluster beverages. Regrettably, both drinks were inedible and had to be discarded, making the entire experience a complete waste of money. It's baffling how a establishment could fail so miserably at crafting these basic coffee-based drinks. Avoid these iced mochas at all costs unless you desire a tasteless, disappointing beverage.

However, in recent times, the store's quality has started to decline. While it's still a pretty decent place, it's no longer the top-notch establishment it once was. The selection and customer service may have taken a hit, but it remains a viable option for those seeking electronic goods and a relatively smooth shopping experience.

The Crescent Park is a hidden gem in New Orleans, offering a scenic 1.25-mile walking trail along the Mississippi River. With multiple entry points, including from Peters Street and Piety Street, this urban oasis rewards visitors with breezy city views, art installations, a dog park, and the chance to witness breathtaking sunsets over the river. Whether you're a local or a visitor, the Crescent Park is a beautiful and refreshing escape in the heart of NOLA.

United Van Lines displayed extremely poor communication and unprofessional behavior when I attempted to obtain a moving quote from them. After an initial virtual survey, they never followed up with a quote despite multiple email and phone requests over the course of a month. Four other moving companies I contacted provided quotes within 48 hours. United Van Lines' lack of response and avoidance is unacceptable for a reputable company. I cannot recommend their services based on this frustrating experience of non-communication and disregard for potential customers.

An outstanding sushi experience with an excellent value! The specialties menu is a standout, with the Snow Mountain and Volcano sushi being truly remarkable dishes that are a must-try. The unique and flavorful creations make this a top choice for sushi lovers seeking something extraordinary.

This place is an absolute gem for gyros! Their chicken gyros are top-notch, with amazing quality and flavor. While the gyros steal the show, they also offer delectable burgers that my daughter loves, and their thick, perfectly seasoned steak fries are simply outstanding – always hot and fresh. The only slight disappointment was the baklava, which is made with pistachios instead of the traditional walnuts. Overall, it's a must-visit spot for anyone craving authentic and delicious Greek fare.

Don't let Reno's reputation fool you – this unassuming Taiwanese eatery is a hidden gem that exceeded all expectations. The three-cup chicken (三杯鸡), oyster omelet, and scallion pancakes were standouts, boasting authentic flavors that rivaled offerings in bigger cities. With an extensive menu leaving plenty more to explore, it's a must-visit for anyone craving top-notch Taiwanese fare, even if just passing through town.

This restaurant offers an authentic culinary experience with delectable dishes in a clean and inviting ambiance. The service is commendable, enhancing the overall dining experience. While the beer selection could be more extensive, it's a minor quibble given the excellent food and service. Highly recommended, and we'll definitely be returning for more.

The cozy and rustic wine lounge offers a delightful lunch experience with an impressive wine selection and tasty small plates like lamb sausage, potato chips, and crab stuffed peppers. The mozzarella with prosciutto bacon bits sandwich is a standout – savory yet light and healthy. The service is prompt and polite, and the atmosphere is intimate with a comfortable noise level. While the bathroom door lock may take some getting used to, overall, it's a highly recommended spot for a enjoyable lunch outing.

Fellinis of Media is an absolute gem for Italian dining. With its extensive menu catering to diverse palates, friendly accommodating staff, and a beautiful, relaxing ambiance, it's no wonder this is a top choice for dining out. In my opinion, their Italian cuisine is simply the best in the area. An excellent overall experience that keeps me coming back time and again.

A True Neighborhood Gem! This new southern Latin eatery is an absolute game-changer for the area. From the delectable takeout we devoured to the warm hospitality of the family owners, every aspect of our experience was top-notch. I'm smitten with their mouthwatering cuisine and can't wait to become a regular. This place is precisely what the neighborhood needed – a delightful addition that elevates the local dining scene. Highly recommended!

An utterly disappointing experience at the Lehigh Acres location. The salon's waiting area was unkempt and cluttered, setting an unprofessional tone from the start. Worse still, the nail technician, Jenna, did a shoddy job that required multiple revisits for repairs, all while engaging in argumentative behavior and scolding the customer. The overall service was subpar, the environment was unpleasant, and there's no incentive to return or recommend this establishment to others. Avoid wasting your time and money here.

This Kimpton restaurant offers an exceptional bar experience with top-notch cocktails and delectable appetizers like the outstanding lemon hummus. However, the brunch service was a letdown. Excessively long wait times, cold food, and a hair found in the meal marred the experience. While the manager commendably comped the check, the subpar brunch quality was a disappointment for a Kimpton establishment. If you visit, enjoy the bar's offerings, but steer clear of the breakfast fare.

The theater offers a pleasant experience with its cleanliness and friendly staff, but falls short in terms of modern amenities. While the pricing is comparable to other theaters with luxurious offerings like recliner seats, in-seat service, and heated seats, this theater lacks such upgrades in most of its auditoriums. Apart from a limited number of premium auditoriums, the overall seating and facilities could use a comprehensive update to match the comforts and conveniences found at competing venues. Despite the shortcomings, it remains a decent option, especially for budget-conscious moviegoers seeking a basic theater experience.

Overall, it's a promising new Thai spot, especially with their affordable cooking class offerings. The LivingSocial deal made the lunch for two, including an appetizer, soup, entrees and a drink, reasonably priced around $24 after discount. Worth checking out for a taste of authentic Thai flavors.

Additionally, the mall features practical stores like Zellers, a dollar store, and Sears, catering to your everyday needs. While the absence of a Hudson's Bay and a movie theater may be a slight drawback, Kingsway Mall still delivers a convenient and enjoyable shopping experience without the hassle of overcrowded malls.

We decided to try Indias Kitchen in St. Louis, deviating from our usual go-to Indian restaurant, Spice and Grill on Olive. Unfortunately, our experience was far from satisfactory. The goat curry we ordered was a letdown – the sauce was overly salty and tomato-heavy, while the goat meat itself was tough and chewy. The naan bread was also subpar and below mediocre. The only redeeming factor was the decent rice preparation. Overall, we were very disappointed with our meal at Indias Kitchen and will likely stick to our favorite, Spice and Grill, in the future.

While the prices were a bit steep, the food quality at this restaurant was generally impressive. The service started off slow in providing menus, but improved thereafter. The bread, chopped salad, and crab cakes were standouts, although the tiny table in the bar area made for an uncomfortable dining experience. However, the biggest concern was an unauthorized overcharge on my credit card, which the manager claimed was a banking glitch. If the charge isn't corrected, it would significantly impact my overall satisfaction. Despite the hiccups, the tasty dishes make it worth considering, but be wary of potential billing issues.

As a self-proclaimed sushi snob, I had a truly disappointing experience at this establishment. The sushi was served warm, which is unacceptable unless it's tempura. Adding insult to injury, the side salad, for which I paid $3, was nothing more than plain iceberg lettuce – no greens, no vegetables, just iceberg. It was a puzzling and frustrating experience that left me feeling cheated. Needless to say, I will not be returning. The poor quality and lack of attention to detail are simply inexcusable for a sushi place. Avoid at all costs.

Excellent vegetarian options! The vegetarian platter was generous and delicious, leaving us comfortably full. The staff was friendly, attentive, and helpful in guiding our choices without being pushy. A great dining experience overall, and we'll certainly be returning.

While the atmosphere and appearance of this hotel seemed classy, the overall experience was extremely disappointing. The staff was unhelpful and unprofessional, failing to provide the booked suite and instead giving separate rooms. To compensate, they offered free valet parking, but the car was vandalized with a keyed door while in their care. The staff's lack of accountability and poor service made for a frustrating and unsatisfactory stay. I would not recommend this hotel due to the ghetto-like treatment and disregard for guests' needs.

This place has consistently delivered an outstanding dining experience. Their accommodating staff goes above and beyond, offering free samples and even packing freshly cooked tamales for our trip to Puerto Rico. The friendly service, combined with their delectable tamales, makes this a must-visit destination. Highly recommended for its excellent food and unparalleled hospitality.

We should have heeded the reviews before dining here. Despite only a few occupied tables, we waited an excessively long 50 minutes for our simple burger and sandwich order. The food itself was merely average. However, the real letdown was the disturbingly loud, offensive, and obnoxious behavior of the bar patrons, which made for an uncomfortable dining experience, especially for an elderly couple present. It's baffling how the management allows such unruly conduct to persist. With such poor service and an unpleasant atmosphere, it's hard to see this establishment lasting long unless significant improvements are made. Avoid this place until they address these glaring issues.

Overall, this Vietnamese restaurant is a decent choice with some tasty dishes like the spring rolls and duck soup. However, the pho could be hit or miss depending on personal preferences. The portions are generous, so be prepared for leftovers. With a few vegetarian options and good service, it's worth a visit, especially if you enjoy Southeast Asian flavors.

Chickie's and Pete's is a lively sports bar that caters well to female fans, offering ample seating and a dedicated sound booth for game commentary and music during commercials. While the famous crab fries, served with a congealed cheese sauce, fail to impress, the bar's tacky beer towers and smoke-free environment make up for it. With its boisterous atmosphere, cute servers, and spacious layout, Chickie's and Pete's is a solid choice for catching a game with fellow rowdy fans, particularly for Eagles enthusiasts. 3.5 stars.

Pancake Pantry is a Nashville institution that should be on every visitor's must-try list. While the lines can be long, the wait is worth it for the chance to enjoy their delicious pancakes and rub shoulders with country music stars. The pancakes are the star attraction, but the lively atmosphere and friendly conversation add to the charm of this quintessential Nashville experience. Be prepared to wait, but savor the anticipation as you take in the buzzing ambiance of this beloved local gem.

As a long-time fan of Magasin Cafe, I visited Magasin Kitchen to satisfy my Vietnamese food cravings while the original location undergoes renovations. The food quality and service at Magasin Kitchen were commendable, with even the chopped salad being seasoned better than the previous location. However, the higher prices and lack of the cozy atmosphere that drew me to Magasin Cafe initially detracted from the overall experience. While the delicious food and attentive service will keep me returning as a loyal customer, the increased cost and different ambiance prevent Magasin Kitchen from achieving the same level of adoration as its predecessor.

A must-visit for Sichuan food lovers! This restaurant offers an authentic and delectable Sichuan dining experience. The cumin-style lamb and rabbit appetizer are standout dishes, showcasing the bold and complex flavors that Sichuan cuisine is renowned for. While purists may debate its authenticity, the food is undeniably delicious and worth trying. Whether you're a Sichuan food enthusiast or simply enjoy flavorful and well-executed cuisine, this place is a gem that deserves a visit.

In the end, the age-old quote, "K-Mart sucks," still rings true, but for those seeking affordable prescriptions or a glimpse into a bygone era, Kmart might just be worth a visit, if only for a dose of nostalgia and the occasional unexpected encounter.

Tuck Special at Tuck Hinkle's Sandwich Shop in Nashville is an absolute must-try! This unique sandwich combines an unlikely trio of brisket, egg, and pimento cheese, creating an incredibly delicious flavor medley. The meat quality is excellent, although the BBQ sauce on the table didn't impress. Despite the potential crowds, it's worth the wait if you plan ahead by checking the menu beforehand. This sandwich alone warrants a special trip from Texas – it's that good! If you're in Nashville or passing through, make sure to stop by and experience the Tuck Special.

Unpleasant Experience: Terrible Smell and Poor Service. Despite being a sushi restaurant, the place reeked like a toilet, making it unbearable to dine in. Our meals were carelessly packed together in one box, despite ordering different items (spicy tuna roll for me and California rolls for my daughter who doesn't eat fish). While my daughter enjoyed her rolls, my spicy tuna roll was merely mediocre. The overall experience was disappointing, and I won't be returning due to the foul odor and lack of attention to detail. 1/5 stars.

This restaurant is a standout for its generous portions and innovative menu that keeps things fresh and exciting. The latkes and bacon are particular highlights, with the latter being the best in Philly. However, the cramped seating and noisy atmosphere can make for an uncomfortable dining experience, especially for those seeking a quieter ambiance. Additionally, while the food shines, the coffee falls short compared to the exceptional brews at Sabrina's. Overall, it's a solid choice for adventurous eaters who prioritize quality food over ambiance, but those seeking a more relaxed environment may want to look elsewhere.

Yellow Subs in Reno is an absolute must-visit! Their subs are phenomenal, especially when you add sprouts – it truly elevates the experience. The friendly staff takes great pride in crafting the best subs using only top-quality ingredients. The casual, conversational atmosphere and ample seating create a welcoming vibe. Don't forget to grab a Yellow Subs tank top or t-shirt as a souvenir – they're priceless! With fast service, amazing food, and a fantastic environment, Yellow Subs is a 5-star experience that any sub lover should not miss. Highly recommended!
The initial wait time was a bit long, but the food made up for it. I enjoyed my meal, especially the side salad. Service from our waitress Tina was decent. Overall, a solid 3.5-star experience.

Love!! is our new go-to local spot. With its inviting ambiance, delicious food, and refreshing drinks, it's a real gem. The salsa is a standout, and the generous salads make for filling entrees. Grab some friends, snag a table on the patio, order a margarita, and soak in the lively atmosphere. Highly recommended for a fun and flavorful dining experience.

While the service was truly excellent, the dining experience fell short in terms of food quality. The soups were disappointingly served lukewarm, and my steak was overcooked, arriving well-done despite requesting a medium doneness. Although the service deserves praise, the kitchen missed the mark on executing the dishes properly. Overall, a mixed experience with excellent service but mediocre food preparation.

Nippon Tei failed to live up to its great reviews on Yelp. While the free edamame appetizer was a nice touch, the mango sake drink was overpriced, and the sushi itself was underwhelming. Despite being tasty, the sushi rolls were falling apart, which made for a disappointing presentation and difficulty eating them. Among the handful of sushi restaurants I've tried, Nippon Tei ranks as the worst, though the sushi wasn't necessarily bad. With average pricing and better options available elsewhere, Nippon Tei hasn't earned a spot as a go-to sushi spot, but I might give them another chance in the future.

Review:

Star Wars Rogue One 3D Experience: A Disappointing Disaster

While the ticket purchase and atmosphere were inviting, the 3D experience for Rogue One at this theater was a complete disaster. The entire screen was shrouded in darkness, making it nearly impossible to discern the actors' faces or details. Despite complaints from multiple viewers, the manager dismissed the issue, claiming it was a "closed-system" and refusing to even witness the problem firsthand.

The dim and distorted 3D projection ruined the immersive experience one would expect from such a highly anticipated film. Even without the 3D glasses, the shadows were doubled, further compounding the visibility issues. It was a frustrating and disappointing experience, leaving me with no desire to revisit this theater's 3D offerings in the future.

While the prompt food service and comfortable seating were positives, they were overshadowed by the subpar 3D projection quality and the manager's dismissive attitude towards customer concerns. This theater has room for improvement in both its technical capabilities and customer service approach for 3D screenings.

Disappointing Experience at an Overpriced Restaurant. Despite the menu prices suggesting an upscale dining experience, the ambiance was lacking, with unsightly plastic containers and a sagging knitted item hanging from the ceiling. The food, while decent, fell short of expectations. The pork chop, not listed on the menu, was overpriced and heavily marbled with fat. The 'ropa vieja' dish, though tasty, was also overpriced for its moderate portion size. Service was lackluster, with servers struggling to pronounce dish names and seeming eager to rush our departure, even with the restaurant half-empty on a Saturday night. Overall, the restaurant failed to deliver value commensurate with its pricing, making it difficult to recommend.

The Chicken Coop Restaurant disappoints with its overpriced and underwhelming fare. While the chicken coop-inspired decor is an interesting concept, the food fails to impress. The Sunday brunch menu offers little value, with the exception of the reasonably priced chicken strips and fries. Portions, such as the comically small seasonal salad, are lacking, especially given the high prices. The chicken, though decent, doesn't surpass the quality of chains like Raising Cane's. Additionally, slow service and food delivery hampered the overall experience, even with a small crowd. Regrettably, the hype surrounding this establishment doesn't live up to the reality.

As a self-proclaimed meat-lover and not a health enthusiast, I was pleasantly surprised by this vegetarian/vegan eatery. Initially skeptical, a co-worker introduced me to their delectable offerings, and I was instantly hooked. Their salads are remarkably delicious, and the friendly service coupled with a bustling atmosphere creates a welcoming ambiance. While I may not indulge daily, the cravings for their meatless delights are frequent. This place is an unexpected gem, even for those without dietary restrictions.

Regis Hair Salon's stylist, Angie, completely botched my haircut. Despite providing clear reference photos, the outcome was a far cry from what I wanted. Angie seemingly disregarded my instructions, leaving me with an unflattering men's flattop hairstyle. Even when I pointed out the discrepancy, she failed to correct her mistakes. To top it off, this happened right before the holidays, ruining my festive look. I cannot recommend this establishment and will not be returning."

This restaurant is an absolute gem for a romantic date night! The standout dishes were the mouthwatering sweet potato nachos and the ingenious 'breakfast' dish, both of which were absolutely to die for. In fact, everything we tried on the menu was deliciously executed. I can't wait to revisit this stellar establishment and indulge in their culinary delights again!

Convivio is a promising new restaurant that delivers excellent food despite a few opening-night hiccups. While there were minor service issues and some wines being out of stock, understandable for a brand-new establishment, the owner's warm and gracious presence at the table left a positive impression. The standout dish was the tortelloni pansotti, hailed as potentially the best pasta ever tasted. With exceptional cuisine and a commitment to improving the minor kinks, Convivio is poised to become a frequent dining destination for those seeking an outstanding culinary experience.

After a long day at the beach, we stumbled upon Crabby Bill's, a casual seafood spot across the street from Clearwater Beach. We ordered the $25 bucket of steamed seafood, which was decent but not the freshest or best seafood we've had. It served as a quick snack to tide us over before our main dinner reservation at the renowned Bern's Steak House. While Crabby Bill's didn't blow us away, it was a convenient option for a simple seafood fix right by the beach. If you're looking for an affordable, no-frills seafood meal in the area, Crabby Bill's could fit the bill, but don't expect exceptional quality.

State Street Kitchen continues to impress with its creative and delicious dishes. The Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Swiss, and Honey Mustard Sub, elevated with the addition of Jalapeno Chips, was an absolute delight – perfect for a blustery autumn day. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff, led by the ever-present Micha, make this local gem feel like a second home. State Street Kitchen's fusion of home-cooked comfort and Korean flavors is truly unique and not to be missed. Whether it's for breakfast, lunch, or any meal, this exceptional establishment should be on every foodie's radar. Do yourself a favor and experience the warmth and flavors that have made State Street Kitchen a beloved staple.

This place is a true gem! With its delectable homemade fare, friendly staff, and rotating specials, it ticks all the boxes. The chicken salad is a standout, perfect for grabbing and making tasty sandwiches at home. If you're looking for an awesome dining experience with great food and a welcoming atmosphere, this establishment is a must-visit.

While the food itself was good, the negative service experience overshadowed any positive aspects of the meal. As a result, I have decided to discontinue doing business with this establishment and will not be recommending it to guests or colleagues in the future.
Exceptional service with a welcoming atmosphere! The staff here is incredibly sweet and efficient, ensuring appointments run smoothly with minimal wait times. A delightful experience all around.

Disappointing Visit - While the cocktails and atmosphere were pleasant, the food at this establishment was a major letdown. The Brussel sprouts were overwhelmingly salty, even after being sent back and replaced. Similarly, the fries that accompanied the burger were also excessively salted. The burger itself and the flank steak were merely decent, failing to impress. Overall, the heavy-handedness with salt and the unremarkable main dishes left us dissatisfied with the dining experience. We won't be returning anytime soon.

Citizens Bank Park offers an outstanding baseball experience for Phillies fans. The open layout provides a spacious and comfortable atmosphere, even during sold-out games. While seats directly under the scoreboard can be inconvenient, the ability to wander and watch from various vantage points on the lower levels is a major plus. The diverse food options, abundant facilities, and cleanliness further enhance the enjoyment. As a converted baseball fan, I can attest that this ballpark fosters an instant love for the Phillies and the game itself. The countdown to the start of the new season is on! Go Phillies!

This Mexican restaurant offers a delightful experience with its fresh and flavorful salsa, perfectly crispy chips, and outstanding chunky guacamole. The side of beans was a standout, praised as the best from a Mexican restaurant, although the portion size could be more generous. While the hot sauces lacked heat, this may cater to those with lower spice tolerance. However, the steak tacos disappointed with low-quality, flavorless meat. Despite this shortcoming, the overall dining experience was enjoyable, prompting a willingness to give the restaurant another chance. It's worth noting that chips and salsa are not complimentary and must be purchased separately.

Plaza Deli is a long-standing sandwich spot in La Cumbre Plaza, Santa Barbara, that serves up delicious and fresh sandwiches. The bread rolls are soft and flavorful, and the ingredients taste fresh. With a wide variety of sandwich options, it's hard to pick a favorite as they're all delicious. The soda selection is also impressive, offering a chance to try something new with every visit. While the menu is not exotic, Plaza Deli delivers on tasty, high-quality sandwiches made with fresh ingredients, making it a great choice for locals and visitors alike looking for a satisfying meal.

Nordstrom's shoe department at this location is a cut above the rest. With an impressive selection of high-end brands and a wide variety of styles, it caters to discerning shoppers. The real standout, however, is the exceptional customer service. Erwin, a knowledgeable and accommodating sales professional, went above and beyond by locating desired shoes across the Nordstrom's network and price-matching them to a competitor's clearance sale, all with free shipping. Such attentive and personalized service has earned Nordstrom's enduring loyalty from this satisfied customer.

Tarpon Springs Aquarium is a modest family-friendly attraction that caters primarily to young children. While not a must-visit destination, it offers interactive experiences like shark feeding shows and the opportunity to pet and feed stingrays. The aquarium's compact size and hands-on activities seem to resonate well with small kids. It's a decent option for those with young ones looking for a brief educational and entertaining pit stop in Tarpon Springs.

While not extraordinary, Jade Garden offers reliable and well-executed Chinese takeout fare. The dishes are relatively light and less greasy compared to other options in the area. The standout aspect is the friendly service provided by the staff, making the overall experience pleasant. If you're in the mood for simple, no-frills Chinese food, Jade Garden is a solid choice in the neighborhood.

This quaint eatery offers a delightful ambience, complemented by outstanding food and service. The Shrimp Po Boy was a standout dish, bursting with flavors, and the perfectly cooked fries and crisp cole slaw made for excellent accompaniments. A truly enjoyable first visit, and certainly not the last.

Broussard's Review:

Broussard's is an iconic New Orleans restaurant, and the experience lived up to its reputation. The charming courtyard and historic foyer set the scene for an authentic local dining experience. The service was prompt and attentive, with knowledgeable staff guiding us through the extensive wine list and daily specials.

The food was undoubtedly the highlight. The Maytag blue cheese salad was delightfully fresh, leaving me craving more. The pecan-crusted drum, topped with a delicious soy butter sauce and crawfish, was a true culinary delight.

However, the main dining room fell short in its ambiance. While the vintage chandeliers added character, the overall decor felt outdated and in need of a refresh to match the grandeur of the rest of the establishment.

Overall, Broussard's delivered a memorable dining experience, with exceptional food and service. But the lackluster dining room ambiance prevents it from being a top-tier destination. It's a place worth visiting for the history and cuisine, but unlikely to become a frequent haunt.

Rating: 3.5/5

This upscale casual dining spot offers an excellent overall experience. The service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is great. Highlights include the fantastic raw bar and the best Alaskan crab legs you'll find, making them worth the splurge. The burgers are also a standout, with generous portions of crispy fries. However, expect to pay a premium for most entrees, with many costing over $30. While some dishes, like the shrimp and grits, may disappoint in terms of value, others, like the rabbit and chicken liver pate served in a large mason jar, are worth trying. The drinks are delicious, and the complimentary appetizer (a unique pizza) offered to out-of-town guests is a nice touch. For the best value, stick to the appetizers, burgers, and drinks, and you'll leave happy.

Doan's is a standout local gem that consistently delivers exceptional service and delicious fare. With its warm, inviting atmosphere and friendly staff, it's the perfect spot to become a regular. The speedy service ensures you can enjoy a satisfying meal even on a tight schedule. Whether you opt for your tried-and-true "usual" or explore new menu offerings, the quality remains consistently high, making every visit as enjoyable as the last. Doan's is a must-visit for those seeking a reliable, welcoming dining experience.

This brick oven pizza joint is a true gem, and it keeps getting better with every visit. The standout dish is the Rotolo - dough wrapped around mortadella, ricotta, and topped with pistachios and oil. It's an absolute must-try, offering an explosion of flavors in every bite. The prosciutto pizza is also incredible, with the high-quality toppings complementing the perfectly chewy and flavorful dough. The service is consistently friendly, and the beer selection pairs well with the delectable pizzas. Overall, it's undoubtedly one of the best pizza places in Philadelphia, offering an exceptional dining experience.

Absolute pizza perfection! This thick, chewy, cheesy, and greasy delight is the epitome of what pizza should taste like. After the first bite, I experienced pure bliss akin to Oprah's famous 'You get a car!' moment, except I got something even better – an authentic, mouth-watering pizza that has become my new go-to spot in Indianapolis. No fancy frills, just good old-fashioned pizza heaven!

Disappointingly slow service at this Chinatown tea shop. Despite being the only customers, we waited an astonishing 27 minutes for just three teas. No beverage is worth such an excessive delay, especially in an area known for its efficiency. The lackadaisical service completely overshadowed any potential quality of the tea itself. An utterly unacceptable experience.

Concise Review:

"As a Chicago native, I'm thrilled to have found an authentic taste of home at this beef sandwich joint. Their mouthwatering sandwiches are the closest I've had to the real deal outside of the Windy City. While it's already stellar, a few tweaks could make it even better: offering a larger sandwich size, adding sweet peppers, serving fries, extending the main location's hours, and keeping it open year-round. Highly recommended for homesick Chicagoans and beef sandwich enthusiasts alike!"

Buff Nail Salon is a true gem! Despite being fully booked, they went above and beyond to accommodate our group of four for a pedicure on Mother's Day. The modern, minimalist decor and complimentary mimosas, wine, and champagne set the tone for a relaxing experience. The staff was incredibly friendly, making us feel welcome and comfortable throughout. The pedicure itself was exceptional, with the polish lasting chip-free for an impressive duration. While street parking may be a minor inconvenience for some, Buff's exceptional service and attention to detail make it a worthy destination. Highly recommended for those seeking a luxurious and memorable pampering experience.

This place is a must-visit for pho lovers in Philadelphia. The broth is incredibly flavorful, and the portion sizes are satisfying. I had the No. 51 small pho, and it was more than enough to fill me up. The quality of the food and the overall experience make it a spot I'd gladly return to on future visits to the city.

This casual café-bar hybrid offers the best of both worlds. On one side, you can enjoy a cozy coffee shop vibe with a variety of coffees, teas, and breakfast items. On the other, it transforms into a laidback bar serving up appetizers, salads, sandwiches, and an impressive selection of beers on tap, bottled, or canned. The relaxed atmosphere invites you to linger for hours, reminiscent of carefree college days. Plus, it's pet-friendly, so you can bring your furry companion along for a truly chill Sunday Funday experience.

Moving forward, exploring alternative rental companies like Hertz or Dollar and making reservations over the phone may yield better rates and transparency. Avis' lack of upfront pricing and failure to provide cost-saving options marred an otherwise satisfactory vehicle rental.

Excellent customer service and a top-notch used car buying experience! The staff, especially Andy, went above and beyond to ensure I found a reliable, well-maintained vehicle that met my needs. Their commitment to customer satisfaction is truly commendable. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a hassle-free used car purchase.

Jungle Prada Tavern is a hidden gem for seafood lovers. The bartender's beer recommendation hit the mark, and the seafood dishes exceeded expectations. Standouts include the scallops prosciutto appetizer, the del mar pizza with crab and scallops, and the crab-stuffed portabella with a delightful crab and lobster bisque. Even the roasted portabella appetizer, a vegetarian option, impressed with its flavor. With multiple visits under their belt, including one with a seafood-fanatic sibling, this place earns a solid recommendation for its diverse and delicious menu options. Give Jungle Prada Tavern a chance, and you won't be disappointed.

This bead store in Nashville is an absolute gem for crafters and bead enthusiasts. With an impressive selection of seed beads and glass strands adorning the walls, it offers an overwhelming abundance of choices. It's a true paradise for anyone seeking unique and vibrant materials to bring their beaded creations to life. A must-visit destination for avid beaders and jewelry makers in the area.

An outstanding addition to the Fairmount dining scene! This new Vietnamese restaurant delivers an exceptional experience with its vibrant atmosphere, friendly staff, and mouthwatering dishes. The green tea, summer rolls, and pho are must-tries, bursting with authentic flavors. This spot has already secured a spot on my regular rotation for top-notch Vietnamese fare.

The unassuming exterior and retro 1950s decor at this small-town diner belie the tasty homestyle cooking on offer. While not the pinnacle of culinary excellence, it excels at classic comfort foods like grandma's hearty, greasy breakfast fare. The fluffy pancakes, thick-cut bacon, and reasonable prices make it a delightful spot for a satisfying, home-cooked breakfast served with warm hospitality. A charming local gem that transports diners back in time with its nostalgic ambiance.

Disappointing experience at this restaurant. Despite arriving well before closing time, they were already serving a limited menu without any notice on their website. The server struggled with simple modifications to dishes and provided lackluster service throughout the meal. The food itself was overpriced for the quality. Unless there's a compelling reason, I wouldn't recommend visiting this establishment.

Revisiting this vegan gem, the experience exceeded expectations once again. The butternut squash and goat cheese rangoons and the mushroom yakisoba were standout starters, boasting incredible flavors and a satisfying, meat-like texture despite being meatless. The coconut curry ramen was a heavenly main dish, absolutely divine. While the lack of a dedicated waiting area can be inconvenient, the swift service and outstanding food make it well worth the wait, especially before catching a show nearby. An exceptional vegan dining experience that delights the palate.

While the beer selection at Brew Hub was decent, with a few good options like the white IPA and red ale, it failed to impress someone with a discerning palate for craft brews. The industrial surroundings and lack of scenic appeal detracted from the overall experience, though the $1 discount on beers when a train passes by was a nice touch. The loyal following present on a Sunday afternoon suggests a solid local fanbase. Overall, Brew Hub earns a respectable 3.5 stars, making it a decent option for beer enthusiasts, but not a must-visit destination.

While I loved my first experience and even referred friends, this lacklustre second visit has me conflicted about returning. Having paid $40 for an unsatisfactory pre-wedding manicure that cannot be easily removed is frustrating. The inconsistency between the two visits is puzzling, leaving me unsure if I can rely on their services for future important occasions.

Off the Beaten Path Gem: While not in the heart of the tourist district, this Marigny eatery is a hidden gem worth seeking out. Despite minor imperfections, the incredibly affordable prices make it a standout choice. Serving breakfast all day, including delectable options like the lox omelet under $10, the menu boasts vegetarian and vegan offerings (though the cheese inclusion is a head-scratcher). Standout dishes include the french fry poboy, mac 'n cheese sandwiches, and the Saturday BBQ Chicken legs Blue Plate special. With no entree exceeding $10 and $5 Bloody Marys that hit the spot, this budget-friendly spot delivers exceptional value for the money. Embrace the imperfections and savor the flavors at this off-the-beaten-path find.

This place is a winner! Their sangria is absolutely awesome, and they have a great rotating selection of craft beers. But the real stars are the pizza and calzones - the delicious pies keep me coming back time and time again. If you're in the area, it's a must-visit for tasty drinks and fantastic Italian fare.

While the alcohol selection and drink quality are decent, this casino bar fails to impress overall. The overpriced food menu is limited, and the meals I had were unsatisfactory to the point of causing illness. The service is also incredibly lacking, with servers being consistently inattentive and difficult to flag down. With so many superior options available in Reno, this establishment is best avoided unless you're solely seeking a place to drink within the confines of the attached casino.

Disappointing experience. The staff was extremely rude and unprofessional when I inquired about availability during the Thanksgiving holiday. Instead of providing a proper response, they abruptly said no and hung up the phone. Such disrespectful behavior towards customers is unacceptable. I will not be patronizing this establishment and would recommend others to take their business elsewhere as well.

This sports bar exceeded our expectations! With a great customer service and an impressive menu selection, we thoroughly enjoyed our meals – the sauteed stir-fry over spinach and the abundant pile of nachos. The lively atmosphere, complete with TVs airing sports events, made for a pleasant dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a friendly ambiance and satisfying fare in a sports bar setting.

My experience at this pizza place was nothing short of a disaster. The pizza arrived a full 2 hours late, soggy and stone cold. Despite calling twice, there was zero communication about the delay. When I finally received the inedible pizza, I requested a refund and was told I wouldn't be charged, only to find the charge on my statement the next day. The staff was extremely rude and unhelpful. Terrible service coupled with subpar food make this an establishment to avoid at all costs. I certainly won't be returning or recommending it to anyone.

This restaurant is an absolute gem! The food is exceptional, from the mouthwatering black bean ravioli to the perfectly cooked and flavorful bone-in steak. The service is truly outstanding, with friendly and attentive staff who go above and beyond to ensure a memorable dining experience. The cozy ambiance, complete with a fireplace and inviting decor, adds to the warm and welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an exceptional culinary journey complemented by impeccable service. Perfect for group outings or intimate gatherings alike.

While Timeout Sports Pub's proximity to a nearby motel could attract some guests, its failure to deliver an immersive sports-watching experience is likely to leave most patrons disappointed and seeking alternative venues that better cater to the sports bar crowd.

If you're an onion ring enthusiast, this place is a must-visit. They serve some of the best onion rings I've ever tasted – crispy, golden, and bursting with flavor. Their Reuben sandwich is also noteworthy, offering a delicious twist on the classic. Overall, a solid choice for satisfying your cravings for well-executed comfort food.

The Charming Gem of Boise Coffee Shops! This cozy café stands out with its delightful ambiance and unparalleled customer service. While the coffee itself is top-notch, the real stars are the incredibly friendly baristas who create a warm and welcoming environment. An absolute must-visit for both locals and visitors alike!

If the restaurant was truly closed for the evening, proper signage or a locked door would have prevented this unpleasant situation. Unfortunately, this initial encounter has left us hesitant to give this establishment another try. Poor communication and lack of hospitality are not qualities we look for when dining out."

This place is a must-visit! The food is incredibly fresh and flavorful. The papaya salad and curry are standout dishes – the salad is deliciously tangy, while the curry packs a perfect punch of spice. The service is excellent too. Convenience is a plus, as they offer takeout options. Highly recommended!

Music City Dental is a fantastic dental practice! Dr. Spurlin and her team are incredibly gentle and prioritize patient comfort. As someone who dreads shots, I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't even feel the injection for my filling. The practice goes above and beyond by offering amenities like pillows, blankets, and entertainment options during procedures. Despite my usual dental anxiety, I had a genuinely pleasant experience and will definitely be a loyal patient at Music City Dental.

This humble Chinese eatery offers a mixed bag of culinary experiences. The shrimp spring rolls were a standout, ranking among the best we've tried. However, the beef noodles were overly salty, and the fried rice was a tad too oily. While the food showed potential, the chaotic seating arrangement and disorganized service during peak hours let the experience down, earning it a modest three-star rating. Despite the flaws, it's a decent option for those seeking an affordable and casual Chinese dining experience, but don't expect exceptional service or a peaceful ambiance during busy times.

Overall, Burger Up is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood, offering a great hangout spot with exceptional burgers and a welcoming ambiance. If you're looking for a place to enjoy delicious food, drinks, and a genuine sense of community, Burger Up is definitely worth a visit.

While not a die-hard fan of Indian cuisine, this establishment pleasantly surprised me and lived up to its reputation. My recommendation? Skip the daunting menu and let the talented Hassan curate a delightful experience for you. Don't miss out on the tantalizing chaat and refreshing lassi combo – a match made in culinary heaven that perfectly complements each other. A delightful discovery for even the most skeptical Indian food enthusiasts.

Mr. B's Bistro offers an excellent dining experience with outstanding entrees like shrimp and grits and barbecued shrimp. While the appetizers and bread pudding were good but not exceptional, the real standouts are the main courses and the great location. However, the service could be more attentive, and the restaurant's interior was surprisingly chilly, so be prepared with a light jacket. Overall, it's a solid choice for delicious New Orleans cuisine, narrowly missing a perfect rating.

The Steamboat Natchez tour in New Orleans was an outstanding experience. The informative commentary made the trip truly fascinating, and the staff's excellent organization and kindness were remarkable. The window seating arranged by JoJo added to the enjoyment. Highly recommended for a pleasant and educational outing in NOLA.

A disappointing experience at this establishment. Despite its prime location and potential, it fails to deliver due to poor inventory management and lack of customer service. The limited beer and cocktail options, with several items unavailable, frustrate patrons. The bartenders' rude and unprofessional behavior, including swearing, further diminishes the overall experience. It's a waste of a promising opportunity, and the management needs to address these issues urgently to prevent losing customers and damaging their reputation.

While the bar and some dishes showed promise, the inconsistent and inattentive service at the table level significantly detracted from an otherwise enjoyable meal. Improvements in staff training and attentiveness are needed to provide a more consistent and satisfactory dining experience.

This cozy cafe is an absolute gem! The adorable and casual interior creates a welcoming atmosphere for enjoying their delicious Vietnamese fare and tasty baked goods. The staff is incredibly friendly, and the service is efficient. The banh mi sandwiches are a must-try, boasting fresh and flavorful bread. Their boba milk tea is also top-notch. Additionally, they offer a loyalty program for free drinks and have convenient hours. Overall, it's a clean, charming spot that's perfect for a satisfying meal or a casual hangout with friends.

As an avid fan of ELF Cosmetics' holiday collections, I stopped by my local Walgreens, hoping to catch a glimpse of the highly anticipated Villain's collection before the holidays. Unfortunately, my excitement quickly turned to disappointment when the cosmetics staff informed me that this particular Walgreens location never receives these limited-edition releases. Despite the occasional luck of other stores getting them early, it seems this specific Walgreens consistently misses out. Disheartened but not deterred, I'll have to continue my hunt for the coveted Villain's collection at other Walgreens locations, determined to snag these villainous beauties before they sell out.

This cozy Italian eatery is an absolute gem! The entrees were exquisitely prepared, and the cheesecake was a delightful indulgence. What truly stood out, however, was the warm and attentive service from the entire staff. It's the perfect spot for a romantic date night, offering both delectable cuisine and a charming ambiance. Highly recommended for an exceptional dining experience.

This casual eatery is an absolute gem for fish taco lovers! Their signature item, the fish tacos, are remarkably delicious and an incredible value at just $2.60 each. While other dishes like the beef taco and chicken fajitas were deemed average by my friend, we both agreed that the fish tacos were simply amazing. Coupled with the cozy interior, inviting patio, and the added bonus of having a Ben & Jerry's right next door for dessert, this place is a must-visit for anyone craving top-notch fish tacos in a charming ambiance.

Excellent experience at this watch repair shop. The staff was prompt and friendly, and they replaced my dive watch battery in under 5 minutes for a reasonable fee. They had plenty of staff available, and the location was conveniently located. Highly recommended for efficient and courteous service.

The Oak Tree Inn offers a unique and peaceful atmosphere, set in a quiet location under the shade of large, old trees. While the tri-tip sandwich was a letdown, being dry and lacking accompaniments, the buffalo burger was an absolute standout. One of the best burgers ever tasted, the buffalo burger received top marks from both diners. The venue's ambiance and the delicious buffalo burger make it worth a visit for a memorable dining experience away from the hustle and bustle of the town. Just be prepared for potential crowds during peak hours.

Overall, the new Mad Mex location offers a more peaceful dining experience with attractive happy hour specials. While the food is nothing exceptional, it's a decent spot to hang out and enjoy affordable drinks if the service improves in handling crowds and chaos efficiently.

Overall, the Yuengling Brewery Tour was a delightful experience for beer enthusiasts. It offered a fascinating glimpse into the brewery's rich history and brewing process, culminating in a generous tasting session. I would highly recommend it, especially when visiting with friends or family who appreciate a good brew.
Overall, the poor service and mediocre food made for a disappointing visit. I had hoped for a consistent experience across Marathon Grill locations, but this one missed the mark significantly.

Disappointing service marred an otherwise good dining experience. Despite arriving during a non-peak time, the service was excruciatingly slow. It took an unreasonable amount of time to receive drinks, and there was a lack of communication about an unavailable beer order. While the food itself was tasty, the lengthy wait and poor service made it difficult to fully enjoy the meal. The delicious fare couldn't compensate for the frustrating lack of attentiveness from the staff.

This organic beer and burger joint offers a delightful experience. With the option to customize your burger or order from the menu, there's something for everyone. The rotating beer selection and specials add excitement. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff create a welcoming vibe. While burgers are served without sides, their selection of fries and other accompaniments ensures a satisfying meal. Vegetarians will also find tasty options on the menu, making it an inclusive dining spot. Overall, a must-visit for burger enthusiasts seeking a fresh, flavorful experience.

Earl's New American Kitchen: Disappointing Experience. The food was decent but nothing exceptional, and the service left much to be desired. On my first visit, the bartender's attitude was indifferent at best. The second time, the bartender was outright rude, ruining the experience entirely. With mediocre food and poor service, I cannot recommend Earl's New American Kitchen, and I won't be returning myself.

Jake's, a franchise of a beloved childhood diner, left a mixed impression. While the ambiance was underwhelming and the restaurant lacked warmth, the burgers lived up to nostalgic expectations. The soft buns and juicy patties were delightful, but the disappointing cold fries failed to impress, even falling short of fast-food chains. Overall, the burgers might warrant a return visit, but the original location likely offers a more authentic and satisfying experience.

Went to this shop in need of a simple jump start for my car, but was met with a complete lack of customer service and willingness to help. Despite being an automotive shop, the employee refused to assist me, citing flimsy excuses about not being able to leave the store or help when leaving.
