Instead of providing basic assistance, the employee seemed more interested in surfing the web and playing on his phone. Extremely poor service and an unwelcoming attitude towards customers in need. Not recommended if you expect any level of helpful or friendly service.

Delightful Twist on Classic Nachos! The Pulled Pork Nachos at this establishment offer a unique and tasty spin on the traditional dish. Instead of the expected tortilla chips, they are served with potato chips, creating a delightful contrast in textures and flavors. The pulled pork itself is delicious, and the dish is perfectly suited for sharing alongside a refreshing beer or a flavorful Bloody Mary. An excellent choice for those seeking a satisfying and inventive take on a beloved classic.

This charming hotel is ideally situated just a block from the beach and wharf, and two blocks from State Street, offering a prime location in Santa Barbara. The room, a King with a courtyard and spa view, was clean and comfortable, featuring a cozy fireplace, ample space, and thoughtful amenities like a couch, refrigerator, and a nice bathroom. While noise from the spa could be heard at times, it wasn't an issue as it closed at 9 PM. The complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings added a nice touch. Although lacking extravagant extras, the friendly staff, reasonable price, and perfect location made for a pleasant stay. The only minor drawback was the room getting a bit stuffy, easily remedied by opening the windows and using the ceiling fan. Overall, it's a solid choice, and I would consider staying here again.

Mirna's is a gem for affordable and generously portioned Italian fare. Their pasta dishes are an absolute must-try, boasting delectable flavors that will leave you craving more. While the fish options are decent, the pasta plates undoubtedly steal the show. Complementing the fantastic food, the complimentary hummus and pita bread add a delightful touch. As a BYOB establishment, you can bring your favorite bottle of wine to enhance the dining experience further. However, be mindful of the cozy space and call ahead for reservations to avoid potential wait times. Overall, Mirna's offers an exceptional value for money and should be on every pasta lover's radar.

While appreciating independent restaurants, this center city Philadelphia establishment fell short of expectations. The prices were staggeringly high compared to the online menu, despite the roomier seating than typical South Philly eateries. The food portions and quality were merely adequate, and the dessert offered a unique twist. However, the service lacked coordination, with the bussers and waitstaff seeming out of sync. Additionally, the bathroom size failed to accommodate the restaurant's capacity adequately. Overall, the exorbitant prices and service hiccups overshadowed any positives, making it a disappointing experience for the special occasion.

Platoon is an exceptional fitness experience, thanks to the incredible trainer, Steve C. His personalized approach tailors workouts to individual abilities and goals, making them achievable and enjoyable. Steve's exceptional listening skills, motivational guidance, and realistic goal-setting set him apart. The welcoming staff and seamless billing and scheduling processes contribute to an overall excellent environment. If you're seeking a customized fitness journey with a dedicated and supportive team, Platoon with Steve C is an outstanding choice.

A quick lunch stop offering decent but unremarkable fare. The Tater-Tots and burger were satisfactory, though nothing extraordinary. However, the friendly staff provided helpful directions to local attractions, which was a nice touch. A serviceable option for a casual meal.

The issue lies not with the cashier but with the management's baffling policy and inadequate staff training. Instead of creating a positive customer experience, their rigid rules and poor communication led to an unnecessarily frustrating encounter. It's disappointing to see a previously highly-rated establishment prioritize inflexible policies over customer satisfaction.

SuperGyro offers an authentic taste of Chicago with their delicious Chicago-style hot dogs. As the only place within a 28-mile radius serving this regional classic, their version hits all the right notes with 100% beef hot dogs, neon green relish, sport peppers, onions, dill pickles, and tomatoes. While the poppyseed bun and celery salt were missing, the overall experience was a resounding success, especially compared to disappointing attempts elsewhere. At just $10 for four Chicago dogs through the drive-thru, SuperGyro provides excellent value and a reason to return to sample their other menu offerings.

This particular location may not be as warm and welcoming as some others, but the quality of the products remains top-notch. Wawa ensures that your snacking needs are met, whether you're grabbing a quick bite or stocking up for a longer journey. It's a reliable go-to spot that consistently delivers a satisfying experience.

My dad and I stumbled upon this lively bar on the corner of Bourbon Street, near Jackson Square, after being disappointed with our first stop. We decided to try their infamous Hand Grenades without even looking at the menu. While pricey at $9 each (including the souvenir cup), these potent drinks definitely packed a punch! As we sipped on them, we couldn't help but sing along with the live band, soaking in the vibrant atmosphere and nice weather through the open-air setting. Despite the strong drinks, we had a blast at this lively spot, making it a memorable father-son experience in the heart of New Orleans.

This shipping store may not offer a warm and chatty atmosphere, but what it lacks in friendliness, it more than makes up for in exceptional service and expertise. The staff, while quiet, are incredibly knowledgeable, professional, and go above and beyond to assist customers. On my second visit, the employee meticulously helped me package an awkward item, exceeding expectations. Despite its compact space, the store is well-stocked with packing supplies and offers additional services like copying. If you prioritize efficiency and top-notch assistance over small talk, this location is highly recommended for all your shipping needs.

The chicken BBQ burritos at this place are packed with delicious fillings, making them an absolute delight for burrito lovers. The restaurant offers a cozy ambiance, perfect for enjoying a meal with family. While the dining experience was enjoyable, the addition of a dedicated play area for kids would make it an even more family-friendly establishment. Overall, it's a great spot for flavorful burritos and a pleasant dining atmosphere.

Starbucks delivered a satisfying experience with its efficient service and delicious drinks. The chai latte was flavorful and enjoyable, while the coffee lived up to expectations. Although they missed the opportunity to stock up on more Starbucks coffee for home, their existing supply ensures their caffeine fix is met. Overall, it reinforces the sentiment that life wouldn't be the same without the ubiquitous presence of Starbucks in our daily routines.

Valor Ridge Armory is a promising young start-up company in the firearms industry. While patience is required, as with any new business, the owner, Jacob, has proven himself to be a stand-up guy who stands by his word. I had the pleasure of meeting him at a gun show in Las Vegas, where I purchased a high-quality Cerakoted billet lower receiver. The machining and Cerakote work were excellent, and Jacob was always prompt and informative in our email correspondence. Despite the gun community's occasional lack of patience, Valor Ridge Armory is a company worth supporting for their commitment to quality and customer service.

Eggs Up Grill offers an impressive menu with creative and delicious options like the fruit bruschetta and Popeye skillet. The food was amazing, but the ambiance fell short due to the uncomfortably cold temperature and lack of background music or inviting lighting. Service was decent but could be improved. Despite these minor critiques, the exceptional menu and tasty dishes make Eggs Up Grill a solid choice that warrants a return visit.

Exceptional nail service at this mall salon! Despite being near closing time, the staff was accommodating and attentive to my specific requests. They delivered a flawless fill and gel pedicure in a clean and welcoming environment. The foot and hand massages were a delightful bonus, leaving me completely pampered. Highly recommended for a top-notch nail experience, surpassing expectations for a mall salon. I will definitely return for their friendly service and quality work.

This memorial dining experience at [Restaurant Name] was truly exceptional. From the warm greeting by the delightful cashier 'Devil Dev' to the mouthwatering aroma of the perfectly cooked 'Dev's Delight' burger, everything was top-notch. The ingenious combination of beef, mozzarella, tomato, basil, and portobello mushroom on the burger, paired with the delectable truffle fries, was a mushroom lover's dream come true. The quality of food and service was outstanding, justifying the slightly higher price point. Despite the expense, it was undoubtedly worth every penny. I will definitely be returning to savor this culinary delight again.

After a long search for a healthy dining option, I stumbled upon this gem. Despite the long walk, their Be My Bison burger sounded too tempting to pass up. The journey was well worth it! The burger was an absolute dream come true for my health-conscious diet. This place is a true find for those seeking delicious yet nutritious meals. Highly recommended!

This restaurant was a major letdown on both visits. The first time, we were completely ignored by the disinterested staff, despite standing in the rain waiting to be seated. The second visit didn't fare much better. While we were seated promptly, the waiter's indifferent attitude and lack of attentiveness made us feel unwelcome. The menu options were limited, and the food quality was unremarkable. My mother's salmon cakes were poorly executed and seemed like an afterthought. Overall, the experience was overpriced and underwhelming. The only positive takeaway is that the takeout might make decent dog food. I would strongly advise against dining here and cannot recommend this establishment.

The mesquite wings at this establishment are an absolute delight – flavorful and highly recommended for sharing or taking home leftovers. The service was commendable, but the lemonade left much to be desired, being the weakest I've ever encountered. Overall, a solid experience marred only by the subpar lemonade.

Taqueria Guerrero is an absolute gem in the New Orleans neighborhood. Serving up the best Mexican cuisine in the city, this unassuming taqueria has become a go-to spot for authentic flavors and mouthwatering dishes. From the heavenly al pastor tacos to the deliciously spicy camarones del diablo, every item on the menu is a winner. The portions are generous, and the prices are incredibly reasonable. Whether you're craving tacos, burritos, or fajitas, Taqueria Guerrero delivers with its fresh ingredients and bold flavors. It's no wonder this hidden treasure has become a frequent choice for both dine-in and takeout. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a truly exceptional Mexican dining experience in New Orleans.

While the food itself was praised, with highlights being the pork belly tacos and spicy beef pho, the overall experience was marred by poor service and lack of cleanliness. Upon arrival, the reserved table was sticky and had a dirty fork, setting a disappointing tone. The large group order led to confusion, with servers unable to identify individual orders, resulting in people accidentally eating others' food. The wait for the check and processing payment was also excessively long, causing further frustration. In summary, the food quality is commendable, but the service and cleanliness standards need significant improvement to justify a visit.

Initially inconvenient due to their hours, but on the second visit, this locksmith shop exceeded expectations. The staff member was friendly and capable, efficiently duplicating odd-shaped keys that larger stores couldn't handle. Quick, polite service at a reasonable cost. Definitely recommended for specialized key cutting needs.

Unprofessional and subpar service. The quality of work is mediocre, especially for pedicures and manicures. The staff displays poor attitudes and seems unwilling to accept feedback or make corrections. Communication issues arise when they talk in another language, making customers feel excluded and disrespected. Overall, an unpleasant experience that falls short of expectations.

The overall experience was disappointing, and the owner's attempt to bribe me into deleting a previous negative review by offering a "free" service was insincere. With multiple bad reviews from unsatisfied customers, it's evident that customer satisfaction is not a priority at this salon. I would not recommend TJ Nail and Spa to anyone seeking quality hair services.

Overall, the Riviera Mansion offers a picture-perfect setting, exceptional service, and a seamless planning experience – all at a reasonable price point. We couldn't have asked for a better venue for our special day. Five stars, without a doubt!

Dave's late-night food cart is a godsend for Santa Barbara's dining scene. With his friendly service and swift preparation, Dave whips up mouthwatering hot dogs that hit the spot. From the popular Dave's Special to the unique pizza dog and custom creations, each offering is deliciously executed. The grilled jalapeños added a nice touch. This food cart fills a much-needed gap for late-night munchies, and more options like this would be a welcome addition to the city.

Wolfgang's Disappointing Experience: A Chaotic Letdown Saved by the Chardonnay. With crowded spaces, dirty floors, and subpar service, this visit to Wolfgang left much to be desired. The only saving grace was the excellent crisp Chardonnay, providing a rare bright spot amidst an otherwise lackluster dining experience.

This Wawa store on Concord Pike is a winner! Their competitive gas prices caused others in the area to drop by 30 cents per gallon, showing they prioritize affordability for customers. The automatic digital air pump is convenient and accurate, providing the exact tire pressure every time - a nice perk found at few other gas stations. The updated store layout with separate non-smoking cashier lines promises efficiency during busy periods. While the service seems generally good, the true test will be during peak daytime hours. Overall, this Wawa stands out with wallet-friendly fuel costs and modern amenities that elevate the typical gas station experience.

A disappointing experience at this restaurant. The food was mediocre, and the service was painfully slow, with our dishes arriving one by one over an extended period. The servers were rude, and it took an unreasonable amount of time to receive our bills, which were riddled with mistakes. Overall, a very poor dining experience that left much to be desired.

This seafood restaurant situated along the pier offers a picturesque setting with ocean views, but the food quality is inconsistent. While the clam chowder is a standout with excellent flavor and consistency, the cioppino lacks depth of flavor and variety of seafood. The crab salad sandwich is a disappointment, with an overpowering mayo taste and a lack of crab flavor, compounded by greasy onion rings. The service is good, but expect a wait during peak times due to the small indoor space. Overall, it's worth a visit for the ambiance, but be selective with your menu choices as the dishes can be hit or miss.

Our family had an enjoyable afternoon at this establishment. The staff was welcoming and accommodating, ensuring we had a fun experience with the activity. It's a great spot for a family outing or gathering.

Chef Kevin Sbraga's lavender honey fried chicken at Juniper Commons is an absolute must-try. The perfectly crispy, crunchy coating envelops juicy, moist chicken that's been expertly brined and fried. The sweet lavender honey glaze elevates the dish to new heights, making it finger-licking good. Accompanied by a buttery biscuit, whipped honey-thyme butter, and potato salad, it's one of the best fried chicken dishes you'll find. The fried smelts appetizer and filet mignon surf and turf were also standouts. Top it off with indulgent desserts like salted pecan pie or an ice cream sundae, and you've got a meal that showcases Sbraga's culinary prowess. Juniper Commons is a must-visit for anyone craving exceptional fried chicken and impeccable American fare.

The food was a mixed bag. My dish and my friends' meals were merely okay, but my wife's baked ravioli was woefully overdone, rendering it inedible. With so many excellent Italian restaurants in the area, the opportunity cost of returning to Casselli's seems too high, especially given the subpar service and atmosphere. While I usually hesitate to write negative reviews, the disappointing experience at Casselli's warrants a word of caution to potential diners. Lastly, it's worth noting that the restaurant is cash-only.

My advice is to be extremely well-researched on pricing if you have to purchase here, but you're likely better off avoiding this dealer if possible and going somewhere with more transparency and honest negotiating practices. The salesperson was good, but the manager's tactics left a bad impression overall.

The Hard Rock Casino in Tampa is a convenient one-hour getaway from Orlando, offering a classic casino atmosphere. While the dining options can be pricey, like the overpriced burgers and fries at the Hard Rock Cafe, the gaming experience makes up for it. The Breakfast at Tiffany's slot machine was a highlight, providing a fun and thematic experience for fans of the iconic movie. Overall, it's a solid choice for a nearby casino escape, especially if you manage to strike some luck on the slot machines.

Merrigans RV Repair is a trustworthy and affordable mom-and-pop shop in Tucson, specializing in RV repairs. While their customer service could be improved, their expertise and fair pricing make up for any communication lapses. With an extensive collection of parts for older RVs and a wealth of knowledge, they can tackle any repair job with quality workmanship. Merrigans is the go-to place for honest and cost-effective RV repairs in Tucson, leaving you with money to spare for your travels. They also offer a free 24-hour dump station with water, which is a convenient added bonus.

Unfortunately, without being able to access the video content you mentioned, I cannot provide a concise review based on that specific material. As an AI assistant, I do not have the capability to reproduce or summarize copyrighted content such as videos from external websites. However, I'd be happy to provide a general review or commentary if you can share some additional details or context about the subject matter that does not involve reproducing copyrighted material.

This neighborhood lesbian bar offers a delightful brunch experience with delicious food, fantastic cocktails, and a warm, inviting ambiance. The staff's exceptional friendliness and the cozy, stylish design make it a standout spot. It's a welcoming haven that celebrates diversity, and I'm thrilled to have it in the area. I can't wait to return, especially for the upcoming Mother's Day celebration with my mom. Highly recommended for a memorable dining experience.

Disappointing experience. The pizza I received was poorly made, and when I reached out to the manager with photographic evidence, they initially responded but failed to follow through or resolve the issue. Despite promising to address the situation, I never heard back from them. Lack of accountability and customer service has deterred me from returning to this establishment.

Finding a seat can be challenging due to the popularity, but the wait is worth it for the charming outdoor seating with live music or the cozy indoor upstairs area. Once settled, order from the delightful tapas menu and savor every bite alongside your wine. Overall, this gem promises an unforgettable dining experience.

Last Frontier is an excellent music venue with outstanding food and drinks. The pork belly and fish nachos were delicious, and they have an impressive selection of whiskies. The sound system was top-notch, allowing me to fully enjoy my son's band's performance. The staff was friendly and attentive, making for an overall fantastic experience.

This local paint store stands out with its exceptional customer service and wide range of products. The friendly and knowledgeable staff goes above and beyond, offering convenient paint record-keeping for future purchases. While their regular prices may be higher than big-box stores, they frequently run attractive discounts like 30% off interior paints. For a comprehensive painting experience backed by personalized assistance, this store is highly recommended.

An exceptional dining experience! The food was delectable, and the service was top-notch. Enhancing the ambiance, we had the privilege of enjoying our meal al fresco on the deck, accompanied by sightings of playful dolphins. This restaurant is an absolute must-visit, and we eagerly anticipate our next visit.

The store's convenient proximity to major freeways makes it an ideal stop for airport travelers. Overall, while not a value destination, Whole Foods offers an attractive and appealing shopping experience for those willing to pay a premium for quality and ambiance.

This place is an absolute gem! The service is outstanding, and the food is phenomenal. It has become our go-to spot, and every visit has been consistently excellent. The quality is truly stellar, making it a highly recommended dining experience.

While Fresh receives glowing reviews, their Chopped Italian Salad left much to be desired. The salad consisted of mixed greens, salami, smoked turkey, tomato, garbanzo beans, and parmesan cheese with house vinaigrette. However, it lacked the robust Italian flavors one would expect from such a salad. The salami was disappointingly bland, and the overall composition felt uninspired. A few additions like olives, artichoke hearts, and pepperoncinis could have elevated the dish to a more authentic and flavorful Italian experience. For a few dollars more, Fresh could offer a more inventive and satisfying Italian salad. While I'm willing to give them another chance with their panini offerings, their current Chopped Italian Salad falls short of expectations for a summertime lunch salad.

Tyson's Auto Repair is highly recommended for their exceptional service. I had my RV's Ford front end repaired, and they not only accommodated me promptly but also completed the work ahead of schedule. From prompt parts ordering to efficient workmanship, they delivered outstanding service. As a business owner, I appreciate their professionalism and commitment to customer satisfaction. Manny and Tyson are true gems, ensuring a seamless experience. It's the only place I'll trust with my vehicles.

Despite being a hectic lunch hour, our server Lyndel provided exceptional service. She was attentive and accommodating, promptly addressing all our needs. The food was satisfying, and the overall experience was enjoyable, leaving us comfortably full. Lyndel's outstanding service made our visit to this classic diner a delightful one.

This place is an absolute gem! The food is exceptionally delicious, and the service is top-notch, provided by genuinely warm and welcoming people. The atmosphere is cool and inviting, making it a perfect spot to frequent regularly. Their Cuban espresso is a must-try and simply unbeatable. Highly recommended for an outstanding dining experience.

Pete's Pizza is a hidden gem in Hatboro, offering delectable pizzas that are far from ordinary. Owner Pete's warm hospitality and the restaurant's fantastic selection make it a standout local favorite. Highlights include the unique California white pizza, the flavorful Meatlovers without the fennel-laced sausage, and the perfectly sautéed veggies on the Veggie pizza. Unfortunately, a recent fire at the adjacent laundromat has temporarily closed Pete's Pizza, but its devoted patrons eagerly await the reopening to savor their beloved pies, especially the unbeatable $3.99 lunch special. If you're in the Hatboro area, Pete's Pizza is a must-try for the best local pizza around.

The buffalo chicken cheese dip here is an absolute must-try – incredibly delicious and perfectly executed. The service is warm and welcoming, and the prices are quite reasonable, making it an excellent value. Highly recommended for anyone craving some tasty and satisfying appetizers.

Despite an initial hiccup with my online order, the customer service at this pizza place was exceptional. When my order didn't go through initially, the staff not only owned up to the mistake but also rushed to make my pizza and deliver it themselves, along with complimentary brownies, at no charge. The pizza itself was fresh, hot, and delicious. The staff's commitment to making things right and ensuring customer satisfaction was truly impressive. I'll definitely be making this my go-to pizza delivery spot from now on.

On the occasion of my 21st birthday dinner with family, this restaurant offered a delightful experience with exceptional food and drinks. However, the prices were exorbitantly high, making it questionable if the quality justified the cost. A standout dish was the heavenly lobster mac and cheese appetizer, arguably the best I've ever savored. While the complimentary desserts were a thoughtful gesture, we had already indulged in a sumptuous array of sweet treats to conclude our meal. Overall, it was a memorable evening, but the steep prices dampen the enthusiasm for a wholehearted recommendation.

This place offers a delightful ambience that strikes the perfect balance for a romantic date or a casual hangout with friends over drinks and sports. The open kitchen adds an inviting touch, and the great beer selection is a crowd-pleaser. Standout dishes include the irresistible rosemary fries and the highly praised house burger. It's a venue that leaves you eager to return for its winning combination of atmosphere, drinks, and delectable fare.

While the food at this brewhouse shines, with delectable offerings like the Chicken Bruschetta Salad and flavorful French Onion Soup at a reasonable lunch price, the brews unfortunately fall short. The beers were described as bland, with strange aftertastes and lacking in inspiration, failing to deliver the expected hop and citrus notes. If you're visiting primarily for the cuisine, it's a solid choice, but beer enthusiasts may want to look elsewhere for more compelling craft brews.

La Taqueria, the latest addition near Rivers Edge Apartments, is a must-visit for taco enthusiasts and foodies alike. Helmed by a James Beard Award-nominated chef, this boutique-style taqueria boasts a flavorful and diverse menu that caters to both vegetarians and meat lovers. The standout dishes include the mouthwatering mushroom taco and the succulent short rib taco, both crafted with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. With indoor and outdoor seating options, a bar, and double doors connecting the two spaces, La Taqueria offers a delightful dining experience. Whether it's for lunch or dinner, this taqueria is sure to impress with its exceptional tacos and appetizers. Highly recommended for those seeking a culinary adventure in a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere.

Capogiro Gelato Artisans is a delightful hidden gem located just steps away from the ever-popular Franklin Fountain. While the line at Franklin Fountain stretched around the block, Capogiro offered a delicious and more affordable alternative for dessert cravings. The gelato flavors were absolutely amazing, with the chocolat scurio and pera combination being a standout and highly recommended pairing. Although we only indulged in the gelato, the tantalizing aroma of their pizza left us eager to return and sample their savory offerings. Capogiro proves to be a fantastic option for those seeking high-quality gelato or a tempting pizzeria without the extensive wait.

A.I. DuPont Hospital is an exceptional healthcare facility for families, especially those traveling from the East Coast. The hospital excels in providing seamless coordination for patients to see multiple specialists in a single day, ensuring efficient and comprehensive care. The recently renovated wing offers top-notch accommodations for caregivers, complemented by a friendly and attentive staff. The quality of care is outstanding, making A.I. DuPont a highly recommended choice, even for those willing to travel long distances for their child's medical needs.

Vetri in Philadelphia offers an exceptional Chef's Tasting experience. The nine-course tasting menu is exquisite, with each dish delivering delicious flavors. The wine pairings are equally impressive, complementing the courses beautifully. If you're in the area, Vetri is a must-visit for an unforgettable culinary journey. Highly recommended!

A true classic American diner that has stood the test of time. The homemade food, particularly the standout fried chicken, is fresh and delicious. The attentive service and bottomless coffee for a reasonable price enhance the experience. Don't forget to save room for their tasty pie! An authentic diner experience that's hard to beat.

Terrible experience. They hassled me over using a Groupon, failed to change the oil filter despite claiming to do so, and provided poor customer service with rude attitudes. Dishonest practices and neglect left me driving 5,000 miles on an old filter. Avoid this place - there are far better options for car service.

Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza delivered an exceptional dining experience at their recent #welldoneTBO tweet-up event. The customer service was outstanding, and the menu offered an impressive array of delectable options. Standout dishes included the Philly Cheesesteak Pizza, the buttery and garlicky Cauliflower Pizza (a vegetarian delight), and the indulgent caramelized onion-smothered wings. Other notable items like the meatballs, ribs, salad, and a custom half-and-half pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms further showcased the restaurant's culinary versatility. While the lack of liquor options prevented a perfect five-star rating, Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza undoubtedly delivered a memorable and highly satisfying dining experience.

An enchanting dining experience! The service and food were exceptional, but what truly set it apart was the dry ice fog effect, adding a captivating touch of coolness to the atmosphere. Highly recommended for those seeking both culinary delights and an unforgettable ambiance.

If you're craving authentic, homestyle New Orleans cuisine, this is the place to go. Despite being busy during our afternoon visit, we were promptly seated. We opted for the à la carte menu over the buffet, and it turned out to be the standout meal of our entire trip. The food was deliciously prepared, capturing the essence of New Orleans flavors. Highly recommended for a memorable dining experience.

This local gem is a must-visit for out-of-towners seeking an authentic breakfast/brunch experience. While the weekend crowds necessitate patience (expect waits over an hour after 9:30 AM), the extensive menu and delectable offerings make it worthwhile. The efficient bakery, coffee, and gelato counters provide on-the-go options or tasty distractions during the wait. Once seated, the attentive service complements the scrumptious fare, ensuring a memorable culinary adventure.

The food at this establishment is excellent, but the service leaves much to be desired. The waitress made me feel rushed and unimportant, and shockingly withheld a portion of my change, leaving me to wonder if this is a common practice. Although the food quality may warrant a return visit, the poor service and dishonest handling of change have significantly diminished my opinion. I had to reduce the tip from my usual 25% to 15% as a consequence. Overall, the outstanding food is overshadowed by the disappointing service experience.

Sushi Spot Review: The sushi here is pretty good, with the Mesa rolls being a standout favorite. However, the pickup experience can be frustrating as they tend to lag and only start preparing the order after you arrive, despite the quoted pickup time. If they could improve their timing estimates, it would easily be a 4-star establishment. As it stands, the delicious sushi is let down by the unreliable pickup process.

Pat's King of Steaks offers an exceptional burger experience that truly lives up to its reputation as the best in Philadelphia. With fresh, pillowy buns, juicy and flavorful meat patties, and warm, friendly service, this establishment delivers on all fronts. The prices are reasonable and accessible, making it an affordable indulgence for burger enthusiasts of all backgrounds. If you're craving an outstanding burger in the city, Pat's King of Steaks is an absolute must-visit destination.

This place is a great spot for enjoying wine and cheese outdoors with live music, but the food leaves much to be desired. The bacon-wrapped dates and brussels sprouts were forgettable, and the sardines were sent back due to an unpleasant smell and taste, likely from being past their prime. If you're looking for a cozy hangout with drinks and ambiance, it's worth a visit, but don't expect a memorable culinary experience.

The Po-Boys at this establishment boast excellent flavor, but the portion size of the catfish filling could be more generous as it was on the skimpy side. However, the service was very good, contributing to an overall positive dining experience.

The hummus was essentially an oil slick with a hint of chickpea lurking beneath. The pita bread arrived charred beyond recognition, rendering it inedible. The excessive oil left me feeling queasy for the rest of the evening. While the manager offered an insincere "upgrade" on the hummus, his aloof demeanor and bellowing across the restaurant made it clear any constructive feedback would fall on deaf ears. With a dubious claim about having the "cleanest bathroom in town," this establishment failed to deliver an enjoyable Mediterranean dining experience on any level. Steer clear and seek more authentic fare elsewhere.

Incredible bagels, but service needs improvement. While the bagels are undeniably delicious, making this place worth a visit, the staff comes across as unfriendly. Additionally, the limited operating hours are a downside for those craving bagels later in the day. Overall, go for the top-notch bagels but don't expect a warm welcome or late-night availability.

This hotel offered a fantastic stay with its great location, friendly staff, and immaculately clean, spacious rooms featuring kitchenettes and large windows. The opting-out housekeeping incentive was a nice touch. While the pool was small, the hot tub provided a relaxing escape. The bar had a decent drink selection but fell short on certain menu items. The food was decent, with the burger being okay and dessert being mediocre. However, the omelet station was a nice addition to the otherwise satisfactory breakfast spread, marred only by the inconsistent coffee quality. Overall, it was a great hotel experience, making it a recommended choice for those visiting the area.

The falafel wrap at this Manayunk eatery was decent but overpriced. The dingy, cave-like seating area lacked warmth and ambiance. With numerous superior dining options in the neighborhood, this establishment falls short of expectations. Skip it and explore the better choices Manayunk has to offer.

Highly recommended! When I faced a flat tire and car trouble during a cross-country road trip, Brian at this auto repair shop promptly assisted me. They quickly diagnosed and fixed the issue, patching up the tire and ensuring my car was roadworthy again. Brian provided excellent service, completing the repair efficiently within 30 minutes. His friendly and accommodating approach made a stressful situation much easier to handle. If you need reliable and swift auto repairs, this is the place to go.

Conveniently located in the French Quarter, this restaurant disappoints with its lackluster cuisine. While the jambalaya and file gumbo were flavorful standouts, the majority of dishes including red beans/rice, meatloaf, mac and cheese, shrimp po' boy, and chicken wings were bland and unsatisfying. Despite the amiable staff, the overall experience was marred by the mediocre food quality, making it a miss for authentic New Orleans fare. With so many excellent dining options in the area, this eatery falls short and is not recommended.

If you're craving incredibly fresh seafood without fancy frills, the Brophy Bros. restaurant in Santa Barbara's harbor is a must-visit. With fish literally going from the tank to your plate, you can't get any fresher. The focus is on a wide variety of shellfish cooked to your liking, not ambiance, though the outdoor seating offers lovely ocean views. Be prepared for long waits during peak hours, but it's well worth it for seafood enthusiasts. Arrive hungry and take a stroll along the pier to work up an appetite for this exceptional culinary experience.

This establishment offers a delightful dining experience with creative and flavorful dishes, complemented by decent house wines. While their cocktails are well-crafted, they might be on the smaller side. The service has always been satisfactory, though it remains to be seen during peak hours. The true gem is the patio, which provides an inviting ambiance for socializing with friends. Overall, it's a recommended spot for those seeking a enjoyable meal and atmosphere.

Skyway Cafe (formerly Skyway Jacks) is a delightful local diner with a cozy, bovine-themed decor. Their portions are generous, prices are affordable, and the food is downright delicious. The service is attentive, and the coffee keeps flowing. Don't miss their incredible breakfast deal from 7 to 8:30 am, offering combos like eggs, pancakes, and sausage for just $2.89 with a beverage purchase. However, the standout dish is undoubtedly the banana pecan pancakes – a must-try that will leave you craving for more. Skyway Cafe is a true gem for those seeking a homey, satisfying dining experience.

One star review. Unacceptable service and disorganization. After waiting over an hour in line, they arbitrarily closed the line while there were still dozens of customers waiting. Completely disrespectful treatment of customers' time. Avoid this place unless you want to risk wasting hours and being turned away without receiving service.

The customer service was abysmal. No one was available or willing to provide any assistance despite multiple attempts. Incredibly frustrating and disappointing lack of support. I would not recommend this company to anyone based on the shockingly poor customer service experience.

Fair Grinds Coffeehouse is a charming and hip spot in New Orleans, perfect for a caffeine fix or a casual hangout. The outdoor seating area provides a pleasant atmosphere to enjoy their delicious cold brew coffee, which can be customized with various flavors and milks, including the rare treat of whole milk. Their gluten-free zucchini bread is a standout pastry, but the lack of other gluten-free options is a disappointment. Despite this minor drawback, the smooth and flavorful coffee, combined with the inviting ambiance, make Fair Grinds a delightful coffee shop worth visiting. If you're in the neighborhood, it's a cozy and enjoyable spot to frequent.

A delightful bakery with an impressive array of sweet treats! The gooey butter cookies were a standout, perfectly indulgent and delicious. The German chocolate cupcake was equally fantastic, boasting rich flavors and moist texture. Overall, an excellent spot for satisfying your sweet cravings with high-quality baked goods.

Frozen Yogurt Fusion offers a decent frozen yogurt experience with a wide variety of flavor choices and an extensive toppings bar, allowing for numerous customization options. However, the self-serve model can quickly lead to a hefty bill, and the limited seating inside can be a drawback. While the staff is friendly, their level of attentiveness could be improved. The bubble tea failed to impress, but the frozen yogurt offerings are worth a try for those seeking a customizable sweet treat.

This restaurant is an absolute must-visit for anyone craving authentic Taiwanese cuisine. The food is so delicious that we drove an impressive 90 miles round trip from Tahoe just to dine here, and it was absolutely worth the journey! The standout dish was the phenomenal Chicken Basil, which left us craving for more. Additionally, they offer delightful Boba Tea, making it a perfect spot for a complete Taiwanese dining experience. Despite any negative reviews, we found the food to be genuinely authentic and highly recommend trying it for yourself. A true hidden gem that deserves your attention!

Overall, Cru is a delightful and cozy wine bar that offers a fantastic wine selection and delicious small plates in a charming atmosphere, making it a must-visit destination for wine enthusiasts and foodies alike.

A longtime favorite, this steakhouse consistently delivers some of the best steaks in the city, easily ranking in the top 3. Despite a recent name change, the quality and excellence remain unchanged. While their steaks are the standout, the chicken cheesesteak offers a delicious alternative for those seeking something different. A must-visit for steak lovers and a reliable choice for an exceptional dining experience.

Pina's in Roxborough is an underrated gem that deserves more recognition. Their standout offerings are the massive and delicious stromboli, as well as the exceptional Sicilian pie, which is arguably the best in the area. While the sandwiches and regular pizza are just average, the restaurant truly shines with its specialties. During sit-down dinners, the chicken parm dish is a highlight, featuring a generous portion of chicken smothered in cheese and sauce. Pina's promises a satisfying and filling experience, making it a fantastic spot for those seeking quality Italian fare without the fuss.

While a bit on the pricier side, this cafe and grocery offer delicious vegan fare. The vegan sandwich and tofu melt are standouts on the cafe menu, complemented by an impressive array of vegan baked goods and sweets. The grocery section boasts a fantastic selection, making it a go-to spot for plant-based dining and shopping.

An absolute must-visit for burger enthusiasts in New Orleans! This place truly lives up to its reputation as the best burger joint in town. With impeccable service, fresh and delicious food, and a unique menu featuring creative options like gator and deer burgers, it's no wonder we left fully satisfied. The buffalo wings were a standout, and their drinks were equally impressive. Despite flying in from Atlanta, we made this our first stop, and it will definitely be a repeat visit before heading back. An exceptional experience all around!

This old-school Italian restaurant with its charming three-floor setting offers an amazing dining experience. The menu boasts delectable dishes like tender veal, flavorful clams casino, succulent mussels, perfectly al dente pasta with olive oil and garlic, and mouthwatering homemade garlic bread. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant ambiance. A recent visit revealed a new must-try dish – the heavenly gnocchi with a rich and creamy gorgonzola sauce that has become a personal favorite. With consistently outstanding food and service, this restaurant is an absolute culinary gem that should not be missed.

Home Wine Kitchen's "No Menu Monday" offers a delightful culinary adventure for adventurous diners. The $30 three-course meal, paired with $12 half-glass wine flights, showcases the chef's creativity and skill. Standout dishes included flavorful lamb meatballs and a perfectly cooked swordfish steak with homegrown veggies. While the corvina fish may have been too adventurous for some palates, the desserts were a hit. The relaxed yet professional service and a charming ambiance added to the enjoyable experience. Although the courses seemed identical across tables, contrary to expectations, the overall concept of surrendering to the chef's whims proved exciting. A must-try for food enthusiasts seeking a unique dining adventure in St. Louis.

The reunion dinner at this swanky restaurant was a memorable experience. While the prices were steep, the delicious lobster bake and perfectly crafted Neopolitan Old Fashioned made it worthwhile for me. However, some friends were caught off-guard by the $170 bill for dishes like fritters, carpaccio, crab cake, fries, tequila shots, lemonade, and old fashions. The ambiance was delightful, but the food quality was just adequate. What truly stood out was the exceptional service – our waiter, whose name escapes me, went above and beyond, attentively catering to our needs and even providing a complimentary dessert for a friend's birthday. Overall, it was a satisfying evening, elevated by the stellar service and lively company.

Susanna Foo holds a special place in my heart, and I hope to see it recapture the magic that enchanted me as a child, perhaps through a reimagined menu that celebrates its heritage while pushing culinary boundaries. With its rich history and commitment to excellence, this beloved establishment has the potential to become a beloved destination once again.

Overall, Spiro's Greek Restaurant is a hidden gem that offers authentic Greek fare and warm hospitality. If you find yourself in the area, I highly recommend giving it a try. You won't be disappointed.

Concise Review:

This establishment fails to deliver authentic barbecue, regardless of regional style. The brisket resembles a braised pot roast, with no smoky flavor and a mushy, overcooked texture. The sandwiches are overwhelmed by excessive fat content, containing large inedible chunks. The overall quality suggests either a lack of care from the owner or incompetent staff. It's advisable to seek out genuine barbecue at other establishments.

Having brought their boys here since they were infants (now 15 years old), this spot has created cherished memories for the family. It's a reliable destination that never disappoints, offering a wonderful sunset experience and a chance to be part of a joyful community tradition.

A true classic! With over six decades of serving up delicious ice cream treats, this place clearly knows what it's doing. From their creamy soft serve to the indulgent sundaes, everything is top-notch and reasonably priced. An enjoyable experience all around – a must-visit for ice cream lovers!

This authentic Mexican restaurant offers a delicious pazole (a pork and hominy soup with toppings like lettuce, radishes, and onions). While the lettuce can get wilted, the addition of hot sauce enhances the flavors, making it a satisfying meal. The taco lunch special with pork tacos and rice was also good. The service was amazing, with a sweet lady attending to the customers. However, the salsa was too sweet for the reviewer's taste. Nonetheless, everything was fresh, and the pineapple water, despite the reviewer's dislike for pineapples, was a must-try based on recommendations. The restaurant's proximity to Costco makes it a convenient spot for cravings, though the reviewer warns that finding good food can be dangerous in that regard. Overall, it's a gem worth visiting for authentic Mexican cuisine.

The ambiance at this rustic eatery is delightful, with charming white brick walls, stylish furniture, and perfect lighting – ideal for a blind date. The service is commendable, being both attentive and timely. However, the pricing feels excessive for the portion sizes, as evidenced by the meager 3-5 ravioli pieces served for $11-13. Moreover, the inflexibility of the kitchen to accommodate simple substitutions, such as swapping a salad for fries, is disappointing and off-putting. While the atmosphere and service are noteworthy, the inability to cater to reasonable dietary preferences and the perceived lack of value for money prevent this establishment from earning a higher rating.

An Interesting Destination in a Culinary Wasteland"

While the vibrant decor and lively atmosphere provide a memorable experience, the service at this establishment leaves much to be desired. The inattentive and rushed service can dampen the overall dining experience. Additionally, the lack of knowledge and accommodation for gluten-free diners is concerning, particularly with the subpar gluten-free buns and the non-gluten-free house catsup. Parking can also be a challenge, adding to the potential frustrations. However, in a town with limited dining options, this quirky spot remains an intriguing destination, primarily due to its unique vibe and ambiance, making it worth a visit for those seeking a change of pace, despite its shortcomings

This place offers a delightful combination of tasty drinks and delectable food at very reasonable prices. The pulled pork and fried chicken po boy sandwiches were standouts, complemented by the amazing mac and cheese. Their impressive draft beer selection is an added bonus. Late-night cravings are satisfied as they serve food until 1 AM. Highly recommended for a satisfying dining experience.

An Absolute Disappointment! This place is a complete letdown. The service is abysmal, with long waits even when the restaurant is nearly empty. The ambiance is dreadful, with a dirty and poorly maintained dining area. The food, while overpriced, is nothing but mediocre at best. Steer clear of this establishment and opt for nearby alternatives like First Watch or Pinky's, which offer superior quality and value despite the misconception about higher prices. This place is a run-down dump that should be avoided at all costs.

We left with full bellies, satisfied with the affordable and filling eats. El Arado may have garnered a bad reputation, but our experience proved that the staff is decent, the food is passable, and the drink prices are a steal. It's a solid option for a pre-night out meal in Fountain Square, even if you plan to follow it up with a mind-numbing strip club experience.

The Loew's hotel is an exceptional choice for travelers seeking a luxurious and memorable stay. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted by impeccable cleanliness and a futuristic, modern aesthetic that leaves a lasting impression. The service is truly remarkable, with staff going above and beyond to ensure a comfortable and enjoyable experience. The spacious rooms and convenient parking add to the overall convenience. But what truly sets this hotel apart is the fantastic breakfast, which left us craving more. With its unparalleled amenities and attention to detail, the Loew's hotel undoubtedly deserves a perfect 5-star rating.

Honeygrow is a fantastic spot for healthy and delicious meals. The Sour Cherry BBQ stir fry with customizable protein and veggie options is a must-try, offering a flavorful yet low-calorie dish that is incredibly satisfying. Despite long lines, the ordering process via kiosks is efficient, and the food is served promptly. The staff is friendly and accommodating, ensuring a smooth overall experience. Honeygrow is a newfound gem that deserves frequent visits for its tasty and nutritious fare.

This cozy neighborhood spot offers an exceptional cheeseburger experience. The thick, perfectly cooked patty, topped with a delightful sauce and nestled in a soft bun, is a true standout. Complemented by the delightful zucchini bread, attentive service, and an impressive gin and tonic selection, the ambiance is inviting and relaxed. While the prices may be on the higher side, the quality justifies the cost. The only potential drawback might be a perceived disappointment from the waitstaff if opting for simpler fare like burgers, though this observation remains unconfirmed. Overall, it's a highly recommended gem, especially for those seeking a top-notch burger in a charming setting conveniently located near home.

The casino offers a wide range of dining options and beverages, although smokers may find the environment less than ideal for non-smokers with allergies. The hotel rooms are pricey, but parking is free. There's plenty of entertainment, including gambling, but be cautious as the ATM's presence can tempt those with impulse control issues. Overall, it's still possible to have fun even as a non-gambler, just observing the lively atmosphere.

Despite its impressive 4.5-star rating, this establishment failed to live up to expectations. The burgers were merely average, and the overall ambiance felt reminiscent of a generic chain restaurant like Red Robin. While it's possible that the experience might be better on busier weekends, the underwhelming food and atmosphere left a disappointing impression. I wouldn't recommend this place or plan to return."

Urban Chestnut Brewing Company is an absolute must-visit for any beer enthusiast. This brewery offers an incredible experience, from the informative and engaging "Beer School" sessions to the comprehensive brewery tours showcasing the behind-the-scenes operations and the iconic Clydesdales. The knowledgeable staff and top-notch brews make every visit a true delight. Highly recommended for both first-timers and seasoned beer lovers alike. Don't miss the opportunity to delve deeper into the art of brewing with their "Brew Master" experience on your next visit!

Terrible Service and Lack of Professionalism! Despite having a reservation, the hostesses at this restaurant were disorganized and unapologetic. They failed to acknowledge us for an extended period, while admitting to seating delays due to a backed-up kitchen. When they finally addressed us, they blamed a new employee for mishandling our reservation without any effort to make amends or offer alternatives. The staff exhibited a dismissive attitude and a complete lack of customer service. Instead of attempting to rectify the situation, they simply brushed us off. Such unprofessional behavior is unacceptable, and I will not be returning to this establishment.

The food at this establishment was excellent, with delicious dishes and impressive flavors. However, the experience was marred by a disappointing business practice. Despite their Yelp offer of a 10% discount for checking in and reviewing, which had a 4-hour redemption window according to the countdown, the staff refused to honor the deal during our visit. Instead, they insisted we could only redeem it on our next visit, which goes against the advertised terms. While the culinary offerings were top-notch, the failure to uphold their promotional deal left a sour taste. Great food, but a frustrating and misleading business practice.

While I've only visited this post office a few times for basic services like sending packages, my most recent experience was truly exceptional. My husband and I went to submit our passport applications, and the representative who assisted us was outstanding. She was efficient, friendly, and knowledgeable, ensuring our process was completed swiftly. She even provided me with follow-up forms and guidance for name change procedures. Her excellent customer service made our visit hassle-free, and I hope all future interactions at this location are just as pleasant. She sets the standard that all staff members should strive for.

Vitamin World is an excellent destination for kickstarting a healthy lifestyle. With an extensive range of vitamins, supplements, beauty products, and homeopathic items, it caters to diverse wellness needs. The knowledgeable staff provided outstanding assistance in finding ingredients for a DIY moisturizer, offering helpful recommendations. Additionally, the rewards program for frequent shoppers and the acceptance of digital coupons make it a wallet-friendly choice. Overall, Vitamin World is a one-stop-shop for anyone seeking a holistic approach to health and wellness.

This shoppe is a delightful find! The friendly staff and inviting atmosphere make it a regular go-to spot. Their menu offers a fantastic selection of healthy and indulgent treats, ranging from delicious croissants to tasty lunch and breakfast options. Everything I've tried here has been absolutely fantabulous, leaving me craving for more. If you're in the area, this shoppe is a must-visit for a genuinely enjoyable dining experience.

A delightful Saturday morning treat! The Great Cranberry Orange Muffin was bursting with flavors, perfectly complemented by a rich Caffe Latte. The cozy ambience and prompt service added to the overall enjoyable experience. Highly recommended for a relaxing weekend indulgence.

This sushi restaurant is an absolute gem! The menu offers a fantastic variety of delectable options, ensuring that every visit is a culinary delight. What truly sets this place apart, however, is the exceptional service provided by the warmest and kindest staff you'll ever encounter. Their hospitality and attentiveness make the dining experience more than just a meal – it's a truly memorable occasion. Undoubtedly, this will remain my go-to sushi destination for its unparalleled combination of outstanding food and unmatched customer service.

This cozy coffee shop is a true gem in the city. With its cool, edgy vibe and ample seating options, both indoors and outdoors, it offers a delightful ambiance. But what truly sets it apart is the exceptional food. Every dish I've tried has been remarkably fresh, delicious, and thoroughly enjoyable. Whether you're seeking a satisfying meal or just a great coffee spot, this place is an absolute must-visit. Highly recommended for its outstanding culinary offerings and inviting atmosphere.

Unquestionably the best burrito spot in town, this family-owned gem offers delectable burritos with top-notch ingredients like chicken and chorizo combo or smoked brisket. The salsas are fantastic, the atmosphere is relaxed, and the service is excellent, all at a reasonable price. While the medium burrito is generously sized, pace yourself unless you're training for a competitive eating event. With their commitment to flavor and healthy options, this place deserves the highest recommendation for those seeking an exceptional burrito experience.

This stellar restaurant offers a delightful lunch menu, specifically their sandwiches available from 11am to 2pm. The grinder and southwesterner sandwiches are absolute culinary delights, satisfying every taste bud with their exquisite flavors. Although a tad pricey and slightly smaller in portion, the exceptional quality makes it well worth the indulgence. While the review focuses on the lunch offerings, the anticipation for trying their steaks, though expensive, is palpable. With impeccable food and service, this establishment deserves top ratings, making it a must-visit for discerning diners.

The restaurant offers a delightful and tasty selection of dishes with a preppy vibe. The What's Up Doc omelet is a must-try, but the portion sizes can be inconsistent. For those with a sweet tooth, the French toasts are highly recommended. The Fancy Breakfast Sandwich is a great choice, and substituting the prosciutto with bacon works well. The mimosas are also a highlight. While there's room for improvement in consistency, the overall experience is enjoyable.

If you're a fan of the 50's and midcentury modern design, this store is a must-visit. With its meticulously curated collection of vintage furniture and decor, it transports you back in time. While the prices might be on the higher side compared to other stores in the area, the uniqueness and quality of the offerings make it worth the splurge. Prepare to be enchanted by this one-of-a-kind treasure trove of retro charm."

Disappointing Experience at Hampton Inn (1/5 Stars) - As a loyal gold member who frequently stays at Hampton Inns, I expected a better experience. Despite giving them a second chance, this hotel failed to deliver. The room was dirty, and the hotel seemed to be under constant construction. Even worse, they turned me away for the first night of my four-night stay, citing overbooking, despite having a confirmed reservation. Such poor service and lack of consideration for a loyal customer are unacceptable. I will not be returning to this poorly managed Hampton Inn.

Hands down, this place serves the best fried rice I've ever tasted! Their Pho (Vietnamese noodle soup) was also incredibly delicious, although coming from Seattle, I'm admittedly a bit spoiled in that department. If you're a newcomer to Vietnamese cuisine or simply craving an outstanding Vietnamese meal, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit! Highly recommended!

Fantastic find! This place truly delivers with its mouthwatering sliders, delectable donuts, and unique beverage selections. The lively atmosphere and exceptionally friendly staff make it an absolute gem. Conveniently located within walking distance, it's a spot we'll be returning to time and again. Highly recommended!

Casa Video is truly a gem - a video rental store that boasts an unparalleled selection and friendly, knowledgeable staff. Whether you're after the latest blockbuster or an obscure vintage VHS, they are sure to have it in stock at an extremely reasonable price. From mainstream hits to niche cult classics, their vast and diverse collection is unmatched. The employees are passionate movie buffs who go above and beyond to provide excellent recommendations and service. It's just a shame this local treasure is not located in Chicago for more film lovers to experience and appreciate. If you're anywhere near Casa Video, it's an absolute must-visit for any cinephile.

This sushi spot offers a great option for a satisfying lunch without the commitment or expense of an all-you-can-eat (AYCE) deal. The a la carte menu allowed me to order just the right amount – a long roll, a hand roll, and the standout chocolate mochi for dessert. The total cost with tip was just under $20, making it a reasonably priced meal. The rolls were fresh and delicious, but the real surprise was the creamy, tasty chocolate mochi – an absolute must-try. For those looking to avoid overstuffing themselves, this place hits the sweet spot with quality sushi and portion control.

Despite the negative reviews, I had a seamless experience at this establishment. The store was well-organized, clean, and properly stocked, allowing me to locate what I needed swiftly. The employees were courteous, and I was in and out within 5 minutes, which is impressive considering my simple needs. However, the surrounding area seems to pose challenges, with numerous nearby businesses shutting down. While the store met my expectations, its long-term viability in this location is uncertain.

The Best Pizza Experience! This place nails it with their mouthwatering pizzas, friendly staff, and perfectly chilled beer from well-maintained taps. Don't miss out on their fantastic $5 deal for a fresh slice and a cold brew. An absolute must-visit for pizza and beer enthusiasts!

Federal Donuts lives up to its hype. As a vegetarian, the donuts are incredibly delicious, especially when paired with their excellent iced coffee. For non-vegetarians, the buttermilk ranch chicken is a standout item. The donuts are truly amazing, and the friendly staff provides great service even during busy periods. Federal Donuts is a must-visit spot, whether you're craving donuts or their famous fried chicken.
Rating: 2/5 stars

Sapore offers an authentic Italian dining experience tucked away in a strip mall. The cool, dimly-lit interior provides a refreshing escape from the summer heat. Despite mixed reviews online, our visit was pleasant, starting with excellent cocktails like the unique anchovy-garnished vodka martini. While the Caprese salad was solid but unremarkable, the main courses like the Chicken Marsala were well-executed and generously portioned. The real standout, however, was the delectable tiramisu dessert. With its tempting cocktail menu, appetizer options, and impressive dessert selection, Sapore warrants a return visit to further explore its offerings. It's a hidden gem for those seeking a touch of Italy in an unassuming location.

Burger Up Cool Springs may lack the trendy vibe of other locations, but it more than makes up for it with its mouthwatering burgers. The fresh meat and toppings make for awesomely tasty and messy creations. While the regular fries are delicious, the truffle fries steal the show – perfectly crisp, not greasy, and finished with parmesan cheese. Top it off with a classic chocolate milkshake that's creamy and not overly sweet. If you crave an upscale burger experience without sacrificing the beloved burger-fries-shake combo, Burger Up Cool Springs is a must-visit.

This auto repair shop failed to live up to expectations. Despite making an appointment to address a simple "check engine" light issue, my car was not even looked at on the scheduled day. When I returned the following day as instructed, I had to wait an entire hour to retrieve my vehicle because it was inaccessibly parked. Ultimately, there was no issue with the car, rendering the two-day delay completely unnecessary. While the staff acknowledged the inconvenience, their offer to make amends felt futile given the overall poor experience. I cannot recommend this establishment due to their lack of efficiency and disregard for customer time.

RH&B, once a celebrated destination for BBQ and blues in south Jersey, has lost its luster after a recent ownership change. While the food was merely decent, the real draw was the live music that complemented the dining experience. Regrettably, the new management has decided to eliminate all live music offerings, stripping the restaurant of its unique charm. Without the allure of live performances, RH&B struggles to justify a recommendation. The only saving grace is the friendly and personable staff, but that alone may not be enough to keep patrons coming back. A disappointing turn of events for what was once a beloved local institution.

Disappointing Visit at Once-Reliable Sandwich Spot: What used to be a go-to place for delicious sandwiches has recently taken a turn for the worse. The cheesesteak lacked adequate meat portion, and the stale, subpar roll was a letdown, especially considering the abundance of excellent bread options in the Philadelphia area. While hoping it was just an off day, I'll be hesitant to return anytime soon unless improvements are made. A disappointing experience at a previously trusted establishment.

As a loyal SPG Gold member, I expected better service and accommodations at this property. Despite paying a premium rate, I was given a room with poor soundproofing, allowing me to clearly hear conversations and television from the adjoining room. When I raised this issue with the front desk, they offered to move me to an unoccupied room but expected me to wait in a long line and handle the room change myself, without any assistance. The lack of attentive service and willingness to address my concerns adequately was disappointing. Additionally, the rooms themselves were nothing special, offering no amenities or features to justify the high room rate. Overall, this hotel failed to meet expectations in terms of service, accommodations, and value for money. I would not recommend this property until they improve their customer service and provide a better overall experience.

The restaurant offers a satisfactory dining experience. While the food is fresh and flavorful, it doesn't stand out as exceptional. However, the prices are reasonable, and the staff's friendly and attentive service is commendable. Overall, a solid choice for a pleasant meal without breaking the bank.

The hotel offers a decent stay, catering more to business travelers than tourists. The rooms are equipped with the essentials, and the beds are quite comfortable. The on-site cafe provides a reasonably priced meal deal, although the inclusions could be clearer. On the downside, the hallways appear somewhat unkempt, and there was an instance of subpar room cleaning, with a leftover food bag found in the mini-fridge. Overall, it's a serviceable option for those seeking a practical accommodation without frills.
Rating: 2.5/5
Overall, this hotel exceeds expectations with its thoughtful amenities, attention to detail, and warm hospitality. Highly recommended for a comfortable, welcoming stay!

Buying a car can be an intimidating process, but Toyota of Santa Barbara made it as smooth as possible. Sam Ladd, the salesman, was courteous and accommodating, allowing me to test drive multiple vehicles until I found the one that met my family's needs. While the negotiation process was businesslike, Frank Flores, the sales manager, was upfront and addressed my concerns. Preparation and research were key to getting what I believe was a fair deal on a pre-owned vehicle. Overall, a positive experience, but only time will tell if the car lives up to expectations.

This bar is a fantastic spot with a lively atmosphere and welcoming staff, including friendly bartenders and the owner. The diverse crowd adds to the inviting vibe, making everyone feel right at home. A major highlight is the excellent BBQ truck parked outside, offering delicious food to complement the drinks. Highly recommended for a great night out!

Despite the friendly and accommodating staff, this Italian restaurant fails to impress with its mediocre and uninspired cuisine. The lukewarm dishes, from the forgettable appetizers like fried gnocchi and calamari to the unadventurous main courses with bland sauces, left much to be desired. Even the different chicken dishes disappointingly arrived with the same unexciting sauce. While the BYOB policy and the ability to accommodate large groups are pluses, the lackluster food makes it difficult to recommend a return visit.

A Delightful Chinese Gem: This unassuming Chinese restaurant is a true hidden treasure, offering an exceptional dining experience with its friendly service and mouthwatering cuisine. The standout dish is undoubtedly the "Double Treasure," a must-try for anyone seeking an authentic and flavorful taste of Chinese gastronomy. Whether you're a local or a visitor, this cozy eatery is a surefire bet for a satisfying and memorable meal.

Reno Vulcanizing is a top-notch automotive service provider. Their team, including Ken, Bruce, and others, consistently delivers exceptional service with honesty, courtesy, and a helpful attitude. After several years as their customer, I can confidently recommend them as the go-to choice for all your vehicle's needs.

Swamp Tour: 4/5 stars. Despite not seeing alligators due to weather conditions, the tour guide Henry provided thorough explanations about the area. Sightings of boars, raccoons, and birds added interest. Comfortable buses, but alligator sightings are essential for a 5-star rating. Avoid booking during cold or stormy weather.

Dominoes Pizza delivered a subpar experience that left me utterly dissatisfied. The thin crust lacked crunchiness, the olives were of poor quality, and the salad was a mere $6 rip-off consisting of limp lettuce strands and minimal cheese that appeared powdery. The pizza itself arrived in a pre-packed divider, adding to the disappointing experience. The only somewhat redeeming aspect was their breadsticks, which were unhealthy but palatable. Overall, Dominoes Pizza is not worth the money, as their offerings are laden with preservatives and lack the quality one would expect. I strongly advise against ordering from this establishment and instead recommend supporting local pizzerias or opting for organic options from reputable grocers, which often provide superior taste at a more reasonable price point. Dominoes Pizza is a stark reminder that corporate chains need to prioritize quality over cost-cutting measures. I wholeheartedly regret this purchase and will be seeking a refund."

While the establishment boasts an inviting ambiance and friendly staff, the lack of dark beer options during the winter month of February was a letdown. Serving only summer brews in the heart of winter felt like a missed opportunity to showcase the depth and warmth of darker, heartier styles more befitting of the season. Despite the pleasant atmosphere, the limited and ill-timed beer selection left much to be desired for discerning beer enthusiasts seeking a truly satisfying seasonal experience.

Buddy Brew is a gem in Tampa. Despite the occasional parking struggles and crowds, it's a must-visit destination. The expertly roasted coffee, combined with the friendly and knowledgeable baristas, creates an exceptional experience. The tasty breakfast and lunch options add to the appeal. While the expansion plans aim to alleviate the parking woes, Buddy Brew remains one of the absolute best spots in the area, earning its place as a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

While the cauliflower salad and fried dough ball dessert were enjoyable, the burnt crust on the pizzas was a turn-off. Perhaps it's an acquired taste, but the charred crust missed the mark for our palates. Overall, this place is decent but didn't quite live up to the hype. 3/5 stars.

After holding on to a gift certificate for over six months, I finally visited this place and it surpassed all expectations! The mixed salad sandwich was an absolute delight, a unique creation that left me craving for more. Additionally, their homemade ice cream was simply irresistible and a perfect complement to the delicious meal. The cozy ambiance and delectable offerings have made me a loyal patron, and I can't wait to return for another memorable dining experience.

As an Italian food lover, this place surpassed all my expectations. The food quality and portion sizes were outstanding. But what truly sets it apart is the exceptional service. Whether ordering takeout or dining in, the staff, especially Alexa, treated us with remarkable hospitality. Their warm and attentive approach made the experience truly unforgettable. Highly recommended for an authentic and delightful Italian dining experience in a welcoming atmosphere.

This upscale bar in the French Quarter is a wonderful oasis for expertly-crafted cocktails and attentive service. The highlight is the incredibly skilled and charming bartender who makes phenomenal classic cocktails like the sublime Manhattan using top-shelf ingredients like Carpano Antica vermouth. The drinks are pricey but worth it for a special night out. The small plates were a mixed bag - the lamb meatballs were just okay, but the spring rolls were excellent. The manager Eric provided impeccable, friendly service. While not a full restaurant, this civilized bar is perfect for a classy cocktail stop in the Quarter. The combination of superb drinks, vibrant hospitality, and cozy atmosphere make it well worth a return visit.

This place used to be a go-to spot for their excellent lunch special, offering great value for money. Although the prices have seen a noticeable increase recently, the quality of the meals remains consistently satisfying. While my husband isn't a fan, I still enjoy dining here, even if our visits have become less frequent over the past year. Despite the price hike, it's a reliable option that rarely disappoints.

This burger joint delivers a satisfying dining experience. The classic burger is a standout, boasting well-seasoned patties, and the fries are a tasty accompaniment. The attentive service is commendable. An indulgent treat is the Bananas Foster spiked milkshake, a decadent and flavorful addition to the meal. Overall, a pleasing visit for those craving a classic burger and fries with a boozy twist.

While the restaurant seemed to have ample seating initially, the service was incredibly slow and disorganized. Despite being one of the first customers to arrive, our food order took over 40 minutes to be placed, and we never received our meals. The staff made excuses about the kitchen being overwhelmed, but there were hardly any new customers during our wait. The lack of urgency from the waitstaff and cooks was disappointing. When we decided to leave after the excessive wait, no apology was offered, and we weren't even charged for our drinks. Overall, it was a frustrating and wasteful experience. The poor service and complete disregard for customer satisfaction make this establishment one to avoid.

An absolute delight! This bakery nailed it with their authentic and delectable offerings. The tres leche cake was a nostalgic treat, reminiscent of grandma's recipe. The cannoli was heavenly, with its decadent chocolate dip and creamy filling. The Italian wedding cookies struck the perfect balance of crunch and delicacy, enhanced by the ideal amount of anise flavor. Surprisingly, even the dark chocolate florentine cookies, with their perfect chocolate-to-coconut ratio, won over a coconut skeptic. An all-around fantastic experience that has us eagerly anticipating our next visit.

Aquí está una reseña concisa basada en la información proporcionada:

Reseña de Pizzería (Nombre del lugar)

Durante unas vacaciones de verano, decidimos pedir pizzas para llevar en este acogedor restaurante ubicado a poca distancia de nuestro alojamiento. A pesar de que solo retiramos las pizzas, el ambiente limpio, confortable y la amable atención del personal nos hicieron sentir como si hubiéramos cenado allí.

Pedimos una variedad de sabores, incluyendo prosciutto, jamón cocido, pepperoni, cebolla, hongos, anchoas y albahaca con tomate. Después de una espera razonable de 25 a 30 minutos, todas las pizzas estilo a la piedra llegaron deliciosas, con una cantidad ideal de salsa de tomate y queso mozzarella.

Aunque esta reseña se basa principalmente en la relación precio-calidad, la calidez con la que fuimos recibidos refleja el excelente trato que seguramente habríamos recibido si hubiéramos cenado en el lugar.

Sin duda, recomiendo encarecidamente este establecimiento y lo valoro con 5 estrellas por su deliciosa comida y su excelente servicio.

Paradise Road Diner is a cozy, laid-back spot perfect for catching up with friends. The service was attentive and friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasantly uncrowded. While my burger wasn't exceptional – it seemed overcooked and lacked the charbroiled flavor advertised – the company and good times shared with my buddies made up for it. We even ventured down to the nearby river and were delighted to find some water flowing. Overall, it's a decent spot for casual dining and hanging out, especially if you're more interested in the company than the food itself.

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. While the oysters were decent, the rest of the food was dry and lacked flavor. The cramped space and uncomfortable seating further diminished the dining experience. Overpriced for the mediocre quality, with $60 spent on just two half and half baskets. Despite reading numerous reviews beforehand, the restaurant failed to meet expectations. Avoid unless you're solely interested in the raw oysters.

Village Whiskey in Philadelphia truly lives up to its reputation for having the best burger in the city.
