The extensive whiskey and bourbon selection, paired with the skilled bartenders who can craft unique and delightful whiskey cocktails, sets the tone for an exceptional experience. The highlight is undoubtedly the Village Burger – a juicy patty topped with applewood bacon and a perfect dollop of homemade thousand island dressing, creating an unbelievably delicious combination of flavors. The duck-fat fries, particularly the plain variety, are also a must-try, offering a crispy and indulgent accompaniment. While the drinks can be pricey, and the restaurant gets insanely busy, the high-quality food, knowledgeable staff, and overall delectable offerings make Village Whiskey a culinary destination worth the wait. It's a place that will leave you dreaming of that burger and eagerly anticipating your next visit.

This neighborhood sushi joint offers a decent experience without being extraordinary. While the roll menu is fairly limited, the staff is attentive, accommodating, and eager to please. The service is thoughtful and speedy. The rolls I tried (Mariner, Rose #1, San Francisco) were competent and perfectly acceptable, but nothing mind-blowing. I've had more memorable sushi elsewhere, but for a convenient option near home, it can't be beaten. I'll likely return for a quick sushi fix, but don't expect to be blown away.

Flanagan's Pub is a hidden gem in the French Quarter, offering a refreshing break from the chaotic Bourbon Street scene. With its laid-back atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and a diverse crowd of regulars and tourists, this pub is a perfect spot to unwind and enjoy a drink. The punk rock music adds a unique touch, creating a lively yet relaxed vibe. If you're seeking an authentic local experience away from the touristy hustle, Flanagan's Pub is a must-visit during your stay in the French Quarter.

The Daily Bread is a disappointing ripoff of St. Louis Bread Co/Panera Bread. While the food itself is passable but unremarkable, the real letdown lies in the abysmal service and lack of cleanliness. Long wait times, disinterested staff, dirty tables littered with trash, and ignored requests make for an unpleasant dining experience that no amount of decent but uninspired food can salvage. With multiple failed attempts, it's clear that the Daily Bread falls well short of expectations, making it difficult to recommend over the superior service and ambiance found at the establishment it seeks to emulate.

The delivery from this restaurant took a bit longer than expected, around 45 minutes, but the friendly driver and delicious food made it worthwhile. The BBQ chicken pizza was a standout, with toppings generously spread across the crust. The mozzarella sticks, though not breaded as anticipated, were still tasty after being deep-fried. The real surprise was the complimentary cookies, which were perfectly chewy and almost stole the show. Despite the slightly lengthy wait, the fair pricing and overall quality make this a restaurant worth ordering from again.

This fabulous gym offers excellent value with its extensive class schedule catering to different work hours. The classes span from early morning to late afternoon, ensuring flexibility for varying schedules. The trainers, especially for spin and rowing, deliver exceptional guidance. Prepare for an intense workout in the challenging We-Fit class, even if you're physically fit. While the facility is currently clean and well-maintained as a new establishment, its long-term commitment to cleanliness remains to be seen. The thoughtful additions like blow dryers and hair ties in the women's locker room demonstrate attention to detail and enhanced convenience for members. Overall, it's a promising gym with diverse fitness opportunities at a reasonable cost.

Despite the frustration of getting rear-ended twice in my new car, Prestigious Auto Body made the entire repair process as smooth and stress-free as possible. I highly recommend their services to anyone seeking a first-rate auto body repair experience.

As a visitor from Colorado, I had an excellent breakfast experience in Santa Barbara. The restaurant offered delicious, high-quality food at reasonable prices, with generous portion sizes. What truly stood out was the exceptional customer service. The staff was friendly and attentive, and our food arrived promptly. Overall, I highly recommend this breakfast spot for anyone visiting Santa Barbara. It's a great value and a fantastic way to start your day in this beautiful city.

This casual Quarter eatery offers a lively diner ambiance with an open kitchen and counter seating perfect for watching the bustle of food preparation. The friendly staff and efficient service are highlights. While my fried shrimp po' boy and red beans were decent tourist fare, the mouthwatering burgers sizzling on the grill have me eager to return and sample those next time. A solid option for a quick, no-frills meal in the heart of the French Quarter.

These veterinarians are exceptional! Over the years, they have consistently demonstrated their expertise and genuine love for animals. They are true professionals who provide the highest quality care. Highly recommended for anyone seeking compassionate and reliable veterinary services.

Louie's Restaurant offers an authentic family-friendly ambiance with excellent service. Their po boy sandwiches are a standout, featuring perfectly crispy bread complemented by flavorful fillings. The mac 'n cheese is a delightful option, with a slight kick of spice adding depth to the dish. Whether you're craving classic Southern cuisine or a casual family meal, Louie's delivers a memorable dining experience.

Mr. B's Bistro in New Orleans delivered an exceptional dining experience during their lively Sunday Jazz Brunch. Despite the bustling atmosphere, the friendly server encouraged a leisurely pace, allowing us to savor every bite. The standout dishes included the flavorful seafood gumbo, melt-in-your-mouth sea bass with a divine sauce, and decadent desserts like chocolate orange ice cream and crème brûlée. Sitting at Ronald Reagan's former table added a touch of history to our memorable meal. While the bill was on the higher end, the outstanding food and service made it well worth the splurge. Mr. B's is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic New Orleans culinary adventure.

The Alexander Hotel in Indianapolis offers a delightful urban experience with its impressive modern art collection showcased throughout the property. The attached parking garage features cool street art, setting the tone for an artistic stay. The rooms are well-appointed with luxurious amenities like Keurig coffee machines, plush robes, and comfortable California king beds. The on-site restaurant, Plat 99, impresses with its creative cocktails, complementary truffle popcorn, and a timeline of cocktail history. The hotel's prime location, just a minute's walk from Bankers Life Fieldhouse, makes it an ideal choice for attending Pacers or Colts games. The friendly staff, easy check-in/check-out process, and the Market Place buffet breakfast add to the overall positive experience. For a stylish and convenient stay in Indianapolis, especially for sports enthusiasts, The Alexander Hotel is a fantastic option that delivers an artistic and memorable experience.

While the establishment has a nice setting with a downtown street patio, TVs, and a bar, the food and service were disappointing. The cashier attempted to add a beer to the to-go order without consent, and the ordered fish taco never arrived. Instead of the requested Sonoran dog, two plain beef tacos with scraps of beef, cilantro, and onion were received. The Sonoran dog itself was the last one available and soggy, paling in comparison to food truck offerings. The experience was further marred by the overcrowded, loud atmosphere and the seeming lack of stock as they were running out of beef and dogs. Despite the inviting ambiance, the poor food quality, incorrect order fulfillment, and lack of attentive service make it difficult to recommend this place for a satisfying dining experience.

For Nashville locals or visitors seeking a reliable spot to catch the game, Sam's is a viable choice, but it fails to stand out in comparison to top-tier sports bars found in other cities with professional teams.

Honey Cream Views (HCV) is a must-visit spot for its delectable food, convenient location, and warm hospitality. While the limited seating can lead to crowds during peak hours, their online ordering system is a smart solution. The takeout option allows you to enjoy your meal in the nearby Rittenhouse Square, making for a delightful alfresco dining experience. With a menu that caters to both vegetarians and meat-lovers, HCV has something for everyone, ensuring no complaints from friends or coworkers. Overall, it's a fantastic eatery that delivers on all fronts.

Avoid at all costs! This company's complete disregard for customer service and accountability is appalling. Their bus was over an hour late from Indianapolis to Chicago, and they failed to inform passengers of the delay. When confronted, they hid behind their atrocious policy of absolving themselves of any responsibility. Dozens of us were left stranded at a bus stop, with our time wasted and no recourse available. An utterly disappointing and unprofessional experience.

Michael and Lucy's new family restaurant is a welcome addition to Santa Claus Lane. After their previous establishment closed due to a family dispute, they've managed to bounce back with a delightful Tuscan-inspired eatery. The food is satisfying and reasonably priced, with a slice and salad special worth asking about. The owners are warm and welcoming, with Lucy's friendly demeanor standing out. The restaurant caters to various interests with local beer on tap, multiple HD sports TVs (including one for patio diners), a dedicated surf video TV, and a kids' TV with a classic Ms. Pac-Man game that's a hit with young guests. While the location may be challenging, this new spot is part of a renaissance in the once outdated Santa Claus Lane area. With its inviting atmosphere and diverse offerings, this family restaurant deserves a chance to succeed.

Don't be put off by the shopping center location – this place is a hidden gem! The staff, particularly Curtis, are incredibly friendly and dedicated to ensuring an outstanding dining experience. Curtis's passion for his job shines through, making you feel truly welcomed. While the scallops small plate is a must-try, the entire menu offers top-notch fare. An exceptional dining destination that exceeds expectations.

A quintessential New Orleans experience! This charming breakfast spot, just a short stroll from the French Quarter, offers an authentic taste of the city's vibrant culture. The bananas foster, a local favorite, was an absolute delight. The colorful, whimsical decor perfectly captures the city's spirit, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking a genuine New Orleans dining adventure. Highly recommended for a delicious and immersive start to your day.

The birthday cakes here are truly outstanding, living up to the high praise. However, the cupcakes and cookies displayed at the front can sometimes be stale. On a positive note, whenever concerns were raised, the staff addressed the issue promptly and made it right. Despite the hit-or-miss experience with the smaller baked items, the exceptional birthday cakes make this place worth revisiting.

Loco is a new affordable Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood. While the service was a bit slow during our Saturday lunch visit, it's understandable as they're just getting started. The margarita and cilantro chicken enchiladas were delicious, and the outdoor seating area was pleasant. However, their opening night on Friday was a total mess with a long line and disorganization. Overall, Loco shows promise with its reasonable prices and chill vibe, unlike the previous failed "casual fancy" establishments in that location. With some time to work out the kinks, this neighborhood spot has the potential to thrive for years to come.

Nary's Nail Salon is a fantastic choice for anyone seeking trendy and unique nail designs. The talented staff, including Nary herself, consistently deliver stunning results that garner numerous compliments. The salon's lively and friendly atmosphere encourages casual banter among clients and staff, making the experience far more enjoyable than the typical silent nail appointment. While they offer the latest nail art techniques, including intricate gem-encrusted designs, clients should be prepared for higher prices reflecting the quality and artistry. To avoid any surprises, it's advisable to discuss your budget upfront. The salon's popularity often results in a wait for walk-ins, so making an appointment is highly recommended. Overall, Nary's Nail Salon is a top-notch choice for those seeking exceptional nail services in a welcoming and engaging environment.

An absolute must-visit in Treasure Island! This place excels with its delicious char-grilled oysters and pet-friendly outdoor seating area. The friendly staff and accommodating atmosphere for furry companions make it a standout, especially for those accustomed to pet-friendly dining experiences. Highly recommended for a enjoyable meal with your four-legged friend.

Joe's Seafood Shack offers an authentic New Orleans experience with a menu dominated by fried seafood options, perfect for dock workers and their families looking for a casual yet "fancy" meal. However, while the atmosphere captures the city's charm, the surprisingly steep prices don't quite justify the average food quality. It's a decent option for those craving a quintessential NOLA eatery, but don't expect culinary fireworks.

Highly recommended by family, this bustling breakfast spot delivers top-notch service and delicious, no-frills fare. The standout Cajun tasso omelet packs a flavorful punch without overwhelming heat, while the fluffy hash browns and classic dishes like French toast and eggs over medium leave no room for disappointment. With friendly staff and a satisfying experience for all, it's easy to see why this place has become a family favorite. Definitely worth a visit for a tasty, fuss-free breakfast.

An Impressive Addition to 10th Street! This restaurant offers a delightful array of unique and flavorful appetizers, like the delicious dumplings with corn and mushrooms. The noodle dishes are also a standout, featuring fresh, high-quality ingredients that elevate them above typical fare. While portion sizes may be smaller than some venues, the dishes are reasonably priced and the BYO policy adds to the overall value. With its vibrant menu and inviting atmosphere, this establishment is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.

The sandwich shop offers the best sandwiches in St. Louis! The food is so delicious that you could happily eat there every day. The restaurant has a welcoming atmosphere with a friendly crowd of customers. Highly recommended for an exceptional sandwich experience!

The [Restaurant Name] in Reno, NV, is an excellent choice for a delightful lunch or dinner. With its impressive menu offerings, this establishment delivers fine dining experiences, thanks to the exceptional management skills of Tyler and their well-trained staff. Beyond the culinary delights, the restaurant also doubles as a pub, boasting an extensive selection of beers and wines to complement your meal. Whether you're seeking a memorable meal or a cozy spot for drinks, this establishment is a must-visit in Reno.

Chuck E. Cheese offers a well-organized and staffed experience for kids' parties and family fun. With plenty of staff on hand, you won't be left waiting for assistance or refunds. The game area is larger than the play area, encouraging kids to spend time (and tokens) on the diverse selection of arcade and chance-based games. The food portions are generous, with leftovers even after feeding a sizable group. However, the birthday party area can feel crowded, with parties accidentally encroaching on each other's space. While primarily geared towards families with children, the nostalgic appeal of revisiting childhood memories at Chuck E. Cheese is undeniable, even for adults without kids. Overall, it's a well-run establishment that caters to creating enjoyable experiences for young partygoers.

This charming eatery is a delightful departure from the standard fare, offering simple yet delectable organic dishes prepared with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The extensive coffee menu, including the renowned Sasquatch brew, is a must-try for caffeine enthusiasts. Beyond the delectable cuisine, the ambiance exudes a casual and relaxed vibe, creating a comfortable dining experience. The warm and welcoming owners add a personal touch, making this establishment a true gem in the local dining scene.

An absolute must-visit for ice cream lovers! This place serves up delightfully fresh and creamy treats made from hormone and antibiotic-free milk. While it's cash only, the quality of their meticulously crafted ice cream is well worth the extra trip to the ATM. Prepare to be blown away by the flavors and leave craving your next visit!

Despite being our second choice after finding Rio Mar closed for Mardi Gras week, and the hassle of getting there due to the parades, we had a truly memorable meal at this restaurant. The service was professional and attentive, and although they were out of some ingredients for a signature cocktail, it was understandable given the Mardi Gras festivities. The bread and butter were excellent, with a perfect crunchy exterior and soft interior. The beets salad was exceptional, with greens that tasted incredibly fresh. My partner's Choucroute was a meaty delight, while my crab ravioli with a delicate Meyer lemon sauce was lovely. The bread pudding dessert, sans raisins, was just how we like it. Overall, it exceeded our expectations for a hotel restaurant and provided a standout dining experience.

Having stumbled upon 51st Deli on the Uber Eats app, we were pleasantly surprised by the delectable offerings. The food we ordered was simply delicious, leaving us eager to visit the deli in person. With such a promising takeout experience, we can't wait to immerse ourselves in the ambiance and savor their menu firsthand. Highly recommended for those seeking a tasty and convenient dining option."

The Honey Apple grilled cheese sandwich at Meltdown is an absolute must-try! The combination of flavors is heavenly, and the overall experience is top-notch with friendly staff and a cool, hip atmosphere. In contrast, the Montgomeryville location left much to be desired – the service was unacceptably rude, with my sandwich being thrown at me and another customer getting splashed with soup. The decor was also too futuristic and weird for my liking. Despite the unpleasant experience at Montgomeryville, Meltdown remains a cheese lover's paradise, and I highly recommend it, especially for their incredible Honey Apple grilled cheese.

This budget-friendly sushi spot offers great value with their combination deals, making rolls and sushi highly affordable. While the rolls are on the smaller side, ordering the combo deal ensures you'll get enough to feel satisfied. Surprisingly, the sashimi is quite fresh despite the low prices. However, the restaurant itself is quite compact, and service can be slow, so be prepared to wait. The upside is that it's BYOB, allowing you to grab some beers downstairs to enjoy while you wait for your order. If you're looking for an inexpensive sushi fix and don't mind the cozy setting and leisurely service, this place is worth checking out.

The food at this establishment was satisfactory, but the service left much to be desired. Despite ordering orange juice for the kids at the beginning, it didn't arrive until we were nearly finished with our meal. Additionally, they only accept cash or checks, which is inconvenient in today's digital age. While the overall experience was decent, the lackluster service and outdated payment methods detract from the overall dining experience. Improvements in these areas would go a long way in enhancing customer satisfaction.
I sincerely hope the management takes this feedback to heart and prioritizes returning to the high standards that made this establishment a beloved dining destination for so many years.

Stigma Tattoo offers an exceptional experience with their friendly and talented artists. I got a beautiful rose tattoo from Eddie, who perfectly captured my vision with his impeccable line work. Despite my back issues, Eddie was accommodating and ensured my comfort throughout the session. The entire staff is welcoming, creating a cool and inviting atmosphere. The owner, Chino, has even developed his own soothing tattoo ointment using natural ingredients. The $10 Yelp check-in discount is an added bonus. Stigma Tattoo is highly recommended for anyone seeking a professional and enjoyable tattoo experience.

This vibrant venue offers the best of both worlds! The outdoor patio keeps things lively with hip-hop beats, while the indoor dance area allows you to salsa the night away. Whether you're in the mood for an energetic outdoor vibe or a sultry indoor ambiance, you can easily switch it up without missing a beat. A fun and versatile spot for those who love to groove!

After years of absence, we visited this restaurant for lunch. The decor and wait staff were great, providing a pleasant ambiance and attentive service. While my friend enjoyed the flavorful fish special, albeit with a small portion size, my fattoush salad with chicken left much to be desired. The spices were on point, but the chicken was merely decent, and the limp lettuce, lack of olives, and soggy pita were disappointing. Additionally, the prices were quite steep for a lunchtime meal. Overall, despite the positives, the mediocre food quality and high prices make it an establishment we're unlikely to rush back to anytime soon.

Animal Clinic is a top-notch facility that treats pets like family. Their compassionate staff provides exceptional boarding, grooming, and medical care, treating animals as if they were their own. The only downside is the somewhat inconvenient exit from their location. Overall, it's a 4-star establishment that prioritizes pet well-being above all else. Highly recommended for conscientious pet owners.

An utterly disappointing experience at this Taco Bell. The restaurant was shockingly filthy, the service was abysmal, and they somehow managed to botch even the simplest orders. How challenging can it be to assemble some basic tacos and burritos correctly? This place is an absolute no-go, and I strongly advise seeking out alternative taco spots that can deliver a modicum of cleanliness, competence, and decent service. Avoid at all costs.

The Nuevo-Latino-Americano cuisine at this restaurant is a delightful fusion of flavors. While my visit was quite some time ago at their previous location, the fresh and tasty chips and salsa left a lasting impression. The new, larger space is a welcome change, although I can't speak to the current menu or overall dining experience. Nonetheless, it's a spot worth trying for those seeking a unique culinary adventure.

Player's Barbershop offers an exceptional grooming experience. With its welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff, and top-notch service, it's a true gem. The relaxed ambiance and great value for money make it a standout choice for a high-quality shave and haircut. Highly recommended for a fantastic overall experience.

Worst dining experience ever. The food, specifically the frog's legs, was inedible - rubbery and foul-tasting. When I politely tried to return the dish, the manager's behavior was appallingly rude and unprofessional. I was treated with shocking disrespect and discourtesy. The manager should be ashamed of their conduct. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

Disappointing Doubletree Experience: This aging hotel, tucked away in an inconvenient location far from amenities, fails to meet the brand's standards. The outdated and poorly maintained rooms, complete with unclean floors, torn wallpaper, and dusty vents, were a letdown. While the bed was comfortable, the overall experience was underwhelming, especially for a Doubletree property. Despite its serviceable accommodations, the hotel's lack of upkeep and remote location make it difficult to recommend, especially for travelers accustomed to a higher level of quality from this chain.

The hotel exudes a charming boutique ambiance, offering a refreshing departure from typical chain hotels. The beautifully appointed rooms, coupled with exceptional service, create a delightful experience. While the air conditioning unit in our room was somewhat noisy, this minor issue was overshadowed by the hotel's proximity to the vibrant Printers Alley area. The on-site restaurant provided an excellent venue for my birthday celebration, with remarkable service and ambiance. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and would happily return for future stays.

This cool spot in a prime location is a must-visit. By arriving early, we avoided the crowded scene others have experienced. The bartenders are top-notch, expertly crafting drinks like the Perfect Rye Manhattan that left me hooked. But the real standout was the burger – hands down the best I've ever had. I'll definitely be returning to this gem.

This place is a breakfast lover's dream! The food is outstanding, with standouts like the delectable biscuits and gravy, perfectly crispy bacon, savory sausage links, and indulgent challah French toast. The service matches the exceptional quality of the cuisine, making it my new go-to spot for a satisfying breakfast experience. Highly recommended!

Terra was the florist for our wedding, and we were delighted with her service. She took the time to understand our needs and work within our budget, resulting in beautiful floral arrangements for the ceremony and reception. While some of the bouquets started wilting due to the heat and fully bloomed flowers, we understand this is a natural occurrence. Overall, we were thrilled with Terra's work and highly recommend her for any wedding or event.

Healthy Nola Gem: A Refreshing Lunch Retreat"

In the heart of New Orleans, where indulgent cuisine reigns supreme, this charming eatery stands out as a haven for health-conscious diners. With an impressive array of delectable yet wholesome options, including a tempting selection of grab-and-go choices, it caters to those seeking a nutritious and satisfying meal. The turkey meatballs and spaghetti dish I savored was a delightful testament to their ability to craft flavorful fare without sacrificing dietary principles. Beyond the mouth-watering fare, the ambiance exudes a tranquil and welcoming vibe, making it an ideal spot for a rejuvenating lunch respite amidst the city's vibrant culinary landscape

A delightful find in Northern Liberties! This take-out spot hits the mark with fresh, flavorful, and relatively healthy fare. It's a much-needed addition to the area, offering convenient and tasty options for those on the go. Highly recommended for a satisfying meal without compromising on quality.

Hidden Library Cafe is a delightful gem for alumni gatherings or casual drinks with friends. The cozy, dimly lit interior adorned like an old library sets the perfect ambiance for a low-key evening. Their cocktail game is strong, with a happy hour offering delicious classics like Moscow Mules and Old Fashioneds that received rave reviews from our group. While the beer and wine selection is limited, Hidden Library shines as a charming spot to unwind over well-crafted drinks in a relaxed, intimate setting.

The burgers here are truly outstanding, deserving of high praise. While the french fries are passable, the real star of the side dishes is the delectable onion rings. If you're visiting, the burgers are an absolute must-try, and be sure to order the onion rings instead of the fries for the full experience.

Disappointing Dining Experience - 1 Star. My visits to this restaurant have been utterly unpleasant. The steak was overly salty, the fish was dry and overcooked, and shockingly, my salad seemed to have been frozen. To top it off, the service was terrible. I can't comprehend how this place manages to receive any positive reviews. I would strongly advise against dining here until significant improvements are made.

Modesto, a Spanish restaurant in St. Louis, is an absolute gem and a must-visit for lovers of authentic Spanish cuisine. Despite having explored numerous great Spanish eateries across the country, particularly in New York City, Modesto remains a personal favorite. The food is simply outstanding, making it one of those rare dining experiences that leave a lasting impression. Unfortunately, living far from St. Louis now, Modesto is undoubtedly one of the places that I sorely miss and crave revisiting whenever possible.

Spa Aria at the Hotel Monteleone in New Orleans is a massive disappointment. The space is small, dirty, and the staff is unprofessional and rude. Despite being a spa, there is no sense of relaxation or escape. The receptionist was inattentive, and the nail technician was sloppy, rushed, and shockingly unhygienic - she cut my cuticle, blew her nose repeatedly into her shirt while working on me, and made insensitive comments. The massage was pathetic, with no pressure applied. Adding insult to injury, there are excessive fees for using a room charge, and tacky signage pressuring cash tips. With chipped nails days later, I deeply regret my experience and cannot recommend Spa Aria to anyone seeking a quality spa experience.

A Truly Indulgent Shaving Experience"

This concise review encapsulates the exceptional service and pampering experience offered by the establishment. The hot shave service is highly praised, surpassing expectations with its meticulous attention to detail. The inclusion of six warm towels and a rejuvenating facial massage with aromatic oils elevates the shave to a luxurious ritual. Beyond the impeccable grooming service, the review commends the inviting ambiance, creating a seamless and gratifying environment for clients. Overall, this establishment delivers an unparalleled grooming indulgence, making it a must-visit destination for those seeking a truly elevated shaving experience

Taco del Mar is a solid choice for fast and fresh Mexican fare, especially if you're in the Delgado area. As a Subway-owned establishment, it offers a similar build-your-own burrito and taco concept, but with better quality ingredients. The vegetarian options are plentiful, making it a great spot for plant-based diners to customize their burritos with an array of fresh veggies. Their chips and medium salsa are also noteworthy accompaniments. While not groundbreaking, Taco del Mar delivers a consistently decent and speedy Mexican meal experience.

This grocery store serves as a backup option when specific items can't be found at the preferred Trader Joe's. However, the prices are higher than expected, and the lack of sufficient staff can make for an unpleasant shopping experience. While it offers a broader selection, the elevated costs and subpar service make it a less desirable choice unless absolutely necessary.

According to this barbeque enthusiast, true smoked ribs should never be mushy or fall off the bone. They warn that if you're looking for that overly tender texture, you should steer clear of proper barbeque joints. Authentic smoked ribs, they claim, are meant to have a little toughness and chew to them. This is a stern reminder for those who appreciate the traditional, no-frills approach to barbeque ribs.

This place is a must-visit for lassi and chaat lovers. While the chaat is elegantly presented and boasts traditional Karachi flavors, the lassi steals the show. It's soft, creamy, and perfectly sweetened – an absolute delight. The chaat might not be the best you've had, but the lassi alone is worth a trip back whenever you're in the vicinity.

Hendel's Cafe provided the perfect venue for our wedding reception. The ambiance was gorgeous, creating a beautiful night to celebrate with our closest friends and family. The staff at Hendel's Cafe ensured our special day was nothing short of magical. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an elegant and memorable event space.

Utterly disappointing experience. Cockroaches in the room, snail-paced wifi, and exorbitant charges for basic amenities like beach chairs. A total rip-off that I wouldn't wish upon my worst enemy. Steer clear and avoid this place at all costs.

El Sol Mexican Restaurant is a true gem! We visited to celebrate my daughter's birthday, and they went above and beyond to make it a memorable experience. The attentive service, delicious drinks (piña coladas and margaritas), and mouthwatering food were simply outstanding. The staff surprised us with a large cake, dessert for the birthday girl, sombreros, and even fireworks – it was a festive celebration with birthday songs playing on the TVs. Portion sizes are generous too; the fajitas were enough for dinner and leftovers for lunch. Highly recommended for a fantastic dining experience!

Skip the long lines at Taco Bus and head to this hidden gem instead! Taco Son offers delicious, freshly made Mexican fare with generous portions at a great value. The ingredients taste incredibly fresh, as everything is made from scratch. Their breakfast burritos are a must-try, especially after a night out. Avoid the crowds and get your fix of authentic Mexican flavors at this underrated spot. Highly recommended for those seeking quality and convenience.

Extremely disappointing experience at Conicelli. Despite a recent state inspection and oil change, the used car we purchased from them had a severely dry-rotted front tire that blew out the very next day. The tire disintegrated completely, posing a serious safety risk that could have led to a catastrophic accident on the highway. We had to replace both front tires at a cost of $450. Their inspection process clearly missed a major safety issue. While the money is frustrating, the potential for a tragic outcome is unacceptable. I cannot recommend Conicelli after this negligent oversight nearly put our family in danger.

The food here is excellent, truly on point. However, the experience was somewhat tarnished by the unacceptable condition of the bathrooms during my Friday night visit. The toilet didn't flush, there was no toilet paper or paper towels available, and overall, the bathrooms were simply gross. While the food shines, the lack of cleanliness and proper maintenance in the restrooms is a concern, leading me to deduct one star from an otherwise positive rating.

The food itself was great, but the service was incredibly disappointing. Despite ordering online with a quoted ready time, they didn't even start preparing my order until I arrived at the restaurant. I had to wait an additional 20 minutes, well past the promised time. The staff showed no concern for the inconvenience caused and made no effort to rectify the situation or provide any compensation. A complete lack of customer service that overshadowed the quality of the food. Highly frustrating experience.

This charming Japanese eatery in Old City is a gem! The sushi is impeccably fresh, and the ramen is absolutely amazing. But what truly sets this place apart is the exceptional customer service. The staff is friendly and attentive, making you feel right at home. With a diverse menu offering a great selection of dishes, this has quickly become my go-to spot for delectable sushi and ramen cravings. Highly recommended for an authentic Japanese dining experience!

Abvionce offered a truly pampering and relaxing experience. The ambiance was top-notch, but the service for ordering drinks fell short. Despite multiple attempts to order, I had to resort to calling room service, which was inconvenient. Overall, it was an enjoyable visit, but the restaurant could improve its drink service to make it a truly exceptional experience.

Dr. Jeffers is an exceptional veterinarian who truly cares for animals. Her diagnostic skills are top-notch, providing accurate assessments quickly. She offers compassionate and affordable care, even for exotic pets like reptiles, which is a rarity in the area. Her practice is well-equipped with advanced machinery to ensure thorough examinations. Additionally, she facilitates pet adoptions. Highly recommended, on par with renowned vets like Dr. Pol.

The Mahi Mahi dish was excellent, offering a generous portion that could easily be shared. However, it's important to note that the fish had a distinct smoked flavor, which may not appeal to everyone's taste preferences. On the service front, the server provided a pleasant dining experience. Overall, a satisfying meal, especially for those who enjoy smoked fish and don't mind larger portions.

Melissa's Lash Lounge is simply outstanding! Having experienced other lash services, Melissa truly stands out with her exceptional craftsmanship. She applies lashes meticulously, without excessive stacking, ensuring a natural and flawless look. Melissa is efficient, getting you in and out swiftly, while delivering top-notch results. Highly recommended for anyone seeking the best lash extensions in town.

The Reno casino stands out as a premier destination for discerning players. With its impressive 4-deck and 2-deck blackjack offerings, real glass drinkware, and a decadent ambiance that will dazzle your senses, this casino exudes an unparalleled level of sophistication. The on-site restaurants are a true culinary revelation, surpassing even the finest establishments on the Las Vegas Strip by a significant margin. Additionally, the accommodations are exceptional, providing stellar rooms at an unbeatable value. Indulge in the luxurious hot tub suites for an ultimate relaxation experience. This casino is a must-visit for those seeking an unforgettable gaming and hospitality adventure.

This restaurant offers delightful fish and chips, with a perfectly crispy batter contrasting the moist and juicy fish. The homemade tartar sauce adds a great flavor punch. While the serving size is modest, the quality surpasses that of larger portions elsewhere. The salmon tacos, though flavorful, suffered from overcooked fish, but the chicken tortilla soup stole the show. Portion sizes are reasonable rather than oversized, making it a satisfying dining experience without excessive leftovers. If you're seeking quality over quantity, this restaurant is an excellent choice for a well-executed, flavorful meal.

The Lemon Cake at Cake Life is deliciously indulgent and satisfyingly dense. While tempted by their irresistible cupcakes, I opted for a slice of this heavenly cake instead, albeit with a hint of guilt. Cake Life undoubtedly delivers on taste and quality, solidifying itself as a must-visit destination for cake enthusiasts. I eagerly anticipate my next visit to explore their tantalizing offerings further.

Beef's Restaurant provided abysmal service on our visit. Despite being seated promptly, it took 40 minutes just to get sodas. Our order was never even entered into the system, causing over an hour of waiting without food or drinks. The manager's offer of free food couldn't make up for the incredibly slow and disorganized service that made us late for another commitment. The only positive was decent boneless wings as an appetizer. However, there are far better choices for dining out - avoid Beef's at all costs to prevent a frustrating and disappointing experience.

Wildflower is a charming, locally-sourced restaurant that serves delectable breakfast and lunch fare. The cozy patio dining area adds to the delightful ambiance. While the menu offers mouthwatering options like the Vermonter salad and tuna plate, vegetarian choices are somewhat limited. Nevertheless, the fresh ingredients, homemade dressings, and baked goods like the muesli bread and honey butter are standouts. The attentive service and thoughtful gestures like a complimentary birthday cupcake make for a truly enjoyable dining experience. Wildflower is a gem, especially for those seeking a delightful local spot with a focus on quality and flavor.

A disastrous dining experience. The roast pork sandwich was the worst I've ever had, with lifeless and freezing broccoli rabe, unmelted cheese due to the extreme cold temperature, and soggy, wet bread. An utterly horrible meal that I would have sent back if not stuck at the airport. Avoid at all costs.

While the appetizers like the Indian pancakes and chicken satay were great, the entrees at this affordable Thai restaurant fell short. The Pad Thai was overly sweet and lacked spice, and other dishes like the Seafood Crispy Noodles, Pearl Noodles, and a Beef rice dish were merely mediocre. With entrees costing around $8, you get what you pay for. It's a shame the main courses were lackluster, but at least the total bill was cheap for a night out. If you're craving Thai food, this place might satisfy your appetizer cravings, but the entrees leave much to be desired.

This place is an absolute gem! As a self-proclaimed sandwich expert from Chicago, I can confidently say that their made-to-order sandwiches are worth every bit of the wait. The quality and taste of their offerings have earned them a well-deserved five-star rating. Kudos to the team for their exceptional work!

The Devils Food Cake from this bakery is an absolute must-try! The decadent chocolate cake paired with creamy vanilla buttercream icing was a heavenly combination that left our group of 12 adults, who typically avoid indulgent sweets, craving for more. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, making the overall experience truly remarkable. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an exceptional cake that's worth every calorie. The Old City location offers convenient access for future cravings.

While the salon's talent may be great, poor time management and a lack of punctuality from the staff severely diminish the overall experience. On 3/23/18 at 11:28 am, despite the listed 11 am opening time, there were 5 customers waiting with no employee present to provide service. In a service-based industry, valuing customers' time is essential, and Perfect Arch fell short in this regard. The salon needs to address this issue to improve customer satisfaction and prevent further frustration.

Spasso is an excellent Italian restaurant in Media that offers a twist on classic dishes. The service, led by the exceptional Oana, is top-notch, with knowledgeable staff providing excellent recommendations. Despite a quoted wait, we were able to snag a high-top table in the full-service bar area. The complimentary bread with a delightful eggplant and pepper topping sets the tone for a delightful meal. The Caesar salad is fresh and perfectly dressed, while the standout pappardelle porcini (thick pasta with sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, chicken, and a light sauce) is a must-try. The portions are generous, ensuring leftovers for the next day. Spasso comes highly recommended for a fantastic Italian dining experience in Media.

Our family has been members of this credit union for around 4 years, with multiple accounts for our business, individual members, and even an ex-spouse. While there have been occasional errors, which is expected with so many accounts, the credit union's branch staff has been accommodating and prompt in resolving any issues. Overall, we've had a satisfactory experience, and their willingness to address concerns directly has been commendable. The credit union's customer service has made us continue as loyal members.

Despite numerous attempts to enjoy this establishment, the experience has been consistently disappointing. The rowdy atmosphere, coupled with poor service, mediocre food, and a lack of attentiveness from rude staff, has made each visit frustrating. Management's dismissive attitude towards customer concerns is unacceptable. The hit-and-miss nature of the dining experience makes it impossible to recommend this place to others. It's a waste of time and money, and we advise avoiding it altogether.

La Quinta Taqueria offers an authentic and delectable Mexican dining experience in St. Petersburg. While the ambiance is unassuming, the food is undoubtedly the star attraction, boasting the best Mexican fare in the city. The chorizo tacos are a must-try for meat enthusiasts, and the fish tacos are a standout for seafood lovers. However, be prepared for long waits during peak weekend hours. For a more relaxed experience, visit on weeknights or during the day. Overall, La Quinta Taqueria is a hidden gem that promises a satisfying and flavorful Mexican meal.
Whether you're a wing connoisseur or seeking a fun sports bar with great food and service, Chatham Tap delivers on all fronts.

This sushi spot offers an authentic and delightfully tasty experience at very reasonable prices. The service is commendably quick, ensuring a smooth dining experience. While the flavors are undoubtedly fantastic and the dishes are ultra-healthy, the establishment could benefit from adding menu photos to better showcase their mouthwatering creations. Overall, it's a highly recommended destination for sushi lovers seeking genuine flavors without breaking the bank.

The food was a standout, with a diverse menu offering everything from steaks to meatloaf, all prepared to perfection and catering to our individual preferences. We eagerly look forward to returning and hope the next visit will be just as excellent as our first.

Jonny's Dive Bar: A Hidden Gem for Food, Drinks, and Entertainment

If you're looking for a relaxed, no-frills atmosphere with surprisingly good food and entertaining events, Jonny's Dive Bar is a must-visit. Despite its unassuming appearance, this dive bar offers a fantastic happy hour, homemade dough for their delicious pizzas, and mouth-watering naked wings that keep patrons coming back for more.

The menu boasts other standout items like the Jon's salad with grilled chicken, making it a great spot for a casual meal. But the real draw for many is the cheap beer and half-price pizza deals on certain days, allowing you to indulge without breaking the bank.

Beyond the food and drinks, Jonny's hosts free trivia and bingo nights, where you can win prizes like gift certificates and even pitchers of beer for just a penny. However, it's important to note that this is a smoking-permitted establishment, which can make for a smoky atmosphere when it's crowded, especially on game days or nights.

Overall, Jonny's Dive Bar is a hidden gem for those seeking an unpretentious ambiance, tasty eats, affordable drinks, and a lively atmosphere with fun events and games.

This spacious restaurant with a bar and stage area offers delicious vegan-friendly fare and excellent guacamole. The friendly servers accommodate special dietary requests, making it a great choice for group gatherings like work parties. Highly recommended for its tasty food and accommodating service in a lively, spacious setting.

Overall, West Ave. Grill is a delightful neighborhood gem, offering a cozy ambiance, friendly service, and generally good food. It's certainly worth a visit for those seeking a pleasant dining experience in Jenkintown.

First Timer's Delight: A Must-Visit Destination for Hot Chicken Lovers in Nashville! This establishment's hot chicken is an absolute game-changer, claiming the title of the best in town. The exceptional flavors have left a lasting impression, making it an essential stop on every future trip to Nashville. Prepare to be amazed by this hot chicken haven!

An unexpectedly delightful experience! This cafe, tucked inside a grocery store, serves up the most incredible tuna melt I've ever had – perfectly crafted and incredibly fresh. What truly stands out, however, is the exceptional service. The staff is attentive, efficient, and delivers top-notch hospitality. While the cafe's location within a store is surprising, it left me wishing they would expand into a standalone establishment, as their offerings and service are worthy of a dedicated space. An absolute gem that exceeded all expectations!

This restaurant offers a one-of-a-kind culinary experience – sautéed seafood served in plastic bags! While the presentation might raise eyebrows, the delightful sauce steals the show. Complemented by attentive service, this eatery is a must-visit for seafood enthusiasts seeking an unconventional yet flavorful dining adventure in St. Louis.

This establishment's drive-thru service was a complete letdown. Despite attempting to order basic items from their menu, none of the requested items were available. The uncertainty and apprehension surrounding what would ultimately be served only added to the frustrating experience. It's as if the staff took inspiration from the movie "Waiting," where subpar service and questionable practices reign supreme. The fact that such a fiasco occurred over a simple beverage order is pathetic and speaks volumes about the establishment's lack of professionalism and customer care. Steer clear of this place unless you're seeking a guaranteed disappointment.

This lively sports bar is a must-visit for any Philly fan, especially during Phillies games. While the staff's occasional lover's quarrels add to the entertaining atmosphere, the real star is the seriously delicious gravy fries – a dish you haven't truly lived until you've tried. Complementing the great food is a decent beer selection, making this a fantastic spot to catch the game, enjoy some brews, and soak in the local character.

We enjoyed a cozy evening at this establishment, sipping wine in the festive bar area. The ambiance was delightful, with a visit from Santa and Mrs. Claus adding to the merry atmosphere. While the service was a tad slow, it suited our leisure pace. Overall, it's a charming spot for a relaxing drink or two, with a pleasant ambiance.

Yelpers delivered again with this hidden gem - a reconverted 1960s A&W stand in South Tucson. Despite its unassuming exterior, the restaurant served up delicious and reasonably priced Mexican fare. The catfish smothered in poblano sauce and melted cheese tasted remarkably fresh, while the chile relleno showcased the chef's skillful use of seasonal ingredients. Even the picky teenagers in our group devoured their enchiladas and chimichangas. An unexpected delight that left us thoroughly satisfied.

This authentic Indian eatery in Media is a delightful addition to the area's dining scene. The vegetable pakora appetizer, a delicious blend of veggies and hushpuppies, sets the tone for an excellent meal. The entrees, including chicken tikki masala, lamb roganjosh, and lamb vindaloo, are expertly prepared and true to their flavors, with sauces so tasty you'll want to drink them. While the service is merely adequate, the reasonable prices and outstanding food make it a worthwhile experience. The lunch buffet, priced at $9.95 on weekdays and $10.95 on weekends, also looks promising. Overall, this restaurant is a must-try for lovers of authentic Indian cuisine.

Howard's the go-to expert for Volkswagen repairs and maintenance. While appointments may require some advance planning, his thoroughness, reliability, and extensive knowledge make the wait worthwhile. Howard's efficient service ensures your VW is in capable hands. Highly recommended for all VW enthusiasts seeking top-notch workmanship.

This place serves up the best desserts I've ever had! The standout is their 'Dark and Sinister' creation, which is absolutely AMAZING. Any dessert that incorporates their rich, decadent chocolate ice cream is a winner in my book. If you have a sweet tooth, this is a must-visit spot for top-notch, indulgent treats.

The oyster happy hour at this establishment is a must-try for seafood lovers on a budget. From 5-7pm, you can indulge in a dozen fresh oysters and a glass of champagne for just $24, including tip – an exceptional value. The staff were friendly and attentive, making us feel welcome despite our casual attire. While we missed out on their renowned to-go cups, we'll definitely be back to experience the full package. Highly recommended for a delightful and affordable oyster experience.

Prep & Pastry is a weekend breakfast hotspot that's absolutely worth the long wait. With delectable offerings like the green eggs & ham, refreshing bloody marys and mimosas, and complimentary birthday pastries, it's a must-visit. The exceptional cuisine paired with locally roasted EXO coffee makes for an unbeatable breakfast experience. Arrive early or late to avoid the crowds, but rest assured, the food and beverages will make the wait worthwhile. An overall fantastic spot for a leisurely and satisfying weekend brunch.

The Coffee Spot" offers an excellent variety of coffee and tea options, with the iced dirty chai being a standout favorite. The friendly staff strikes the perfect balance of being attentive without being overbearing, ensuring a relaxed and unhurried experience. The spacious seating accommodates groups of all sizes, while the rotating display of local artists' work adds a delightful touch to the warm and inviting ambiance. Overall, it's a cozy and charming spot with a great vibe for enjoying a quality beverage and immersing oneself in the local art scene

The worker was fantastic, delivering excellent service. However, the company's pricing is exorbitant and not in line with the quality of work provided. While the worker's hourly pay structure motivates them to work diligently, it might be more cost-effective to hire an independent contractor from platforms like Craigslist for specific tasks rather than paying the company's premium rates.

The new Bacon-Bleu cheeseburger is a standout! With its flavorful combination of savory bacon and tangy bleu cheese, this burger is a delightful offering that sets itself apart from typical fast food fare. It's easily one of the best fast food burgers available right now, and the late Wendy's founder Dave Thomas would undoubtedly approve of this tasty creation.

While the carrot cake itself was decent, albeit pricey at $10 for a single slice, the service at this trendy cafe left much to be desired. Despite being one of the few customers during a relatively slow period, I had to wait an inexcusably long time for my simple cake order to be processed and packaged. The staff seemed disorganized and inattentive, leaving my cake sitting unattended on the counter for an extended period before addressing it. The ambiance and decor were charming, making it a potentially pleasant spot for a ladies' outing, but the lackadaisical service was a significant drawback. Overall, a mixed experience - the cake gets four stars, but the service only merits two.

This place deserves high praise for its delectable burgers and mouthwatering pulled pork, which are easily the best in the Reno/Sparks area. The food is excellently prepared and bursting with flavor, complemented by top-notch service that elevates the overall dining experience. It has undoubtedly become our go-to spot for indulging in outstanding comfort food.

The Smoked Salmon Frittata at this versatile restaurant is a delightful dish that delivers on its mouthwatering description. The harmonious blend of smoked salmon, fluffy eggs, crispy potatoes, sweet red bell peppers, tangy goat cheese, and the zesty kick of horseradish-dill crema create a symphony of flavors that truly satisfies. Complemented by fresh fruit, this frittata shines as a standout item on the menu. Whether you're seeking a delectable brunch, a casual dinner, or a private dining experience, this modern establishment is a stellar choice that consistently impresses with its culinary offerings.

Dinner for 9: A Memorable 70th Birthday Celebration at [Restaurant Name]. This upscale establishment provided an exceptional dining experience for our special occasion. Despite being on the pricier side, the outstanding steaks, entrees, and top-notch service made it worth every penny. The ambiance was inviting and added to the celebratory atmosphere. Highly recommended for those seeking a truly first-class dining experience.

The cuisine at this establishment is truly remarkable, with standout dishes like the delectable fried pickles and the irresistible smash fries. However, the outstanding food is overshadowed by the subpar customer service, which leaves much to be desired. While the culinary experience is top-notch, the overall dining experience suffers due to the lack of attentive and hospitable service.

Despite the hype, this taco joint fell short of expectations. Parking was a headache, and the 30-minute wait for just 5 tacos was unacceptable. The tacos were barely warm, and the flavors were underwhelming, with the buffalo chicken being a particular letdown. Only the BBQ and Korean tacos were decent, while the shrimp taco was mediocre. With the parking hassle and disappointing food, it's hard to justify a return visit.
While the gym facilities are decent, the MBSC Thrive program falls short, bringing down the overall rating.

While the prices are reasonable (4 stars), the food quality at this BBQ joint is just average (2.5 stars). The cheeseburger patty was tasty, but the pork BBQ sandwich was soggy. The BBQ sauce is decent, but not exceptional. The mac and cheese suffered from overcooked noodles. For locals, it's an occasional visit spot, but not a standout BBQ destination.

This Indian buffet offers a decent variety of dishes without being outstanding. While nothing will truly wow you, the selection covers many classic Indian favorites executed well. The real draw is the excellent value for money, making it an affordable option for those craving Indian cuisine. Overall, it's a reliable choice that won't disappoint, prompting a desire to return for a satisfying, budget-friendly meal.

On our first visit to this gym, we were disappointed by the lack of flexibility when it came to trying out the facility. Despite inquiring about a guest pass, the staff member rudely dismissed the option and insisted we purchase a one-day pass for $15 per person. This unfriendly policy left a sour taste, especially for newcomers looking to explore the gym before committing. Thankfully, we found a more welcoming environment at Retro Fitness, where we could take advantage of a free trial, better equipment, and a more inviting atmosphere. [Gym Name] missed an opportunity to win over potential new members with their inflexible and off-putting approach.

If you're a pizza connoisseur on the hunt for delectable pies, Brixx Pizza is a must-visit. Their menu caters to diverse dietary preferences, including gluten-free options, ensuring everyone can indulge. The perfectly portioned lunch offerings are a delightful treat for those seeking a satisfying mid-day meal. Beyond the mouthwatering pizzas, Brixx boasts a lively atmosphere with a wrap-around bar, making it an ideal spot to unwind after a long day at work. However, be sure to arrive early, as their inviting patio fills up quickly with fellow pizza enthusiasts. Brixx Pizza is a surefire win for those seeking a delectable and accommodating dining experience.

A Versatile and Healthy Gem! This establishment caters to a diverse range of dietary preferences, offering delectable options for meat eaters, vegetarians, and vegans alike. With multiple visits under my belt, I've yet to be disappointed by their offerings. It's a refreshing haven for those seeking a healthier dining experience in a welcoming atmosphere.

This frozen yogurt spot in Central Bucks is a solid choice with a friendly staff and tasty flavor options. While it was once my go-to, I've since discovered another contender that rivals it in terms of quality. Still, it's worth a visit if you're in the area and craving a good fro-yo fix.

Tranquil Lakeside Living at its Best! This apartment complex in St. Petersburg, FL, offers a serene environment surrounded by lakes, providing a peaceful oasis. The friendly and helpful leasing office staff added to the exceptional experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a tranquil stay in the area.

The Vieux Carre is an absolute must-visit when in New Orleans. This cozy bar transports you back to the prohibition era with its intimate atmosphere and live jazz performances. The highlight is the small side room where you can sink into a plush couch and savor their excellent Vieux Carre cocktail, a classic New Orleans drink. If you're looking for an authentic and immersive NOLA experience, this hidden gem should be on your list.

Sushiritos, the gimmicky sushi burrito joint, fell short in delivering a satisfying experience. While the ingredients tasted fresh, the flavors in the slammin' salmon sushirito were imbalanced, with an overpowering sauce that overwhelmed the crisp veggies and salmon. The Japanese fried chicken was dry and had a mediocre sweet-and-sour sauce. Their green tea and lemonade were decent but not standout items. Despite the potential appeal to Penn's campus crowd, the high prices don't justify the overall underwhelming meal. With plenty of better options available, Sushiritos failed to impress, making a return visit unlikely.

While Enzo's pizza doesn't quite live up to the former Nabruzzi's standards, it remains a solid takeout choice in the area. Their standout items are the meatball sub and garlic knots, with the meatballs boasting a homemade, high-quality taste. While the pizza may not be their forte anymore, Enzo's still merits visits for their other Italian offerings.

Special shoutout to Alya and the team for serving up delicious, high-quality fare that earned rave reviews from a discerning LA-based musician. Whether you're a foodie, health-conscious, or simply seeking an exceptional burger experience, Bareburger is a must-visit spot in the City of Brotherly Love.

Cosi is a reliable option for travelers seeking tasty flatbreads and salads. Their BBQ chicken flatbread is a standout dish, offering a generous portion size and delicious flavors. While not a destination in itself, Cosi provides a satisfying meal when on the road.

This used to be an excellent restaurant, but it has gone downhill significantly. When it was just the original location run by the owner, the food was amazing. However, since they expanded to multiple locations, both the service and food quality have suffered and are no longer up to par. The operational growth seems to have come at the expense of what made this place great initially. Unfortunately, the disappointing decline means I will no longer be a customer.

Disappointing experience. The egg roll was awful, and the sushi roll was chewy and unappetizing. Not surprising that the place was nearly empty. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for decent quality Asian cuisine.

If you're seeking a vibrant stay on Bourbon Street, this hotel offers a prime location with hospitable staff and satisfying dining options. The rooms are spacious, but be cautious when choosing your room location. While avoiding street-facing rooms may seem ideal, rooms near vending and ice machines can suffer from thin walls that amplify corridor noise. Despite the otherwise pleasant experience, the lack of soundproofing in certain areas warrants a 3-star rating.

Ocharleys disappointed with subpar service during a Sunday afternoon visit. Despite a moderate crowd, our server seemed overwhelmed, forgetting crucial items like bread, butter, and fries multiple times. Refills had to be obtained from the bar due to prolonged waits for the server. Even the coupon application required manager intervention after being initially overlooked. While the experience wasn't a complete disaster, the lack of attentiveness and consistent lapses left much to be desired. Ocharleys may warrant another chance, but perhaps during a less hectic lunchtime rush.

A Disappointing Experience: Overpriced and Underwhelming. This restaurant fails to deliver on both service and culinary fronts. Despite giving it a second chance, the terrible service and mediocre food remained consistent disappointments. With no innovative dishes and a clear prioritization of churning tables over customer satisfaction, the steep price tag of around $150 for two feels like a complete rip-off. Unless you're a tourist seeking a subpar dining experience, it's best to steer clear of this establishment and explore other options that offer better value for your money.

Unfortunately, there does not seem to be a formal 12-step program specifically designed to help manage a Reanimator Coffee problem. Reanimator Coffee is a fictional concept, likely referring to a humorous or satirical take on the idea of being overly reliant on or addicted to coffee.

However, if the underlying issue is a perceived addiction or unhealthy dependence on caffeine, there are general strategies and programs that could be applicable:

1. Seek support: While not a formal 12-step program, there are online communities and forums where individuals can share their experiences and offer mutual support in reducing caffeine intake.

2. Gradual reduction: Many experts recommend gradually reducing caffeine consumption over time rather than going "cold turkey" to minimize withdrawal symptoms like headaches and fatigue.

3. Identify triggers: Understand the situations or emotions that trigger a desire for caffeine, and develop alternative coping mechanisms or replacements.

4. Stay hydrated: Drinking water and other non-caffeinated beverages can help manage cravings and withdrawal symptoms.

5. Get enough sleep: Adequate rest can reduce the perceived need for caffeine as a pick-me-up.

6. Counseling or therapy: In cases of severe caffeine dependence or co-occurring conditions like anxiety or addiction, professional counseling or therapy can be beneficial.

While a humorous notion, managing caffeine intake and dependence can be a legitimate challenge for some individuals. Applying general strategies for habit change and seeking support as needed can be helpful.

The newly opened meadery is a delightful addition to the area, offering a fantastic selection of flavorful and well-crafted meads. With ABVs comparable to wine, their offerings like Goober Vitis, Suzy's Cherry Pie, and the coffee mead truly impressed with their pure, beautiful aromas and flavors. The spacious taproom provides ample seating, including a comfortable bar area and outdoor picnic tables. It's a great spot for mead enthusiasts and those looking to explore this unique beverage. With another meadery within close proximity, the neighborhood has become a haven for mead lovers.

Pina's offers a delightful casual dining experience with a diverse menu that caters to various cravings. Their dinner specials, cheesesteaks, calzones, and seafood dishes are standout favorites. The shrimp scampi appetizer (without linguini) and steamed clams are excellent and inexpensive options. The service is consistently flawless, making it a reliable choice for a satisfying meal. Pina's is a very good option for casual dining that won't disappoint.

If you're in town and looking for a lively pub to catch the big game, Chatham is a fantastic choice. As a visitor, I stumbled upon this gem and was delighted by their sports-friendly atmosphere and incredible deals, like $4 Guinness and Black and Tans on Tuesdays. While cheering on my team to victory, I indulged in their unique take on fish and chips. The fried fish had an unexpectedly soft, almost donut-like texture, which was a pleasant surprise. Chatham Pub offers a great spot to enjoy a game, a pint, and deliciously unconventional pub grub.

Fantastic Nail Salon with Talented Artists! After searching high and low in Tampa, my friend and I have finally found our holy grail nail spot. The artists at this salon, like Pamela and Steven, truly listen and execute intricate nail designs flawlessly. Despite being nearly an hour away, the quality and skill make the drive more than worth it. We won't be going anywhere else! Highly recommended for those seeking true nail artistry.

Exceptional service from Belinda and Jerry! As a travel nurse leaving my car in Boise for the winter, their kindness and helpfulness were truly outstanding. Despite my late arrival on a snowy evening, Belinda patiently waited, and Jerry went above and beyond by driving me to my storage shed and assisting with my luggage. Their dedication to ensuring a seamless storage experience is highly commendable. I wholeheartedly recommend their services!

Unique Air Services is a top-notch HVAC company that delivers exceptional service with professionalism and integrity. Their technicians are efficient, clean, and pleasant, while their pricing is extremely fair and competitive. The company's representatives, Mike P. and Chris, are outstanding professionals who prioritize transparency and honesty. The work was performed to the highest standards, leaving the house spotless. Unique Air Services comes highly recommended for their excellent service, quality workmanship, and competitive pricing.

This local eatery is a true gem! Their delicious food, lightning-fast delivery service, and friendly staff make it an absolute go-to for takeout. As a resident of 2601 Parkway, I appreciate their willingness to deliver right to my condo door, which many other places don't offer. Particularly noteworthy is their exceptional pizza – a must-try! Overall, this establishment operates with top-notch professionalism and customer satisfaction as their priorities. Highly recommended!

An absolute must-visit spot for authentic street tacos, excellent service, and delectable homemade horchata. The top-notch quality across the board makes this a standout destination for a truly satisfying dining experience.

The experience at this nail salon was disappointing. While my student technician was friendly and engaging, the service quality was subpar. It took an excessive 3 hours for a mani-pedi, with the manicure turning out terribly despite the lengthy process. No one checked on the work quality, and I should not have been charged for the unsatisfactory manicure. The pedicure felt great initially but was ruined upon putting my shoes back on, despite being assured it was ready. The only positive was the student's pleasant demeanor. However, the overall service was unacceptable, especially considering the $34 cost. 2 stars.

This restaurant offers a serene and intimate ambiance with its quiet and dimly lit setting. The menu features a diverse selection of Chinese and sushi dishes. The Szechuan chicken, hot and sour soup, and steamed rice were flavorful and satisfying. The prime rib and shrimp hot pot were also well-received. Portion sizes were just right, eliminating the need for doggy bags. The service was attentive and excellent, complementing the overall pleasant dining experience.

Dr. Frank is an exceptional dentist with a warm, gentle bedside manner. His genuine care for patients, combined with his exceptional dental skills, makes him a top-notch choice. I've been his patient for years, and many others have had similarly positive experiences. If you're seeking a new dentist, Dr. Frank comes highly recommended.

This trendy waterfront spot offers a delightful ambiance with its sidewalk lounge seating and an outdoor walk-up bar. On Friday nights, the atmosphere is further elevated by a DJ spinning tunes. The interior decor is visually appealing, adding to the overall experience. While we only sampled the appetizers, they were both satisfying and well-executed. Overall, it's a great place to enjoy a lively evening in a vibrant setting.

This place offers an exceptional happy hour special that's an incredible value. Despite the great deals, it wasn't overly crowded. The food and drink offerings on the happy hour menu were surprisingly delicious, far exceeding expectations for typical happy hour fare. The pork sliders and beignets for dessert were standout items that are highly recommended. The atmosphere was lively and fun, complemented by the friendly and attentive staff. Overall, a fantastic happy hour experience that's worth checking out.

A delightful dining experience! The service was exceptional, with Lisa being an attentive and friendly host. The fresh, flavorful food and the lovely outdoor seating area on a warm October evening created a beautiful atmosphere. We had an enjoyable evening chatting with Lisa, which added to the overall enjoyable experience. Highly recommended, and we'll definitely be returning for more!

The Lush store in New Orleans is my favorite among the ones I've visited across multiple cities like Arizona, San Francisco, San Jose, and Maui. The distinct and inviting aroma of this store can be detected from a block away, adding to the experience. I make it a tradition to visit this particular Lush location every Halloween, and it's always a delightful and fun time. The festive atmosphere and exceptional products make it a must-visit destination during the spooky season.

This place is an absolute gem for happy hour and dinner, though brunch is just okay. Their standout dish is the Asian Nachos, which are practically a meal in themselves. The other happy hour offerings and desserts, especially the crème brûlée, are fantastic too. The blueberry mojito and mango sling are must-try cocktails. It's a lively spot with a nice ambiance, perfect for celebrating birthdays. However, the bar area gets packed during happy hour, and parking around the mall can be a hassle. Overall, it's a fantastic option for drinks and dinner but less remarkable for brunch.

This bakery offers top-notch pastries that are an absolute delight for the taste buds. Despite some inexplicable negative reviews, the quality and flavor of their offerings are simply outstanding. The service is commendable, with staff members going above and beyond to ensure a pleasant experience, even for demanding customers. Their commitment to excellence is further evident in their ability to craft exquisite macaroons for special occasions like weddings. If you appreciate true culinary craftsmanship over mere affordability, this bakery is an absolute must-visit.

While the ingredients were fresh and the service commendable, the pizza at this establishment fell short of expectations. The crust was disappointingly thin, causing the pizza to cool rapidly and become unappetizingly floppy and bland. Despite a desire to enjoy the experience, the subpar pizza quality, coupled with the abundance of superior pizzerias in the vicinity, makes it an establishment I cannot recommend or plan to revisit.

Bier Brewery's tap room is a lively and enjoyable spot, with a rotating selection of unique craft beers that keeps things interesting. While my first visit was somewhat underwhelming, with only a couple of memorable brews, their constant rotation ensures a fresh challenge to create standout offerings. The atmosphere is vibrant, with patrons circulating to sample the weekly taps and socialize in the lounge area. Despite a 3-star rating this time, I'm optimistic about improving their score on future visits as they continue to experiment and evolve their craft. The unpredictable hours of operation, however, can be frustrating.

Sweet Confections on Magazine Street in New Orleans was a delightful find for a sweet treat after a savory lunch at Cochon. Our group of six girls sampled the delicious chocolate cupcake with mocha filling, as well as the raspberry, creme brulee, and orange truffles. The standouts were the mocha filling in the cupcake and the raspberry truffle with its perfect balance of dark chocolate and fruit. The coffee complemented the sweets nicely with its smooth, non-acidic flavor. The cafe had cozy indoor seating for our group, and the staff provided excellent service with helpful flavor recommendations. While the single staff member was gracious, an additional employee may have enhanced the experience slightly. Overall, it earned a well-deserved 4 out of 5 stars for the delectable sweets and enjoyable ambiance.

The pulled pork sandwich was delightful, showcasing the restaurant's expertise in delivering delicious flavors. However, the Asian fusion-style "Lucky Bun" burger was a letdown due to the use of a frozen beef patty. While the bread, toppings, and sauces were commendable, the processed patty overpowered and undermined the otherwise well-crafted burger. Had they used fresh, high-quality ground meat, it could have elevated the burger to a truly gourmet experience. Overall, a hit-and-miss scenario, where one dish shone while the other fell short of its potential.

This charming establishment is a delightful spot for families, offering a delectable range of treats that cater to both kids and adults. Children will be enchanted by the juice, cake slices, and homemade popsicles, making it feel like a whimsical tea party. For the grown-ups, the standout items include the unique red bean-filled homemade doughnuts, the refreshing popsicles, the delightful patbingsu (a Korean shaved ice dessert), and even the classic coffee with cream and sugar. With its ability to please all ages, this place is a must-visit for a delightful and memorable dining experience.

This pizza joint is an absolute gem! The crust is phenomenally delicious, and the toppings are incredibly fresh and unique compared to other places. The salads are also a tasty addition to the menu. The staff is friendly, and the outdoor patio offers a relaxing atmosphere to enjoy a beer or wine alongside the best pizza in town. An all-around fantastic dining experience!

Highly recommended gas station conveniently located on Clearwater Beach. As an employee at a nearby hotel, I frequently direct guests here as it's the only 24/7 option in the area. Reliable and accommodating service makes this a go-to spot for all your fuel and convenience store needs. The extended hours are a lifesaver for locals and visitors alike.

This St. Petersburg gem is an absolute must-visit! The food is out of this world delicious - no matter what you order, you can't go wrong. Be prepared for an incredible food coma after indulging in their decadent dishes. An amazing all-around dining experience.

This Chipotle location is a winner! During Teacher Appreciation Week, they efficiently served fresh, delicious food with minimal wait times. Their recognition of teachers is commendable. The white cilantro lime rice bowl with steak, black beans, and all the toppings, accompanied by a bag of fresh tortilla chips, is a must-try. Chipotle consistently delivers tasty, satisfying meals made with high-quality ingredients.

Jimmy John's delivered a standard meal, neither impressive nor disappointing. While the food didn't stand out, the restaurant itself was commendably clean. A serviceable option for a quick sandwich fix.

From start to finish, Dooners exceeded our expectations, making it a highly recommended destination for anyone visiting St. Petersburg. Without a doubt, I wouldn't hesitate to return on my next visit to the city.

The Alexander Hotel's bar is a must-visit for cocktail enthusiasts and ambiance seekers alike. Boasting a menu of vintage pre-Prohibition cocktails, the standout is undoubtedly "The Elephant in the Room" – a bourbon cocktail served in a cherrywood smoke-filled decanter, allowing you to infuse it to your desired level. The cozy indoor seating and spacious heated deck overlooking the street life create a inviting atmosphere.
