As an added novelty, you can watch people work out at the adjacent CityWay YMCA through the glass. Complement your drinks with the irresistible truffle oil and sea salt popcorn, which will have you craving more bags. If you're in the area, this bar offers a unique and memorable experience.

The hotel is secure and well-staffed with extremely polite and helpful personnel who go above and beyond to ensure a comfortable stay. While the location on a tight one-way street and lack of views from some rooms may present minor inconveniences, the overall experience is excellent. With its comfortable accommodations, attentive service, and prime location, the Hotel Monaco is highly recommended for anyone seeking a delightful stay in Philadelphia.

Cuchifrito el Mofongo is an authentic Colombian eatery in Northeast Philadelphia that offers delectable dishes at unbeatable prices. The oxtail soup (Sancocho) is a standout, with a hearty, stew-like broth and flavorful potatoes, setting it apart from the Korean-style soups you may be accustomed to. The portions are generous, and the Carne Asada (flat steak) is a crowd-pleaser, devoured in mere minutes. This hidden gem is a must-visit for those seeking an affordable and delicious culinary adventure in the City of Brotherly Love. Don't miss out on the vibrant flavors and welcoming atmosphere that Cuchifrito el Mofongo has to offer.

This place offers a delightful variety of fun donut flavors, but what truly stood out was their outstanding fried chicken. The chicken sandwich I tried was an absolute delight, bursting with flavor and perfectly fried. It's a must-try item that I highly recommend, alongside their delicious donut assortment. With friends, we sampled an array of their offerings, and the fried chicken sandwich emerged as the star of the show.

While on the pricey side, as expected in Santa Barbara, this charming and slightly hidden gem offers delectable fare that justifies the cost. The standout items include the heavenly green eggs and ham breakfast biscuit and the excellent Santa Barbara tri-tip sandwich. Their cold brew coffee and grab-and-go options, like the salami and pesto sammy, are also noteworthy. Despite the slightly steep prices, the exceptional quality and flavor make this a must-visit spot for those seeking a delightful culinary experience.

The food at this establishment is delightfully delicious, undoubtedly a major draw. However, the service leaves much to be desired, consistently slow and subpar even during non-peak hours when the restaurant is not particularly busy. While a certain degree of patience can be expected during rush times, the lackadaisical service is perplexing and detracts from the overall dining experience.

Review: Tasty Indian Gem for Casual Dining

If you're in search of an unpretentious yet delectable Indian dining experience, this restaurant is a must-visit. While the ambiance might not be particularly noteworthy, the prompt seating and pleasant service more than make up for it. But the real star of the show is the food itself.

The naan bread is delightfully soft, with the garlic variety being a standout, although purists might prefer the original. Regardless of your chosen entrée, you can't go wrong with the flavorful dishes on offer. While the spice level might not satisfy those who crave fiery heat, the flavors are sure to delight the average spice enthusiast. Highly recommended are the Masala or Vindaloo options, available with chicken, shrimp, or lamb.

Don't forget to save room for dessert and indulge in the creamy, sugary delight that is the Rice Pudding and Gulab Jaman combination – a heavenly treat to round off your meal.

Overall, this unassuming Indian restaurant offers a casual and enjoyable dining experience, with a focus on delivering truly delicious and flavorful fare at reasonable prices. A must-try for anyone seeking authentic and satisfying Indian cuisine.

While the location on Goleta's Hollister Avenue may not seem remarkable, this unassuming spot serves up an absolute showstopper of a burger. The reviewer boldly claims it's "the best burger of my life!" Despite the unspectacular surroundings, the burger itself is an otherworldly delight that deserves a visit from any true burger enthusiast. If you're in the area and craving an exceptional burger experience, this hidden gem is an absolute must-try.

While the stadium may provide opportunities for witnessing home runs due to its hitter-friendly design, the overall experience is marred by poor food quality, inadequate amenities, and the potential for encountering unpleasant fan behavior. Visitors are advised to bring their own food and exercise caution when attending games at Citizens Bank Park.

This old-school diner is an absolute gem! With its friendly staff and delectable homemade dishes, it's a must-visit. Their gumbo, grits, fried chicken, and out-of-this-world split pea soup were standouts, even converting a self-proclaimed shrimp-averse diner. The best part? All this deliciousness comes at insanely affordable prices, making it a true bargain for quality comfort food. An authentic and flavorful experience that's hard to beat!

Exquisite and one-of-a-kind jewelry await at this delightful store run by the warm and talented owners, Ali and Albisia. Their creations are so captivating that decision-making becomes a challenge. The inviting ambiance, enhanced by great music and complimentary wine, makes for a delightful shopping experience. Highly recommended for those seeking exceptional handcrafted pieces and a welcoming atmosphere.

While the menu offers good options and ingredients, this place falls short when it comes to sandwich assembly. The so-called "wraps" were more like "crumples," haphazardly thrown together by staff who seemed either confused or rushed. Watching the sandwich line was a painful experience, with employees appearing lost or disinterested in anything beyond basic bagels. The lack of clear signage and customer guidance only added to the disorganized atmosphere. Unless you're a fan of poorly constructed sandwiches and chaotic service, you might want to look elsewhere for your lunchtime fix.

This cute little bakery is an absolute gem! The employees are incredibly attentive and generous with their samples, allowing you to truly savor and appreciate the flavors before making a purchase. The star of the show is undoubtedly their banana puddings, particularly the salted caramel and strawberry varieties. Crafted with perfection, these multi-layered desserts boast smooth, flavorful cremes and delightful textures from the incorporation of wafers or pound cake. The upside pineapple cake is another standout, with its perfectly dense cake and well-balanced pineapple flavor, although the caramelized bottom can be a tad too chewy. Service is exceptional, leaving you wishing you could tip the friendly staff. Overall, this bakery is a must-visit for dessert lovers seeking meticulously crafted and delectable treats.

This new donut shop in Paoli offers a delightful array of delicious and creative donut flavors, leaving the mundane options at Dunkin' Donuts in the dust. With tempting varieties like Salted Caramel, Bacon Maple, and Lemon, their donuts are a true treat for donut connoisseurs. In addition to the stellar donut selection, they also serve a range of breakfast items like sandwiches, muffins, and bagels. If you're in the area and craving a high-quality, flavorful donut experience, this new spot is definitely worth a visit.

Initially disappointing visit, but the manager Chris handled the situation professionally. They decided to give the restaurant a second chance without any special treatment. During the second visit, the service was excellent, even though they were seated in the bar area due to the busy night. The server was attentive and friendly, and the food was well-prepared and delicious. Since then, they have returned multiple times, and the great service has remained consistent. The management's prompt response and the restaurant's ability to redeem itself with consistently good service and food deserve commendation.

Thrilled with my haircut! Reasonable prices and a talented stylist. While the color wasn't perfect the first time, the cut and style were outstanding. The second visit was an absolute success. I'm now a loyal customer and highly recommend this salon.

This Thai restaurant truly shines with its commitment to using fresh, healthy ingredients like Japanese squash instead of potatoes in the curry dishes. The sauces are phenomenal, and the extensive menu caters to all dietary needs since everything is made from scratch. Delightful extras like a welcome snack and origami-inspired straw wrappers elevate the experience. The desserts also impress by incorporating unique elements like black sticky rice. With its focus on quality and attention to detail, this gem has become my go-to spot for authentic and innovative Thai flavors. Highly recommended!

Rouses Market in Mid-city is a fantastic local grocery store that offers an impressive array of delicious and affordable options. Their deli, soup, hot bar, and salad bar selections are top-notch, providing a Whole Foods-like experience at a significantly lower cost. On weekends, they elevate the experience with crawfish or lobster boils available by the pound. Their fried chicken is an absolute standout, described as "BOMBlicious!!!!" Overall, if you live in the area, Rouses Market is an excellent go-to option for fresh, high-quality local groceries and prepared foods.

This cozy Victorian-style cafe in the French Quarter is a true gem. The atmosphere exudes a friendly and casual vibe, perfect for relaxing over delicious coffee and food. The barista's personable service, despite being understaffed, added to the charming experience. With both indoor and outdoor seating options, including a booth and counter, it caters well to those seeking a quiet retreat for reading or sketching. The dog-friendly policy is a bonus for pet owners. The only drawback was having to leave after just one visit during my trip to New Orleans. Highly recommended for locals and tourists alike seeking a quintessential cafe experience.

While the tea selection is decent, the prices at this establishment are simply too exorbitant to justify. There are far more affordable and equally delightful options available from reputable brands like Republic of Tea or the classic Twinings. Unless you're willing to splurge unnecessarily, it's advisable to explore other tea purveyors that offer better value for your money.

Millers had the potential to be a good neighborhood spot with ample parking, spacious seating, and a cozy fireplace ambiance. However, the underwhelming food and disappointing overall dining experience fell short of expectations. Despite often having long waits, suggesting popularity, the flavors were bland, portions were hit-or-miss, and the presentation lacked the attention to detail expected for the price point. While the service was attentive, and the scantily dressed hostesses may have been a distraction for some, the lackluster food quality and lack of value ultimately overshadowed any positive aspects. Unless significant improvements are made, this establishment is unlikely to warrant a return visit for a dine-in experience, with takeout being the only potential option for those craving their boneless wings.

Disappointing Quality Despite Convenient Location - While the facilities are nice, the lack of attention to detail and poor cleaning service is frustrating. Despite repeated visits over 6 months due to a membership, the staff consistently fails to thoroughly clean the vehicle, leaving areas like cup holders and door kick panels untouched. Communication is also challenging due to language barriers. It's a shame because the location is perfect, but the subpar quality overshadows this convenience.

The Libertine is a refreshing liquor bar for those seeking a straightforward yet elevated experience. While it caters to a discerning clientele, the establishment maintains an approachable charm with its commitment to using fresh, hand-crafted ingredients, even going as far as crushing ice with a mallet at the bar. However, the dimly lit restroom signage could use some improvement, as discerning between the men's and women's rooms can be a puzzling endeavor. Nonetheless, The Libertine offers a delightful escape for the simple man seeking a touch of sophistication in their libations.

An Exceptional Pizza Experience! As a self-proclaimed pizza connoisseur, I can confidently recommend this establishment. The pizza was top-notch, the service was friendly and efficient, and the overall experience was solid. Based on a recommendation, I visited with my family, and we were not disappointed. The food arrived promptly, and the quality exceeded expectations. I would happily return and recommend it to others seeking an outstanding pizza dining experience.

If you're a cheese lover, these deep-fried cheddar curds are a must-try delicacy. Despite being a bit pricey, they're worth the splurge. The light and crispy batter perfectly complements the stringy, melty cheddar without overpowering its delicious flavor. Unlike many fried foods, these curds aren't greasy, making them a delightfully indulgent treat. The accompanying sauces serve as delicate accompaniments, enhancing the overall experience. Once you've tasted these heavenly morsels, you'll be craving them again and seeking them out wherever they're available.

With its mouthwatering Cajun fare, welcoming vibe, and the charismatic presence of Joe Vuskovich, Yats is a culinary experience that shouldn't be missed. Whether you're a local or a visitor, this place is sure to leave a lasting impression on your taste buds and your heart.

After a disappointing experience at an Ethiopian restaurant, we stumbled upon Pi, famished and desperate. The accommodating staff promptly seated us and even provided complimentary garlic bread, sensing our hunger. We devoured two delectable pizzas, both deep dish and thin crust, which were consistently excellent as expected from our previous visits. Pi's exceptional service and consistently amazing pizzas saved the day, turning a disastrous dining experience into a satisfying one. Their attentiveness to customers and delicious offerings make Pi a reliable and highly recommended establishment in St. Louis.

I've been a patient at this dental practice for 5 years, primarily for wisdom teeth extraction. The dentists and staff did an excellent job with the procedure, and I have no complaints about the quality of care. However, one minor drawback is the lack of consistency in seeing the same dentist during each visit. Despite this, the overall experience has been positive, and I would recommend this practice for their professionalism and skilled dental work.

While the appetizers like the delicious takoyaki and fried octopus were enjoyable, the ramen dishes at this establishment fell short. The thin noodles were disappointingly mushy and overcooked, lacking the desired bouncy texture. The red spicy tonkotsu broth was overpowering in its heat, masking the depth of flavor, while the black garlic tonkotsu broth fared better. Despite the flavorful broths and reasonable pricing, the presence of unruly, screaming children detracted from the overall dining experience. The attractive decor couldn't compensate for the subpar noodles and disruptive atmosphere. While the appetizers showed potential, the lackluster ramen and chaotic environment make it difficult to wholeheartedly recommend this place.

Philly's Breakfast Gem: A Flavorful Delight! This unassuming cafe has quickly become my go-to spot for breakfast in the city. As a self-proclaimed breakfast fanatic, I've scoured through Philly's acclaimed eateries, but this hidden gem truly stands out. Despite its cozy ambiance, the menu packs a punch, offering incredibly flavorful yet refreshingly simple dishes that could easily draw crowds to a much larger establishment. If you're seeking an authentic and delectable breakfast experience, look no further than this culinary jewel.

This unassuming diner is an absolute gem! Despite its unimpressive appearance, the food is truly outstanding. The biscuits and gravy were mind-blowingly delicious, and the portion sizes were incredibly generous – so much so that I couldn't finish my plate. If I could rate it higher than 5 stars, I absolutely would. Don't let the looks fool you; this place deserves a visit for its fantastic diner fare.

Lüke is a hip and trendy restaurant that may be too casual for some, with a lively atmosphere and boisterous, casually dressed younger crowd. While the dress code is relaxed, the food is definitely worth it. The crispy Brussels sprouts starter is a standout, with a delightful sweet and sour sauce, fried until crispy, and topped with almonds, jalapeños, and cheese shavings. The pork schnitzel with shoestring fries (pommes frites) is also excellent, though the accompanying gravy is better skipped. The staff is attentive and accommodating, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The only downside is the crowded and noisy dining room, which may not appeal to everyone. Overall, Lüke gets 4 out of 5 stars for its delicious food and efficient service, despite the lively atmosphere.

This brewery is an absolute gem! The beer selection, featuring a delectable porter, a robust double IPA, and a refreshing table gutt, was simply outstanding. If you're a fan of Russian cuisine, their food offerings are equally impressive. During my visit, the sausage and sauerkraut special was a standout dish, bursting with flavors. The pickled everything appetizer was also a great choice, adding a tantalizing twist to the experience. Overall, this place is a must-visit for anyone seeking an exceptional combination of craft beers and delightful Russian fare.

If you're a true sushi aficionado who appreciates the simple pleasures of fresh, high-quality fish, Rickshaw Sushi is a must-visit in Reno. With an extensive array of sushi options in the city, Rickshaw stands out for its exceptional nigiri and sashimi. The fish is consistently fresh, outshining many of its competitors. While rolls and sauces may be appealing to some, Rickshaw excels in offering a pure and authentic sushi experience for purists who prefer to savor the delicate flavors of expertly prepared raw fish. For those seeking a refined and genuine sushi experience in Reno, Rickshaw is a top contender.

On my initial visit to this establishment, I left with mixed feelings. The parking situation was quite disappointing, making it an inconvenient start. While they offer a decent selection of draft beers, the food failed to impress thoroughly. We sampled a few appetizers, and the standout was the unique and delicious fried olives. However, the blue cheese chips, calamari, and meat/cheese platter were merely average. Overall, the experience was mediocre, but I might give them another try in the future. The potential is there, but some improvements are necessary to truly captivate customers.

While the ambiance at this establishment was pleasant enough, the limited menu and unremarkable food fall short of justifying the hype surrounding its opening. The cuisine fails to leave a lasting impression, rendering it forgettable at best. The saving grace, however, lies in its desirable location, which offers ample opportunities for exploration and sightseeing while waiting for a table. Overall, this restaurant struggles to live up to its billing, leaving diners with a sense of disappointment.

This ice cream parlor is an absolute gem! While I didn't get the chance to try their hot chocolate, the ice cream stole the show. From the indulgent brownie sundae loaded with three creamy scoops to the delightful nutter butter flavor with hot fudge topping, each treat was a delightful experience. Standout flavors included the smooth pumpkin cake and the rich pralines and cream. The service was exceptional, with friendly and patient staff who happily accommodated my indecisiveness and offered generous samples. Despite devouring the entire brownie sundae myself (no judgement here!), the welcoming atmosphere made it a guilt-free experience. Highly recommended for ice cream lovers seeking a delightful treat and top-notch service.

Lively Bistro offers a mixed dining experience. While the seafood dishes, like the flavorful Catfish Acadian, shine, the meat entrees fall short. The standout is the exceptional service from servers like Bria, who was attentive and personable. However, the upstairs dining area lacks ambiance, feeling somewhat warm and lackluster. The atmosphere might be better enjoyed on the balcony during cooler weather. Overall, Lively Bistro delivers tasty seafood options but leaves room for improvement in terms of the overall dining environment and non-seafood menu items.

While the comped bill was a small consolation, no amount of free food could make up for the terrible service and discrimination we encountered. We will not be returning, and caution others, especially from the LGBTQ+ community, to avoid this establishment at all costs.

Despite its seemingly inevitable demise, this particular K-Mart store stubbornly clings to life, a tired relic that smells funny and refuses to go anywhere. Its attempted updates are akin to Jack Palance's aged appearance, failing to conceal the store's inherent flaws. The frustration mounts with frequent instances of misleading sale prices, forcing customers to halt checkout lines and retrieve evidence from the aisles. Even worse, the store shamelessly hikes prices on desirable items from one day to the next, leaving customers feeling cheated and enraged. While a shiny new Target might be a welcome sight, stabbing this miserable son of a bitch through the heart with its superior retail sword, the indomitable K-Mart persists, a testament to resilience or a curse, depending on one's perspective.

Don't be deterred by the unassuming exterior; this Thai restaurant offers a charming ambiance and delectable fare at reasonable prices. While the papaya salad could use a lighter hand with the fish sauce, the triple flavor duck and king tofu soup are standout dishes. The BYOB policy is an added bonus, allowing you to complement your meal with your preferred beverages. Overall, a delightful hidden gem worth seeking out for its flavorful and budget-friendly Thai cuisine.

Overall, the Mazzoni Center provides exceptional healthcare services in a respectful and inclusive environment, making it a valuable resource for the LGBTQ+ community and allies alike, despite some minor operational areas for improvement.

As a Texan, I was utterly disappointed with the supposed "BBQ" served at this establishment. The sample platter was a horrific representation of what real barbecue should taste like. The chicken resembled and tasted like frozen, processed meat, the ribs were mostly cartilage, and the sausage was bland and forgettable. The sauce was an overly sweet concoction that tasted like a basic Walmart sauce with excessive sugar added. The portion sizes were laughably small, akin to a child's plate, yet priced exorbitantly. I would never recommend this place to anyone seeking authentic, high-quality barbecue. It's an insult to the proud barbecue traditions of Texas.

Vine & Tap is a cozy wine bar with an exceptional happy hour deal, offering $5 glasses of wine or $5 off bottles, perfect for sampling a variety of wines. The cheese plates are a standout, with excellent selections that pair perfectly with their impressive wine list. The sandwiches are also highly praised by foodies for their delicious aromas and flavors. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with a romantic enclosed patio area that's particularly charming during the winter months. The service is attentive and friendly, contributing to an overall delightful dining experience. Whether you're a wine connoisseur or simply seeking a relaxing evening with great food and drinks, Vine & Tap is an excellent choice.

Disappointing Experience at This Establishment. The staff was rude, and they couldn't even get a simple salad order correct. The pizza prices are exorbitant, especially for just ordering by the slice. Service was incredibly slow, despite being one of the few customers there at the time. Overall, it's an overpriced and underwhelming dining experience. I would not recommend wasting your money here.

This Mexican restaurant serves some of the most authentic and delicious cuisine around. As someone from California with high standards for Mexican food, the enchiladas with mole sauce and carne asada tacos are outstanding. The flavors transport you straight to places like Rosarito Beach in Mexico, making it a truly exceptional dining experience that tastes just like homemade family recipes. Highly recommended for those craving genuine, top-notch Mexican fare.

The Cinnamon Rolls from the bake house are an absolute must-try! They're so delicious that you'll want to get two because life would be a little less bright without them. The coffee and salads are also excellent, making it the perfect spot for a delightful Saturday morning breakfast treat. If you're in the area, don't miss out on these heavenly Cinnamon Rolls and the other tasty offerings.

Disappointing Carrot Cake Dessert. The carrot cake had an unpleasant taste reminiscent of licorice and baking soda, completely missing the mark on flavors. The inclusion of chocolate chips was also a puzzling and unwelcome addition. Despite an initially appealing presentation, the execution of this dessert fell flat. A missed opportunity for what should have been a delicious classic.

While the unlimited food at an unbeatable price is a major draw, the overall dining experience is hit-or-miss. The sushi shines as the standout item, but the salad and crab Rangoon fail to impress. Despite the inconsistencies, the affordability and delicious sushi make it worth returning.

The Bourbon Street eatery serves up the best chicken you could ever hope for. With juicy, flavorful chicken and a delicious sauce, everything is simply good. If you're craving exceptional poultry dishes, this place hits the spot. Highly recommended for chicken lovers.

While the $16 price tag for a burger and fries may seem steep, The Lama Burger delivers an exceptional dining experience that justifies the cost. The burger patty is generously sized and expertly crafted, featuring unique ingredients like gruyere-stuffed peppers that elevate the flavors. The fries arrive crispy and satisfying, complemented by a high-quality bun. The restaurant offers a wide selection of craft beers and a lively atmosphere, especially on weekends. Despite the initial sticker shock, the overall quality and creativity of the food make The Lama Burger a worthwhile indulgence for burger enthusiasts seeking an elevated dining experience.

Disappointing breakfast visit on 12/2/17. Sluggish service, lukewarm coffee and grits, lengthy wait for cinnamon biscuit after the meal was served, and a frustrating checkout process. This place has certainly gone downhill for breakfast options compared to other better choices in the area. I should have gone with my initial pick instead.

Termini Brothers Bakery is an absolute gem! As someone from an Italian family, their desserts are an essential part of our gatherings. Their cannolis are out of this world – perfectly crisp shells filled with a luscious, creamy filling. But it doesn't stop there; every item on their trays is simply divine. Highly recommended for anyone seeking authentic and delectable Italian pastries and desserts. Termini Brothers is truly the best!

Excellent experience! This hotel offers top-notch service, outstanding on-site dining options, and immaculately clean accommodations. The welcoming atmosphere and attention to detail make it a truly delightful place to stay.

After a trip to New Orleans, this diner found a newfound appreciation for their local gem in Reno. The standout dish is the shrimp po' boy, which they declare as their favorite menu item. Additionally, the cornbread receives high praise, described as amazing. Despite the temptations of the renowned New Orleans cuisine, this establishment managed to impress upon their return, solidifying its status as a beloved local favorite.

While the staff at this hair salon is generally friendly, I had a terrible experience with the stylist Katie. She rushed through my hair coloring and cut, spending less than 5 minutes on each, despite the hefty $200 price tag. It felt like she was in a hurry to leave for the day and shouldn't have accepted me as a client. The end result was disappointing, and the rushed service left me feeling shaken. I cannot recommend Katie as a stylist here.

The Pancake Pantry is a Nashville institution and a must-visit spot for breakfast, especially if you're craving their legendary banana pancakes. Located conveniently near Vanderbilt University, this place is perpetually busy, so be sure to park in the back lot and get a validation ticket for free parking. The banana pancakes are the star attraction – imagine the flavor of banana bread in a fluffy pancake form, sheer perfection! For many locals and visitors alike, a trip to Nashville isn't complete without indulging in these delectable pancakes at The Pancake Pantry.

MexiCali is a vegan-friendly gem in University City, offering a delightful array of plant-based options. The marinated tofu burrito is a standout, boasting a wonderfully chewy texture and a protein-packed punch that keeps you satisfied for hours. The sweet potato and plantain burrito, purportedly dairy-free, is another delicious and filling choice. For a lighter fare, the veggie tacos with spicy sweet potato, marinated tofu, and cabbage on corn tortillas are a flavorful option. And don't miss the homemade guacamole burrito, with its to-die-for delicious guac. Despite often having a line, MexiCali's efficient system ensures a timely burrito experience. With years of experience and a commitment to vegan options, MexiCali is a must-visit for plant-based diners in the area.

This breakfast spot offers a decent selection of well-executed dishes, particularly the omelets and impressive pastries. The eggs provençale, though flavorful with herbs and seasonings, suffered from inconsistent cooking. While the tomato side was a standout, the coffee was disappointingly bad, which can be a dealbreaker for many at breakfast. Additionally, the misspellings on the menu raise questions about attention to detail. Overall, it's a mixed bag – tasty food options but let down by the coffee and minor oversights.

This lively and energetic restaurant offers a cool atmosphere with a good beer selection, delicious but eclectic food, and big-screen TVs showing sports. While it's not a traditional sports bar vibe, it's a great spot for those seeking a bustling dining experience with tasty, flavorful dishes. However, if you're looking for a quieter, more laid-back setting to catch a game with pub grub and sports banter, this might not be the ideal choice.

Excellent windshield repair service! The process was fast, hassle-free, and best of all, completely free of charge. I highly recommend this company for their top-notch service and would undoubtedly use them again in the future.

An Outstanding Dining Experience in New Orleans! This restaurant exceeded all expectations with its impeccable service and exceptional cuisine. The meal started strong with the delectable fried oysters with bearnaise sauce and Benton's bacon, a must-try appetizer. The scallops and swine entrée, accompanied by a velvety butternut squash purée and balsamic vinegar, was a culinary delight. However, the true star of the show was the cafe au lait panna cotta with mini glazed donuts, reminiscent of the famous beignets at Cafe du Monde. The unique house-made 'cellos, including ginger and limecello, provided a perfect ending to an amazing dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking outstanding food and service in the heart of New Orleans.

BARRA is an absolute gem offering an exceptional dining experience with delectable food and outstanding service. The blood orange margaritas were strong and delicious, setting the tone for the fantastic meal. The appetizers, including melt-in-your-mouth veal and beef meatballs and a grilled cheese delight, were amazing. The main courses were equally impressive, with the flavorful and well-balanced fishermen stew and the perfectly cooked, juicy, and tender medium-well steak accompanied by a delightful cauliflower puree and vegetable medley. The attentive and knowledgeable staff provided excellent service, enhancing the overall experience. BARRA offers an intimate ambiance with great food and service at a reasonable price, making it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a memorable dining experience.

This bustling breakfast spot definitely lives up to the hype. Be prepared for a long wait, but it's worth it for the delicious and hearty pancakes. The cornmeal pancakes with all the fixings and the banana pancakes were standouts, though the small bacon portion was a letdown. The service was impressive given how packed it was. However, the coffee left much to be desired. The dilemma of whether to go with the homemade syrup or maple syrup (or both!) is a tasty problem to have. Overall, a great choice for a satisfying breakfast indulgence.

Visited this establishment on a Monday evening hoping to enjoy a daiquiri and catch part of the NBA basketball game. When politely asking the employee to turn on the game, she rudely stated she was watching Netflix instead and refused to accommodate. Completely lacking in customer service and unwilling to provide a pleasant experience for patrons. Will not be returning due to the staff's dismissive attitude toward customers. Not recommended.

The Pearl is a culinary gem that deserves the highest praise. With exceptional food, impeccable service, and a captivating ambiance, it offers a truly unparalleled dining experience. Every visit is a delightful indulgence, meticulously crafted to pamper and delight the senses. The Pearl is not just a restaurant; it's a destination for savoring the finer things in life. Prepare to be wowed!

The bagels here are pretty good, and the staff is generally pleasant, which is a rarity in Dunedin. However, the lack of proper hygiene from the staff is a major turn-off. During my visit, the employee handled money, used the phone, wiped his nose, and then prepared my bagel without washing his hands or wearing gloves. While the bagels taste decent, the unsanitary practices are unacceptable. I won't be returning unless the hygiene issues are addressed.

Despite the great reviews, my experience with this new barber was mixed. While my husband's haircut turned out fantastic, my son's cut unfortunately fell short of expectations. An inconsistent performance overall.

The steaks were delicious, but the restaurant is on the pricey side. While the tableside guacamole preparation is a nice touch, the flavor missed the mark. Overall, a decent experience, but you'll need to splurge for the quality.

New Day Meadery is a fantastic spot in Fountain Square for mead and cider lovers. With a wide variety of options ranging from sweet favorites like the South Cider and Shelby Blue Ribbon to seasonal offerings like the tart Paulding Light, there's something for every palate. The friendly staff and prompt service make for an enjoyable experience every time. While some seasonal meads may not be as sweet as their staple offerings, the ever-changing menu ensures there's always something new and exciting to try. Overall, New Day Meadery is a must-visit for anyone seeking a delightful mead or cider experience in a welcoming atmosphere.

While an improvement over the Philadelphia location, this restaurant still falls short of the outstanding Szechuan House in Hamilton, NJ. The Hamilton establishment remains the top choice for authentic and flavorful Szechuan cuisine.

An exceptional dining experience! The food is outstanding, with fresh ingredients that burst with flavor. The service is equally fantastic, making for a truly enjoyable meal. Highly recommended, and I'll definitely be returning.

Disappointing experience at Make Up For Ever, King of Prussia. Despite initially spending $75, I wasn't satisfied with the products after trying them for a few days. When I attempted to return the opened items, I was denied a refund but allowed to exchange them, albeit having to spend more money. The new receipt was stamped "FINAL SALE," leaving me feeling unsatisfied with the products and the store's inflexible return policy. In contrast, Sephora at King of Prussia offers a more generous return policy for the same Make Up For Ever products, allowing returns of gently used items. Moving forward, I'll be taking my business to Sephora for a better shopping experience.

This cozy spot is a gem for happy hour enthusiasts, offering an impressive selection of draft and bottled beers, paired with mouthwatering appetizers – the mac & cheese being a standout favorite. Discovered during the 2011 Center City Sips, it has since become a go-to destination for locals seeking a lively atmosphere and delectable bites. While the main floor can get crowded, the basement level provides a more intimate setting for private events, complete with its own bar. One minor drawback is the occasional intrusion of non-patrons seeking access to the ATM and restrooms, despite alternative facilities on the upper floors. Overall, this establishment is a must-visit for those in search of a memorable happy hour experience.

Disappointing service and order errors. On three separate occasions, I ordered a green tea lemonade but received a peach tea lemonade instead. Each time, I had to go back inside and have them remake my order, which was inconvenient and frustrating. The staff needs to be more attentive and accurate when taking and preparing orders. Overall, a lack of consistency and attention to detail.

While the free pizza coupon lured us in, the overall experience at this newly opened pizza joint was just average. The pizza itself wasn't exceptional, but it was decent and served quickly by the friendly pizza-making staff. However, the lackluster enthusiasm from the cashier dampened the visit somewhat. Convenience seems to be its strongest suit – we might return if in the vicinity and craving pizza, but it's not a destination worth going out of the way for. A forgettable but inoffensive option for a quick pizza fix.

The Eatery" has an impressive remodel, but the experience fell short. While greeted warmly, a strong dirty mop water stench lingered in the entry. The limited menu was a letdown, and the server struggled to be heard in the loud dining area. The highlight was the delicious "Knuckle Sandwich" tri-tip sandwich. However, the burger lacked flavor and was disappointingly small, the chicken strips were bland, and the fries were unremarkable. Despite a promising atmosphere, the lackluster food and service left much to be desired. With some improvements, this establishment could live up to its potential

Tuttini Caffe offers delicious breakfast fare, but their lunch service leaves much to be desired. Despite their posted hours stating lunch until 2:30 PM, I arrived at 1:45 PM and was told the kitchen was closing over 30 minutes early. The staff seemed willing to make a to-go order, but I wanted to dine in and enjoy my meal. Ultimately, I left and took my business to the nearby North Star Coffee instead. While the breakfast was tasty, Tuttini's inconsistent lunch hours and poor customer service are disappointing. 2 stars.

This place offers an excellent overall experience. The service is prompt and friendly, making you feel welcome. The portion sizes are generous, providing great value for the price. Particularly noteworthy are the pancakes, which boast the perfect fluffy yet substantial consistency. An absolute delight! Highly recommended.

An absolute gem! This place never disappoints. The crepes here are simply divine – hands down the best I've ever had. The flavors are amazingly delicious, and the quality is consistently excellent. The ambiance is calm and inviting, with friendly service that adds to the delightful experience. I highly recommend this spot and have been raving about it to all my friends, who have also given it a resounding thumbs up. If you're craving exceptional crepes in a cozy setting, this is the place to go.

Tires Plus in Flourtown continues to deliver excellent service. Having purchased tires from them multiple times, my recent visit for mounting 4 new Michelin tires was no exception. They honored my scheduled 9:00 appointment promptly and completed the work within an hour, making it a hassle-free experience. Highly recommended for their efficient and reliable tire services.

The Wildflower Triple at this brunch spot is a fantastic choice, allowing you to customize your selection from a variety of delicious options. The food was absolutely spectacular, with flavors that left a lasting impression. Complementing the outstanding fare was the friendly and attentive service, creating an overall enjoyable dining experience. This place is a must-visit for brunch, so much so that we're considering returning during our short stay in town.

An exceptional happy hour experience! The staff, particularly Vaughn and Mark, provided top-notch service that truly set this place apart. The complimentary appetizer was delightful, and the slot machines at the bar added an extra touch of fun and luck. With amazing service and a lively atmosphere, this happy hour is an absolute must-visit. We'll definitely be returning for more of this one-of-a-kind experience!

This place is a gem for those craving delicious yogurt and mouthwatering crepes. The yogurt flavors are fantastic, and the addition of crepes on the menu is an absolute treat. The atmosphere is welcoming and inviting, making it the perfect spot to indulge in these delectable treats. Highly recommended for a sweet escape or a satisfying snack. Don't miss out on this fantastic find!

Wine Fest Disappointment: Overcrowded and Underwhelming. This event was a letdown from start to finish. Despite arriving just 30 minutes after the scheduled start time, the venue was already unbearably packed, making it impossible to truly enjoy the experience. Most tents did not even offer wine tastings, instead featuring advertisements, beer, or food that required additional payment. By 3 PM, most tables had already run out of offerings, even though the event was supposed to continue until 5 PM. Overall, it was not worth the money, and I likely won't be returning next year.

The Tucson Seafood Boil has impressed me with their genuine service and dedication to ensuring a great dining experience. Although the seafood itself was just okay, which is understandable given the landlocked location, their servers went above and beyond, running to fulfill every request. The movie selections added a fun touch. While the prices are on the higher side, as expected for seafood boils, they are fair for the quality and quantity received. I particularly enjoyed their Asian-inspired sauce with varying spice levels. The Dungeness crab, being a full crab, can be a bit unpredictable in terms of portion size, so sharing or opting for their measurable selections might be advisable. Overall, I would recommend The Tucson Seafood Boil for their exceptional service and decent seafood offerings, making it a worthwhile experience.

The oso bucco ravioli at this restaurant were undoubtedly homemade, but lacked sufficient filling, resulting in a less flavorful dish than expected. While the service was commendable, the exceedingly loud ambiance made it challenging to communicate with the staff without raising one's voice. The establishment's tiny size and cramped seating arrangement detract from its suitability for a date night. Although the bring-your-own-bottle policy is a draw, the neighborhood offers numerous other appealing dining options that potentially provide a superior culinary experience with less noise and more comfortable seating. Overall, this restaurant falls short in terms of flavor, ambiance, and spaciousness, despite its fresh and well-prepared food.

Yuengling Lager holds a special place in my heart as the first beer I truly enjoyed after moving to Philadelphia from the Midwest. Its smooth, sweet taste and affordable price make it a top-five favorite. The Yuengling brewery tour was a delightful experience, with a humorous British guide who engaged well with visitors. I was amazed at the proximity to the active equipment and the historic, no-frills ambiance reminiscent of an old school building. The tasting was fantastic, and I indulged in the beloved lager multiple times. Additionally, the company's decision to rehire laid-off workers after a closure adds to their appeal as a family-owned business worth supporting in the face of industry giants like InBev. Overall, Yuengling Lager and its brewery tour offer a taste of Philadelphia's brewing heritage and a genuinely enjoyable experience.

During the busy Mardi Gras weekend, this establishment failed to deliver a satisfactory experience. While the outdoor seating area and convenient location near the parade route were appreciated, the poor service and lackluster food overshadowed these positives. The bartenders displayed a concerning lack of knowledge and attentiveness, ignoring customers and struggling with basic drink orders. The pizza was a disappointment, further detracting from the overall dining experience. Despite the added convenience of portable restrooms, the establishment's shortcomings in service and quality make it difficult to recommend, especially during peak seasons like Mardi Gras.

Welcoming Oasis for Pampering Pedicures"

This cozy salon offers a relaxing ambiance and top-notch pedicure services. The staff is incredibly friendly, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The salon's commitment to cleanliness is evident, ensuring a hygienic experience. If you're seeking a soothing pedicure in a tranquil environment, this is an excellent choice. Highly recommended for indulging in some well-deserved self-care

Grill 25, the new downtown burger joint from the Harry & Izzy's chain, offers a solid burger experience. While the burgers are tasty, the need to order sides separately adds to the overall cost, following a current industry trend. Reservations are accepted, which is a convenient feature. The menu is burger-centric, so those seeking diverse options may want to look elsewhere. A weekday lunch special could attract more daytime diners and make it more affordable. Overall, the service and ambiance are enjoyable, making Grill 25 a worthy spot for burger enthusiasts seeking a satisfying meal.

While the salad was satisfactory, the pizza was a major letdown - bland, unappetizing, and overall unsatisfying. Adding to the unpleasant experience, the interior felt uncomfortably cold on a chilly evening. Despite giving it three chances, this restaurant failed to impress, prompting the decision to not return in the future. The lackluster food quality and uncomfortable ambiance make it difficult to recommend this establishment.

The sandwich bar was closed, so I settled for a burrito, which turned out to be a huge letdown. For $8, I received a microwaved burrito slathered with an unappetizing cream of chicken and old cheese topping. It was a nasty and overpriced meal that left me utterly unimpressed. I could have had a far better and fresher option at Taco Bell for a fraction of the cost. An utter disappointment and a waste of money - I would not recommend this place based on my experience.

This old-school brewpub offers a cozy, family-friendly atmosphere with plenty of games to keep kids entertained. The beer selection is solid, though lacking in adventurous offerings. The food is a mixed bag – the pizza can be a gooey mess, but the scotch egg dishes (including on pizza and burgers) are tasty albeit overly salty. The burgers are a safe bet, and the desserts, especially the frangipane, are excellent. For a relaxing experience, pair the ploughman's plate with one of their good beers. While not perfect, this brewpub delivers a enjoyable casual dining experience with some standout items.

Zen Yai is a tiny, cozy Thai restaurant with a vibrant and refreshing decor. While the prices for their curry dishes are excellent at less than $12, the small size can be a double-edged sword – it's great if you don't have to wait, but can be frustrating during busy periods. The service is prompt, with food arriving quickly. The Pineapple curry is a standout dish, with the rice served in an enjoyable pyramid shape. However, the green curry fell short of expectations, leaving a seasoned lover of the dish disappointed. Overall, Zen Yai offers a decent dining experience with a few high points and a few misses, earning it a respectable 3.5 stars.

Overall, this hotel offers a fantastic experience, thanks to its remarkable staff and well-appointed accommodations. The reviewer highly recommends it and looks forward to future stays, with the hope of seeing Louis back in the elevator.

This sushi restaurant offers delightful rolls and a fantastic selection of sake. The highlight, however, is the bamboo room, which provides an immersive and authentic dining experience. Be prepared for a bit of agility as seating in this room might require some maneuvering. Overall, it's a great spot for sushi lovers seeking a taste of Japan.

Highly recommended! Their food delivery service is a game-changer. The gyro was absolutely massive and delicious – perfectly seasoned meat, authentic tzatziki, and no need for sides as the gyro itself was incredibly filling. Both the gyro and fries were flavorful, making it a satisfying and authentic Greek dining experience without even leaving home. I'll definitely be ordering from them again!

This Thai restaurant offers a tasty happy hour selection, including a refreshingly balanced dragonberry iced tea. The lemongrass chicken and rice dish was fantastic, though the crab rangoon could have used more filling. Despite that minor critique, the dipping sauce was great. The service has been consistently good across multiple visits. Overall, the flavorful food and pleasant dining experience make this a reliable spot for Thai cuisine.

A consistently remarkable experience! The #1 Deluxe is a standout, and the service is truly exceptional. Special shoutout to Amanda for going above and beyond with her excellent customer service. Highly recommended!

While the hotel's unique charm and great location initially appealed to me, my stay was unfortunately marred by a bed bug infestation. Despite the management's efforts to accommodate us, having to discard personal belongings worth hundreds of dollars and the lingering worry of bringing these pests home overshadowed any positive aspects of the hotel. Until the establishment undergoes a thorough remediation process, I cannot recommend staying here due to the high risk of encountering these unwanted guests. Proceed with extreme caution.

Disappointing breakfast experience at this establishment. Despite arriving early on a Saturday with no wait, the service and food quality left much to be desired. While the sweet potato pancakes with cinnamon cream syrup were decent, the hash browns were borderline inedible. The total bill of $24.43 before tip seemed overpriced for the mediocre offering. Additionally, the restroom lacked paper towels, which was a minor yet unsatisfactory detail. Overall, I would not recommend this place and would instead suggest purchasing the syrup separately for home use if you crave that particular item.

The Marsh store offers a convenient shopping experience with its spacious layout and wide aisles, making it easy to navigate and avoid crowds. However, the store could use some attention to detail, as the condition of the red baskets leaves much to be desired. While the product selection remains impressive, as expected from Marsh, the checkout process could be improved by having an adequate number of cashiers on duty to prevent long lines. Overall, it's a decent shopping destination, but addressing the minor issues could enhance the overall customer experience.

This place offers a truly unique dining experience. From the moment you arrive and are greeted with complimentary coffee or tea, you know you're in for something special. The creative menu showcases inventive dishes that are both delicious and visually appealing, making each visit an adventure for the senses. Their Bloody Marys are also a standout, perfectly crafted and a must-try. With impeccable service and an atmosphere that encourages culinary exploration, this restaurant is a gem for those seeking an extraordinary culinary journey.

This place offers a delightful ambiance coupled with an impressive beer selection. The Asian chicken salads and Cajun pasta we tried were both outstanding. Highly recommended, and we'll definitely be back.

While this review isn't specific to this location, it's a testament to the enduring love for this establishment. Having been a patron for nearly 25 years since their college days, the reviewer is thrilled to see the chain's expansion. The spacious seating, cleanliness, and lively atmosphere at this particular spot are praiseworthy, though the lack of Herr's chips, a Delaware staple, is a minor letdown. Nonetheless, if this location upholds the quality of others, it's bound to be a great addition to the area. The reviewer eagerly awaits the chain's arrival in Huntsville, AL, underscoring their long-standing fondness for this beloved eatery.

While the initial prices seemed reasonable, this Mexican restaurant charges extra for every side item like chips, salsa, rice, and beans. This nickel-and-diming approach might be acceptable if the food quality was exceptional, but sadly it is subpar at best. The rice was hard and dry, the burritos were sad and limp, and the service was lacking with rude waitstaff both visits. The only redeeming qualities were the decent guacamole and strong margaritas. It seems their strategy is to get customers drunk enough not to care about the lackluster food and poor service. Unless the margaritas are the main draw, there are likely better Mexican dining options in the area.

Hidden Gem in Trolley Square! This cozy Italian restaurant is an absolute delight. The friendly and knowledgeable waiter made us feel right at home, sharing the restaurant's history and offering excellent recommendations. The food is authentically delicious, with fresh ingredients and recipes straight from Sicily. The prosciutto-wrapped shrimp appetizer and homemade cannoli were standouts, and the penne alla vodka and spaghetti with meatballs were fantastic. Generous portions and a special offer (two entrees, free appetizer) made it an exceptional value. If you're craving authentic Italian cuisine without breaking the bank, this hidden gem is a must-try!

Despite the lack of alcohol (which would have been a welcome relief after a stressful week), this pizzeria delivered a delightful dining experience. The margherita pizza is a must-try, boasting a fresh and delicious taste. The Greek salad, brimming with flavorful veggies, made for a satisfying appetizer. Overall, a solid 3.5 stars for the scrumptious food, but the absence of an adult beverage selection left something to be desired.

Mr. Wizard's Frozen Yogurt: A Refreshing Treat with a Catch

Pros:
- Offers a healthier alternative to frozen custard with their delicious frozen yogurt
- Provides pre-selected combinations and the freedom to create your own customized treat
- Variety in flavor options

Cons:
- Limited seating options with only outdoor seating available
- Dining in your car may be necessary during colder weather

Overall, Mr. Wizard's Frozen Yogurt is a great choice for those seeking a refreshing and relatively guilt-free dessert. The ability to customize your frozen yogurt makes it a fun and personalized experience. However, the lack of indoor seating can be inconvenient, especially during inclement weather conditions.

Despite the unclear significance behind the restaurant's name and logo, Tres Amigos delivers a delightful dining experience. The extensive menu offers a wide variety of options for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert, ensuring there's something for every palate. The food is described as great, and the staff is praised for their friendly service. Furthermore, the restaurant's 24-hour operation adds to its convenience. Overall, Tres Amigos is a recommended stop for anyone visiting the area, and the reviewer plans to return on their next visit."

Spasso is an absolute gem! Their creative and delectable dishes, like the seafood pappardelle special with jumbo shrimp and lump crab, are simply heavenly. The service is attentive and friendly, and the wine selection pairs perfectly with their fare. Even the leftovers were just as delightful the next day. Located conveniently on State Street, Spasso is a must-visit for an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended!

While they may use quality products, their idea of being a "high-end" salon seems to translate into exorbitant pricing and a lack of basic customer service. I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're willing to spend hundreds of dollars for a simple nail service.

Scoopful's Ice Cream Parlor in Belmawr offers decent ice cream at an above-average price. While the flavors weren't exceptional, the treat satisfied my craving for something sweet during my visit. The service was friendly but sluggish, and the parlor's decor has a charming, nostalgic vibe. It's a convenient option for locals, but not a destination worth traveling for. If you're in the area and need a quick ice cream fix, it could hit the spot, but don't expect an extraordinary experience.

Devlin's Auto Body Shop in Philadelphia is a true gem. My Honda Fit had accumulated numerous dents, scratches, and unsightly stains, making it look well-worn despite being only 3 years old. After taking it to Devlin's, the finished result was simply remarkable – my car looked brand new, as if it had just come off the assembly line. Ed Devlin's exceptional workmanship is nothing short of miraculous, and the best part is that his services are incredibly affordable. I was pleasantly surprised by the reasonable cost. If you're in need of top-notch auto body repair at a fair price, Devlin's is undoubtedly the place to go.

45 is a quintessential dive bar with a laid-back, 'Cheers'-like atmosphere where regulars are warmly welcomed. While the cigarette smoke may deter some, it adds to the bar's gritty charm for those who don't mind it. On game days, 45 offers a generous spread of complimentary food, a rarity in today's bar scene. During baseball season, the establishment is a haven for Red Sox fans, so non-fans beware. Conveniently located near Tipitina's, it's an ideal pre or post-show stop, often accompanied by a tantalizing food truck parked outside. If you're seeking an unpretentious, dive-y experience with a friendly local vibe, 45 is a solid choice.

The coffee at this establishment is undoubtedly excellent in terms of quality. However, the experience is somewhat dampened by the pretentious and intimidating practice of not providing cream and sugar unless requested. Coffee is a simple pleasure, and patrons should be able to enjoy it as they prefer without unnecessary hassle. While the coffee itself shines, the reluctance to readily offer basic accompaniments detracts from the overall experience.

While I haven't ventured beyond their grits, this place has undoubtedly earned the title of my favorite brunch spot. Their grits are an absolute masterpiece – perfectly creamy and flavorful, never grainy or watery. The portion size is generous, making it easy to share (if you can bear to part with it!). Customizing your dish is a delightful experience, with a variety of toppings available for a small additional cost. I'm a fan of loading up with avocados, red bell peppers, bacon, cheddar, and mushrooms. While I haven't tried their other offerings yet, the grits alone are enough to keep me coming back again and again. Whenever I crave a comforting and delicious brunch, this is my go-to spot.

This restaurant is a winner with its exceptional staff and delicious cuisine, particularly the chili cheese etoufee, which is an absolute must-try. The outdoor seating area is a delightful addition, perfect for enjoying a meal on a pleasant evening. However, the cash-only payment policy prevents it from receiving a perfect 5-star rating. Don't forget to order the garlic sauce, which is highly recommended by patrons. Overall, it's a fantastic dining experience that shouldn't be missed.

The Beach Shack offers a delightful outdoor dining experience with impressive views of the ocean. While the menu and service are fairly standard for a beachside eatery, it's a fantastic spot to unwind with a refreshing beverage and soak in the picturesque scenery.

All About Hair and its owner, Lou, deserve more than just five stars - they're simply exceptional. After a three-year odyssey of disappointing haircuts, I've finally found my go-to barbershop. Lou's incredible haircutting skills are complemented by his warm and inviting demeanor, making the experience truly enjoyable. The fantastic conversation and welcoming environment left me compelled to write this glowing review. All About Hair has earned a lifelong customer in me, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a top-notch barbering experience.

While the destination itself was enjoyable enough for a family visit, the medical treatment experience left much to be desired. The derma bond adhesive used did a poor job, resulting in a noticeable scar on my young child despite their squirminess being an expected challenge at that age. Expecting top-notch care, especially for kids, shouldn't be too much to ask for. Disappointing medical outcome marred an otherwise decent trip.

This airport hotel offers a unique and thrilling experience for aviation enthusiasts. The highlight is its revolving rooftop restaurant, providing stunning panoramic views of the runways and control tower. The hotel's direct connection to the airport terminal, with its array of dining and shopping options, adds to the convenience. While the proximity to the airport ensures easy access, it also means potential noise from aircraft operations. Overall, it's a remarkable choice for those seeking an immersive airport experience.

A must-visit eatery with outstanding turkey, beans, and biscuits. While the pecan pie could be better, the delicious main dishes more than make up for it. Highly recommended and I'll definitely be returning!

Sunnyside Diner offers a spacious menu in a clean and welcoming environment. The staff is friendly, and the restaurant was fairly busy during our midday visit. While our experience was limited to sandwiches, the meal was enjoyable. They have a decent selection of draft beers, wine, and cocktails. The paper tablecloths and crayons provided make it a family-friendly spot. Overall, a solid choice for a casual dining experience.

The crab cocktail was delightfully delicious, and my husband thoroughly enjoyed his steamers. However, the humidity inside the restaurant was quite uncomfortable, making a fan a welcomed addition. Overall, a tasty experience but the lack of proper ventilation was a drawback.

Freddy's serves up an unbeatable fast-food burger experience. Their burgers are top-notch, featuring fresh patties and an impressive array of toppings. The fries are equally exceptional, perfectly complemented by their signature "fry" sauce. But the true star of the show is Freddy's rich and creamy custard, a decadent treat that's as delicious as their savory offerings. With outstanding food across the board, Freddy's is a must-visit for anyone craving a fantastic fast-casual meal.

Delightful Donut Delicacies! This place offers fantastic donuts that are not only deliciously soft but also well-priced. The blueberry cake donut and apple fritter were particular standouts. Highly recommended, and we can't wait to return for more of their scrumptious treats!

For an establishment catering to both adults and families, such a lack of attention to customers is unacceptable. I sincerely hope this incident was an isolated occurrence and not a reflection of the brand's standards elsewhere. Improvements in customer service and communication are crucial to prevent similar disappointments in the future.

Allegro's offers delicious and affordable pizza with lightning-fast service. The Sicilian and meaty varieties are standouts, but the stuffed options can sometimes have cold centers. While the food is excellent, the service can be rude at times, and the restaurant attracts some eccentric patrons. Despite these minor drawbacks, Allegro's is a great spot for tasty, inexpensive pizza in a lively atmosphere.

The Peppermill Resort Spa Casino in Reno, Nevada, offers an exceptional experience for guests, combining classic casino charm with modern amenities and outstanding service. From the moment you step through the doors, you're treated like a valued patron. The reviewer consistently stays at the Peppermill during visits to Reno and finds the service improving with each stay.

One of the standout features is the generous complimentary offers, such as free nights and free play credits, which add tremendous value to the overall experience. The casino is renowned for having the loosest slots, enhancing the excitement and chances of winning.

The rooms are well-maintained, with clean bathrooms and no issues with pests, ensuring a comfortable stay. The casino itself exudes an old-school vibe with its dazzling displays of neon signs and millions of light bulbs, evoking a nostalgic ambiance.

Dining options abound, with excellent restaurants within the casino catering to various cravings. Highlights include the happy hour at the Fireside Lounge, offering mini appetizers and $3 martinis, and the Fish Bar, which boasts a mesmerizing 40-foot aquarium wrapping around two walls, creating a serene atmosphere.

The friendly staff is consistently praised as the top reason for returning to this casino, exemplifying exceptional customer service.

While the dazzling lights in the casino can be disorienting, the provided key sleeve with a map serves as a handy guide to navigate the premises.

Overall, the Peppermill Resort Spa Casino offers an unforgettable experience, blending classic casino charm with modern conveniences, generous perks, and unparalleled service, making it a top destination for visitors to Reno.

A delightful dining experience! The burger and pulled pork were excellent, while the egg white and goat cheese omelet was a hit with my wife. The solid beer list and spicy bloody Mary complemented the flavorful dishes. Service was attentive, and the eclectic playlist added to the enjoyable ambiance. Highly recommended for a satisfying meal in a lively atmosphere.

Disappointing experience at the Peppermill. Despite assisting in restraining a belligerent guest who was assaulting others, I was treated poorly by the staff. Instead of gratitude, I was threatened with trespassing charges and received no follow-up or resolution from management or security despite multiple attempts to address the situation. The lack of appreciation and customer service is unacceptable. I cannot recommend this establishment after such treatment.

If you're on a student budget, this massive convention center with up to 2,000 guestrooms can be a great option, but be prepared for overpriced food and beverages. While the service, including the shuttle, is well-done and the place is immaculately clean, dining options within the center like Wasabi and the pizza place can be quite expensive. Consider staying at one of the budget hotels across the street, like Days Inn, where you'll pay much less (around $55/night in this case) but still be within walking distance to the shuttle pick-up. These nearby hotels also offer more affordable dining options like Cracker Barrel, Applebee's, Chili's, and McDonald's. Inside the convention center, you'll find more restaurants and bars like Finley's Pub, FUSE nightclub, STAX burger, and Jack Daniel's, but be prepared for higher prices.

While this restaurant has been a favorite for family lunches due to their personal pizzas for kids, our recent visit was disappointing. Despite ordering this way several times before, we were informed that the kids could not have BBQ sauce as the base instead of tomato sauce on their pizzas, even when we offered to pay extra. This inflexibility, especially for children's meals, was frustrating. The kids were looking forward to their usual order, but we had to leave and find another restaurant to accommodate their preferences. It's unfortunate as they previously enjoyed dining here, but the rigid policy has made it an unviable option for our family lunches moving forward.

Hidden Gem! This charming spot is a delightful find, offering a warm welcome from the friendly staff and irresistibly delicious cookie dough. Despite getting lost in town, stumbling upon this place turned out to be a serendipitous discovery. An absolute must-visit for anyone with a sweet tooth!

Disappointing Taco Experience: While the tacos were passable, nothing about this establishment stood out. The chips and salsa were subpar, leaving much to be desired. Overall, it was a forgettable dining experience lacking any memorable qualities or flavors.

A delightful addition to Reno's culinary scene! This new spot offers authentic and delicious matcha and ube flavored desserts. While the menu is currently limited, the soft serve, cake, and sauces are well-executed and not overly sweet. The friendly staff and solid foundation make this a promising establishment. Looking forward to an expanded selection of flavors in the future.

Hidden Gem Near Home: A small, cozy eatery with a hip hop vibe and a compact yet flavorful menu. The standout dish was the indulgent Duck Fries – a generous portion of fries smothered in smoked gouda, shredded duck, and scallions. The scallop and foie gras tacos were a delightful special, though the ethical concerns around foie gras did dampen the enjoyment slightly. The pork roll burger was a juicy, perfectly cooked delight. Despite its unassuming appearance, this place packs a punch with its creative and well-executed dishes. Definitely worth multiple visits for those seeking a satisfying dining experience close to home.

Three Muses: A Tapas Delight in the Heart of New Orleans

Nestled in the vibrant heart of New Orleans, Three Muses offers an exquisite tapas experience that captures the essence of the city's culinary heritage. With a diverse menu of small plates designed for sharing, this establishment invites diners to embark on a flavorful journey through a tapestry of flavors.

From the delectable blue cheese-stuffed dates to the delightfully crispy crawfish egg rolls, each dish is a testament to the chef's culinary prowess. The standout dishes, however, were the lamb sliders and the steak and cake. The former, a harmonious blend of succulent lamb and tangy goat cheese, left an indelible impression, while the latter showcased a crab cake that could rightfully claim the title of the best in town.

While the fish tacos may not have been a personal favorite, the feta fries were a delightful accompaniment, adding a touch of creamy indulgence to the meal.

Overall, Three Muses is a must-visit destination for those seeking an authentic tapas experience in New Orleans. With its vibrant atmosphere and exceptional dishes, it offers a delightful opportunity to savor the city's culinary delights, one shared plate at a time.

The restaurant boasts a trendy and modern ambiance with great decor, setting the stage for an enjoyable dining experience. While the presentation of the dishes was visually appealing, the food itself fell a bit short, with undercooked potatoes and greasy pancakes. However, the excellent service and the enticing appearance of other menu items like the French toast and omelets warrant giving it another try, especially for lunch. Overall, it's a promising spot that could benefit from some refinements in the kitchen.

This restaurant is an absolute gem! The food is outstanding, with dynamite dishes that tantalize the taste buds. The service is top-notch, with a super friendly staff that adds to the exceptional dining experience. But the true star of the show is their homemade flan, which is hands-down the best I've ever tasted – a true coup de grace! The prices are reasonable, making it an incredible value. The only thing that could make this place even better is if they had a liquor license. Overall, it's a must-visit establishment that delivers on all fronts.

We stumbled upon this place for a quick breakfast stopover, and we're glad we did! Despite being busy on a Saturday morning, there was no wait time. The food was delicious, and the service, especially from Jonathan, was top-notch. Definitely a great find for a satisfying weekend breakfast with family or friends.

The Praline Connection in New Orleans delivered an authentic taste of Southern soul food that left my dad reminiscing about his childhood. While the fried chicken and red beans and rice were undeniable standouts, receiving high praise from my dad, the other dishes had their hits and misses. The ribs were flavorful but challenging to eat gracefully, and the mac and cheese lacked seasoning. However, the cornbread and potato salad were enjoyable sides. Despite a few minor hiccups, the overall experience was satisfying, especially for my dad, who couldn't stop raving about the flavors that transported him back to his grandmother's cooking. If you're craving authentic Southern comfort food, The Praline Connection is a must-visit, particularly for their exceptional fried chicken.

Buddy Brew in Hyde Park Village is a trendy coffee shop that offers a delightful coffee experience. The coffee drinks are flavorful, and the beautiful latte art on the lattes and cappuccinos is a nice touch. The modern and stylish interior design evokes the vibe of coffee shops in New York City. While the free parking is a plus, the limited seating and overly cold temperature inside the shop might make it more suitable for grabbing your coffee to go and enjoying a stroll around the picturesque Hyde Park Village.

V Vegaz Salon is a spacious, stylish spot in the East Loop that deserves more recognition. Despite being a walk-in my first visit, I keep returning for the excellent cuts from Callie. The modern-meets-baroque interior has a lively, pleasant vibe among the happy staff. As a guy with tricky hair, Callie listens to my evolving preferences and cuts accordingly, delivering styles that still look great a month later - a rarity for me. While I haven't tried their color services, V Vegaz offers full salon treatments beyond just basic cuts. It's an underrated gem worth checking out for a quality, on-trend haircut in a cool, friendly atmosphere.

Exceptional alteration service! The talented seamstress worked her magic on my pants, suit jacket, and sleeves, delivering impeccable alterations in just one day. Despite the tight deadline and intricate nature of the work, the results were flawlessly executed. The suit now fits me like a dream, thanks to her expertise. Convenient payment options and flexible hours made the experience even better. Highly recommended and will undoubtedly return for future alteration needs.

The Irish Pol is a hidden gem for craft beer lovers, especially on weekends. My first visit on a lively Saturday night revealed an impressive selection of beers on tap and a fun, vibrant atmosphere. However, a recent happy hour visit left me slightly disappointed. The dimly lit interior felt a bit dingy, and the crowd was considerably older, giving off an odd vibe. While the beer selection remained excellent, the happy hour deals weren't as enticing, with many of the desirable drafts excluded from the $3 special. I'd recommend skipping the Irish Pol for happy hour but making it a priority for weekend nightlife if you're in the mood for great brews and an energetic ambiance.

An absolute must-visit for Italian cuisine lovers! This charming restaurant serves the most delectable spaghetti and meatballs I've ever tasted. The cozy ambiance adds to the delightful dining experience, making it my new favorite Italian haunt. Highly recommended for those seeking authentic and flavorful Italian fare in a warm, inviting setting.

Happy Hour at this restaurant is a fantastic deal with 50-cent oysters and half-priced drinks. We indulged in both, along with the beet salad (divine), mussels, and flammenkuchen (a delicious appetizer that served as my entree). The flammenkuchen, with its caramelized onions, melted cheese, and generous portions of bacon, was a standout dish, far surpassing the versions I've had in Strasbourg. Everything was excellent, making it a highly recommended spot for a delightful dining experience.

This restaurant has proven to be a reliable choice for families, offering a pleasant dining experience with no smoke or excessive noise. The food and service have consistently met expectations on my three visits, all of which were on late Tuesday afternoons. The menu offers a variety of satisfying options, and I've been happy with the different dishes I've tried. It's a definite contender for future family outings.

An absolute delight! This pizzeria offers an irresistible combination of delectable pizza, a stunning ambiance, and attentive service. The inviting atmosphere sets the stage for a memorable dining experience, complemented by the speedy and friendly service. Highly recommended for those seeking an exceptional pizza outing.

Richard's in downtown is a delightful spot for an excellent Italian meal. The fresh Caesar salad and bread started the dinner off right. The star of the show was the delectable cheese ravioli with an exquisite pesto cream sauce that complemented the pasta perfectly without overwhelming it. The Dunham cabernet made for a tasty pairing. An all-around scrumptious and enjoyable dining experience at this welcome downtown addition.

A delightful breakfast spot in the French Quarter! The outdoor patio is charming, and the open-air interior lets in refreshing breezes. The French toast was delicious, and they promptly replaced a dropped fried egg order. The vanilla latte was perfectly sweet without needing additives. Despite a minor mishap, the attentive service and tasty fare made for a really nice experience overall. Highly recommended for a relaxing breakfast in a lovely setting.

While the atmosphere and service were inviting at this eatery, the food fell slightly short of expectations. The quiche and croque madame had minor issues with the crust and bread quality, but the fresh fruit and great coffee partly made up for it. Despite the slight hiccups, the overall experience warrants a return visit.

Salty's is a must-visit restaurant for families, offering a diverse kids menu and delectable options for adults. While the Crabby Dip appetizer was tasty, it was slightly overpriced. The main courses, including the Salty Burger and macadamia crusted grouper, were excellent choices.
