The attentive service complemented the delightful dining experience, making it a five-star visit overall. Salty's has secured a spot on our list of places to revisit whenever we're back in town.

While the shredded beef dishes are usually a hit, today's chili beef nachos were unfortunately a miss. My boyfriend fell violently ill after eating them, likely due to ingredients that were not as fresh as they should have been. The chicken burrito I ordered also caused some stomach issues. Despite this disappointing experience, we've been loyal customers drawn by the delicious shredded beef dishes. However, this visit serves as a reminder to ensure food quality and freshness are consistently maintained. An off day in those regards can lead to a really unpleasant dining experience.

A nostalgic gem! This place captures the essence of a classic music venue. The tunes are fantastic, creating an incredible ambiance. However, seating is extremely limited, so arrive early to secure a spot. Overall, it's a solid 4-star experience for music enthusiasts seeking an authentic vibe.
Save yourself the trouble and skip this restaurant. The recommendation is clear: go to Blue Fin or Masamoto instead for a better dining experience. This place is not worth your time or money.

Pepper Tree Inn offered a decent stay for a bachelorette party in Santa Barbara, considering the high prices of other hotels in the area. The rooms were clean, cozy, and relatively comfortable, with charming exterior and grounds. However, the decor was dated, and there were some issues with the toilet, door, and noise levels. Despite the lack of amenities like a hair dryer or complimentary breakfast, it served as a reasonably priced option for a weekend stay in the location. While not outstanding, Pepper Tree Inn provided a satisfactory experience for the price point and fulfilled the group's needs for the bachelorette celebration.

Johnny Rockets is a reliable choice for a classic diner experience. Their recent barbecued pulled pork burger promotion was a hit, offering a generous portion with plenty of flavor. Paired with their signature endless fries, it's a satisfying meal that leaves you content. However, it's worth noting that since their relocation from the casino floor to the shopping level, they no longer offer the singing and dancing entertainment, which was a unique part of the Johnny Rockets ambiance. Despite this change, the food quality remains consistent, making it a solid option for those craving a classic American diner meal.

Avoid this salon at all costs. The facility is appallingly unsanitary with cobwebs, dust, and dilapidated equipment everywhere. Unprofessionalism runs rampant - my nail technician was brazenly watching YouTube videos instead of focusing on her work. I have no idea how this place continues operating given the obvious health code violations. Do yourself a favor and go literally anywhere else for nail services. A zero-star experience.

A fantastic local business with a wide selection and a delightful perk - free popcorn! Why pay for overpriced snacks at the big chains when you can support a homegrown gem that treats you right? Their commitment to quality and customer satisfaction shines through in their generous freebies. A must-visit for anyone seeking a personalized shopping experience without sacrificing variety.

This place continues to be a beloved spot, thanks to its friendly and knowledgeable staff, spacious seating with ample outlets, and, of course, delicious tea offerings. The "Awake" Fizz Tea remains a standout, but the reviewer has also embraced the bubble tea craze, particularly enjoying the taro flavor. However, the warm bubble tea did come with a bit of suspense, as the tapioca pearls created a mini anxiety attack with each sip, never knowing when one might make its way up the straw. Despite this minor quirk, the tea is deemed worth the suspense. The only real drawback mentioned is the somewhat distracting music selection, but this can be easily remedied by bringing headphones and listening to one's own tunes. Overall, it remains a highly recommended spot for tea lovers seeking a welcoming atmosphere and quality beverages.

Yah Man is a must-visit Caribbean gem in the Tampa area. Their beef pie, chicken dishes, and island sampler plates are deliciously authentic, and the bread pudding is simply heavenly. The warm and personable service adds to the inviting atmosphere, ensuring you leave feeling full and satisfied. This is a highly recommended spot for locals and visitors alike, evidenced by the reviewer's third enthusiastic post about the restaurant on Yelp. If you're craving delectable Caribbean flavors and a welcoming ambiance, Yah Man is the place to be.

The Spotted Cat Music Club is a delightful hidden gem in New Orleans. This chill backyard bar offers a cozy atmosphere with fantastic live local music. The wine and cheese bar up front is a charming touch, allowing you to curate a delectable cheese plate and pair it with a mid-range bottle from their impressive wine selection. While seating can be tight for larger groups, the intimate setting adds to the charm. It's a perfect spot to escape the touristy crowds and savor the city's vibrant music scene like a local. A must-visit for an authentic New Orleans experience.

A hidden gem! This cozy eatery offers a delightful dining experience. The menu caters to various tastes, with delectable options like the classic chicken Caesar salad and the ability to customize your own salad. The friendly and attentive service, specifically our cheerful waitress, allowed us to savor our meal without feeling rushed. The ambiance is inviting, creating a tranquil oasis tucked away from the hustle and bustle outside. Highly recommended for a relaxing and enjoyable lunch.

Despite making a reservation over a week in advance with a specific seating request, the establishment had no record of it upon arrival. We were seated in an undesirable location near the bathroom, while better tables remained open for other reserved guests. The cocktails, food, band, and atmosphere were excellent (5 stars), but the lack of organization and disregard for our reservation was disappointing (1 star). The staff blamed a new employee for the mix-up, but it's a reminder to always call and confirm reservations, especially at a place that has provided amazing experiences in the past. An otherwise enjoyable evening was marred by poor handling of our reservation.

Exceptional tattoo experience! Bryan's artistry and the friendly staff make this the top tattoo shop in town. My husband and I are thrilled with our new ink. Highly recommend their new location at 1418 N. Clairborne, Suite 5 (upstairs).

Conway Family Wines in Santa Barbara is an exceptional winery offering breathtaking views, outstanding wines, and exceptional hospitality. The Conway cabernet sauvignons are among the best in the region, and their Rolo's Red is a crowd-pleaser for both wine connoisseurs and novices alike. The owners, Tom and Gillian, are generous hosts who consistently provide an outstanding tasting experience. Even industry professionals rave about the warm welcome and quality wines. With a tasting room employee gifting a coveted Conway Reserve Syrah, it's clear that Conway Family Wines goes above and beyond to create a memorable and delightful experience for all visitors.

Disappointing Drink, Friendly Service. The draft latte here was subpar - just plain bad stuff (BS). However, the employee at the register was friendly and complimented my tie, providing a pleasant interaction. Overall, the poor beverage quality drags the rating down, but the nice service helps slightly. 5/10.

This place is a culinary gem! The BBQ shrimp and truffle-infused dishes like the truffle fries and truffle butter filet mignon are absolute must-tries. The bread pudding and white chocolate brownie provide a delightful sweet ending. Exceptional flavors and highly recommended!

An utterly unique and enchanting experience! This wine and cheese shop offers a delightful twist on traditional dining. You get to handpick your favorite bottle(s) of wine, cheeses, and meats, which are then transformed into a stunning charcuterie platter complete with nuts, spreads, and fresh artisan bread. The cozy outdoor (or indoor) seating area provides the perfect ambiance to savor your customized board and wine. While a kitchen menu is available, the platter itself is remarkably satisfying. Highly recommended for a charming and memorable outing!

An Exceptional Gem in Manayunk! This charming eatery offered one of the most delightful dining experiences I've had in a long time. The warm and friendly service from Smiley himself was truly remarkable. But the real star was the delicious food – so good that I'm happily enjoying the leftovers for lunch today! An absolute must-visit for anyone in the Manayunk area. Don't let this hidden gem slip under your radar!

This upscale steakhouse delivers an exceptional dining experience on par with renowned establishments like Ocean Prime and Ruth's Chris. The steaks are a cut above average, expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. The service is impeccable, with attentive and knowledgeable staff ensuring a seamless evening. Additionally, the extensive wine list is a true highlight, offering an excellent selection to complement your meal. Whether you're a steak connoisseur or simply seeking a refined dining experience, this steakhouse is a must-visit destination.

This small restaurant offers a unique seating arrangement where parties of four or fewer may share a table, separated by a small partition. While the close quarters can contribute to a lively and bustling atmosphere, it can also get quite noisy. The service was attentive and efficient. The menu items we tried, including the Kale Caesar Salad and Fried Chicken with Mac n Cheese, were decent but nothing exceptional. The salad's soft-boiled egg, encased in a crispy crust with a runny yolk, was a highlight. However, they ran out of watermelon, which meant altering the side that typically accompanies the chicken dish. Overall, it's a cozy spot with good service, but the food is average at best.

Disappointing service and subpar brews. Despite requesting a table, we were ignored by the staff for an unreasonably long time. The flight of beers we eventually ordered took forever to arrive, and the flavors were underwhelming, with one beer even tasting like soap. Compared to the enjoyable flights offered at other breweries, this experience fell short of expectations. Poor service and lackluster beer quality make it difficult to recommend this establishment.

Overall, it's a bit of a dive, but the low prices may make up for the lack of traditional breakfast service or attentive waitstaff. Just don't expect a pleasant, relaxed dining experience. Suitable for those on a tight budget who don't mind a chaotic atmosphere.

The Greek diner offers an authentic and delicious dining experience. Their Greek omelette, loaded with flavorful ingredients like feta, gyro meat, tomato, and spinach, is a standout dish. The classic home fries are perfectly cooked, and the service is outstanding. It's a must-visit spot, and we can't wait to return on our next visit to the area.

Disappointing service. Over 30 minutes went by, and we were only served miso soup and drinks. No entrees had even been started despite ordering food. Unacceptably slow and inattentive service. We ended up leaving hungry without being served our main courses.

Dr. [Name] is an exceptional medical professional. With a warm and friendly demeanor, they create a welcoming environment that puts patients at ease. Their attentiveness ensures that every concern is thoroughly addressed, and their professionalism inspires confidence. What sets them apart is their ability to inject humor into the consultation, making the experience not only informative but also enjoyable. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a compassionate and competent healthcare provider.

While the ramen didn't quite live up to expectations compared to offerings in New York, this restaurant in Philadelphia proved to be a hidden gem thanks to its outstanding sushi rolls. The standout was the Steven roll, which ranked among the best rolls I've ever had. Thankfully, I followed the staff's recommendations and ordered it despite an initial craving for ramen. The Steven roll alone makes this place worth a return visit the next time I'm in Philly. The ramen may have fallen short, but the sushi more than made up for it.

This restaurant seems to prioritize service based on age and perceived wealth rather than treating all customers equally. Our young waitress catered attentively to older, well-dressed patrons while largely ignoring us. She rarely checked on us, neglecting to inquire about our steaks which were not prepared as expected. Management also failed to follow up on our experience despite visiting other tables. For an $80 bill, the lack of basic courtesy and subpar service left us very disappointed. Unless you fit their apparent discriminatory criteria, you may encounter a frustrating double standard here.

The Paris Hair Salon offers an exceptional hair care experience. With their warm and friendly atmosphere, combined with skilled professionals who truly understand hair, particularly thick and unruly textures, this salon stands out. The staff takes the time to meticulously work through each client's hair, ensuring excellent results every time, whether it's a cut, color, or highlights. Maureen Kerfoot highly recommends the salon, praising the perfect execution and reasonable pricing."

While the new Chick-fil-A location was initially a dream come true for the author, the excitement quickly turned to frustration. The double-lane drive-through system seems to be a mystery to Nashville residents, causing excruciatingly long wait times. Additionally, the unconventional layout, with the drive-through wrapping around the front of the restaurant, only adds to the inconvenience. The only saving grace is the free Wi-Fi, allowing customers to pass the time on their phones while enduring the interminable queue. Ultimately, the author has chosen to avoid this particular location altogether, opting to make the trek to other areas for their beloved waffle fries and Chick-fil-A experience.

An excellent dining experience! The fast and efficient service allows you to linger without feeling rushed after your meal. The fresh and flavorful food is the real highlight, with standouts like the delicious chicken taco salad and tasty plantains. The refreshing mojito is also a must-try. Highly recommended, and I'll definitely be returning to explore more of their delectable offerings.

The Sultans of Schlep provided an exceptional moving experience. Their attentive and responsive owner, Tom, offered fair prices and complimentary wardrobe boxes. The punctual and efficient movers made the entire process seamless. And let's not forget their delightfully witty company name! I wholeheartedly recommend their services for any upcoming move.

Fantastic pedicure experience! The salon was immaculate, and I was attended to promptly without any wait. The staff demonstrated exceptional expertise during my pedicure, making it an amazing treatment. While I did not get a massage, the pedicure service alone was outstanding. Highly recommended!

Yats is a true gem for Cajun food lovers. With an ever-changing chalkboard menu that keeps things exciting, you never know what delectable Cajun delights await. Their dishes are not only incredibly flavorful but also surprisingly affordable. Yats has earned its place as a regular haunt for me and my wife, consistently delivering the best Cajun cuisine we've ever tasted. If you're seeking an authentic and unpredictably delicious Cajun experience, Yats is an absolute must-visit.

While primarily known for their pizza, Castrillo's also offers a delightful selection of sandwiches. The roast beef sandwich I ordered was absolutely delicious, though the wait time of 15-20 minutes was a bit lengthy. The lack of seating inside the restaurant can be inconvenient, but the nearby community patio provides an outdoor dining option. I'm excited to try their pizza next, as I've heard nothing but praise for it.

Excellent urgent care experience at Med Express during our beach vacation! The staff, including the nurse and doctor, were incredibly friendly, compassionate, and patient while addressing my daughter's ear pain. Although removing the wax blockage was challenging, they persevered until successful. The convenience of having Target nearby to fill the prescribed antibiotics at a lower cost was a bonus. Highly recommended for prompt and attentive care while traveling.

This place serves hands down the best veggie wings I've ever had. Their crispy, flavorful meatless wings are an absolute must-try and will leave you craving more. The fried pickles are also a solid choice for a tasty appetizer. However, the drinks could be a tad stronger. I'd recommend sticking to the Mexican coke for a refreshing beverage to accompany your meal. Overall, the veggie wings alone make this spot a winner in my book!

This quaint diner sets itself apart from the typical greasy spoon with its charming ambiance. While the Yankee pot roast lacked flavor, with bland meat and mediocre mashed potatoes, the fresh vegetables were a standout. The omelette received high marks from my wife. Despite the hit-or-miss food, the attentive service was excellent, making for an overall pleasant dining experience. If you're in the mood for a cozy diner with a good vibe, it's worth a visit, but don't expect mind-blowing cuisine.

An absolute letdown. The Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Bento Box from [Restaurant Name] fails to meet the most basic expectation of a bento box - it comes without any rice! It's an unforgivable oversight for a Japanese-style meal, leaving me utterly disappointed. Zero stars.

Brooke's latest musical endeavor, a fusion of pop and electronic dance music (EDM), falls flat and fails to resonate. The attempt to blend these genres results in a cacophonous mess that lacks cohesion and artistic merit. The overly synthetic production drowns out any genuine emotional connection, leaving the listener feeling disconnected and unsatisfied. Brooke's pop-EDM experiment is a misstep that needs to be abandoned in favor of a more authentic and compelling musical direction.

This hotel offers a great value with its affordable pricing and convenient location. The accommodations are decent, with reasonably sized rooms. However, the bed is quite firm, and the sheets are unpleasantly rough. Despite these minor drawbacks, the overall experience is satisfactory, and I would consider staying here again.

This unassuming eatery delivers delectable Italian fare, with perfectly cooked pasta, delicious chicken parmesan, and a tasty pizza. What truly stands out, however, is the exceptional service from the lone cashier/waitress, who effortlessly managed a packed house with seamless efficiency and grace. A gem worth experiencing for both the flavorful food and impressive one-woman show behind the counter.

This beachfront restaurant offers an unparalleled dining experience. While the food itself is delightful, the real draw is the breathtaking view and ambiance. Enjoying a meal al fresco, with the soothing sound of crashing waves as your soundtrack, is simply sublime. Adding to the allure, they serve beer, making it an ideal spot for a laid-back evening. Whether you're a local or visiting the area, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit, even if it requires a drive. Prepare to be enchanted and yearning for a return visit.

The private room at this venue is an excellent choice for hosting events. With its dedicated bar and bathroom, our party enjoyed a seamless experience without any hassle or wait for drinks. The spacious area provided an ideal setting for comfortable mingling and conversations. The buffet offerings were delightful, making it an all-around enjoyable experience. I highly recommend considering this private room for your next gathering.

First-time visit at this salon and it was a fantastic experience! Tori, the stylist, was incredibly friendly and attentive. She expertly recreated the hairstyle I wanted and even provided product recommendations tailored to my hair type. The salon itself was clean, modern, and conveniently located with ample parking. Highly recommended for a professional and personalized hair service.

Flavorful burger with excellent seasoning and generous sides like homemade chips, waffle fries, and sweet potato fries. The outdoor patio dining was pleasant, though a smoke-free policy would be preferred. Our waiter Jesse provided attentive service. While slightly off the beaten path, this hidden gem exceeded expectations with its delicious food and great overall experience. Highly recommend based on a friend's suggestion - will definitely return.

I've been a loyal customer of Mark's at Blades for over 2 years now. Coming from expensive salons where I paid $35 plus tip for a haircut, I was initially apprehensive about trying a new place. However, knowing that the owner had salon experience gave me the confidence to give Blades a shot. Mark is not only a skilled barber who consistently delivers great haircuts, but he's also an incredibly friendly and personable guy. I highly recommend Mark and Blades for an excellent haircut at a reasonable price.

This modern, trendy restaurant is a great spot for young diners in their 20s. The mahi mahi entrée, served with pita chips and hummus, was a standout dish. The fish was cooked to perfection, tender and packed with flavor. The appetizer of hummus and pita chips was also quite enjoyable. Service was attentive and efficient, contributing to an overall pleasant dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a contemporary ambiance and delicious seafood dishes.

Ding Ding Dim Sum is a standout restaurant in Reno for authentic and delicious dim sum. While their dim sum menu may be somewhat limited, the quality is exceptional, making it the best place in town for favorites like chicken feet and siu mai. Their dim sum is freshly made, unlike some other places that serve pre-frozen varieties. The restaurant offers tasty combo meals as well, with highlights like sesame chicken, beef and broccoli, and shrimp and vegetables, accompanied by appetizers and soup. It's a go-to spot for cravings, unless you're willing to make the trip over to Sacramento. Ding Ding Dim Sum consistently delivers a fantastic dining experience for dim sum lovers and Chinese cuisine enthusiasts alike.

The cheeseburger and fries were the highlight of my meal, with the burger cooked to perfection and the fries reaching the peak of crispiness. Overall, no complaints from our group of eight – a great time was had by all! Highly recommended for a delightful dining experience.

An absolute must-try! The bayou burger is an extraordinary culinary delight, undoubtedly the finest burger I've ever savored. Complemented by an excellent staff that elevates the overall experience, this place earns an enthusiastic two thumbs up from me. Highly recommended!

An exceptional experience at this private dining event! The food, from the delightful hors d'oeuvres to the melt-in-your-mouth filet mignon, was outstanding. The service was impeccable – attentive yet unobtrusive. The private room offered a breathtaking view, even better than the main dining area. Highly recommended for corporate events or special occasions. A truly memorable dining experience.

Lazos Pizza is a standout in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area. Their pizza and wings are among the best we've had in the neighborhood, with perfectly crispy pepperoni and wings that defy the usual soggy norm. The only minor hiccup was receiving a Sprite instead of the requested Coke, but overall it was an excellent pizza and wing combo that we'll definitely order again.

The garganelli with roast pork ragu, mushrooms, and Creole tomatoes was the star of the show. The light sauce expertly blended the flavors, while the tender, caramelized roast pork stole the spotlight, leaving diners craving for more. A hidden gem that marries old-world elegance with impeccable culinary craftsmanship.

Excellent Location, Friendly Staff, but Pricey Parking"

This hotel boasts a prime location, just a stone's throw away from the vibrant Bourbon Street bars and within easy walking distance of popular attractions like Harrah's Casino and Jackson Square. The staff receives high praise for their warm hospitality and willingness to assist guests. However, the steep $38 nightly parking fee is a notable drawback. Overall, if you prioritize convenience and a welcoming atmosphere, this hotel could be a great choice, but be prepared for the additional parking expense

This store is a true gem! With an impressive selection of designer brands like Chloe, Marc Jacobs, and Chanel, it offers exceptional value for money, especially during their ongoing summer sales. While the Chanel pumps at $87 were a steal, they were unfortunately too small for me. The price range is fantastic, with high-quality silk blouses available for around $100, a fraction of their typical retail price. The friendly and attentive staff, particularly the lovely lady who assisted me, added to the overall positive experience. This store has become my go-to destination for designer fashion at unbeatable prices.

Velvet Lounge has a disappointing experience for those expecting a welcoming atmosphere or attentive service. Despite offering free happy hours, their disorganized management fails to honor reservations or communicate effectively. The staff, from bouncers to bartenders, lacks friendliness and efficiency. While the free booze is a perk, the dress code, unappealing crowd, and overall lack of hospitality make it an undesirable destination unless you're solely interested in getting drunk on a budget before moving elsewhere. With numerous better options available, Velvet Lounge falls short in delivering a enjoyable night out.

This 7-Eleven has a nice, clean and spacious interior with an impressive selection of prepared meals. However, my experience at the checkout counter was deeply disappointing and left me feeling disrespected. When I questioned the clearly incorrect $19.99 price listed for plastic cups, instead of checking the actual price, the cashier and manager attempted to mislead me by quoting a made-up $14.99 price. Their unscrupulous behavior seemed motivated by racial prejudice, assuming I would blindly accept whatever inflated price they stated. This underhanded tactic is unacceptable and has led me to completely lose trust in the integrity of this establishment. Despite the appealing store appearance, the dishonest pricing practices have soured my view and make me unable to recommend this location.
With such disgraceful treatment of patrons and subpar workmanship, I cannot recommend this nail salon to anyone. Steer clear and find a place that values its clients."

In the scorching heat, there's nothing more refreshing than indulging in the frozen treats from this gelati haven. Despite calorie concerns or diabetes risks, their delectable gelati offer a much-needed respite from the sweltering temperatures. An absolute five-star rating for their ability to cool us down with their delightful frozen delicacies. PS: Don't miss their website for a touch of Vanilla Ice!

If you're looking for a lively weekend brunch experience, this place hits the spot. Their all-you-can-drink brunch deal for $20 on Saturdays and Sundays is an absolute steal. You get your choice of unlimited bloody marys or mimosas, along with their tasty brunch items. It's the perfect setup for a fun 'Sunday Funday' with friends. The unlimited drinks and laidback vibe make it an excellent spot to indulge and kick back on the weekend.

This no-frills eatery delivers flavorful Chinese dishes and an impressive beer lineup. While the sushi remains untested, the Chinese food is a solid choice for take-out. The staff may not be the warmest, but they're sufficiently pleasant for a casual dining experience. Just manage your expectations accordingly, as this is a reasonably priced, unfussy establishment. If you're seeking authentic Chinese flavors and an extensive beer menu, it's worth a visit.

Andres Richard Salon on Locust St is a true gem! I had the pleasure of getting a balayage and fix for my brassy ombre from Stephanie, a junior stylist, and the results were exceptional. Stephanie was attentive, catered to my requests, and delivered exactly what I wanted after a year of disappointing experiences at other salons. Her technical skills, creativity, and expert hair care were outstanding. I've finally found my go-to stylist and won't trust anyone else with my hair. Highly recommend Andres Richard Salon for top-notch hair services.

This Mexican restaurant offers a festive atmosphere with a nice variety of Spanish music. The service is attentive and they get orders right, even for picky eaters. While the salad was lackluster, made with iceberg lettuce, the chicken soup is a standout dish that even impresses culinary enthusiasts. The queso fundido is also recommended, but it's best to order the chorizo on the side to avoid a greasy dish. Overall, it's a great spot for an enjoyable dining experience, especially if you're craving their acclaimed chicken soup or want to indulge in some authentic Mexican fare like the queso fundido.

Terrible Experience at Starbucks! Despite having multiple staff members, I had to wait 15 minutes for a tea latte that was essentially just hot water. After returning it twice, the barista offered a pre-made iced tea latte, but it was equally disappointing and watery. The baristas clearly lack proper training in making their beverages correctly. Extremely disappointing and unacceptable service from Starbucks!

Having recently moved from Brooklyn, we were craving that iconic thin and crispy crust pizza. Luckily, we stumbled upon this hidden gem that truly delivered an authentic Brooklyn-style pizza experience. The crust was perfectly crispy, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. But what really stood out was the exceptional service – friendly, attentive, and ensuring a delightful dining experience. We couldn't be happier to have found our new go-to pizza spot. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a taste of authentic New York pizza and top-notch customer service. We'll definitely be back again and again!

Delicious Halal Eats in NYC - This place surpasses the hype of Halal Guys. Despite arriving close to closing time, the staff, especially Jules, provided exceptional service, explaining the menu and offering samples. The steak shawarma with rice and sauces was absolutely delicious, healthy, and filling. The baba ghanoush was also a tasty treat. Highly recommended for authentic and flavorful halal cuisine in a friendly atmosphere.

Cozy and Delightful Dining Experience"

This charming eatery offers a delightful ambiance – quiet yet lively, with attentive and friendly staff who strike the perfect balance of casual conversation and excellent service. Despite its compact size, the space feels ample and inviting. The menu shines with standouts like the highly recommended "Crabby Wife" (best savored with fried eggs) and the mouthwatering chicken & waffles, elevated by the tantalizing combination of hot sauce, syrup, and a signature sauce. Overall, it's a fantastic culinary gem that delivers a delightful dining experience

Surrey's is a hidden gem worth seeking out for an exceptional brunch experience. While not in the city center, it's a must-visit destination. Their shrimp and grits are unparalleled in the city, and the fresh juices are a refreshing accompaniment. The lump crab omelette with its delectable sauce is a true standout, even for those typically averse to omelettes. However, be prepared for crowds and arrive at least 30 minutes early to secure a table, as the tantalizing aromas alone will leave you ravenous. Surrey's is a brunch haven that shouldn't be missed.

While the store itself is spacious, clean, and well-stocked, the customer service experience left much to be desired. Despite being the only customer in the store, and visibly struggling with trying on clothes for a pet while heavily pregnant, none of the four employees behind the counter offered any assistance. To make matters worse, one of the store's free-roaming cats even swatted at the customer's dog, further complicating the situation, yet still no help was provided. This lack of attentiveness and failure to provide basic customer service resulted in the customer leaving without making any purchases, feeling disappointed and unlikely to return. The store's impressive selection and ambiance are unfortunately undermined by the subpar level of service received.

Exceptional auto service! As newcomers to the area with older vehicles, we've found this shop to be a trustworthy gem. Their team is honest, hardworking, and communicative, addressing every quirk with meticulous attention to detail. Highly recommended for all your automotive needs.

This self-serve frozen yogurt shop offers a good selection of yogurt flavors and toppings in a clean and inviting space. The friendly staff went the extra mile, allowing me to pay by card despite being slightly short of the minimum. While nothing extraordinary, it provided an enjoyable fro yo experience that left my son happy. A solid option for a sweet treat with the kids.

The Cafe offers a delightful Sunday brunch experience. The food is not only delicious but also satisfyingly filling, complemented by a nice selection of drinks. The service is exemplary, with pleasant and attentive servers. The cafe itself has a cool and inviting ambiance. Overall, it's a highly recommended spot for a enjoyable brunch outing.

Decent Ambiance, Disappointing Fare: This restaurant boasts a nice, clean ambiance with friendly staff and reasonable pricing. However, the food itself fell flat. The chicken fajitas lacked flavor and were served at an underwhelming temperature, with tepid components like room-temperature meat and a bland onion and pepper base. The accompanying sides were nothing special either. While the presentation was decent, the overall dining experience was mediocre at best. Unless significant improvements are made to the cuisine, a return visit is unlikely.

Gelateria is a delightful gelato haven in St. Louis, offering a cozy coffee house-like atmosphere and a charming outdoor patio surrounded by a fountain and lush foliage. Their gelato and baked goods are simply delicious, making it a favorite spot to indulge in sweet treats. With its pleasing ambiance and mouthwatering offerings, Gelateria is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a delightful gelato experience in the city.

Hidden Sushi Gem Near Dale Mabry: This cozy, intimate sushi spot with under 12 tables and a lively sushi bar is a true hidden gem. The sushi chefs, including the owner, are friendly and engaging, creating a welcoming atmosphere. While the spicy tuna and rainbow rolls were average, the standout was the exceptionally fresh and delicious Wahoo sushi. The rice could have been stickier, but the overall experience was enjoyable, with a reasonable $30 price tag. Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic, entertaining sushi experience away from the crowds.

While the restaurant offers an extensive menu at reasonable prices, the poor service overshadows any potential positives. Our order was completely forgotten, resulting in an excessive 15-minute wait without any acknowledgment or apology from the staff. The lack of attention and disregard for customers is unacceptable. The large selection and affordable prices are hardly redeeming qualities when met with such disappointing and indifferent customer service.

While the author can't vouch for the rest of the menu, it hardly matters when the cheesesteaks are this good. Skip the tourist traps like Pat's and Geno's (and their subpar whiz cheese) – Larry's Steaks is the new king of authentic Philly cheesesteaks.

An utterly disappointing experience. The service was abysmal, the food arrived cold and inedible, and any attempt to rectify the situation turned into a needless ordeal. With such a lack of leadership and low standards from the management, this establishment is best avoided until significant improvements are made. Steer clear.

Disappointing sanitation concerns at a previously enjoyed restaurant. While the establishment was a favorite in the past, recent E.coli and coliform bacteria issues have raised serious health and safety worries. Lacking confidence in their food handling practices currently. To regain trust, they should thoroughly cook meats to 165°F, serve blazing hot to kill bacteria, and source produce exclusively from U.S. suppliers to avoid potential Mexican water contamination issues. A real shame as it was an enjoyable spot prior to these troubling sanitation lapses. Hopefully they can get their act together and properly prioritize diner safety.

This fast-food experience was a complete disaster. Despite placing a straightforward order with clear modifications, the employees managed to get almost every item wrong. The order included a single burger with no condiments, a double burger with everything, nuggets, a side salad, and a kids' meal with specific requests. However, the outcome was a jumbled mess, with burgers coming with incorrect toppings, wrong sides, and drinks substituted without consent. The employee's blank stare upon mentioning "no ketchup" was a telling sign of the impending chaos. It's baffling how a simple order could go so terribly wrong, leaving the customer thoroughly dissatisfied and questioning the competence of the staff. An experience that should have been quick and convenient turned into a frustrating ordeal, warranting only a single star rating.

On a friend's recommendation, I visited this restaurant for breakfast on a busy Saturday morning. Despite the crowd, we were seated promptly, and the service was quick and friendly. I thoroughly enjoyed the veggie omelette with fruit and rye toast, and the menu offered a good selection to cater to different tastes. The portions were generous, and the prices were reasonable. Overall, it was a delightful experience, and I'll definitely be returning!

Wells Fargo Center offers an electrifying atmosphere suitable for all ages. The Philadelphia Flyers put on an exceptional show during every game, ensuring an entertaining experience regardless of your seating location. Even if you're not a hockey fan, attending a Flyers game at Wells Fargo Center is highly recommended for its energetic and enjoyable environment.

This late-night eatery is a go-to spot for satisfying those midnight cravings. With a drive-through option for added convenience, it's a must-visit. The menu boasts new additions and vegetarian choices, catering to diverse dietary preferences. However, my experience was slightly marred when they forgot to include my dessert order, leaving me disappointed after realizing it too late. Overall, it's a reliable stop for late-night bites, but be sure to double-check your order before leaving.

Don't let the unassuming exterior of this former garage fool you – Cafe XYZ offers an unexpectedly delightful dining experience. The spinach and feta hummus is a must-try, bursting with flavor. The chicken caesar pita is equally impressive, with a zesty dressing and fresh, flavorful greens that outshine typical bagged salads. Despite initial skepticism, this hidden gem is well worth a visit for its exceptional fare.

An absolute gem for vegans! This place stands out with its extensive vegan-friendly menu options and knowledgeable staff. The Pad Thai with tofu, veggies, and cashews is a must-try, an absolute perfection. Their avocado egg rolls are also a fan favorite. A top-notch spot for delicious and accommodating vegan cuisine.

NOM NOMS is a swanky downtown spot frequented by trendy professionals. While the portions are on the smaller side, the food packs a flavorful punch. The mussels and clams dish was a standout, with a buttery, delicately spiced broth perfect for dipping the accompanying breadstick. Appetizers like the Tuna Tartare and Coconut Shrimp also impressed with their bold flavors and beautiful plating. However, the cocktail "The Tryst" fell flat with a watery taste and strange aftertaste. Service was attentive and knowledgeable once seated, although getting noticed at the bar can be challenging. While the prices are on the higher end, NOM NOMS is a hip spot to impress with its creative and flavorful dishes, making it worth a visit for a special occasion or during happy hour.

Exceptional customer service and delicious Thai cuisine make this place a standout. The curry's flavor and consistency were top-notch, and the shrimp fried rice, though unassuming in appearance, delivered on taste and texture. However, the lack of 'extra egg' despite the $2 upcharge and the hour-long wait for a called-in order were minor letdowns. Nonetheless, the staff's genuine passion for ensuring customer satisfaction shone through, leaving a positive overall impression. A solid 4-star experience.

This pizza place is a true gem! Their fresh-made pies are a standout, with a delightfully crunchy crust that sets them apart from the rest. The toppings are generously portioned and flavorful, making every bite a treat. I highly recommend trying the Cowboy steak pizza – the savory toppings pair perfectly with the crust, with or without the BBQ sauce. Their pies are so good that I found myself unable to stop at just two slices! Whether you prefer classic or unique toppings, this pizzeria delivers an exceptional dining experience. Definitely worth a visit for some of the best pizza in Philly.

Overall, the UPS Store offers a decent mailbox rental service, especially for those constantly on the go. However, the high annual cost and preference for other carriers/suppliers make it a practical but not exceptional choice.

Heads and Tails is an exceptional choice for those seeking a professional and comfortable waxing experience. Jenne, the esthetician, deserves high praise for her exceptional service. As a first-time bikini wax client, she made me feel at ease, walking me through the entire process with patience and expertise. Despite my initial apprehension, the treatment was surprisingly comfortable, thanks to Jenne's skill and attentiveness. The salon itself is impeccably clean, catering to those with sensitive skin. With an excellent staff and a welcoming atmosphere, Heads and Tails is a top-notch establishment that I highly recommend. I will undoubtedly be returning for their outstanding services.

Unacceptable service marred an otherwise decent meal. After not eating all day due to airline issues, I placed an order at 11:47 pm, expecting a timely delivery. However, it took an excruciating 2.5 hours and two follow-up calls before my food arrived, sans utensils or napkins. While the food itself was satisfactory, the dismal service left me frustrated and resorting to eating my salad with my bare hands. Such a disappointing experience warrants never ordering from this establishment again.

Exceptional sushi experience! The J Sushi and Fire Roll were deliciously prepared and beautifully presented. The service was excellent, and the overall value was outstanding. Highly recommended for sushi lovers seeking quality and great value.

Delightful Authentic Mexican Gem! Having recently moved to the area, we were delighted to discover this fantastic Mexican restaurant. The ambiance is truly traditional and inviting, complemented by exceptional service. We appreciated the thoughtful touch of serving glass bottle sodas. The food was simply outstanding – my wife's Taco Sombrero and my Chimichanga were both incredibly flavorful and exceeded our expectations. If we could give more than 5 stars, we would! Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic, top-notch Mexican cuisine in a warm and welcoming atmosphere.

Ultimately, this restaurant proved to be a colossal waste of time and energy. The abysmal service and subpar food quality make it an establishment to avoid at all costs. Even a free coupon wouldn't entice a return visit.

An outstanding car rental experience! The excellent customer service sets this company apart from the competition. Wish I could rent from them more frequently. Highly recommend renting from here if given the opportunity!

Café Piazza, the successor to the original Benton Park Cafe, is a delightful addition to the St. Louis dining scene. The atmosphere is quintessentially St. Louis, with a stunning mural on the ceiling that's a true work of art (be sure to ask about its creation and check out the bar area). The food is a refreshing departure from standard breakfast fare, offering creative and elevated dishes that are both delicious and reasonably priced. The decor, prime location, and innovative menu make Café Piazza a must-visit for locals and visitors alike. With its unique charm and culinary flair, this restaurant is a welcome addition to the city's vibrant dining landscape.

As a die-hard fan of this food vendor, I'm utterly heartbroken that I only got to savor their exceptional dishes once before they mysteriously disappeared from the market scene. Their chicken, undoubtedly the most tender and smoky I've ever tasted, left me craving for more. The creative and awesome side dishes only added to the overall incredible experience. I desperately hope this culinary genius resurfaces soon, for their absence has left a gaping void in the local food scene. An absolute must-try whenever they make their long-awaited return!

The Peppermill Resort Spa Casino in Reno is an exceptional destination that truly stands out. Attending a corporate event with 2,000+ people in the grand Tuscany Ballroom and staying overnight in the luxurious Tuscan Tower, I experienced a first-class, cruise ship-like atmosphere. As a non-smoker, I appreciated the lack of pervasive casino smoke. The highlight was having breakfast at the coffee shop, where the approachable CEO/GM John Hanson joined me for a friendly chat, making the experience even more personalized and memorable. The Peppermill undoubtedly sets the standard for resorts in the area, offering an unparalleled level of hospitality and amenities.

Despite its unassuming exterior, this traditional Indian/Thai restaurant exceeded our expectations. The crispy Tamarind Duck and flavorful Panang Curry with calamari were standouts, complemented by tasty mussels as an appetizer. Portion sizes were generous for the price, and the service was attentive without being intrusive. With multiple duck preparations and a sushi menu yet to explore, we're eager to return and sample more of this hidden gem's delectable offerings. A true delight for the taste buds!

Corropolese is the undisputed king of tomato pies in the area. If you're a true aficionado of this regional delicacy, it's simply non-negotiable – you must go to Corropolese for an authentic, superior tomato pie experience. While they offer other menu items, their tomato pie is the star attraction that keeps locals and visitors alike coming back. For any occasion that calls for this beloved dish, Corropolese is the go-to spot that consistently delivers unmatched quality and flavor. No one does tomato pie better!

My recent visit to this restaurant for a birthday celebration was a pleasant experience overall. The ambiance was tranquil on a Tuesday evening, and the service was attentive, likely due to the spacious setting. The beef and lobster entrées were well-executed, complemented by delicious mashed potatoes and asparagus. However, the crab and cheese appetizer fell short, lacking flavor and seasoning. The crème brûlée dessert was a highlight and worth ordering again. While the wobbly table was an annoyance in an otherwise upscale setting, I would rate the restaurant 4 out of 5 and happily recommend it to friends for its overall quality.

Five-Star Dining Experience! This place deserves top marks for its exceptional service and delicious food. Our server Debbie was outstanding - knowledgeable about the menu, attentive to our needs, and incredibly friendly. The food came out quickly, piping hot, and prepared perfectly to order. Highlights included the indulgent mac n cheese burger and the perfectly mixed whiskey sour. With stellar service and high-quality eats, this restaurant is a must-visit. We'll definitely be returning for another fabulous meal.

This delightful independent store is a true gem for holiday shopping. With a warm and inviting atmosphere, coupled with friendly and accommodating staff, it offers a refreshing alternative to the typical retail experience. From unique gifts to cheerful holiday decor, you're sure to find something special to make your celebrations merry and bright. Highly recommended for a pleasant and hassle-free shopping trip.

The ambiance and service at this eclectic art-house-meets-coffee-house establishment truly shine. The relaxed, social vibe and delicious beverages create a delightful atmosphere. However, the food, while decent, falls short of greatness. Dishes like the Bird and Pig and specialty grilled cheese were good but not exceptional. If judging solely on the culinary offerings, a three-star rating would be more fitting. Nonetheless, the charming ambiance and wonderful staff elevate the overall experience, earning it an extra star. While the food could use some improvement, the unique atmosphere makes it worth a visit, and I'll be back to explore more menu items.

Joyce's salon is an excellent choice for a painless and comfortable experience. Despite the longer drive from Palm Harbor, it's absolutely worth it. Her high-tech equipment and expertise surpass the horror stories you might hear from other salons. Joyce's services are top-notch, and I highly recommend her!

The Quarter Stitch is a true gem for knitters visiting New Orleans. As an avid knitter, I was thrilled to find this delightful yarn store within walking distance from my hotel. Their unique Mardi Gras yarn collection was an absolute delight, prompting me to visit twice during my stay. The extensive selection and the incredibly helpful staff made each visit a pleasure. If you're a knitter in NOLA, The Quarter Stitch is an absolute must-visit!

While the ice cream itself was delicious, the service at this establishment was appallingly bad. The staff members were unprofessional, rude, and seemingly intoxicated during our visit on a Sunday afternoon. One employee hurled napkins around the store, with one even hitting me without an apology. The other employee rudely yelled at my son for merely looking at the candy, despite him not touching anything. The server who took our order was discourteous, failed to greet us or make eye contact, and engaged in bizarre behavior with her coworker while we waited. Undoubtedly, the deplorable service overshadowed the quality of the ice cream and made for an unpleasant experience overall. A fun atmosphere is one thing, but not at the expense of basic customer courtesy.

The Wharf Shellfish Shack is a tiny seafood joint with a prime waterfront location. While the space is cozy and a bit noisy, the service was attentive. The fried shrimp was a standout – light, moist, and delicious – but the crab sandwich on plain white bread underwhelmed. As a non-seafood lover, I enjoyed the shrimp and onion rings, but my seafood-enthusiast husband wasn't impressed with his sandwich choice. With an all-shellfish menu, seafood fans should definitely give this place a try, but be selective with your order. The location alone makes it worth a visit if you're craving fresh seafood.

My brunch experience at this restaurant was an absolute nightmare from start to finish. Even before arriving, the poor customer service was evident when I was left on hold indefinitely after inquiring about their brunch menu. Upon arrival, our group was forced to sit outside despite having a reservation and some members being allergic to bees, which were swarming our table. When we requested to move inside due to the allergies, the manager and waitress rudely dismissed our concerns and refused to accommodate us. The waitress even disrespectfully spoke over the manager in front of us. We ended up having to separate from our friends to avoid the bees. The service was appalling, with our designated waitress never showing up at our table. Another server witnessed the poor treatment and advised us not to tip. The entire experience was deplorable, and I left without eating due to the frustration. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone, even if they were starving.

This eatery is a must-visit for its unique sandwich offerings and excellent vegan/healthy options. The menu caters to diverse dietary preferences, making it an ideal spot for groups with different requirements. Highly recommended for those seeking flavorful and nutritious fare.

If you're in Reno and up for a gastronomic adventure, the Brew Bros. Burger Challenge is a must-try. Just be prepared for a battle against the clock and your own appetite. As for me, I'll be back to conquer this elusive challenge and claim victory over the colossal burger.

The [Restaurant Name] offers an exceptional breakfast experience. Their Sunny Side Skillet, priced under $8 and paired with a delectable pancake, is an absolute delight. The service is top-notch, and the atmosphere, along with the store selections, surpasses all other locations. Highly recommended for a delicious and enjoyable breakfast outing.

This food truck offers an outstanding dining experience. The service is prompt and efficient, ensuring a hassle-free visit. The meat dishes are a standout, with juicy and flavorful cuts that are expertly prepared. The tantalizing BBQ sauce perfectly complements the meats, elevating the flavors to new heights. Moreover, the prices are reasonable, making it an affordable indulgence. If you stumble upon this food truck, do not hesitate – stop by and savor the delectable offerings. You won't be disappointed.

While I wanted to enjoy this restaurant, my experience was ultimately underwhelming. The chicken lacked flavor, and the sauces were average at best. The mac and cheese was overly salty, and the bananas foster pie filling was disappointingly sparse. However, the birch beer soda was a refreshing highlight. The concept and atmosphere show promise, but the food quality fails to match the pricing. With some improvements, this place could live up to its potential, but as it stands, I can only give it 2 out of 5 stars. The lackluster execution of the dishes left me wishing for a refund on my $16.20 bill.

Slow Service and Mediocre Food. The service here is painfully slow, even with few customers. We visited with a group, and despite being the only ones there, the single server struggled to handle everything from drinks to food delivery. The food itself was just okay, nothing exceptional. Avoid this place if you're in a larger group or have time constraints, as the glacial service will likely make you late for your next commitment. While I sympathized with the overwhelmed server, the overall experience was disappointing.

While pricey, this establishment delivers top-notch service and exceptional cuisine. The melt-in-your-mouth ribeye and the massive, flavor-packed burger are standout dishes. The acclaimed bread pudding lives up to its hype. It's worth splurging at least once and sharing portions with companions to fully savor the culinary experience.

The Seasonal Table offers an exquisite dining experience with its ever-changing menu featuring locally sourced ingredients that tantalize the taste buds. While the flavors are a delight, securing a reservation can be a challenge due to its popularity, so plan well in advance to savor this culinary gem.

Spot on! is a small, dive bar-like eatery that serves up delicious vegetarian fare. The standout is the portabella burger dubbed "the veg" - a flavor-packed combination of a grilled portabella cap, melty mozzarella, tangy pickled veggies, arugula, and guacamole sandwiched between a perfectly proportioned potato bun. The unexpected highlight is the mozzarella fused directly onto the portabella, giving it an almost halloumi-like texture. The spicy fries, reminiscent of crab fries with a subtle kick of spices, make for a tasty side. While the cozy space lends itself more to takeout, Spot on! delivers big on flavor for meat-free cravings.

While vegetarian options are scarce in New Orleans, Tomasito's fell short of the good vegetarian eats I've typically found in the city. The chips and bean and cheese burrito were decent, but the fact that the rice wasn't vegetarian-friendly was surprising. The service was average, and although the flan was excellent, being served with just one raspberry was a bit of a letdown when advertised as "with berries." On the upside, at least Tomasito's offered some vegetarian choices on the menu, which can't be taken for granted in a city known for its meat-centric cuisine. However, for truly satisfying vegetarian fare in New Orleans, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

An excellent Mexican dining experience! This restaurant stands out with its delectable cuisine, superb drinks, and wallet-friendly prices. After a long time, I've finally found a Mexican eatery that truly delivers on all fronts. Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic and satisfying meal without breaking the bank.

This venue offers a delightful contrast between its lively ground floor and the more serene upstairs bar. Downstairs, the live music kicks into high gear, providing an energetic and immersive experience for music enthusiasts. However, those seeking a more intimate atmosphere can escape to the second floor, where a subdued ambiance allows for enjoyable conversations without having to shout over the tunes. It's a versatile spot that caters to both the party crowd and those preferring a quieter evening.

Our new home welcomed us with a nasty sewer backup, but Steve from Roto-Rooter came to our rescue! He promptly resolved the issue, allowing us to enjoy our new home without any plumbing woes. If we ever face such challenges again, Roto-Rooter will undoubtedly be our go-to service. Highly recommended!
Ultimately, I decided to take my business to a different GMC dealership nearby, as I cannot entrust my vehicle to a service department that fails to respond to customers' inquiries.

Sweet Indulgence Bakery is a true gem! Their hazelnut cake is a must-try – a signature item that exceeds its well-deserved reputation. The butter cookies are equally delectable, making perfect gifts for loved ones. With consistently excellent quality and reasonable prices, Sweet Indulgence delivers a fantastic experience. The friendly and helpful staff adds to the delightful ambiance. An absolute favorite bakery that never disappoints!

First Visit for Lunch: Delightful Gluten-Free Gem! This restaurant offers an impressive gluten-free menu with a wide array of flavorful options. The lunch was delicious, and the service staff was warm and welcoming. Definitely worth a visit for those seeking a satisfying gluten-free dining experience.

The service at this establishment was excellent, and they did a great job hosting our event. However, the food left much to be desired. The brisket was mediocre, potentially due to sitting under lamps for an extended period, and the bread it was served on was tough and unappetizing. While the mac and cheese was a redeeming factor, the disappointment continued with the dirty and chilled glassware, compounded by the lack of any draft beer options. Overall, the service was commendable, but the food and beverage experience fell short of expectations.

The Mississippi River Steamboat Tour is a relaxing and leisurely activity perfect for a laid-back day. While the cost of around $28 is average, the experience can be enhanced by skipping the touristy add-ons like the photographer. Instead, research the history of the Natchez Native American tribe beforehand to gain interesting insights and become an impromptu tour guide for your group. Grab a drink and let the gentle cruise along the river transport you back in time as you learn about the rich cultural heritage of the area. It's a enjoyable way to spend a few hours immersed in the region's past without being too taxing.

The Fat Ham offers a cozy ambiance with a nice vibe and an impressive whiskey display. Despite its small size, the service is exceptional, with bartenders like Dan providing efficient, friendly, and attentive service. The menu features delectable comfort food, including standouts like the flavorful pimento cheese, melt-in-your-mouth skillet cornbread, and the star of the show, the creamy and perfectly seasoned shrimp & grits. The hot chicken lives up to its name, offering a fiery kick balanced by the brioche and ranch dressing. While the raspberry cobbler dessert was underwhelming, the overall dining experience is a winner with reasonably priced dishes and a high-end take on comfort food. The Fat Ham is a must-visit spot for those seeking exceptional service and delicious Southern-inspired fare.

When this Greek/Mediterranean restaurant first opened, it was a delightful experience with fresh, tasty food like Greek salads and gyros served in a cute, clean atmosphere. However, on a recent visit, the overall quality and cleanliness had severely declined. The tables were dirty with lamps full of dead bugs - an immediate turnoff. The food was subpar, with items like salads containing inedible, off-tasting tomatoes and peppers. The chicken in a fajita bowl was charred and rubbery. Even the baklava dessert was disappointingly stale. While the restaurant showed promise when new, it desperately needs to address cleanliness issues and restore the fresh, high-quality fare it originally offered. Unless significant improvements are made, it will be difficult to recommend returning.

If you're fortunate enough to attend this coveted event, be prepared to have your senses awakened and your taste buds tantalized. Carrollton Market's annual brunch is a hidden gem that shouldn't be missed – a true celebration of culinary excellence in the heart of New Orleans.

While the beer selection is excellent, the service at the bar leaves something to be desired, with bartenders moving at a sluggish pace. If you're in no rush, it's a great spot to indulge in a wide variety of brews, but don't expect lightning-fast service during peak hours.

The Beach Bar & Grill offers a delightful experience with its mouthwatering fish tacos and nachos. The inviting atmosphere caters to both families and romantic dates, with a beach-themed ambiance, live music, homemade ice cream, and a playground for children. It's a perfect spot for a casual yet enjoyable dining experience.

O! Wings is an outstanding wing joint that delivers on flavor and service. Their Hot Momma and Original wings are simply the best, and their bulgogi wrap is another standout menu item that even the pickiest eaters can't resist. The friendly and accommodating staff goes above and beyond, effortlessly handling last-minute order changes with efficiency. Whether dining in or taking out, O! Wings guarantees a delightful experience that will leave you craving for more of their mouth-watering offerings.

New York Pizza Grill gets a strong negative review for their unethical and potentially illegal marketing tactics. Their employees trespass into hotels, sneaking around and stuffing unwanted flyers under guest room doors. This intrusive littering makes guests feel unsafe and violated in what should be a secure environment. One encounter with a "greasy looking punk" employee nearly escalated into a confrontation before the wise decision to avoid him. Beyond the trespassing and harassment issues, such underhanded advertising is a turn-off and provides a great reason to avoid this establishment entirely. With so many other pizza options, there's no need to support a business that disrespects customers and properties through these aggressive, sketchy practices. New York Pizza Grill's operation seems shady at best, and potentially dangerous for both employees and anyone unfortunate enough to cross paths with their solicitors.

Overall, however, the experience was positive. The prices were fair, and the total time of 18 minutes was reasonable, given how busy they were. I would certainly recommend this car wash and plan to return myself in the future.

Nailed It Salon is my go-to place for manicures whenever I visit family in Indiana. David, the nail technician, is an absolute artist when it comes to pink and white nail designs. His work is truly amazing. The salon itself is impeccably clean, and the staff members are professional, courteous, and welcoming. The management team, though new to me three years ago, has been outstanding in maintaining the salon's high standards. I highly recommend Nailed It Salon for anyone seeking top-notch nail services in a pristine and friendly environment.

I expected better from this establishment, but their lack of accountability and disregard for customer satisfaction has left me with no choice but to take my business elsewhere. If they cannot deliver on their promises, how can I trust them to deliver accurate orders in the future?

The Turnip Truck is a true gem for organic and natural food lovers. This upscale grocery store offers an impressive selection of fresh produce, prepared foods, and all-natural products that surpass even Whole Foods. Their rotating hot buffet and made-to-order sandwiches, like the delicious chipotle chicken salad wrap, are must-tries. The aisles are a paradise for those seeking organic and healthy options, from beauty products to lip balms. While the lack of a rewards program is a slight drawback, the overall experience at The Turnip Truck is truly delightful. Whether you're grabbing a quick lunch or indulging in a shopping spree, this place is a perfect destination for a relaxing afternoon in the gulch.

The main draws at this establishment are the excellent happy hour deals and delightful brunch offerings. While my sole dinner experience was merely average, likely due to an unconventional menu choice, the overall positive impressions from happy hour and brunch make it a place worth revisiting to fully explore the dinner menu.

After a long flight from Chicago, my colleagues and I stopped by this establishment for an afternoon snack. Despite arriving before happy hour, we were accommodated and seated in their well-decorated, open space. The cocktails were a mixed bag – my Mint Julep was underwhelming, but the gin drink was fantastic. However, the real stars were the happy hour bites – the Mac and cheese, fries, and pretzel were all delicious and reasonably priced. The Brussels sprouts weren't my cup of tea, but overall, it was a satisfying experience. I'd happily return during my next visit to Reno.

Muriel's Jackson Square in New Orleans is a welcome respite for vegetarians seeking Southern/Cajun comfort food. While finding vegetarian options in The Big Easy can be challenging, this restaurant accommodates veggie needs with a decent selection. The service is friendly and attentive, with staff willing to modify dishes upon request. The Veggie Soiree sampler offers a variety of flavors, including standouts like divine beets, roasted acorn squash, and gingery yams. However, some components could use improvement, such as the crunchy chickpeas and wild rice. The goat cheese crepe appetizer is a hit, but be mindful of potential non-veg ingredients in sauces. With lively cocktails and a lively atmosphere, Muriel's provides a satisfying vegetarian dining experience in New Orleans, though making reservations is recommended due to its popularity.

Puckett's is a must-visit for anyone craving delicious, old-fashioned comfort food. The meat-and-three (or meat-and-two in my case) offers hearty and flavorful options like the standout squash casserole and meatloaf. While tasty, the cornbread comes in the form of a pancake-like "hoe cake" rather than the traditional slice, which could surprise some diners. Overall, Puckett's delivers a satisfying Southern dining experience with its well-executed classics.

After years of staying at The Grand Sierra, I decided to try the Peppermill Resort on a friend's recommendation. My stay exceeded all expectations, thanks to the outstanding service provided by the Operations Manager, David Fuller. Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed and generously upgraded to a Tuscany Balcony Suite, complete with a private balcony – an excellent start to the trip. The staff's dedication to providing an unparalleled experience was evident in their willingness to go above and beyond. The Peppermill Resort has won my loyalty with its exceptional accommodations and top-notch service. I wholeheartedly recommend this resort and look forward to returning for another memorable stay.

The hotel's staff offered insincere apologies but made no genuine effort to rectify the situation or provide adequate compensation for their deceptive tactics. This experience has left me with a sour taste, and I highly doubt I'll ever consider staying at a Hilton property again.

The burger at this establishment was merely average, failing to justify its exorbitant price point. The seating arrangement, with long communal tables surrounded by strangers, felt cramped and uncomfortable. While the service was acceptable, the overall experience left much to be desired. Unless they significantly reduce their prices, this place offers a subpar burger at an unjustifiable cost. St. Louis has numerous superior options that deliver better taste and value for your money.

Pete and Ron from Arbour Bay Tree Service provided an excellent tree removal experience. After receiving multiple quotes, their proposal stood out as the most reputable. The team expertly handled the removal of two massive oak trees, one inaccessible from the front yard and another dangerously close to the roof, utilizing a crane. Despite the challenging job, they completed the work efficiently while I was away, leaving minimal disruption to the yard. I wholeheartedly recommend Pete, Ron, and Arbour Bay Tree Service for their professionalism and top-notch service.

Disappointing Sushi Experience: While the portion sizes at this sushi restaurant are generous, the prices are exorbitantly high, with two basic sushi rolls costing nearly $20 for a lunch. The rolls were not filling enough to justify the steep pricing. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this establishment due to the unreasonable prices and lack of value for money.

It's a lively spot with a pleasant ambiance and attentive service. While the live music added to the enjoyable vibe, the food fell slightly short of expectations. The burger was decent but not outstanding. Overall, it was a good experience worth revisiting.

This hotel is an excellent choice for corporate events and conferences. During our 2 1/2 day corporate conference in mid-June, we were thoroughly impressed with the excellent service, beautiful facilities, and delicious catering. The hotel's proximity to the airport, along with complimentary shuttle service and parking, made it incredibly convenient. Overall, it's a great spot for small conventions or conferences, and we highly recommend it.

Cheese lovers, rejoice! This cozy spot offers an outstanding selection of delectable cheeses, perfect for sharing with friends over a drink from their impressive beverage menu. While not the cheapest for drinks, the knowledgeable staff's expertise on the cheese varieties and the high-quality offerings make it a worthwhile indulgence. Prepare to savor every bite in a delightful ambiance. Highly recommended for cheese enthusiasts seeking a memorable culinary experience.

Disappointing Culinary Experience. The restaurant's attempt at serving Middle Eastern cuisine fell flat. The side dishes were poorly executed, with tasteless offerings like reheated rice that seemed to have been taken straight from a frozen bag, lacking any authentic flavor or care in preparation. Overall, the experience failed to deliver an enjoyable or authentic Middle Eastern dining experience.

An absolute gem for lunch! The salmon dish is a must-try, bursting with flavors that will leave you craving for more. The immaculate restrooms and impeccable service elevate the overall dining experience. This place has rightfully earned a spot in my lunch rotation for its consistent quality and delightful ambiance. Highly recommended!

An absolute gem! This place is a true standout with its phenomenal service and fantastic ambiance. The creative and delectable dishes are out of this world, making it impossible not to daydream about the food. From the unreal chicken and waffles to the best deviled eggs I've ever tasted, every bite was a culinary revelation. Even their take on classic dishes like French toast was simply divine. The cleverly named 'Flinstones pushup-pop' drink added to the fun and innovative experience. The perfect music selection enhanced the overall ambiance, making it the best brunch experience of my life. Ignore any review below 4 stars, as this place is a must-visit culinary destination that does everything right.

This hidden gem offers an incredible happy hour deal from 3-8pm daily, with half-off beers, $3-$4 wines, and a remarkable $8 hookah (regularly $13). The extensive shisha flavor selection, coupled with unique options like an ice chamber or fruit bowl smoking experience (extra cost), elevates the overall experience. While the food menu wasn't sampled, the dishes looked promising. With its relaxed ambiance and excellent value during happy hour, this spot is a must-visit for unwinding with friends and indulging in flavorful hookah sessions. Highly recommended for an enjoyable and budget-friendly evening out.

The Monaco Hotel in Philadelphia is an absolute gem! From the moment you step into the charming, eclectic lobby, you'll feel right at home. The friendly staff, including the fantastic concierge Roshid, provide exceptional service. The rooms are immaculate, and the king spa rooms boast stunning bathrooms with freestanding tubs and large showers. The decor is gorgeous, with beautiful wallpaper, rugs, and brand-new furnishings. Enjoy complimentary wine in the cozy lobby every evening, and explore the nearby historical attractions like the Liberty Bell. The Monaco Hotel offers a truly enjoyable and memorable stay in the heart of Center City, Philadelphia. Highly recommended!

This review is an exhilarated rave about a thrift store that offers unbelievable savings on high-end fashion brands. The writer confesses to being an addict, but who can resist the temptation when you can score a Bebe top, a Banana Republic skirt, and a BCBG skirt for just $4.13? The savings are described as "ridiculous," which is an understatement considering the steep prices these brands typically command. If you're a fashionista on a budget or simply love a good bargain, this thrift store is an absolute must-visit gem!

A fantastic family-friendly spot in Carp for catching the big game! The atmosphere is lively and welcoming, the service is prompt, and their pizza is simply delicious. Highly recommended for a fun outing with loved ones while cheering on your favorite team.

This Acme store delivers the expected shopping experience, though with a few notable differences. The aisles felt slightly narrower than usual, potentially causing minor inconvenience. Additionally, the store's smaller size results in a slightly reduced product variety compared to larger locations. However, the frozen and refrigerated sections appear to have received upgrades, which is a plus. Service remained satisfactory, aligning with Acme's standards. Overall, it's a typical Acme visit with some minor quirks, mainly related to the store's compact layout.

The Roost is a newcomer's delight in the area. With its freshly baked breads and pastries, standout dishes like the raisin bread, sugar-cinnamon toast, and cornbread casserole, coupled with prompt and friendly service, it's no wonder this breakfast spot has already become a favorite for my wife and me. The Roost delivers a delightful dining experience that will keep us coming back for more.

Despite its compact size and bustling atmosphere, this breakfast spot delivers big on flavor and portions. The efficient wait staff deftly navigates the hubbub to ensure a satisfying dining experience. If you're seeking a lively ambiance and delectable morning fare, this is a great choice.

This small but visually appealing restaurant with its rustic decor is a hidden gem. The prosciutto fig arugula Parmesan flatbread appetizer is a delightful mix of flavors and perfect for sharing. The grass-fed beef burger, though massive in size, is a standout with its enticing aroma and taste, complemented by the truffle-dusted fries. The seafood soup, featuring a coconut curry broth with fish, shrimp, and mollusks, is a deliciously spicy delight without overwhelming the taste buds. The extensive wine and craft beer selections add to the overall experience. With its limited seating and no reservations accepted, it's advisable to arrive early to avoid the crowds. Overall, this restaurant is highly recommended for its quality food and inviting ambiance.

With superior Chinese buffet options in the area, it's unlikely I'll return to Dragon Buffet anytime soon. However, if I do give them another chance, I hope to find a busier environment where the food is fresher and the service more attentive.

This cozy, family-friendly restaurant is an absolute gem! With consistently delicious fare like their standout pasta pockets with pear filling, attentive and friendly service, and the convenience of being BYOB, it's no wonder this place is a go-to favorite. The warm atmosphere and highly recommended menu make it an excellent choice for a enjoyable dining experience. A must-visit!

The bar's claim to fame is its association with a popular TV show, but that's about all it has going for it. The food, while decent, is overpriced. The $11 gravy fries, though tasty with steak fries, gravy, and mozzarella cheese, are a steep price to pay. The $4 White Rascal's offer a reasonable drink option. Service is friendly but can be slow at times. Overall, it's an average establishment coasting on its TV fame, failing to deliver exceptional value for the price.

True to the Yelp reviews, this bike repair shop exceeded expectations. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and patient in addressing all inquiries. Their exceptional service has earned my loyalty – I will undoubtedly return for all future bike repair and maintenance needs.

The Hotel Monteleone is a great choice for its central French Quarter location, offering a nice balance of value and amenities. The rooms are tastefully furnished with comfortable king beds, and the rooftop pool and rotating Carousel bar provide unique experiences. However, be prepared for noise if you have a room facing Royal Street, especially on weekends. Additionally, be vigilant about the hotel's policy of adding incidental charges to your room rate. Overall, it's a solid option for those seeking a well-situated and reasonably priced stay in New Orleans.
