The handmade Orangina at this establishment is a true delight, boasting a superior taste compared to the bottled version. Additionally, the croissant sandwiches are nothing short of amazing, making this eatery a must-visit for those seeking high-quality, delectable offerings.

This place is a must-visit for delectable American classics at pocket-friendly prices. Their mouthwatering milkshakes, creamy ice cream, authentic Chicago-style hot dogs, and indulgent cheese fries consistently deliver on taste and quality. A fantastic spot for affordable and delicious comfort food that never disappoints.

The food at this restaurant is excellent, but the lack of Bud Light on tap is a significant drawback. The service, particularly from Jamie White, is outstanding – she's the best server there. However, the absence of a popular light beer option like Bud Light is a notable negative for this establishment.

If you're a fan of delicious Indian cuisine, this place is a must-visit! The food quality and taste are simply outstanding, deserving of a five-star rating. While the atmosphere may not be the most impressive, the flavors of the Chicken Tikka and Malai Kofta dishes more than make up for it. The prices are reasonable, and the experience has us already planning our next visit. Don't let the ambiance deter you – the food alone is worth the trip!

Caesars Palace is a fantastic choice for a luxurious stay in Las Vegas. As a player card member, I've enjoyed numerous visits over the past year, thanks to their generous room offers. The check-in process is seamless with the express kiosk option, and the rooms are consistently clean, comfortable, and often offer beautiful pool views. The pool area itself is well-maintained and never overcrowded, providing a relaxing atmosphere. While the dining options I've tried so far haven't been exceptional, I'm eager to explore the steakhouse and Chi restaurant on future visits. The casino floor is spacious, and I've never had trouble finding my preferred slot machines. Overall, with its excellent accommodations and amenities, Caesars Palace remains my go-to destination in Vegas as long as they continue to offer enticing deals.

Delightful bagel sandwich! The pork roll, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel was simply delicious. Fresh bagels made on-site daily add to the experience. At $4.23, it's a steal. The only downside was the apparent understaffing, which hopefully gets addressed to handle the crowds better. Overall, a must-try for bagel lovers!

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. While the food itself was delicious, the portion sizes and serving style left much to be desired. On Sundays, they offer a set tasting menu served 'family style.' However, our party of two received the same portions as a single diner seated next to us. This misleading practice of serving one-person portions 'family style' to multiple guests is unacceptable. Unless you request individual plates, you'll end up sharing a single serving meant for one. The food quality was excellent, but the deceptive serving approach overshadowed the dining experience. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this restaurant until they rectify their portion and serving policies.

Sur La Table is an exceptional culinary destination that offers immersive and engaging cooking classes. Their pizza-making class was a delightful experience, thanks to the knowledgeable instructor John from Ornesto. It provided valuable techniques and a chance to connect with fellow food enthusiasts. With its vast array of culinary products and diverse class offerings, Sur La Table is a true wonderland for bakers, chefs, and aspiring culinarians. While the location can be a bit tricky to find due to dim lighting, it's well worth the effort. Highly recommended for anyone seeking to enhance their culinary skills and indulge in a delightful foodie adventure.

Fantastic experience! The extensive vegetarian and organic menu options were a refreshing delight. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, adding to the pleasant ambiance. To top it off, the coffee was absolutely delicious. This place has earned a loyal patron in me, and I can't wait to return.

This place is a must-visit for veggie burger lovers! Their handmade veggie patties are simply the best in town, and the pretzel buns they serve them on are an absolute delight. If you're craving a delicious and unique veggie burger experience, this is the spot to go to. Highly recommended!

Having recently moved to Tampa from Los Angeles, I've been underwhelmed by the food scene until my visit to Ploy Thai. This restaurant is a standout, not just by Tampa standards but by good food standards in general. The dishes are bursting with flavor, and the ingredients are remarkably fresh. As someone accustomed to the diverse culinary offerings of LA, Ploy Thai has restored my faith in Tampa's dining scene. Highly recommended for those seeking authentic and delicious Thai cuisine."
Rating: 2/5 stars

Disappointing Service at [Restaurant Name]. While the food and coffee were satisfactory, the excruciatingly long wait at the single open cashier station was unacceptable. With only one cashier handling all transactions, the line quickly grew out of control, and several staff members idly watched as customers grew increasingly frustrated. Unless they address this inefficient staffing issue by adding more cashiers during peak hours, this establishment risks losing customers due to the poor service experience. Recommended only if you have an abundance of patience.

Peppermill continues to impress with its exceptional service and top-notch accommodations, solidifying its position as one of the best destinations in Reno. As a frequent visitor and gambler, I can attest that the casino offers favorable odds, especially on the lower denomination slots. The dining experience is also a highlight, with delicious and reasonably priced cuisine. Overall, Peppermill is a standout choice for anyone seeking a memorable and enjoyable stay in Reno.

Disappointing and overpriced breakfast sandwiches. The sausage and egg sandwich was undersized, with cold sausage patty, while the bacon and egg sandwich had a cold egg and was overly greasy. For nearly $5 per sandwich, the quality was comparable to fast food chains at a fraction of the cost. An embarrassing display that failed to meet expectations set by the menu photos. Not worth the premium pricing.

While the staff seemed competent initially, their lack of attentiveness, dismissive attitude toward my concerns, and unprofessional response to constructive criticism are deeply concerning. I cannot recommend Music City Optical based on my overall negative experience.

Whether you're stopping by for a quick lunch or browsing their extensive selection of Italian delights, be sure to savor a freshly crafted coffee beverage and pastry. It's the perfect accompaniment to your Italian Centre experience.

With the staff turnover and declining service standards, this once-beloved nail salon has become a disappointment. Unless significant changes are made, I will have to seek alternative options that better meet my expectations for a relaxing and professional experience.

Boulevard Pizza is a nostalgic gem in the Sparks/Reno area, serving up delicious pizzas in a retro setting that hasn't changed since the 1980s. While the decor may be outdated, the pizzas are the real stars, with their mouthwatering flavors making it a go-to spot for locals. Adding to the experience are the fun arcade games, perfect for keeping the kids entertained. If you're in the mood for some seriously tasty pizza and a dose of nostalgia, Boulevard Pizza is the place to be.
Overall, this cafe is a true gem that shouldn't be missed by any caffeine connoisseur in the vicinity. Prepare to be blown away by their top-notch brews and hospitality.

Jack's Donuts in Indianapolis is a must-visit! Their plain glazed donut is a classic delight, but the real standout is the lemon-filled glazed donut - absolutely delicious! I was thoroughly impressed and would happily return whenever I'm in the area.

Bomb.com Wings and Drinks! This place is a must-visit in Indianapolis, especially on Wednesdays when they offer delicious, perfectly seasoned jumbo wings for just $1 each. Their Dirty Lemonade is an absolute standout drink that you'll instantly fall in love with. Don't miss out on this hidden gem!

Don't let the unassuming exterior fool you - this hidden gem serves up incredibly flavorful and expertly prepared dishes. From their mouthwatering gyros to the perfectly seasoned fish and chicken offerings, every bite bursts with flavor. The real showstopper, however, is the dessert menu, which is an absolute must-try. Prepare to be wowed by this unsung culinary haven.

This new establishment has made an impressive debut in Reno. Despite being packed on their opening day, they maintained excellent organization and provided a seamless experience. The staff deserves kudos for their preparedness and efficiency in handling the crowds. As a local, I'm thrilled to have this addition to our city, and my family is already planning to become regular patrons multiple times a week. A warm welcome and sincere thanks for choosing Reno as your new home!"

Baguette Deli is a fantastic introduction to Vietnamese cuisine! The BBQ pork banh mi (Vietnamese sandwich) stands out as the crowd favorite, but their fresh spring rolls are also impressive, rivaling those from sit-down Thai restaurants. The friendly staff accommodates special requests like adding extra fresh jalapeños at no extra charge. Their bubble tea is a must-try, providing a refreshing addition to the delicious food offerings. With its exceptional flavors and welcoming atmosphere, Baguette Deli is a hidden gem that deserves a visit from anyone seeking an authentic Vietnamese culinary experience.

This place is a regular haunt for me, thanks to their delectable brisket tacos and quesadillas. Their happy hour, starting at 3 PM, offers an enticing 2-for-1 deal on drinks, making it an ideal spot for a late, budget-friendly lunch. Highly recommended for meat lovers seeking flavorful Tex-Mex fare and a lively atmosphere.

Xtreme Tacos is an absolute gem! With an impressive track record of 8-10 delightful visits, it has become a personal favorite. The food is consistently delicious, and their homemade chips with excellent salsa and queso are a must-have. But what truly sets Xtreme Tacos apart is the warm and welcoming service provided by their friendly staff, particularly the guy at the counter. It's a delightful combination of incredible food and fantastic customer experience that keeps me coming back time and time again.
Whether you're a newcomer like me or a long-time resident, Cabrillo Union 76 is a reliable choice for top-notch auto care in a comfortable and trustworthy environment. Highly recommended!

The Location Cafe boasts a prime spot for hungry tourists, striking a balance between edgy and chill vibes. While the ahi fish tacos with avocado relish sounded promising, the execution fell short with the use of premade taco shells, which undermined the delicate fish. The fish itself was flavorful, but the avocado relish was disappointingly sparse. On the plus side, they offer a selection of local microbrews, and their brunch menu looks enticing. Overall, a mixed experience with room for improvement in the food department.

This place nailed it with their delicious breakfast pizza and never-ending mimosas and bloody marys. The food was top-notch, but what really stood out was the exceptional service. Getting a warm handshake on the way out demonstrated true hospitality that's increasingly rare these days. An all-around fantastic brunch spot that delivers both on taste and genuine customer care. Highly recommended for a memorable weekend indulgence!

Bing's Boba in Tucson is an excellent spot for bubble tea lovers. Their Taro snow drink is a must-try and certainly a crowd favorite. The establishment maintains a clean and welcoming environment, offering board games for customers to enjoy while they sip their beverages. The staff is attentive and friendly, going the extra mile to ensure customer satisfaction, as evidenced by their willingness to remake a drink that didn't meet expectations. Overall, Bing's Boba stands out as the best boba spot in Tucson, delivering top-notch drinks and excellent customer service.

Venus Nail is a fantastic nail salon that I discovered through a Google search in my area. Over the course of three visits, they have consistently provided an outstanding experience with their excellent service and welcoming atmosphere. I highly recommend asking for Ivy, who is truly skilled and talented. For my recent birthday trip, I trusted her to create a special nail design, and she exceeded my expectations with a beautiful and thoughtful result that I absolutely loved. Venus Nail is a gem, delivering top-notch service and artistry.

Tucked away in an unexpected location, this unassuming Indian restaurant is a true gem that delivers an authentically delicious experience. As someone picky about Indian food, the flavorful dishes like the perfectly spiced Lamb Korma and the divine Naan with peach chutney were an absolute delight. The well-cooked rice and lamb further showcased the kitchen's expertise. While the decor is inviting and the service friendly and efficient, it's the exceptional cuisine that steals the show. Despite being a bit of a drive, this place is an absolute must-visit for Indian food lovers seeking a truly remarkable culinary adventure. Highly recommended!

For those seeking a quick, casual dining experience with a focus on flavorful, well-executed dishes, Greko hits the sweet spot. It's a rare gem that manages to captivate diners to the point of returning repeatedly within a short span, making it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking an exceptional Greek culinary adventure.

Compere Lapin is a fantastic addition to the New Orleans dining scene. The cozy ambiance, stellar cocktail selection (try the Oban 18), and incredible house biscuits set the stage for a delightful culinary experience. While some small plates like the crispy chicken skins lacked flavor, standouts included the fresh marinated shrimp, jalapeño jus, and the smoked tuna tartare. The decadent dobeger cake with lemon curd, chocolate ice cream, and rich chocolate sauce is a must-try for dessert. With its inviting atmosphere and creative fare, Compere Lapin is an excellent choice for groups, date nights, or any occasion.

Overall, while the pizza didn't impress, the toasted ravioli alone would make me consider ordering from Imo's again, albeit skipping the pizza and sticking solely to the ravioli. A mixed experience, but the ravioli left a lasting positive impression.

Having grown up savoring the flavors of Italian cuisine, I can confidently say that Mazzaro's is the epitome of authenticity. Their signature sauce and meatballs are nothing short of a culinary masterpiece, bursting with rich, traditional flavors that transport you straight to the heart of Italy. If you're seeking a genuine Italian dining experience, Mazzaro's is a must-visit!"

The Mandarin is a trendy dance club in the Central West End (CWE) area, offering a mix of higher-end cocktails and beers alongside standard well drinks and domestic bottles. The venue boasts a spacious patio that remains mostly open even in winter, thanks to an enclosure. While the music is hit-or-miss, ranging from danceable genres like hip-hop, pop, and rock to less danceable tunes, the patio provides a quieter space for conversation. On certain nights, men are required to pay a cover charge, which is common in the industry. Overall, The Mandarin is worth a visit if you're in the mood for dancing and don't mind the occasional off-beat music selection. It caters to a specific crowd, but if that's your scene, it's a great option in the CWE.

Nestled on the lively Frenchmen Street, this cozy establishment offers a delightful happy hour experience. The highlight is undoubtedly the $4 tapas during their daily 4-6:30 pm happy hour. The pork pot stickers and smoked hanger steak with chimichurri sauce were standout dishes, delivering great flavor at an unbeatable price. Surprisingly, the lobster egg rolls, despite their unassuming appearance, were a tasty treat. The diverse menu, featuring Asian influences from the Korean owner/chef, adds an interesting twist to the offerings. Complemented by live piano tunes and affordable drinks, this place is a gem for those seeking a lively yet cozy spot to unwind after work or kick off an evening on Frenchmen Street. Highly recommended for its excellent happy hour deals and vibrant ambiance.

While the food was passable, the overall dining experience was marred by the overly cramped and chaotic setting. The restaurant felt rushed, with too many tables crammed into a small space, leading to constant disruptions as servers and customers frequently bumped into our chairs. The congested layout made for an uncomfortable and less than enjoyable meal.

Avoid this restaurant at all costs. The service was abysmal, with a rude waiter that ruined the entire dining experience. The food was equally disappointing. If you're craving delicious BYO Italian cuisine in a welcoming atmosphere, head to La Baia on 17th and Lombard instead. They won't let you down.

This new Randall's location is a fantastic addition to the West County area. While the Jefferson store has been a staple, having a local Randall's is a game-changer for convenience. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, creating a pleasant shopping experience. Beer enthusiasts will appreciate the solid selection, featuring various styles at competitive prices compared to other beer markets nearby. If you're in the area, this Randall's is well worth a visit for its friendly service and quality beer offerings.

Deseree is an exceptional hairstylist with over a decade of experience. She masterfully handles any hair transformation, from color changes to length adjustments, delivering flawless results every time. Her professionalism, dependability, and accommodating nature make her a joy to work with. I have entrusted her with styling my wedding hair and that of my six bridesmaids, confident that her expertise will create picture-perfect hairstyles. Deseree's humorous personality is an added bonus, making every appointment delightful. Highly recommended for all your hair needs!

The Sockeye Grill disappoints with slow service, subpar food, and a lackluster ambiance. While the salmon and dark lager were excellent, the salads, dressings, finger steaks, and lighter beers failed to impress. The waitress's beer knowledge was a redeeming quality. However, the warehouse-like atmosphere with TVs broadcasting news channels dampened the dining experience. With several misses in both food and atmosphere, this restaurant needs significant improvements before warranting a return visit.

Celebrating a birthday at this rotisserie grill proved to be a delightful experience. The staff went above and beyond with attentive service, complimentary treats, and a warm atmosphere. While the veggie burrito fell short, the rotisserie chicken, tri-tip, and pulled pork dishes were outstanding – moist, flavorful, and generously portioned. With reasonable prices and exceptional service, this restaurant is a solid choice for meat-lovers, making it a place we'll gladly revisit, albeit without the vegetarian companion.

If you're looking for an authentic New Orleans experience, Tip-ton Venue is a must-visit. I had the pleasure of catching Anders Osborne's performance here, and it was undoubtedly a highlight of my trip to NOLA. The venue's proximity to Bourbon Street made it easily accessible via streetcar, although I wish I had lingered longer to fully immerse myself in the vibrant atmosphere. The tantalizing aromas wafting from the food offerings were simply mouthwatering, and the drinks were surprisingly affordable. Perhaps the most remarkable aspect was the mellow, welcoming crowd that added to the overall ambiance. Tip-ton Venue offers an authentic music experience in the heart of New Orleans, making it a gem for locals and visitors alike.

Ralph's, touted as one of the best Italian restaurants in Philadelphia, failed to live up to its reputation during our visit. The grilled calamari appetizer was drowned in an overly salty red sauce, masking the flavor of the calamari itself. The pasta bolognese with filet mignon tips was similarly plagued by an excessively salty red sauce, and the beef tips were of average quality. Even the black lobster ravioli, while decent, suffered from an overpowering saltiness. For the oldest Italian restaurant in the country, our expectations were left unmet, leaving us disappointed with the overall dining experience.

Sabino Canyon is a breathtaking high desert oasis nestled in the stunning Catalina Mountains. Its natural beauty and dramatic landscapes leave visitors in awe. With its excellent hiking and running trails, it's a beloved outdoor destination for locals who embrace the #MCLifeTucson lifestyle. An absolute must-visit gem for nature enthusiasts!

While the place boasts a large craft beer selection, the beer service leaves much to be desired. One of the beers I ordered had an off-flavor (sour), which the bartender didn't bother investigating when I sent it back, suggesting a lack of beer knowledge. Their glassware choices are questionable, with the superior English Nonic Pint glasses used for water and the inferior shaker pints used for beer. The shaker pints are also kept too cold in the fridge. Overall, for a burger joint promoting its craft beer selection, the beer knowledge and service fall short of expectations.

Orangetheory Fitness offers an incredible full-body workout experience. With a diverse range of classes available at convenient times, it's an excellent choice for anyone seeking an effective and versatile fitness routine. The enthusiastic endorsement speaks volumes about the enjoyable and rewarding nature of their program.

An excellent tour experience! The knowledgeable and engaging guide, Raymond, really made it enjoyable. The tasty food stops along the way were a delightful addition. Highly recommended as a worthwhile investment of time and money.

Ron's remains a regular go-to for craft beer enthusiasts and casual diners alike. The rotating selection of craft beers is a highlight, with excellent offerings during my recent visit. While the food menu can be hit or miss, sticking to their tried-and-true dishes will ensure a tasty meal to accompany your brews. A dependable spot for a enjoyable night out, just know what to order from the kitchen.

This donut shop is a real gem! The donuts are made fresh to order, ensuring you get to enjoy them at their absolute best. While the short wait time for the donuts to cool down might test your patience, it's well worth it for the unbeatable taste and quality. The clean and never overcrowded environment adds to the pleasant experience. With ample parking, it's convenient for those driving in. Undoubtedly, these are the best donuts in the Philly area – a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.
Rating: 1/5 stars

As someone with high standards for French pastries, Café Soleil exceeded my expectations. The croissants were buttery, flaky, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious – even better than some I've had in France. The secret lies in the imported ingredients and the skilled hands of the French baker, Nico, who adds an authentic touch to every creation. Despite being a 45-minute drive away, the quality of the pastries makes it worth the trip. Nico's friendly and personable demeanor adds to the charming experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a genuine taste of France.

Tre Scalini is a fantastic neighborhood BYOB Italian restaurant that delivers excellent food and welcoming service at reasonable prices. It offers an authentic, unpretentious Italian dining experience, making it a go-to place to work your way through their delicious menu. The specials, like the broccoli rabe and sausage or grilled romaine salad, are standout dishes. The classic pasta with red sauce is also satisfying. The friendly staff makes you feel like a regular, even if it's your first visit. While it's conveniently located near sports venues, reservations are recommended due to its popularity. Overall, Tre Scalini is a must-visit for those seeking a genuinely enjoyable Italian meal in a warm, neighborhood setting.

Unfortunately, without any additional context or background information provided, I cannot write a meaningful review about "Todd Cobell." A review typically requires some details about the subject matter, such as a book, movie, product, or performance. Without knowing what "Todd Cobell" refers to, I cannot compose a thoughtful and accurate review. If you can provide more specifics about the topic you would like me to review, I would be happy to assist.
With its lively atmosphere, exceptional service, and mouth-watering food, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit. Highly recommended!

Despina at EWC is a waxing virtuoso! Her skills are unmatched, delivering impeccable results with utmost professionalism and a friendly demeanor. The waxing experience at EWC is far superior to traditional strip waxing, leaving you feeling refreshed and fabulous. Despina's expertise in shaping eyebrows is exceptional, creating on-fleek looks. She truly makes waxing appointments an enjoyable experience – Despina is undoubtedly the best in the business.

While the driver was friendly and the pizza tasted delicious, the temperature of the pizza was lukewarm at best. Unfortunately, this is the second time I've experienced this issue with this establishment. Until they can consistently deliver hot, fresh pizzas, I'll have to explore other dining options.

Sbraga's Chef's Counter six-course tasting menu with wine pairings is an indulgent yet worthwhile experience. The open kitchen allowed for an enthralling view of the culinary team's well-choreographed dance. From the heavenly Gruyere popover with foie gras soup amuse to the standout saffron spaghetti with blue crab, crispy Arctic char, and unexpectedly delightful chicken liver mousse, every dish was a delectable triumph. The expertly paired wines complemented the flavors exquisitely. Sbraga's team went above and beyond, presenting the birthday celebrant with a thoughtful note and gift bag. An unforgettable dining experience that warrants a revisit.

GlobalQ is a must-try for anyone seeking a unique and delicious dining experience. With an impressive menu boasting gigantic quesadillas and wraps bursting with creative flavor combinations, they consistently deliver quality ranging from satisfactory to phenomenal. Standout items include the 'Montreal' and 'New Orleans' wraps, as well as the unlisted but highly recommended 'French Dip' quesadilla – a must-try for French dip enthusiasts. The portions are generously sized, ensuring you'll have leftovers for the next day. Moreover, GlobalQ offers the convenience of delivery service, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a hassle-free dining experience. If you're craving something out of the ordinary, GlobalQ is the place to explore.

Wendy's has stepped up their game significantly. After avoiding the place for a while, I was pleasantly surprised by the high quality of their food, especially the sea salt fries. It's a refreshing change for a fast-food joint, and even though I typically don't rate such establishments highly, Wendy's deserves praise for their improved offerings. A solid choice for a quick, tasty meal.

What was once a beloved lunch destination has sadly taken a turn for the worse. Despite multiple visits and past enjoyment, the recent experiences have been marred by subpar service and underwhelming food. The declining quality is a letdown, making it challenging to justify the expense. While cherished memories linger, the inconsistent standards have diminished the appeal, and a return visit seems unlikely for the time being.
Rating: 2/5 stars

That BBQ Place offers a dining experience that falls short despite its neat ambiance and friendly service. The lack of proper cutlery, table service, and glassware doesn't justify the wildly overpriced fare. Additionally, the ribs lack the desired bark and are too moist for some tastes. While the restaurant seems to be popular among Sherwood Parkers, it's unlikely to be a return destination for those seeking an authentic BBQ experience at a reasonable price point.

Avoid this store if you value your time. The severe understaffing results in excruciatingly long checkout lines, with wait times often exceeding 25 minutes. While the workers are friendly, it's evident that management prioritizes profits over customer experience by intentionally keeping staff numbers low. Unless you have an abundance of patience, it's best to steer clear of this establishment until they address their staffing issues.

Mel's is a delightful eatery that serves up mouthwatering sandwiches in a welcoming atmosphere. Their turkey club is a standout, generously stuffed with fresh turkey on delicious multi-grain bread. The service is friendly and attentive, with the cook/waiter greeting guests with a warm smile. The tantalizing aroma of a pork roast being prepared for the next day's sandwiches is enough to make one's mouth water. Mel's is a must-visit for anyone craving a satisfying sandwich experience, and their breakfast offerings are already highly anticipated.

An absolute gem for authentic Mexican cuisine! This place serves up delicious tacos and tortas with lightning-fast service. Their baked goods are equally impressive, making it a one-stop-shop for all your Mexican food cravings. Highly recommended for those seeking a tasty and efficient dining experience.

The Monteleone Hotel in New Orleans is a true gem for a memorable stay. As newlyweds celebrating our honeymoon over New Year's, we were fortunate to experience the hotel's historic charm and impeccable service. The beautiful decor, coupled with an unexpected room upgrade, set the tone for a relaxing and luxurious visit. The rooftop pool boasts stunning city views, and our room's jacuzzi tub added a touch of indulgence. The hotel's prime location allowed us to explore the vibrant city on foot with ease. We can't wait to return and relive the magic of the Monteleone.

While the salad was decent, the dining experience left much to be desired. The bread portions were meager, and the lack of sweet tea was disappointing. Moreover, the staff's inattentiveness to a booth with unattended children for an extended period raised serious concerns about the restaurant's commitment to customer care and safety. One employee seemingly brought her own children to work, leaving them unattended for an alarmingly long time. Overall, the establishment needs to address these issues to provide a satisfactory dining experience.

Celebrated my college graduation with my brother at this restaurant. The ambiance was fantastic, providing great vibes for our special occasion. Our waiter deserves high praise for their outstanding service. Most importantly, the food was absolutely delicious, making the entire experience truly memorable. Highly recommended for any celebration or casual dining.

Blaze Pizza, a new addition to the area, left a sour taste in my mouth during my first visit. Despite clearly stated hours indicating they were open until 10 PM, I was abruptly informed they were closed as soon as I joined the line at 9 PM on a Tuesday night. No explanation was provided for this discrepancy between their advertised hours and actual closing time. As an eagerly anticipated newcomer to the neighborhood, Blaze Pizza failed to deliver on its promise of service, leaving me disappointed with my inaugural experience. While I hope this was an isolated incident, the lack of communication and disregard for posted operating hours does not bode well for potential return visits.

Dr. Dayley's dental practice is a true gem! Despite my past traumatic experience and dental anxiety, Dr. Dayley's personable approach and expertise put me at ease. He skillfully performed a wisdom teeth extraction, and I trust him wholeheartedly with my dental care. The entire staff, including the welcoming front desk, provides an exceptional experience. My entire family, including parents and siblings, are patients here – a testament to their excellence. Highly recommended for their outstanding service and ability to alleviate dental fears. Dr. Dayley and his team are simply the best!

Pei Wei Asian Diner is a fast-casual spin-off from the popular P.F. Chang's chain. While the atmosphere lacks the upscale ambiance of its parent restaurant, the food delivers on flavor and value. The efficient counter-service model ensures a quick turnaround, with orders arriving piping hot within minutes. Despite the fast-food setup, the dishes pack a flavorful punch that belies their affordable pricing. For fans of P.F. Chang's seeking a more casual and speedy dining experience without compromising on taste, Pei Wei is a solid recommendation.

Highly recommended for excellent blow outs! The entire staff at this salon is talented and friendly. Online booking makes appointments convenient. Krissy and Bianca are standout stylists. The vital shot deep conditioning treatment is a game-changer, especially for blondes like me, leaving hair nourished for a week without adding extra time. A top-notch experience all around!

Overall, the experience was unsatisfactory due to the mishandling of temperature-sensitive items, resulting in subpar sushi quality. The calamari and lettuce wraps were also disappointing and did not match the menu descriptions. While the delivery was prompt and the spicy tuna roll was enjoyable, the overall meal fell short of expectations. I would not recommend this restaurant and will likely return to Niji's on 5th for better sushi in the future.

Disappointing bar experience. The bartender exhibited a clear bias towards regular patrons, blatantly ignoring new customers waiting to order. Despite having cash in hand, ready to purchase, the bartender consistently prioritized serving the same familiar faces. An unwelcoming and frustrating atmosphere that left a sour taste. Service should be impartial and attentive to all guests.

Normand's Bistro near the Winspear Opera House is a decent option for post-show snacks and drinks. While the menu seemed a tad overpriced, the food quality was good, with fresh ingredients and flavorful dishes like the Caesar salad and smoked salmon Carpaccio. The portion sizes could be better, though, as the "jumbo" shrimp were average-sized for the $15 salad. The soup and dessert offerings looked appealing, and they had an interesting beer selection. The bistro stays open late on weekends, making it a convenient spot for a bite after performances in the area. Overall, it's a reasonably priced choice for those seeking a casual late-night spot near the Winspear, but don't expect exceptional value for money.

Excellent customer service! The managers at this store, especially Tonya, went above and beyond to resolve an issue with a damaged item I had previously purchased. They were incredibly helpful, accommodating, and did not hesitate to make things right. Tonya in particular provided outstanding assistance. Highly recommend this store for their stellar service.

This pet store is a true gem! With a wide selection of toys and well-stocked inventory, it's a delightful shopping experience, especially when they have sales. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and friendly, providing excellent guidance on products. What really sets this place apart is that they allow pets inside, making it a welcoming environment for fur babies. Despite being a chain, it has a warm, neighborhood feel. Highly recommended for all pet owners!

While the service was excellent with a very friendly staff, the food left much to be desired. On the day we visited, I ordered a to-go item recommended as one of the most popular German dishes. However, it turned out to be nothing more than a plain pretzel and a single sausage link in a box - a huge letdown for what was promoted as a highlight from their menu. The friendly service couldn't make up for the underwhelming and overpriced food. Perhaps it was an off day in the kitchen, but the lackluster meal was not on par with expectations.

As a longtime fan of Charlie's, I recently revisited the store for new jeans and had an excellent experience. The sales associate was incredibly attentive, pulling numerous options for me to try on and patiently explaining the differences in fits and washes. Despite my indecisiveness, she remained patient and helpful. I ended up discovering and purchasing two pairs of the Sebastian McCall brand, which are both stylish and comfortable. Charlie's outstanding customer service and quality offerings solidified my love for this store.

Disappointing experience at this car wash. Despite paying for the 'Super wash' package, the cleaning job was shoddy. There were large dirt smudges on the sides, cup holders were barely touched, and the vacuuming was subpar with paper scraps left on the floor. To make matters worse, they neglected to mention that they don't clean third rows on 'Senior Discount Day' until after I had already paid. When I addressed this issue with the manager, his response was dismissive and unapologetic, essentially saying 'too bad' for me not knowing their policy. Such poor customer service and lack of transparency is unacceptable. I would not recommend this car wash to others.

While the seafood combo, especially the generous portion of catfish, along with the red beans and rice, and coleslaw, was pretty damn good, the highlight was the 2-for-1 happy hour deal on drinks from 4pm-7pm. The margarita, however, fell short of expectations, failing to meet the high standards of someone from California. Nevertheless, the delicious food made up for the average margarita. If you're in the mood for a hearty seafood meal complemented by a budget-friendly drink special, this place is worth a visit.

Heavenly Massage is a true gem in Rita Ranch. After moving to the area and tackling extensive home renovations, my husband and I found solace in their exceptional massages. The facility is always impeccably clean, and they respect your scheduled time without any shortcuts. Felicia, in particular, stands out for her remarkable therapeutic skills. During my recent visit for a nagging neck issue, her talented massage provided incredible relief. Felicia's expertise in targeting problem areas is unmatched. Heavenly Massage comes highly recommended for a rejuvenating and therapeutic experience.

The Sunrise Family Restaurant offers a cozy, small-town diner ambiance with friendly and prompt service. While the Monte Cristo sandwich was a letdown, with microwaved meat and limp french toast, the accompanying steak fries were golden and delicious. The salad was also enjoyable. Despite the unsatisfying sandwich, the restaurant shows promise, especially for breakfast items. It's worth giving another try to explore more of their menu offerings.

Butcher & Bee offers a charming farmhouse ambiance with cozy booths, though seating can be tight for larger groups. The pork belly gnocchi lacked textural contrast, as crispy pork belly would have elevated the dish. The trout sandwich was disappointing, resembling a tuna salad sandwich more than expected. The coconut macaroons were enjoyable, while the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) sandwich received praise. Mixed reviews from the group overall, but the unique touch of using books as bill holders added to the quaint appeal. While not a standout experience, Butcher & Bee warrants another visit to explore more of its menu offerings.

The beer event offers an impressive variety of local, national, and international brews, making it a delight for beer enthusiasts. The drinks are reasonably priced at $2-4 for a 4 oz. sample. However, the food options are overpriced, with a small cup of fancy macaroni and cheese costing a whopping $6. While the VIP experience includes a glass mug, beer class, and seminar, it may not be worth the extra cost unless you fully utilize the offerings. The venue's parking fee of $16 adds to the overall expense. Despite these drawbacks, the event remains a fun and enjoyable experience for those passionate about exploring different beers. The on-site liquor store also provides the convenience of purchasing your favorite sampled brews.

Kiwi Nails consistently delivers a subpar service, cutting corners and providing shoddy workmanship. During my recent visit, after a poorly done fill with French tips, the nail tech refused to properly fix my accidentally smudged nails, opting instead to carelessly paint over the mess, leaving a dripping, clumpy disaster. Adding insult to injury, the staff expects customers to tip in cash, even when the service was unsatisfactorily rendered. Overall, Kiwi Nails offers a frustrating and unprofessional experience, and I strongly caution against visiting this establishment. Save yourself the hassle and go elsewhere for your nail care needs.

Despite not being a fan of fast food, Chick-fil-A stands out as a superior option. Their food quality is exceptional, with a noticeable absence of fillers commonly found in other fast-food chains. The ingredients used are fresh and satisfying, making it a healthier and more enjoyable fast-food experience.

Square 1682 is a stellar hotel bar that excels in all aspects – delectable food, impeccable service, and an upscale ambiance. The bar attracts a diverse yet friendly crowd, making it easy to strike up engaging conversations. However, the true highlight is the exceptional bartender, Dan, who works on Mondays. With his personalized attention, remarkable memory for patrons' preferences, and unparalleled skills, Dan elevates the experience to extraordinary heights. His presence alone is reason enough to frequent Square 1682 on Mondays, creating cherished memories that keep patrons coming back time and again to this fine establishment.

A local favorite, this cozy cafe delivers a delightful dining experience. Arrive early to beat the crowds and savor their delectable offerings without delay. While the menu may be concise, it boasts a decent selection of coffees, including the coveted French press. The Wilburt Skillet is a standout dish that keeps patrons coming back for more, thanks to its fresh, flavorful ingredients. The friendly staff and prompt service ensure a satisfying meal that leaves you full and content. A must-visit gem for those seeking a delightful culinary adventure.

European Wax Center in Philadelphia failed to impress. Despite giving it two chances, the experiences were subpar. The first waxer, Despina, was entirely silent throughout the appointment, making it awkward. She also missed several areas, leaving patches of hair behind. The second waxer, Amy Jo, was friendly but extremely rushed and sloppy, leaving half the hair unremoved before a special occasion. The 8-minute service felt hurried and incomplete for the $47+ price point. Adding insult, the front desk staff came across as rude and disinterested in providing good customer service. The request to announce a tip preference instead of discretely inputting it also felt uncomfortable. Overall, the salon's inconsistent quality, lack of customer care, and rushed services make it difficult to recommend, leaving the search for a decent waxing experience in Philadelphia ongoing.

This cozy eatery offers an exceptional dining experience with its creative and flavorful dishes. The Cuban Lamb Frita, especially with the addition of an egg, is a standout must-try item. The side options are equally delightful, ensuring a satisfying meal no matter what you order. Complementing the delectable fare is the friendly and attentive staff who keep the coffee flowing. It's no wonder this gem has quickly become a go-to brunch destination for many.

While the high prices don't quite match the small portion sizes, this place shines with its affordable drinks, attentive service, and the delightful ambiance created by the live piano music. The true star, however, is the incredible cheesecake – a must-try that makes it worth overlooking any shortcomings. Overall, a pleasant experience, especially if you prioritize the cheesecake and drinks over the main courses.

Ruby Slipper Cafe is an absolute gem for breakfast and brunch in New Orleans. While the space is a bit tight, making it prone to crowds, the incredible food more than makes up for it. Their menu boasts an impressive array of delectable options, including vegetarian and vegan choices. The french toast specials are a particular standout, always leaving patrons craving for more. It's a go-to spot for locals and visitors alike, especially during Mardi Gras when the line snakes out the door. If you're in the area, be prepared to beat the crowd, but trust that the wait is well worth it for a truly amazing dining experience.

Butch's tour was an excellent way to kick off my stay. He provided a relaxing yet informative experience, with well-timed stops for dining and visiting a cemetery. His fun personality added to the enjoyable atmosphere. I highly recommend taking this tour at the start of your trip to get a lay of the land and plan your activities accordingly.

This food truck is an absolute must-try for anyone craving delicious and creative street foods. Their unique offering, the Captain Crunch tilapia burrito, is a standout dish that perfectly blends the crispy, flaky fried fish with fresh veggies and a zesty Sriracha mayo. The katsu and curry chicken options are also flavor-packed winners. Even their Thai tea is exceptional. Despite being a small operation, they deliver big on variety and quality. With friendly service and affordable prices, it's no wonder the reviewer gladly drives all the way from New Jersey to satisfy their cravings at this outstanding food truck.

When I was having a terrible day with a migraine and sinus infection, Massage Envy came to the rescue. Not only did they accommodate me and my father on short notice, but the therapists Jen and Carrie provided exceptional service. Jen was understanding, attentive, and even showed me at-home techniques. My father thoroughly enjoyed his foot massage with Carrie. The friendly staff, calming atmosphere, and cost-effective membership program convinced me to sign up without hesitation. I left feeling remarkably better and can't wait to return for another rejuvenating massage. Highly recommended for a top-notch massage experience!

This place serves up some of the best roast chicken around. The chicken is perfectly cooked, with moist and flavorful meat complemented by a crispy, smoky skin that's simply irresistible. The aromas are tantalizing, making your mouth water before you even take a bite. The double chicken family meal is a steal, featuring two whole chickens generously accompanied by a bed of tasty wedge fries and cole slaw – more than enough to feed a family of four. The dipping sauces, particularly the mustard-chipotle and green salsa varieties, are standouts. Service is attentive, and the owners' friendly demeanor adds to the overall pleasant experience. Compared to fast-food chains, this place offers a healthier, more substantial, and better-valued option. It's a must-try for anyone craving exceptional roast chicken that's sure to have you coming back for more.

If you're not a fan of traditional sushi but still crave Japanese flavors, this place is a great option. Their rice bowls and tempura dishes are delicious and satisfying. The restaurant doesn't get too crowded, so you can enjoy a quick lunch or dinner without long waits. The service is efficient for a fast-food establishment. They also offer catering services with sushi and maki platters for events. Overall, it's a convenient spot to grab a tasty Japanese-inspired meal while sticking to your dietary preferences.

As a newcomer to the Westchase area, I was in search of a reliable dentist. Based on positive reviews and the convenient location just half a mile away, I decided to try this dental practice. I'm delighted with my decision. The entire staff is fantastic, and both Dr. Creech-Gionis and Dr. Stern are exceptional. They make dental visits a comfortable experience. I'm 100% satisfied and highly recommend this dental practice.
While cleanliness is a concern with the former favorite, Gloria's, the search for a satisfying Mexican dining experience in Boise continues.

The service was exceptional, with Heather being an attentive waitress and bartender. The food was simply delicious, particularly the tenderloin sliders and french fries, which left me craving for more. I wholeheartedly recommend this place and can't wait to return as often as possible. You won't regret giving it a try!

Avoid LEX Nightclub like the plague. The bouncers are unbearably rude and aggressive, likely due to deep-seated insecurities and unresolved childhood issues. This establishment epitomizes the worst aspects of Reno's nightlife scene. Only consider going if your other option is literal torture during a family gathering.

Here's a concise 5-star review based on the provided text:

"An absolute gem for gourmet sandwiches and delectable specials on St. Pete Beach! The Artisan sandwiches are a steal, with fresh ingredients and flavorful sauces cooked to perfection by the friendly owner. Today's shrimp tacos with kiwi sauce were a standout - perfectly cooked shrimp on fresh tortillas with the perfect kick of spice and fruity notes. While seating is limited to outdoor benches, the exceptional quality easily makes up for it. A must-visit for locals and tourists alike seeking an affordable, mouthwatering beach bite."

The Yolk Modern Retreat offers a stunning contemporary setting with breathtaking views. While the proximity to the train tracks can be a bit noisy for rooms on that side, the overall experience is excellent. The highlight is the conveniently located Yolk restaurant just around the corner, making it an ideal choice for those seeking a stylish stay with great dining options nearby.

I went in for a full set of acrylics and provided a photo reference for the desired length. However, the nails were cut much shorter than requested. When I pointed out a crooked nail, the technician admitted they hadn't filed it properly before applying the acrylic. As they attempted to fix it, the nail kept getting shorter and shorter. This was a frustrating experience, especially since it wasn't my first visit there. Unfortunately, it will be my last due to the poor service and lack of attention to detail."

Tuesdays at this tapas bar are a must-visit! With an enticing selection of half-priced tapas and $5 sangria/margaritas, it's a delightful deal. The fried manchego, hot cauliflower, and camarones (shrimp) tapas were standouts – uniquely flavored and incredibly tasty. An over-the-top dining experience that shouldn't be missed!

The Venue offers an authentic taste of New Orleans' vibrant Jazz culture. With its focus solely on live Jazz performances, it provides an immersive musical experience without the distractions of food or alcohol. The $15 ticket price is a bargain for the opportunity to enjoy exceptional Jazz talent in an intimate setting. If you're a true music lover seeking to explore the heart of NOLA's cultural heritage, this is the place to be.

For those seeking a peaceful shopping oasis, this mall offers a refreshingly uncrowded atmosphere. It's the perfect destination to browse and make purchases without battling mobs of shoppers. Enjoy a tranquil retail therapy experience.

H & I Steakhouse is a solid choice for a high-quality steakhouse experience. The service was attentive and professional, and our waiter's recommendation of the aged ribeye steak was spot-on – it was one of the best steaks we've ever had, cooked to perfection. The signature shrimp cocktail and iceberg lettuce wedge salad were also standouts, showcasing classic steakhouse fare done right. While the wine list could have offered a broader selection of mid-range bottles, this is a minor quibble. Overall, H & I Steakhouse is highly recommended for an exceptional steakhouse meal. 4.5/5 stars.

Caruso's Italian Restaurant is a massive disappointment. Despite a 45-minute wait with hungry kids, the service was forgetful, and the food was subpar. The lemonade was overly tart, the garlic bread stale, and the Italian dressing the only option for salads. The stuffed shells were overbaked and hard, the chicken parmesan bland, and the marinara sauce tasted aged. The only saving grace was the decent salmon dish. For an underwhelming $50 meal, it's better to visit more authentic Italian places like Contessa, where everything is freshly made. Caruso's failed to deliver an enjoyable Italian dining experience, and I won't be returning.

Although initially hesitant about visiting a strip mall bar, the establishment exceeded expectations thanks to a recommendation from a friend who works there. The food, particularly the pizza, received high praise and is a must-try. Additionally, the newly added craft bar offerings are noteworthy, providing a great selection at reasonable prices. Overall, this hidden gem delivers an enjoyable experience with quality food and drinks, making it worth a visit despite its unassuming location.

I tried the Buffalo chicken salad from this restaurant for the first time, and it was an absolute delight! The fresh, crispy romaine lettuce complemented the perfectly cooked chicken and smooth blue cheese dressing beautifully. Despite living nearby, this was my first visit, but the delicious salad has ensured that I'll be a returning customer. Highly recommended!

Luke Restaurant in New Orleans' Central Business District offers an impressive French-German dining experience, despite a rocky start with the host's initial reluctance to seat us without reservations. Once seated, the open kitchen and historic ambiance set the stage for a delightful meal. The cocktails were well-crafted, and the dishes showcased bold flavors, from the raved-about Luke Burger to the standout Moules et Frites with a flavorful broth and house-made fries. The Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" was a hit, while the Crawfish Bisque left a sour aftertaste. The Bread Pudding was deliciously sweet, and the Bourbon Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee stole the show as a perfectly balanced dessert. Despite the initial seating hiccup, our server's exceptional service and engaging demeanor more than made up for it, making Luke Restaurant a must-visit for those seeking an impressive French-German dining experience in New Orleans.

While the facility offers a modern touch with TVs in the exam rooms, the high prices overshadow this perk. During my recent visit, I was recommended several costly inlays that weren't covered by insurance, raising questions about the necessity of the work. While the dental work itself was satisfactory, the overall experience left me feeling that the practice prioritizes profit over patient care and affordability. Proceed with caution and be prepared for potential upselling of expensive procedures.

Paris Parker salon exceeded my expectations! Despite not having a prior recommendation, my stylist Stacey delivered excellent results on my full highlight appointment. She expertly removed brassy tones and achieved a natural, vibrant blonde shade on the first try - a rarity for blonde hair. Stacey's skills and pleasant demeanor made the lengthy appointment enjoyable. Highly recommended, though her talent may soon make her too popular for her own good!

While the loose tea can be pricey, this tea shop offers an excellent selection of ready-made teas, with new and exciting options to try. The ability to customize your own blends is a fantastic perk, and the staff ensures each creation turns out perfectly. Moreover, the staff is incredibly friendly and personable, remembering regular customers' preferences. A delightful tea experience overall!

GRI stands apart from typical mall jewelers, offering a relaxed, enjoyable environment where you feel like you're working with friends, not just making a transaction. If you want a truly memorable jewelry experience and a breathtaking, unique piece, look no further than GRI. Highly recommended without hesitation.

This cocktail bar is a real gem! While the prices are on the higher side, the unique glassware and innovative cocktail creations like the Dragon's Tear and Blackmail make it worth the splurge. The ambiance is delightfully laid-back, with a well-curated mix of decor and music that perfectly complements the drinking experience. The food menu may not be a standout, but for expertly crafted cocktails in a cool, relaxed setting, this place is an absolute must-visit.

Pizzaville delivers an exceptional pizza experience with top-notch quality and service. The pizza crust strikes the perfect balance between crispy and chewy, complemented by flavorful cheese and tangy tomato sauce. They're generous with toppings, as evidenced by the abundance of mushrooms. The standout "breadsticks" are more like buttery, garlicky garlic bread strips that are irresistible. The prices may be on the higher side, but the quality justifies it. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and the restaurant maintains a clean ambiance. The lunch buffet is worth trying on a future visit. Overall, Pizzaville is a highly recommended spot for those craving an outstanding pizza and garlic bread experience.

While the service and staff were commendable, the restaurant fell short in its culinary offerings. The food lacked flavor and was disappointingly bland, and the drinks were merely average for a chain establishment. If you're seeking a quick, no-frills lunch spot, this place might suffice, but those in search of a more flavorful dining experience may want to look elsewhere.

The ambiance and modern, cozy decor at this restaurant were enjoyable, but the lighting could have been better for taking selfies. The service, however, left something to be desired. Our waiter seemed impatient and rushed, failing to provide a genuine dining experience. The food, on the other hand, was a mixed bag. The Shrimp Breaux Bridge and Balsamic Salmon were tasty, while the Pesto Crusted Idaho Trout stood out as a flavorful and well-cooked dish. However, the Zangria White sangria lacked the advertised seasonal fruits, which should have been disclosed on the menu. Despite the hit-and-miss aspects, the restaurant's menu and ambiance make it worth giving another try, in hopes of receiving better service.

Topping Rouge's Flagship Burgers! Rouge's spin-off burger joint delivers an exceptional burger experience that surpasses their flagship restaurant. With a constantly evolving menu of burger toppings and cheeses, they offer endless customization options. The Kobe Beef burger is a standout, especially when paired with delectable toppings like truffle cheese and grilled onions. Their brioche buns elevate the burgers to a whole new level of indulgence. Don't overlook their irresistible truffle oil fries, which are a perfect complement to the burgers. Moreover, their late-night availability on weekends is a major plus. If you're a burger enthusiast seeking an elevated dining experience, this spin-off is a must-visit.

Disappointing pizza experience. The pizza here was subpar compared to the previous establishment I visited. The former place offered far superior homemade food, which made me wish I had stuck with it instead of trying this new spot. The pizza failed to impress, and I wouldn't recommend it.

Quick Bite with a Great Jalapeno Burger and Patio Ambiance: This place hit the spot for a tasty lunch break. The jalapeno burger was flavorful and satisfying. Enjoying it on the patio added to the pleasant experience. I'll definitely return for another enjoyable casual meal.

Overall, this hotel excels in providing a luxurious and comfortable stay, with its pros far outweighing the minor cons. It's no wonder the reviewer keeps returning to this establishment whenever visiting Reno.

This place offers an engaging tour experience for those interested, complemented by a solid beer selection. However, the true highlight is the lively atmosphere. With a perfect blend of entertainment options like TVs for sports, board games, live music, and tours every hour, there's something for everyone. Despite the bustling environment, the vibe flows seamlessly. It's an ideal spot for a fun outing with friends or a delightful date night. Highly recommended for a guaranteed good time.

An utterly disappointing experience. The service was appallingly poor, the food was inedible, and the overall cleanliness of the establishment was shockingly unsanitary. I wouldn't be surprised if I contract food poisoning after this visit. Steer clear of this place at all costs.

The Beverage Shoppe is my go-to liquor store in Nashville. With a knowledgeable and approachable staff, they make you feel welcome whether you're seeking a budget-friendly wine or a top-shelf spirit. Their selection is impressive, and prices are competitive. The only downside is the high curb at the entrance, so take it slow when pulling in to avoid scraping your car's undercarriage. Overall, it's a fantastic spot for all your wine and liquor needs.

Circle of Friends Daycare is an excellent choice for childcare. The owner, Linda, is wonderful and accommodated my needs, even when I needed care for both my toddler and infant son. The staff turnover is low, which is important for consistency and building trust. My kids have thrived emotionally and academically, learning interesting facts beyond their age level. While there may be some unruly children at times, as is expected in any group setting, the positives far outweigh any negatives. Linda was incredibly helpful during a time of need years ago, and she continues to provide outstanding care. I'm very satisfied with my decision to enroll my children at Circle of Friends Daycare.

This restaurant's new Central location is a hit! The ambiance is inviting, thanks to the fantastic staff and lively atmosphere. It seems they've found the perfect spot to flourish and leave their mark on the local dining scene.

Mesob Ethiopian Restaurant offers an authentic Ethiopian ambiance and friendly service. However, the food falls short of expectations, lacking in flavor and taste compared to other Ethiopian eateries. While the location and atmosphere are pleasant, the cuisine is merely average and unremarkable. For those seeking a truly exceptional Ethiopian dining experience, this restaurant may leave you wanting more.

First Visit Success at [Restaurant Name]! The seafood seasoning was top-notch, particularly on the oysters and the $45 combo platter, which offered ample portions for our family of six, even with the addition of garlic chicken wings. The only hiccup was a mistake with our order, but overall, it was a satisfying experience that left us eager to return.

Disappointing Experience: 2/5 Stars. The chicken was overly salty, and the portion size was underwhelming for the price. Despite ordering a half chicken, rice, and plantains, I received only two pieces of plantains. At $8, the meal felt overpriced and not worth the cost. While the restaurant had great reviews, my experience was subpar. I'll hesitate before ordering from this establishment again.

Updated Review: After the recent delivery, a complete turnaround! They nailed our complex order, and the food quality was excellent. Definitely deserving of a 5-star rating now. Highly recommended for delicious and accurate Chinese take-out.

The Rib Cook-Off is a well-organized event that's easy to navigate with the JA Nugget app, which maps out all the vendors. Getting there via public transportation is a breeze and saves the hassle of parking. Start your day at Great Basin for their delicious large beers, perfect for battling the crowds. While ribs are the star, don't miss out on the non-rib vendors selling unique items like hats. Come prepared with cash as not all vendors accept cards. Saturdays can be a full-day affair, but Mondays offer a more relaxed experience with shorter queues. Plus, vendors start selling off remaining food at discounted prices towards the end of the day on Mondays. Whether you're a rib connoisseur or just looking for a fun day out, the Rib Cook-Off has something for everyone.

Brasserie Quartier delivers excellent food and an extensive drink menu in the CBD. The crab bisque and Poulet Grand-Mère entree were standout dishes. However, the slow and inattentive service from what seemed to be culinary intern servers was a drawback. While a good overall dining experience, there are likely better options to explore in the area before returning. 3.5/5 stars.
Overall, the Pancake Pantry is a must-visit for tourists and locals alike, offering delectable pancakes and a quintessential Nashville dining experience.

The Sunday brunch buffet at this restaurant is an indulgent extravaganza that will leave you stuffed and buzzed. With an extensive spread featuring seafood, sushi, pasta, carving stations, desserts (including a chocolate fountain), and bottomless mimosas heavy on the champagne, it's a recipe for gluttony. The brunch also offers a la carte options like waffles and French toast, which servers encourage you to order freely. While the $35 price tag seems steep, the all-you-can-eat and all-you-can-drink offerings make it worthwhile if you're prepared to overindulge. Even on a rainy day, the cozy ambiance and lack of crowds added to the experience. If you're looking for a decadent brunch where dietary restraint is left at the door, this is the place to be.

During our road trip, we stumbled upon this highly-rated spot for Baja fish tacos in Santa Barbara. The fish tacos were deliciously prepared, and the kitchen went above and beyond by providing a complimentary platter of battered shrimp upon our request. Savoring the flavorful tacos on the pleasant veranda, with friendly service, made for a delightful dining experience. We'll definitely revisit this gem on our next trip to Santa Barbara.

On the Border in Mount Laurel is a reliable spot for tasty chips and salsa, cold beer, and moderate prices. The vegetarian sides and cheese enchiladas are standout menu items. Service is generally good when dining, but the bar experience can be hit-or-miss depending on the bartender. Joann is an exceptional bartender – friendly, attentive, and provides great service. However, Nikki is the polar opposite – unfriendly, inattentive, and her poor service can ruin the experience. Overall, it's a solid Mexican restaurant if you catch the right bartender, offering a laidback atmosphere to enjoy appetizers and drinks.

Crown Candy Kitchen in St. Louis is a must-visit destination, especially for its famous peach shakes. Despite the long wait and confusing ordering process, the delicious treats and reasonable prices make it worth the effort. With a wide range of options, everyone in our group found something to enjoy. While the experience could be improved with better queue management, Crown Candy Kitchen remains a great spot to savor classic treats when in the area.

The dessert bar offers delicious cakes and treats, but the service leaves much to be desired. While the staff seemed well-meaning, the ordering and pickup process was inefficient, with an overly long wait time and an odd presentation of the to-go items. The barista's handling of a simple iced coffee order was particularly disappointing, requiring the customer to essentially make their own drink and resulting in an unpalatable beverage. Despite the excellent quality of the desserts, the subpar service and lack of attention to detail detracted from the overall experience. Hopefully, as a new business, they will work on improving their service standards to match the quality of their baked goods.

The JW Marriott hotel goes above and beyond in accommodating the needs of nursing mothers. During a recent trade show, the staff promptly provided a private, locked boardroom for pumping, ensuring privacy and cleanliness. Multiple moms were accommodated simultaneously with the same thoughtful service. The hotel's clean facilities and supportive, kind staff truly impressed. High praise for the JW Marriott's commitment to supporting working mothers - it made this new mom's day and experience incredibly positive.

While the food and atmosphere are commendable, the subpar service detracts from the overall dining experience. Improvements in staff training and attentiveness could elevate Joe's to a truly exceptional establishment.

This place is a real gem! The food is excellent, with a wide array of delicious choices. Their sandwiches are outstanding, featuring high-quality meats. But the standout item is their handmade toasted ravioli, which is arguably the best in town. The welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff add to the overall delightful dining experience.

Salt + Smoke (St. Louis): Authentic St. Louis-style BBQ with a bold, homemade sauce. The sweet, tangy, and slightly spicy sauce packs a punch, making it an acquired taste for those not accustomed to robust flavors. The pulled pork sandwich, accompanied by classic sides like baked beans and coleslaw, is a must-try for BBQ enthusiasts. Attentive service complements the flavorful fare. However, the bold flavors may be overwhelming for those with milder palates or infrequent exposure to hearty BBQ. Overall, a solid choice for those seeking a genuine St. Louis BBQ experience.

Disappointing and misleading food experience. The 'chicken salad sandwich' was a pathetic attempt, consisting of mere cubes of chicken with mayo, falling short of expectations. Similarly, the 'salad' was a bowl of plain lettuce, hardly qualifying as a substantial or satisfying salad. Overall, the portions were inadequate, leaving me hungry and dissatisfied with the lack of thought and effort put into the dishes. Highly disappointing and not recommended.

A delightful brunch experience! The omelets were sumptuous, and the bloody mary bar added a fun twist to the beverage options. While the bacon initially ran out, the staff was accommodating in replenishing it upon request. The budget breakfast with scrambled eggs, roasted potatoes, and a sweet muffin was satisfying. The fish tacos were also a tasty choice. The service was efficient and courteous, complementing the consistently good food. The al fresco dining on the patio provided a pleasant ambiance. Overall, a highly recommended spot for a enjoyable brunch outing.

This place is an absolute gem! Despite not having tried their famous pancakes yet, the basic breakfast fare of hashbrowns, eggs, and bacon was simply fantastic. The long line snaking out the door and down the sidewalk is a testament to its popularity and quality. The service was equally impressive, adding to the overall delightful experience. While parking can be a challenge in the area, it's a small price to pay for such an outstanding breakfast spot. I'm already eager to return and properly dine in to savor their legendary pancakes. Highly recommended!

C & B's delivered a delightful winter meal through Order Up Delivery Service. The Swanky Frank with fries was a hit, with the fries offering a nice seasoned touch. The large bowl of beef chili, a must-try from this renowned chili house, came perfectly packaged for a satisfying late-night snack. The option to have sour cream and crackers on the side for warming was a thoughtful touch. Highly recommended for a cozy chili night in during the chilly season!

This place offers delectable, decadent dishes that tantalize the taste buds, but be prepared to pay a premium price. The ever-changing menu keeps things exciting, ensuring you'll never experience the same flavors twice. However, their true standout is the mind-blowingly unique selection of donuts – a must-try for any adventurous foodie.

Livery offers a delightful dining experience with a menu that showcases a perfect blend of creativity and flavor. The Carriage House Margarita with its unique brandy twist is a must-try for those seeking a refreshing and inventive cocktail. The empanadas are simply irresistible, making it impossible to order just one variety – indulge in them all without shame. The Red Drum fish dish is a standout, not only for its delectable taste but also for the opportunity to savor the accompanying yuca fries. And no visit to Livery would be complete without indulging in the heavenly churros – so good that sharing is not an option. Whether you're a fan of bold flavors or seeking a culinary adventure, Livery's menu promises to delight your taste buds and leave you craving for more.

This bustling burger joint lived up to its reputation, providing swift, courteous service and reasonably priced fare, even with a full house. The Highland stouts were a nice accompaniment to the fresh, flavorful garden salad, though the vinaigrette dressing was a tad heavy. The real stars of the show were the burgers. My Black and Blue burger was perfectly cooked, with just the right amount of tangy blue cheese, nestled in a soft, fresh bun. The regular fries were crispy and lightly salted, made even better by the homemade ketchup with its perfect balance of flavors. My son's basic burger looked equally appetizing, and he raved about the exceptional sweet potato fries, quite possibly the best either of us has ever tasted. The burgers were so delicious that we devoured them in silence, always a testament to their quality. We'll definitely be returning to this gem for another round of their outstanding burgers and fries.

This New Orleans-based donut shop is an absolute gem! Their donuts are simply the best I've ever tasted, making it an absolute must-visit whenever in the city. The move to Florida left me craving for their delectable treats, wishing they offered shipping services. If you find yourself in New Orleans, do yourself a favor and indulge in these heavenly donuts – you won't regret it!

Katie's is a long-standing neighborhood gem, offering classic New Orleans cuisine with an Italian-American twist. While it may not be a culinary revelation, it delivers solid comfort food, with standout meatballs that are sure to please. The restaurant's charm lies in its authenticity, attracting a diverse crowd of classic New Orleans locals, especially during the early dinner hours. If you're seeking a no-frills, unpretentious dining experience that captures the essence of the city's culinary heritage, Katie's is a safe bet, provided you manage your expectations accordingly.

Top-notch auto service! The team here is incredibly efficient, friendly, and professional. Their speedy oil change turnaround time and exceptional customer service have made this my go-to spot for future oil changes. Highly recommended!

Based on the information provided, I would not feel comfortable writing a review that makes broad negative generalizations about a business based on ethnicity. Promoting discrimination or biased reviews would be unethical. Perhaps we could rephrase the review to focus solely on the specific poor customer service experienced, without making assumptions about the treatment of certain ethnicities. A concise, fact-based review stating "The hairstylist was rude and unprofessional during my visit" would be more appropriate.

An Embarrassing Disappointment: This run-down establishment is a prime candidate for Restaurant Impossible. With its tacky, mismatched decor, dim lighting to conceal the dinginess, and sticky surfaces, the atmosphere alone is a turnoff. The food fares no better – the burger was a charred, tasteless hockey puck, the 'baked crap soup' lived up to its accidental misnomer, and the crab stuffed mushrooms were lacking in crab. The only redeeming factor was the friendly service from the servers, but that's hardly enough to salvage this sorry excuse for a dining experience. Avoid at all costs unless you're desperate for a lesson in how not to run a restaurant.

New American Gem with Exceptional Service and Delicious Fare! This cozy restaurant, owned by a friendly and passionate proprietor, is a must-visit for those seeking a delightful dining experience. The service is impeccable, and the food is ridiculously good, with standout dishes like the flavorful Huevo Rancho and the mouthwatering Best Sandwich. The grits are also noteworthy, and the mixed berry waffle and traditional breakfast bagel are solid choices. Don't miss the opportunity to chat with the welcoming owner, who adds a personal touch to this hidden gem. Highly recommended for a memorable culinary adventure.

This place is a fantastic spot for happy hour! The oysters were absolutely delicious – we devoured two dozen of them. The cocktails, like the Riverbend and Champagne au Poir, were quite tasty too. The sides were excellent – the fries were great, and my friend raved about the grits, saying they were the best she'd ever had. Our server was attentive and provided just the right level of service. We'll definitely be returning for another enjoyable experience!

Bella Vista Designs is an exceptional event design company that truly shines with their professionalism, creativity, and affordability. They consistently deliver stunning designs that leave clients and guests in awe, with a "wow" factor that sets them apart. Their positive attitude and commitment to excellence ensure a seamless experience from start to finish. Highly recommended for those seeking an innovative and conscientious partner for unforgettable events that create lasting magical moments.

After relocating to Tucson, I needed to find a new dentist. My experience at this dental practice was excellent. The staff was friendly and professional, and the overall service was top-notch. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a reliable and efficient dental care provider in the area.

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. The food was mediocre at best, earning a C- rating, and the service was abysmal. They botched my order completely with no apologies offered. With numerous better options available on State Street, I strongly recommend avoiding this establishment. Save yourself the frustration and dine elsewhere.

Nunu's Mediterranean Cafe is an absolute gem in Manayunk. Taking over the former Mugshots location, this unassuming spot offers exceptionally fresh and flavorful Mediterranean fare at reasonable prices. The owner's hospitality shines through, making the dining experience truly delightful. The beef gyro, falafel, and hummus are standout dishes, bursting with authentic flavors and generous portions. The complimentary baklava is a sweet touch that adds to the overall value. With its unique offerings and warm service, Nunu's is a hidden treasure that deserves to thrive in the neighborhood. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a delicious and satisfying Mediterranean meal.

The restaurant offers delectable cuisine and exceptional service, creating an overall delightful experience. However, the timing of the entrée delivery could be improved, as it arrived a bit too soon after the appetizers, disrupting the natural flow of the meal. Despite this minor hiccup, the establishment deserves high praise for its culinary excellence and attentive staff.
