While not outright discouraged, this establishment offers nothing remarkable to warrant a recommendation. It's a serviceable option for those seeking a convenient, no-frills Chinese food experience without high expectations for ambiance or culinary sophistication.

An absolute must-visit! The Hickory burger is an absolute delight – juicy, flavorful, and downright delicious. This place nails it with their mouthwatering burgers, making it a surefire spot to return to time and again. Highly recommended!

While the small portions and lack of cozy booths were minor drawbacks, this restaurant offered a truly unique dining experience. The flavors were unbelievably delicious, thanks to the passionate and knowledgeable server, Brian, who enthusiastically discussed the intricate ingredients. The ever-changing, innovative menu showcases the skills of the talented chefs, making it a must-visit for foodies seeking culinary adventures. However, the complicated dishes might be overwhelming for frequent visits. Owned by a reputable local restaurant group, this establishment is definitely worth a try, at least once a year, for those seeking a memorable gastronomic journey.
If you're craving a fast and casual Asian dining experience, this place is worth giving a try, especially if you appreciate good value and a laidback atmosphere.

Snooze, an A.M. Eatery, offers a vast menu with a wide range of breakfast options, from traditional fare to unique specialties. The yelp app's waiting list feature proved handy during our busy Saturday morning visit, significantly reducing the wait time. Standout dishes included the delectable cinnamon French toast and the refreshing strawberry orange juice. While the traditional breakfast items were satisfactory, the extensive menu encourages multiple visits to explore the diverse offerings. The service was commendable, and the two payment counters streamlined the departure process. However, the restaurant could have been cooler for a more comfortable dining experience. Overall, Snooze delivers a enjoyable breakfast experience with its diverse menu, efficient service, and clever use of technology to manage the crowds.

Shaving Grace Barber Shop is a true gem! It perfectly captures the nostalgic vibe of an old-school barbershop, with a cozy waiting area featuring a big TV and plush couch. The friendly staff makes you feel right at home, offering refreshments like water, soda, or even a beer. The barbers are skilled and engage in lively discussions on current events, sports, and local happenings, creating a welcoming environment. The haircut exceeded expectations, and this place has undoubtedly become my new go-to barbershop. Highly recommended for an authentic, enjoyable grooming experience.

This place is an absolute gem! The food is outstanding, with the eggs Benedict and cream pancakes being particular standouts. The poached eggs were perfectly cooked, and the toast was exceptional. But the real star of the show was the cream pancakes—flavourful, pillowy soft, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, needing no syrup. The service is also top-notch, with our server Tina going above and beyond to ensure a delightful experience. Not only is the food excellent, but the genuine warmth and hospitality of the staff make this a must-visit spot.

Excellent dining experience! The service was top-notch, and the food exceeded our expectations. My husband's cheese and bacon burger was deliciously crafted, while my crawfish sausage po' boy was a flavorful delight. Both dishes were well-prepared and left us thoroughly satisfied. Highly recommended for anyone seeking delectable American fare.

Exceptional service from JT at Ashley Furniture! Despite having to modify my order, JT remained extremely helpful throughout the process, ensuring a wonderful shopping experience. Highly recommended for their customer-centric approach.

Whether you're a student at Drexel or just passing through, this food truck is a must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable and delicious lunch. Highly recommended for those craving something out of the ordinary.

I had my hair cut at this salon for the first time, and Jessie Becker did an excellent job trimming off the damaged ends. She's incredibly kind and listens to your preferences, doing exactly what you ask. Jessie is also great with kids, making her an ideal choice for families. I highly recommend this salon and Jessie Becker for a pleasant and tailored haircut experience.
An exceptional ramen experience! This place truly delivers with its delectable ramen and outstanding service. Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic and flavorful ramen dishes.

While the ambiance and service were pleasant, this neighborhood eatery fell short with its portion sizes. The dishes were undoubtedly delicious, but the minuscule servings left me feeling unsatisfied and disappointed. For a local establishment, one expects generous portions that provide value for money, not stingy portions that leave customers wanting more. Regrettably, the undersized dishes overshadowed the positive aspects, making it difficult to fully recommend this place.

First-time visit, and the hype lived up to expectations. The Greek Salad and Chickpea Vegetarian Pita were delicious, with generous portions that left us satisfied. The staff was accommodating, allowing for substitutions. The ambiance was great, and the service was excellent. We'll definitely be returning for another enjoyable dining experience.

A delightful find! Urban Chestnut's Maryland Heights location offers a spacious bar and restaurant area with an open floor plan and plenty of TVs for catching the game. As the second-highest selling micro-brewery in the St. Louis area, their on-site brewery ensures fresh, quality brews. The House Special IPA is a standout – wonderfully balanced and not overly bitter. Bartender Troy provides excellent service. The only minor drawback is the lack of dessert options. Overall, a fantastic spot for beer lovers seeking a lively atmosphere and top-notch craft brews.

Tucked away in a strip mall on the eastern end of Whyte Avenue, this neighborhood dive bar offers a laidback atmosphere for a younger crowd. With a couple of pool tables, a foosball table, and live music on weekends, it's a decent spot to grab reasonably priced drinks and enjoy some cheap wings. The decor is nothing fancy, but the pizzas looked tempting with their cheesy goodness. Service was friendly, and the owner behind the bar seemed pleasant enough. While not exceptional, it's a decent option for a casual night out, especially if you're in the area.

Seeking a change from typical buffet fare, we ventured to this small Chinese restaurant located near auto repair shops. Unfortunately, our experience was underwhelming. The staff struggled with taking our order accurately, and the food itself was of poor quality. Even a simple dish tasted unpleasantly off. With multiple order mistakes and lackluster flavors, this eatery failed to impress. Unless you're specifically catering to the automotive crowd in the area, there are likely better Chinese dining options available elsewhere.

Despite a minor hiccup with the Yelp coupon, this place delivered an excellent dining experience. The chicken caesar salad was a standout, generously loaded with chicken. The subs were fresh and flavorful, too. While they offer beer, I opted for the nostalgic Dr. Brown's cream soda from their impressive selection of flavors. The location is convenient, just a mile away from the popular Wagon Wheel flea market. Definitely worth a visit for tasty fare in a prime spot.

Stellar service from Dr. Neel and Robin at this optometry practice. They were friendly, knowledgeable, and patient, taking the time to answer all questions and help select stylish Lucky Brand frames. The contact lens fitting process was also top-notch. Highly recommended as one of the best optometrists in the area.

An absolute gem for breakfast! This place serves up some of the best pancakes in town – massive and delicious. The home fries are simple yet satisfying, without unnecessary extras. What really sets it apart is the warm hospitality from the owner, who is incredibly generous and welcoming. It has quickly become my new go-to spot for a fantastic breakfast experience.

This charming hotel in New Orleans offered a delightful stay for our family vacation. With its beautiful accommodations, friendly and attentive staff, and the iconic Carousel Bar, it was an absolute delight. The prime location was an added bonus. We couldn't be happier and will definitely return on our next visit to the Big Easy.

Utterly disappointing experience. The supposed 'chicken stew' was a travesty – nothing more than flavorless, fried leftover chicken carelessly thrown into a pot. It tasted like reheated scraps, not a freshly prepared dish. The entire ordeal was nauseating, leaving me regretting my decision to dine out instead of eating leftovers at home. An absolute waste of money and a culinary disaster. Avoid at all costs.

Wei Hong proved to be another disappointing Chinese takeout option in our area. While the steamed dumplings showed promise with a homemade taste and good filling, the overly thick doughy wrappers detracted from the overall quality. The main dishes were a complete letdown - the beef and broccoli was inedible due to an awful gelatinous texture and off-flavored sauce. The general Tao's chicken and orange beef suffered from mushy meat and overly thick, gloopy sauces. Even the fried rice failed to impress. With an empty dining room on a Saturday night, the lack of customers should have been a warning sign. Unfortunately, Wei Hong joins the list of mediocre Chinese places we've tried, and we won't be returning. The search for a decent neighborhood Chinese spot continues.

Cecile provided exceptional customer service during our preparation for Hurricane Irma. She went above and beyond by lending a helping hand to load plywood onto our vehicle. Her assistance was invaluable, and we are truly grateful for her kindness and support during a challenging time. Kudos to Cecile for her outstanding service!

This Moroccan restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience at an affordable price. The chicken tagine, a star dish, features fall-off-the-bone tender meat in a flavorful sauce. The carrot salad, infused with mint and cumin, provides a refreshing complement. The service is attentive, and the well-lit, cheerful ambiance creates a welcoming atmosphere. For around $13, you can savor outstanding Moroccan flavors in a delightful setting.

Disappointing Food, Decent Ambiance: This restaurant had garnered a lot of positive reviews, but our experience was underwhelming. The food arrived suspiciously fast, suggesting it wasn't freshly prepared. The Caesar salad was room temperature and overdressed, the hush puppies were flavorless, and the chicken wings were undercooked and barely warm. The only redeeming dish was the chicken and biscuits, but even the biscuit was cold in spots. While the atmosphere was hip and the service friendly, the sub-par food quality makes it difficult to recommend dining here again, especially considering our late arrival time when the kitchen should have been able to deliver. Perhaps it was an off night, but the disappointing meal left a sour taste.

Disappointing online ordering experience. Despite placing an order 30 minutes in advance to skip the long line, the restaurant claimed they had no record of my order when I arrived for pickup. The convenience of online ordering was negated, and I ended up wasting my time. Poor system and frustrating customer service.

An absolute must-visit for doughnut lovers! Their cream-filled doughnuts are out of this world, so heavenly that I couldn't resist driving back just to stock up for the journey home. These doughnuts are truly life-changing, and the temptation to devour every last one is irresistible. An unforgettable indulgence that's worth the trip!

Joe Bob's is an establishment to avoid at all costs. The place caters primarily to over-served gamblers, neglecting other patrons. The kitchen is plagued by mold issues, emitting foul odors reminiscent of a sewer plant. The staff, particularly the bartenders, are unfriendly and solely focused on extracting large tips from gambling patrons. The establishment's owners prioritize profits from slot machines over providing a clean, welcoming environment or investing in basic amenities like flat-screen TVs. The overall atmosphere is unpleasant, with a constant presence of intoxicated individuals. Neighboring fast-food restaurants offer a safer, cleaner, and more hospitable dining experience. Steer clear of this greasy, dilapidated establishment unless you wish to encounter unsavory characters and unsanitary conditions.

First-time visitors stumbled upon this gem while seeking an alternative to a crowded restaurant. The warm hospitality and attentive service immediately set the tone, with the waitress going above and beyond to assist the family. The ramen dishes were exceptional, with the Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen, Shrimp Katsu Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen receiving high praise for their flavors and quality ingredients. The pork buns, though unconventional, were also a hit. Overall, it was a delightful experience that left a lasting impression, making it a highly recommended spot for an authentic and satisfying ramen experience.

Brew D Licious serves the best coffee in town, hands down. The owner, Brigitte, is not only knowledgeable about brewing exceptional coffee but also knows how to create a loyal customer base. Their coffee is so fresh and delicious that it's worth buying in bulk (5 lbs at a time). Even during renovations for their new location, Brigitte went above and beyond by delivering coffee to patrons. The current location inside the Hollander Hotel is cramped and has an unpleasant odor, so the new standalone location is eagerly awaited. While long lines are expected at the new spot, the outstanding coffee will make the wait worthwhile. Brigitte has set the standard for what real coffee should taste and smell like in St. Petersburg.

An Absolute Gem! This beachside pizza joint is a real find. The pizza and garlic knots are incredibly delicious, showcasing the expertise of the kitchen crew. The location is fantastic, with a lively street vibe adding to the overall experience. Highly recommended for anyone craving top-notch pizza in a vibrant setting.

If you're an oyster lover, this place is an absolute must-visit! Their oysters are incredibly fresh and delicious, quite possibly the best I've ever had. While the server couldn't provide details on the specific variety, the exceptional taste more than made up for it. An oyster connoisseur's dream come true! Highly recommended for those seeking a sublime oyster experience.

An exceptional dining experience! The kung pao beef, basil shrimp, and pork fried rice were all deliciously prepared, making it the best meal I've had in the area. The food was top-notch, and the prompt delivery service added to the overall satisfaction. Highly recommended for anyone seeking delectable Asian cuisine.

Don't let the name "deli" fool you – this place offers much more than your typical sandwich shop. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our Philly cheesesteak and club sandwich, which were both delicious and reasonably priced. For two hearty sandwiches, four bags of chips, and feeding our two kids, our total bill was just over $20 – an excellent value. Be sure to come hungry, as the portion sizes are huge (or as the owner might say, 'yuge'). Highly recommended for a satisfying and affordable meal.

Despite some people's complaints (which seem rooted in veiled racism), this dry cleaner is highly competent and efficient. They skillfully removed decade-old stains and offer quick turnaround times, even during busy periods. While the staff may not be overly friendly, their professionalism and expertise are top-notch. The reviewer highly recommends this establishment and plans to continue using their services even after moving away from the area. A reliable and capable dry cleaner that delivers excellent results.

This HipCityVeg location is more spacious than Rittenhouse, with street parking available – a definite plus. The server was incredibly friendly and enthusiastic about recommending her favorites. While the Groothie smoothie was too sweet for my taste, the Udon Noodle Salad was a delightful and well-executed dish. Overall, a pleasant experience with attentive service and tasty vegan fare.

First-time visit, and it was a fantastic experience! The waitress, Bailey, provided exceptional service, being both friendly and attentive. The food was incredible, with generous portions of fresh and delicious dishes like the hummus plate, pretzels, mozzarella sticks, and caprese salad. Highly impressed and will definitely be returning!

Fazoli's had some hits and misses during my recent visit. The entrees were tasty, and the prices were reasonable, but the service left much to be desired. The breadsticks, advertised as unlimited, were delicious, but the manager gave us a hard time for requesting more, which was frustrating given the "as much as you want" promise. The ordering process was also chaotic, with a new hire struggling to manage the lunch rush. While the food quality was good, the lackluster service and attitude from the staff marred the overall experience. If Fazoli's can improve their service and live up to their advertised offerings, it could be a great spot for a quick meal. As it stands, the subpar service knocks my rating down to 3/5 stars.

While the $12 basic "Tchoup" car wash at Riverside Plaza seemed like a good deal initially, the results were somewhat lackluster. Despite being better than not washing the car at all, there were still remnants of bird poop on the hood and stubborn bugs on the grill after the wash. The wait time was reasonable, but the overall experience felt lacking compared to the reviewer's favorite car wash in Los Angeles, which offers a more thorough $14 wash with elbow grease and extras like vacuuming and window cleaning. While 85% of the price, the quality was only about 66.67% in comparison. The review suggests trying a touchless car wash next time for potentially similar results, minus the entertainment of watching parrots and playing Ms. Pac-Man while waiting.

Delightful Update: While the beloved live turtle tank is now gone, a vibrant and captivating fish aquarium has taken its place. The new aquatic display adds a whimsical touch to the ambiance, though the fate of the former turtle resident remains a mystery. Despite this change, the establishment remains highly recommended for its overall excellence.

For those preferring to dine in, the cafe offers ample seating indoors and a spacious outdoor area. Overall, this Starbucks delivers an outstanding experience, whether you're on the go or prefer a sit-down visit.

Despite clearly communicating my preference for a scissor cut, the stylist blatantly ignored my request and proceeded to use clippers, cutting off 90% of my hair against my wishes. When I reiterated my desire for a scissor cut and mentioned going elsewhere, the stylist dismissively claimed she could do a good job, yet continued with the clipper cut I explicitly did not want. This establishment shows a complete disregard for customer requests and provides an extremely disappointing experience. I would strongly advise against visiting this salon unless you want a high and tight clipper cut, regardless of your expressed preferences.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience with its delectable cuisine, inviting ambiance, and prime location in New Orleans. The artichoke and crab salad was an absolute standout, bursting with flavors that left a lasting impression. The grilled and roasted vegetable platter was equally impressive, showcasing the chef's skill in preparing fresh, flavorful dishes. Highly recommended for those seeking a memorable culinary adventure in the heart of NOLA.

On a recommendation from a friendly local at the Nashville airport, I stumbled upon this funky, eclectic eatery with an impressive array of healthy and delicious options. The standout dish was the sweet potato casserole – a unique and flavorful combination of sweet potatoes, coconut, and dried cranberries that left me craving more. With its vibrant atmosphere and fantastic food, this hidden gem is a must-visit for anyone passing through Nashville.

As frequent visitors from Orlando, this intimate venue has become our go-to spot. The staff is fantastic, and the service is top-notch. If you get the chance, request table #4 for the best experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a cozy ambiance and attentive service.

An absolute gem! This place delivers an exceptional dining experience with its delectable cuisine, inviting ambiance, and top-notch service. While the prices may be a tad steep, the quality justifies the cost. Particular standout: the Belgian Waffle with Nutella – a heavenly indulgence that will leave you craving for more. Highly recommended for those seeking a memorable culinary adventure.

Overall, if you're looking for a solid late brunch spot with a standout waffle and a generally pleasant experience (once you're seated), this restaurant could be a good option. Just be prepared for some potential seating hiccups upon arrival.

Companion Bakery & Cafe offers a delightful breakfast and lunch experience, with standout dishes like the chicken, bacon, and avocado sandwich on French bread and the flavorful spicy chicken soup accompanied by a generous portion of delicious cornbread. However, the Reuben sandwich fell short due to disappointing rye bread, which is surprising given the bakery's focus on bread. While the chi latte didn't impress, the friendly staff and overall enjoyable fare make it a worthwhile visit, despite being on the pricier side. If you're in the area, it's definitely worth checking out, but skip the chi latte.

Target is a fantastic one-stop shopping destination that outshines its competitors. While its wide range of offerings, from apparel to electronics and groceries, is undoubtedly impressive, what truly sets Target apart is its commitment to affordability and customer convenience. The makeup section, in particular, stands out for its competitive pricing, often undercutting other retailers by $2-3 per item. Moreover, the well-stocked household and grocery sections cater to diverse needs, making it a go-to spot for essentials. Target's efficient queue management ensures a smooth shopping experience, with ample registers open to minimize wait times. Overall, Target delivers an exceptional retail experience that seamlessly blends variety, value, and attentive service, solidifying its status as a superior alternative to its rivals.

Despite the temptation to award a perfect 5-star rating, a more objective assessment would be 4.5 stars. The oysters alone were truly spectacular, making the visit worthwhile. However, the standout experience was the "firecracker" creation by the talented Kentrelle at the Oyster Bar. This dish was an absolute game-changer, with flavors that will leave you awestruck and craving for more. If you visit, be sure to ask for Kentrelle and indulge in the "firecracker" – it's an explosion of taste that will blow you away.

Overall, the store earns a rating of 3 out of 5 stars. It excels in product variety and checkout efficiency but falls short in pricing and order follow-up. Nonetheless, it's worth a visit for those seeking hard-to-find movies or music.

This restaurant is a must-visit! The fried oysters are an absolute standout, and the crawfish bisque and shrimp with grits were equally delicious. The flavors were exceptional, and the dishes left a lasting impression. However, be sure to make a reservation in advance, as the popularity of this establishment means it can get quite busy. An outstanding dining experience that seafood lovers won't want to miss.

After an exhaustive search for the perfect holiday coat, I finally found my dream camouflage jacket at Ross Dress for Less. However, the initial purchase, a pleather bomber jacket, turned out to be a wrinkled mess despite trying various hacks to remove the creases. With no receipt or tags, I returned to Ross and spoke to the manager, who graciously allowed me to exchange it. Remarkably, there was my desired camo coat hanging in my size! The excellent customer service and availability of the coat I had originally wanted made Ross my go-to store from now on. Despite the initial setback, their accommodating staff and product selection turned my coat quest into a delightful shopping experience.

HipCityVeg delivers an exceptional experience with its delectable vegan fare, standout dishes like the Udon Noodle Salad and Crispy Hipcity Ranch, friendly staff, and efficient service. Their delivery option adds to the convenience, making it an excellent choice for plant-based cravings. Highly recommended for vegans and non-vegans alike.

Pizzeria Vetri in Philadelphia is a true gem that showcases the beauty of simplicity in wood-fired pizzas. The marinara pizza, with its crushed San Marzano tomatoes, garlic, and olive oil, was a hit even for those who don't like cheese. The thin, charred crust and the delightful toppings like fennel sausage, roasted fennel, and mortadella make their pizzas stand out. The cocktails, like The Brooklyn, are expertly crafted and served in a stylish manner. The Rotolo, a pizza dough rolled with mortadella, ricotta, and pistachio pesto, is a must-try, addictive delight. The desserts, including the soft serve affogato and the assortment of Italian cookies, provide a perfect sweet ending. With friendly service and a cozy atmosphere, Pizzeria Vetri is a Philadelphia gem that rivals legendary pizza joints like Lombardi's and Grimaldi's.

This high-end clothing store at West Edmonton Mall offers a premium shopping experience for those seeking designer fashion, particularly for suits, dress shirts, and formal attire. The staff is friendly and attentive without being pushy, allowing you to browse at your leisure. While the prices are on the higher end, reflecting the quality and brand names, the exceptional service and impressive selection of dressy clothing for men make it a standout destination in the mall. If you're prepared to invest in luxury fashion, this store won't disappoint.

The Humble Mediterranean Gem: A Quirky Yet Satisfying Experience"

This unassuming Mediterranean eatery offers a respectable dining experience without breaking the bank. While the food may not be groundbreaking, it delivers a tasty and satisfying taste reminiscent of your favorite food truck fare. The portion sizes are fair, although a tad more generosity would make the value more compelling.

Beyond the culinary offerings, the ambiance is a delightful hodgepodge of quirky elements. From the dimly lit interior to the space-themed mural and eclectic music selection, the atmosphere exudes a unique charm. Despite its proximity to the lively bar and club scene, the restaurant provides a welcome respite for casual conversation.

Service is prompt and friendly, even when staffed by just a couple of efficient workers. The establishment maintains a clean and well-kept environment, ensuring a pleasant dining experience.

While not without its minor quibbles, this hidden gem offers a satisfying and affordable taste of Mediterranean cuisine in a pleasantly offbeat setting. It's a spot worth revisiting for those seeking a dependable yet slightly unconventional culinary adventure

This is an exceptional bait shop that excels in multiple areas. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly, offering valuable insights on productive fishing spots. The bait selection is top-notch, ensuring a successful fishing experience. Additionally, the shop boasts an impressive inventory of high-quality tackle at surprisingly affordable prices, making it a more cost-effective option compared to big-box retailers. The only downside is the lack of multiple locations around the city. Overall, this bait shop is a must-visit for any angler seeking expert advice, quality gear, and a pleasant shopping experience.

In this review, you'll discover why Nigel's candy is causing a stir among friends and locals alike. Nigel's Bon Bons are praised for their incredible taste and quality, leaving everyone craving for more. The reviewer's friends can't get enough of these delectable treats, devouring them swiftly. Despite the distance, the reviewer enthusiastically recommends making the trip to experience these amazing candies, as they are well worth the drive. Nigel himself is described as an awesome guy, adding to the overall positive experience. If you're a fan of exceptional confections, Nigel's Bon Bons are a must-try sensation that will have you joining the ranks of devoted fans.

Muriel's offers a great way to indulge in quality New Orleans cuisine at a decent price, with a spectacular location and a rich history that adds to the dining experience. It's a must-visit spot for those in the French Quarter.

On our shuttle driver's recommendation, we visited this place, and the red velvet ice cream was an absolute delight! The creamy texture combined with chunks of red velvet cake made for a wonderfully indulgent treat. A must-try for anyone with a sweet tooth!

Friendly service and reasonably priced lunch specials, but the food quality is just average for American-Chinese cuisine. While the vegetarian options are appreciated, the greasy sauce and lack of standout flavors leave much to be desired. Unfortunately, I experienced severe food poisoning after my visit, which is an absolute deal-breaker. I cannot recommend this establishment.

Delicious Deep Dish at Patxi's Pizza! While they don't take reservations and it can get crowded, the Western Addition deep dish pizza is a must-try. The unique cornmeal crust tastes deliciously like a cross between cornbread and pizza dough. The bianco salad was average, but the pizza itself was very tasty and worth a visit, especially if you can snag a table inside on a chilly day. A tad pricey, but the delectable deep dish makes up for it.

Indy Reads is a true gem in the heart of downtown, offering a delightful browsing experience for book lovers while supporting a noble cause – adult literacy. With a vast collection of gently used books spanning various genres, this cozy bookstore invites you to lose yourself in the pages of unexpected treasures. While the tightly packed children's section can be a minor inconvenience, the overall ambiance and reasonable prices more than make up for it. Beyond being a book lover's paradise, Indy Reads is a beacon of hope, with every purchase contributing to the empowerment of adults through literacy. Whether you're seeking a new read or simply seeking solace among kindred spirits, this charming bookstore is a must-visit destination for anyone who values the written word and its transformative power.

Just Tires failed to deliver satisfactory customer service. Despite requiring a couple of hours wait, the staff was unaccommodating and refused to allow an appointment, citing a strict first-come, first-served policy. This approach contrasts with the customer's previous experiences at other Just Tires locations. The employee's rude demeanor and lack of willingness to provide service prompted the customer to take their business elsewhere. At a nearby competitor, Mr. Tire, the customer received prompt and efficient service, with a new tire replacement in just half an hour, despite appearing busier. Overall, Just Tires' poor customer service and inflexible policies led to a frustrating experience for the customer, prompting them to seek better service elsewhere.

Exceptional Service at [Flower Shop Name]! As a florist myself, I have high standards, but this shop exceeded my expectations. Their expert team crafted a vibrant and cheerful arrangement within my budget, delivering it promptly. Their attention to detail and ability to capture the desired mood were truly impressive. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch floral arrangements.

Here's a concise one star review based on the details provided:

An utterly disappointing experience. The queso fundido arrived oddly paired with tortillas instead of chips, and the requested salsa took an hour and was an inedible mushy mess. Entrees like the unseasoned "carne asada" tacos and the bizarre white rice with refried beans on top were amateur mistakes. Service was glacially slow too. When even Taco Bell seems a better option, you know a Mexican restaurant has failed spectacularly. Avoid at all costs - there are far superior alternatives for authentic Mexican cuisine in the area.

A delightful little coffee spot run by the friendly and warm Karyn. The coffee is excellent, and they offer the convenience of a drive-through. With Karyn's big smile greeting you, it's a welcoming place to get your caffeine fix. Highly recommended for great coffee in a cozy, personal setting.

The only downside is that the name change from Red's to Ed's can be confusing, as the sign looks like part of it has fallen off. But overall, Ed's is a one-stop shop for endless entertainment and a diverse range of activities and events under one roof.

While the food itself didn't live up to the hype, given my extensive culinary experiences across Asia Pacific, the real highlight of the evening was the delightful conversation and company I was fortunate to enjoy. The lively ambiance and good company more than compensated for any shortcomings in the cuisine.

Review: My excitement for the restaurant's relocation quickly turned into disappointment upon learning they no longer offer the beloved salad and pizza bar. As a long-time patron of their previous location, I fondly remember the convenience and variety provided by the salad bar, which I thoroughly enjoyed. The ability to grab a quick slice of pizza and accompany it with a fresh salad was a major draw. Unfortunately, that option is no longer available, and now the only way to get pizza is by ordering an entire pie. This change has significantly diminished the appeal of the restaurant for me, as the salad and pizza bar were a highlight of the dining experience.
Rating: 2/5

Overall, Dewey's Primary Pizza offers a convenient location and visually appealing pizzas with a good crust. However, the overwhelming saltiness of their pizzas, particularly the combination of salty sauce and toppings, is a significant drawback that numbs the taste buds and overshadows other flavors. The salads, while sizeable, are unremarkable and not worth the price. If the excessive salt issue is addressed, it could significantly improve the overall experience.

While the service and dessert shone, the main courses at this PF Chang's location left much to be desired. The attentive and friendly server deserves praise, as does the decadent chocolate cake. However, the tepid temperature of the entrees and the clashing flavors in dishes like the Shrimp with Candied Walnuts made for a disappointing dining experience. The brown rice was bland, and the combination of sweet and savory elements felt disjointed. Though the restaurant caters well to food allergies, the inconsistent quality of the main dishes makes it hard to fully recommend. With some tweaks to temperature control and flavor profiles, PF Chang's could live up to its potential.

The BBQ joint's standout dish is undoubtedly the heavenly mac and cheese, worth selling your soul for! While the rib meat had great flavor, it lacked tenderness. The pulled pork, however, impressed with its sweet taste and overall quality. The baked beans were average, but the creamy coleslaw left an unpleasant aftertaste reminiscent of lake water. Despite being housed in an abandoned car wash, the unique experience is worth trying for the exceptional mac and cheese alone.

This cozy mom-and-pop restaurant offers a fantastic experience, with stellar service and fair prices. The standout dish is undoubtedly the incredibly delicious fries, which are so good that they linger in your memory. However, the beef kebab sandwich was a letdown, with an overpowering onion flavor and a lack of meat. The smoothies also fell short, tasting more like syrupy ice than a refreshing beverage. Despite the hit-or-miss food items, the warm and welcoming ambiance makes it worth giving a second chance, especially for those addictive fries.

Taqueria Burrito's Grill (formerly under different ownership) in New Orleans East is a true gem for authentic Mexican cuisine. As someone who recently moved from Houston, it's a delightful find and reminds me of the hidden gem taquerias in that city. Their green sauce is a standout, perfectly complementing dishes like cheese enchiladas. The Mexican rice is also a highlight, meeting even the pickiest standards. With an extensive menu, friendly service, and convenient hours (open 7 days a week, breakfast until 11 AM, and open past 5 PM), Taqueria Burrito's Grill is a must-visit for anyone craving genuine Mexican flavors in the area. With its new ownership and relocation from Houston, this taqueria promises to be a frequent stop for authentic Mexican food cravings.

Disappointing Sushi Experience: The Mexican Roll and Philadelphia Roll ordered for take-out fell flat in terms of both portion size and flavor. The rolls lacked any standout taste, leaving an overall bland impression. The tiny portions were a letdown, failing to justify the price. A lackluster sushi experience that failed to impress.

Silver in the City is a trendy gift shop on Mass Ave, offering a wide range of stylish home decor and fashion items. It's a go-to destination for browsing and indulging in the latest "it" products. The store's pet-friendly policy is a major plus, allowing customers to shop with their furry companions. However, while the staff is friendly, the watchful eyes of the employees can make browsing feel a bit uncomfortable, likely due to concerns about shoplifting. Overall, Silver in the City is a great spot for finding unique gifts, but the lack of privacy can be a minor drawback. If you're looking for a trendy shopping experience in a competitive market, it's definitely worth a visit.

Despite ordering takeout just 45 minutes before closing, the puttanesca pasta at this establishment was an absolute delight. The perfect balance of saltiness and spiciness made for a delicious dish. The menu offered a wide variety of combos, and the option to create your own was genius. However, the lack of a gluten-free dough option was a drawback, as my post-meal discomfort attested. Overall, it was a satisfying experience, but the addition of a gluten-free option would make it truly outstanding.

An exceptional dining experience! The crab cake Benedict was a standout dish, bursting with flavor and perfectly prepared. The service was attentive and friendly, complementing the delicious food. The smoothies were also a highlight, making it a well-rounded and highly satisfying visit. Highly recommended!
This restaurant has undoubtedly earned a spot on my must-visit list for future trips to New Orleans, where I can savor the authentic taste of this culinary gem once again."

An utterly disappointing experience. Poor communication, misleading information, and a complete lack of professionalism. Despite receiving a specific unit, price, and move-in date via email, the unit was already gone when I tried to secure it. The staff was unhelpful, unreachable, and unwilling to honor the agreed-upon terms. In the end, I wasted $50 on an application fee for a property they never intended to provide. This business seems solely focused on making money, with zero regard for their tenants or customer service. I would strongly caution against renting from this company." ★☆☆☆

Sierra and her team at JOTSB provided exceptional service during a family reunion in Santa Barbara. Their meticulous planning, attention to detail, and anticipation of our needs made the event a resounding success. From thoughtfully purchasing supplies in advance to replenishing items as needed, Sierra and India ensured a seamless experience. Their flexibility, fun demeanor, and thorough approach were truly impressive. I highly recommend JOTSB for any event in Santa Barbara and look forward to the opportunity to work with them again.

Disappointing visit to this bagel spot. Despite the charming hand-written signs, the lack of available bagels and mediocre food quality left much to be desired. The pastrami, egg, and cheese sandwich lacked sufficient pastrami, and the cheese wasn't even melted. Adding insult to injury, my wife's coffee was ruined by spoiled creamer. Overall, it's better to stick with more reliable options like Einstein's or St Pete Bagel.

This Italian restaurant offers a delightful dining experience with friendly staff, reasonable prices, and a standout homemade salad dressing. The food is good overall, making it a solid choice for those seeking an enjoyable Italian meal.

This place serves fantastic breakfast burritos! The standout items are the well-seasoned and perfectly diced potatoes, which complement the flavors of the eggs and bacon. While more cheese would be ideal, it's a minor gripe. The salsa bar offers a nice variety, and the staff is friendly and welcoming. Conveniently located about a mile away, this place is a local gem that deserves to stick around for a long time.

As a newcomer to Tucson, I've tried numerous pizza places near the University of Arizona, and this establishment stands out as the best so far. In fact, I'd go as far as saying it's the best pizza I've ever had, surpassing even the renowned spots in New York City. The crust is simply magical, boasting an unparalleled quality. For those who crave a spicy kick, the 'Five Alarm' pizza delivers the perfect level of heat without overwhelming the palate. If you're in the area, this pizzeria is an absolute must-try – I highly doubt you'll be disappointed.

Honey's lived up to its reputation for delicious food on my birthday visit. Despite the crowds, the wait wasn't excessive at around 20 minutes. The French toast, home fries, sausage, and the heavenly Jewish apple cake for dessert were absolutely scrumptious. I'll definitely be returning to this fantastic eatery.

Tria is a popular spot known for its knowledgeable staff and impressive selection of beers and wines. The real highlight is the extensive drink menu, making it a go-to destination for beverage enthusiasts. While the food offerings are not mentioned, the outdoor seating during warmer months adds to the appeal, providing a delightful al fresco dining experience when available. With its consistently busy atmosphere, Tria seems to be a crowd favorite, primarily for its expertly curated beverage program and enjoyable ambiance.

Mae's is a hidden gem for authentic and fresh Chinese cuisine on the east side. Despite an initial hiccup that led us to discover this place, we're grateful for the happy accident. The ambiance is inviting, and the service is attentive and friendly. The food is the real star – flavorful, not greasy, and made with high-quality ingredients that taste fresh, not frozen or reheated. For a large family, the portions are generous, and the prices are incredibly reasonable, making Mae's an excellent value. Their lunch specials are also a must-try. If you're in the area, we highly recommend giving Mae's a visit for a delightful Chinese dining experience.

A Tucson gem that has beautifully expanded to the Phoenix area! This place is an absolute favorite, with flavors that exceed expectations. Their strawberries & champagne, toasted marshmallow, and cheesecake flavors are standout personal favorites. The flavors taste exactly as you'd imagine, but even better! A must-visit for anyone craving delicious and authentic flavors.

Once a decent establishment, this place has unfortunately hit rock bottom in recent years. During my recent visit on a Saturday evening, the understaffing was glaringly apparent, with only two employees struggling to keep up with a nearly full house. Customers were left waiting endlessly to order and pay. The sandwich I received was a disastrous mess – burnt and served on stale, hard bread, rendering it barely edible. Unless drastic improvements are made promptly, this establishment's future looks bleak. They need to either step up their game or consider closing down.

While the girly's fascination with photographing angels and monuments here might come across as a tad creepy, this well-maintained cemetery offers an unexpectedly intriguing setting for shutterbugs. The peaceful ambiance and absence of any undead disturbances are definite pluses. The occasional photobombing by witches practicing their spells adds a delightfully quirky touch. If you can overlook the slightly eerie vibe, the beautifully crafted gravestones and statues make for unique photo opportunities. Just keep an eye out for any suspicious zombie activity – the lack thereof is a selling point worth remembering.

Holiday Inn Express in Port Richey was a decent stay, but it fell short of expectations. While the staff were friendly, and the free WiFi and breakfast offerings were appreciated, the subpar sleeping experience was a major drawback. The overly soft, worn-out mattresses and inconsistent air conditioning made it challenging to get a good night's rest. Additionally, the lack of reliable thermostat controls added to the discomfort. Despite having a pool, hot tub, and a small gym on-site, the overall experience was just average. Having been accustomed to the superior comfort and amenities of Hyatt hotels, this Holiday Inn Express failed to meet the desired standard, leaving room for improvement in key areas such as bedding quality and climate control.

Disappointing service marred the experience at this establishment. The staff seemed disinterested in assisting customers, preferring to congregate and engage in personal activities. The food was merely average, neither impressive nor appalling. Overall, a lukewarm rating of 2 stars is a generous assessment considering the lackluster service and mediocre fare.

While the food itself is excellent, the declining customer service and portion sizes over the past two years have become major issues. The portions have gradually become smaller, and when I raised this concern, I was met with dismissive and rude responses from the staff. Rather than acknowledging the issue or offering a resolution, they were confrontational and unwilling to listen. Despite the great food, their poor attitude and shrinking portions have led me to take my business elsewhere. It's unfortunate because the quality was there initially, but the customer experience has deteriorated to an unacceptable level.

This restaurant is a winner! The food was delicious, with standouts like the flavorful chicken poblano and the customizable enchilada plate that allowed for variety. The staff added to the excellent experience by being friendly, helpful with recommendations, and providing attentive service. Don't miss the fantastic house margaritas and the excellent value of the Happy Hour specials. Overall, it's a great spot for tasty Mexican fare, refreshing drinks, and a welcoming atmosphere.

Indulge in the salted caramel chocolate cake – an absolute must-try and the best you'll ever have. The Apple Brown Betty is another fantastic choice, bursting with awesome flavors. Complementing the delectable desserts is a impressive beer selection, catering to diverse tastes. A truly delightful dining experience not to be missed.

The Collegetown Bar is a casual hangout spot catering to the student crowd, offering affordable drinks and a sporty atmosphere. With projectors for catching major games, it's a great spot for sports fans, though the screen size could be improved to prevent the picture from spilling off the edges. During the day, the spacious interior provides ample room, but it likely gets lively and crowded come nighttime when the college crowd rolls in. Overall, a decent budget-friendly option for a laid-back drinking experience and sports viewing, especially for those seeking an energetic college vibe in the evenings.

Abysmal service and repeatedly botched orders make this pizza joint a major disappointment. Despite clearly communicating my order for a half sausage, half cheese pizza, they managed to mess it up twice - first, misunderstanding and repeating it back incorrectly, and then delivering an entirely sausage-covered pizza after confirming the correct order. Adding insult to injury, they had also forgotten to place my order during a previous visit. With such consistently terrible service and inability to follow simple instructions, this establishment is simply not worth the hassle. Avoid at all costs unless you enjoy frustration and inedible pies.

Marmont Steakhouse failed to deliver a satisfactory dining experience during Restaurant Week. The crab bisque was served cold, and the calamari was bland, overcooked, and rubbery. However, the most egregious issue arose with the supposed "lobster ravioli" entree. Despite multiple assurances from the staff that it contained lobster, the dish was ultimately revealed to be beef ravioli. This mistake was particularly concerning for diners who do not consume beef or pork for dietary reasons. The staff's nonchalant attitude and insincere apology only compounded the issue. To make matters worse, the consumption of the beef ravioli resulted in a bout of diarrhea for one diner. Overall, Marmont Steakhouse's poor food quality, lack of attention to detail, and dismissive service make it a dining establishment to avoid.
In summary, Tako offers an unbeatable combination of exceptional sushi, a lively atmosphere, and affordability. Highly, highly recommended for sushi enthusiasts!

This local ice cream parlor offers an exceptional experience with their homemade, custom-crafted flavors. Stand-outs include the rich Espresso Chip, the decadent Moose Tracks, and the unique Graham Slam, showcasing their creativity and attention to quality ingredients. A must-visit for ice cream enthusiasts seeking one-of-a-kind frozen treats.

This car wash offers reliable and affordable services. While it's not a hand-wash, it provides a decent $5 wash for a quick clean. They have weekly discounts, such as Ladies Day on Wednesdays and a Firemen discount on Mondays. Additionally, they occasionally run great deals on auto detailing packages, with 2-for-1 specials. The detailing services have consistently delivered satisfactory results. Overall, it's a solid choice for both regular washes and occasional comprehensive detailing at reasonable prices.

Mediocre Experience: This place fails to impress with its average food and inconsistent service. The drunken noodles and Thai green curry dishes were just passable, offering nothing exceptional. While you might get decent service on a good day, the overall experience is forgettable and unlikely to warrant a repeat visit.

Overall, the combination of the stunning setting, impeccable service, and outstanding dishes made this meal rank among the top 10 of my entire life. If you haven't been to Redemption, it's an absolute must-visit for an unforgettable culinary experience.

This local ice cream shop is a must-visit! With its convenient location and frequently rotating flavors, it's no wonder I'm a regular customer. The staff is accommodating, offering additional toppings upon request. But what truly sets this place apart is the unexpected yet delightful addition of pumping EDM music, creating a unique and energetic atmosphere. If you're in the area, be sure to stop by for a tasty treat and an unexpected auditory experience!

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience with outstanding dishes and impeccable service. The steak tartare stands out as potentially the best you'll ever have, while the unique curried goat with sweet curry and gnocchi is a delightful surprise that's sure to please adventurous palates. Even the lime cheesecake receives high praise. Service is top-notch, living up to the city's reputation for hospitality. An absolute must-visit for anyone seeking a truly memorable culinary adventure.

Portions are generous, and the prices are reasonable, making Olive + Oak a great value for the quality and creativity of the food. With a satisfying meal for two, including drinks, totaling around $52 before tip, this restaurant is a must-try for those seeking an intimate dining experience with a sense of adventure.

High Score!" may not refer to a video game but rather the hefty serving of delicious frozen yogurt from this South Street gem. Despite indulging in generous portions, the tasty and creamy treats, even the fat-free varieties, satisfy sweet cravings without feeling overly indulgent. The convenient location makes it a perfect spot for a satisfying dessert while exploring the neighborhood. An absolute must-visit for those with a sweet tooth

While the food and decor were decent, the real standout at this establishment was the exceptional service provided by the servers, particularly a petite server with purple hair. Despite dealing with demanding and unreasonable customers who made ridiculous complaints and threatened not to tip, she handled the situation with professionalism and grace. She carried multiple plates at once, explained the menu thoroughly, and maintained an attentive eye on her entire section. The servers truly deserved praise for their patience and exemplary service in the face of rude patrons. Overall, the restaurant receives a high rating solely for the staff's commendable skills in dealing with difficult customers. However, some diners need to learn basic manners and treat service staff with respect, or simply stay at home.

Although I did not purchase a vehicle from Hallmark, the car shopping experience was refreshingly straightforward and better than most dealerships I've visited. Their pricing on new and certified pre-owned vehicles appeared fair and competitive. The staff, including the salesman and sales manager, were friendly and not pushy, allowing me to test drive vehicles without pressure. Had the car model I was interested in been a better fit, I would have likely made my purchase there. Compared to some pretty terrible experiences elsewhere, I would recommend giving Hallmark a try if you're shopping for a vehicle locally.

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. The fried chicken was slimy and overly salty, while the sides (mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes) were flavorless and served cold. The service was equally unsatisfactory, with the server inexplicably laughing during our order, making us feel uncomfortable. Overall, a gross and unpleasant dining experience that I cannot recommend. Will not be returning.

The lobster rolls, both warm and cold, were deliciously prepared with high-quality ingredients. The bread was phenomenal, elevating the overall experience. While the prices were on the higher side, the exceptional quality of the food justified the cost. A must-visit for seafood lovers willing to indulge in a splurge-worthy meal.

Habit Burger is an excellent burger joint that deserves just as much recognition as the renowned In-N-Out Burger. Their double charburger, paired with a rich chocolate milkshake, is a delightful combination that never disappoints. The onion rings are also a standout side, delivering crispy and flavorful perfection. Whether you visit their Goleta location or elsewhere, Habit Burger consistently serves up delicious and satisfying burgers that rival the best in the game. It's a must-try for burger enthusiasts.

A longtime local favorite, this eatery has been our go-to for the past 8 years. The menu offers delicious fare that's always prepared quickly, and their drink specials are hard to beat. With consistently great food and drinks at a good value, it's no wonder we keep coming back time and time again.

Delicia is a charming, trendy spot in Broad Ripple that doesn't take reservations, which can be inconvenient. The lively atmosphere is great, but it gets too noisy when crowded, making conversation difficult. The creative cocktails and servers' recommendations were excellent. The guacamole was good, but they included nuts despite being asked to leave them off due to an allergy. The Harvest salad with fruit, root vegetables, and herbed goat cheese mousse was a highlight. The Veracruz Triggerfish, Serrano Scallops, and white sweet mashed potatoes were delicious, though portion sizes were large. The Tostones (fried plantains) were dry but improved when dipped in the flavorful Stewed Black Beans. While they offer many options for dietary restrictions, there were no gluten-free or dairy-free desserts. Overall, Delicia is recommended, but arrive early on Friday nights to secure a table before it gets too noisy.

Jackson's is a solid restaurant with delicious paninis and an impressive selection of wines and beers. The panini Reuben was a standout, featuring perfectly melted cheese, flavorful sauerkraut, and high-quality meat on wonderful rye bread. However, the presentation could be improved, as the sandwich was served directly on the plate, causing the bread to get soggy. Additionally, while the wait staff is friendly, service can be inconsistent, with long wait times for drinks during rushes. Despite these minor issues, the overall experience is good, and the quality of the food and drinks justifies the slightly higher prices. It's a place worth revisiting for those seeking a tasty panini and a great drink selection.

While the pedicure experience with Young was exceptional – she was friendly, thorough, and provided an incredible massage – the gel manicure left much to be desired. The owner used a drill to remove the old gel polish, raising concerns about potential nail thinning. Moreover, the new gel polish application was subpar, with noticeable bumps, uneven coverage, and remnants of the old polish left behind. Despite the stellar pedicure, the disappointing manicure makes it difficult to recommend this salon wholeheartedly. Young's skills are commendable, but the owner's manicure technique could use improvement.

The appetizer trio at this restaurant was an absolute delight, bursting with amazing flavors that truly whetted my appetite. Furthermore, their pizza did not disappoint either, delivering a deliciously satisfying experience. The overall quality of the food was excellent, making it a highly recommendable dining establishment.

This unassuming Westside eatery is a true hidden gem serving up delectable Native American cuisine at wallet-friendly prices. Their signature Indian taco and heavenly sweet fry bread are must-tries, but the real draw is the rotating daily specials like the irresistible $1 taco deal on Tuesdays and Fridays. With its consistently fantastic food and unbeatable value, it's no wonder this local favorite warrants weekly visits from devoted patrons. An authentic and affordable dining experience not to be missed.

This bakery shines not just with its decadent cookies, cupcakes, and puddings but also with their exquisite cakes. The salted caramel cake I ordered for a birthday celebration was an absolute showstopper. Four layers of moist, delectable cake sandwiched between rich, buttery caramel buttercream made from real ingredients – a perfect balance of elegance and indulgence. A true gem that delivers both taste and quality.

Skip the fancy dessert at the restaurant and head to this delightful ice cream parlor on Broadway instead. Their homemade ice cream, especially the Cake Mix flavor, is a real treat. It's a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll and a sweet way to cap off a romantic date night. Highly recommended for its delicious ice cream and charming ambiance.

I stumbled upon this fantastic local sushi spot, and I'm thrilled I gave it a chance. After previously overlooking it for the convenience of chains like Domino's, I'm kicking myself for not trying it sooner. The sushiya roll was an absolute delight, with impeccably fresh salmon and perfectly balanced miso soup. The flavors were spot-on, and the overall experience left me more than satisfied. Hands down, I wholeheartedly recommend this hidden gem to fellow sushi lovers. It's a a 10/10 in my book, and I'll be a frequent patron from now on.

This Thai restaurant serves some of the best Thai food in the area. Despite living 30 minutes away, it's worth the drive for their delectable red curry, flavorful pad thai, and succulent chicken satay with an addictive peanut sauce. Their lunch specials are also a great value. If only I lived closer to indulge in their authentic and delicious Thai cuisine more often!

While the kids' attraction offered plenty of entertainment for my 15-month-old daughter, the overall experience was marred by the establishment's lack of cleanliness. Despite paying a premium for admission, the facility was filthy, with dust everywhere, exposed electrical cords posing potential hazards, and a noticeable absence of staff maintaining the area. The management needs to prioritize cleanliness and safety to justify the admission cost. Despite the fun factor for kids, the unsanitary conditions are a major disappointment and warrant attention from the management."

Fantastic first-time experience! The salon boasts a pristine ambiance and warm, welcoming staff. Tammy's exceptional skill in shaping my eyebrows was complemented by their generous offer of a complimentary service for new clients. Their comprehensive waxing packages are a definite plus. Highly recommended, and I'll undoubtedly be returning for future services.

As a sushi lover, I was utterly disappointed with my recent visit to this highly-rated restaurant. The sushi was poorly executed, with poorly cut fish and tasteless sushi rice. The dynamite roll was overwhelmingly salty and drowned in mayonnaise, leaving me unable to finish it. Despite the restaurant's 4.5-star rating, this was undoubtedly the worst sushi experience I've ever had. I strongly advise against dining here and suggest exploring other sushi options in the area.

The service at this restaurant was abysmal. After waiting for 30 minutes without being attended to, I had to get up and order at the counter myself. Despite only having a few occupied tables, the waitresses were lazy and preferred chatting with friends instead of serving customers. One waitress even advised a family against dining in, suggesting they order takeout instead. The lack of attentiveness and disregard for patrons is unacceptable. Unless you want to be ignored and receive terrible service, avoid dining in at this establishment. Save yourself the frustration and opt for delivery instead.

Hands down, this is the best Caribbean cuisine in town. The food was incredibly fresh, perfectly cooked, and not overly heavy. Both the stewed chicken and curried chicken dishes were excellent, and the plantains were the best I've ever had. The owner's warm hospitality, ensuring we were satisfied with our meal, added to the delightful experience. The prices are unbeatable, and there are even unlisted specials like oxtails available. As a bonus, it's a BYOB establishment. Absolutely worth every 5-star review – this place is a must-try for anyone craving authentic Caribbean flavors.

Momo's Ouzaria offers an upbeat ambience that's great for groups or first dates, with some semi-secluded tables in the back room for a bit of privacy. The tapas portions are generous, and the three-cheese sampler, Greek meatballs, and pan-seared scallops were all delicious standouts. However, the traditional Greek salad's dressing was a disappointment. The $6 Spanish granacha wine was an excellent value. While the belly dancer provided entertainment, it added an awkward element for some. Overall, Momo's is a lively spot with tasty Greek tapas and a fun atmosphere, though the food may not surpass other Greek restaurants in town. It's a recommended choice for an enjoyable night out.

This bookstore used to be a wonderful place to browse and shop, but the terrible customer service has driven me away for the past three years. On multiple occasions, the staff has been rude, condescending, and overly critical, with one employee even threatening to charge me for improperly handling a book. Their behavior was so off-putting that I left without making a purchase and haven't returned since. While this store was a favorite hangout during my high school days in the 90s, the consistently poor treatment from the employees has made the experience unbearable as an adult. Unless there are significant changes in their approach to customer service, I cannot recommend this bookstore to others.

While attending a show at Birdland Jazz Club might require standing in line, squeezing onto wooden benches with strangers, and braving the elements without heat or air conditioning, the legendary venue's exceptional jazz performances make the sacrifices worthwhile. This iconic New York City spot offers a truly unique and unforgettable experience that every music lover should witness at least once. With its cool, intimate ambiance and top-notch talent, Birdland is a must-visit destination that will undoubtedly leave you craving for more.

A disappointing experience overall. The confusing layout and lackluster self-guided tour at this attraction fail to justify the $5 per person admission fee. Save your money and simply visit the local courthouse instead, as it offers a similar experience without the cost.

Ted Drewes Frozen Custard is an absolute must-visit gem in St. Louis, MO. Their frozen custard is hands down the best you'll ever taste in the city, with a rich, creamy texture and decadent flavors that will leave you craving for more. Missing out on this iconic spot would be a sin for any visitor to St. Louis. Prepare to be blown away by the ultimate frozen custard experience.

While the ambiance fell short of a four-star experience, with a slightly worn-down atmosphere, this sushi spot offers serviceable fare and friendly staff. It's not a dining destination, but a convenient option if you find yourself in the area craving sushi. Manage your expectations accordingly, and you may leave satisfied.

This seafood restaurant is an absolute gem! The menu offers a wide variety of delectable options, from the innovative crawfish beignet to the classic seafood flatbread. We sampled a range of dishes, including the crab cakes, seafood-stuffed mushrooms, and a crab cake po'boy, and every bite was bursting with flavor. The kitchen excels in expertly blending fresh, high-quality ingredients to create mouthwatering seafood delights. An absolute must-visit for any seafood lover!

If you're visiting Dairy Queen for anything other than their famous Blizzard desserts, you might want to reconsider. This particular location seems to be staffed by inexperienced and potentially immature high school students, which reflects in the subpar service and quality of the non-Blizzard items. The Blizzards remain a safe bet, but for a more well-rounded experience, it's advisable to explore other establishments in the area. Unless a thick, creamy Blizzard is your sole objective, this Dairy Queen may leave you feeling underwhelmed.

If you're seeking a one-of-a-kind shopping experience and a chance to support local artisans, this shop is a must-visit. Highly recommended for those seeking unique treasures that also contribute to the local economy.

As coffee connoisseurs from Sacramento, my husband and I were thoroughly impressed by this hidden gem of a coffee shop in Reno. Their exceptional Matcha lattes and overall quality have made it our go-to spot in the area. We only wish we had a place like this back home. Highly recommended for those seeking an authentic and delightful coffee experience.

I had an excellent experience at Chipotle in Idaho. The staff member, Taylor, provided exceptional customer service that truly stood out. She kindly offered me a complimentary meal, which was incredibly generous and made my week. Taylor's friendly demeanor and attentiveness to customers are commendable. I highly recommend this Chipotle location, especially if you have the chance to be served by the wonderful Taylor!

This place is a martini lover's paradise, boasting an astonishing selection of around 400-600 martini varieties. But that's not all – they also serve up giant pitchers of heavenly Petron pomegranate margaritas that will have you questioning why you haven't visited sooner. While the prices aren't rock-bottom cheap, they're reasonable enough to indulge in their cocktail delights. The friendly and attentive staff goes above and beyond, willing to guide you through the extensive menu if they're not too swamped. It's a must-visit for anyone seeking a fantastic cocktail experience with top-notch service.

If you're craving genuine Italian food products, look no further than Claudio's. This family-run establishment is a testament to old-school Italian culture, where quality reigns supreme. Despite the long lines, patrons happily wait, knowing they'll be rewarded with exceptional cheeses and delectable offerings. The knowledgeable staff is eager to assist, and even fellow customers will share their expertise. Stepping into Claudio's transports you to Italy, making you crave the rich cultural experience. It's not just a grocery run; it's an immersive journey that every food lover should embark on.

The hotel is a massive convention center masquerading as a resort. While offering numerous amenities like restaurants, bars, and shops, everything comes at an exorbitant price, from the steep nightly rate to overpriced sodas and shuttle services. Service is abysmal, with long waits and unhelpful staff responses. The sheer size of the property makes navigation a challenge, and the constant crowds and noise from conventions, thin walls, and blaring music ensure a lack of relaxation. Unless attending a convention, this hotel is best avoided due to its resort misnomer, exorbitant costs, poor service, and overwhelming crowds and noise levels.

While the atmosphere and service were nice, this Szechuan restaurant fell short in delivering an authentic and memorable dining experience. The highly anticipated Dan Dan noodles, though flavorful, lacked protein and failed to impress. The scallion pancakes paled in comparison to those found in Chinatown, resembling flat quesadillas rather than the crispy, substantial delicacies they should be. The wontons in chili oil were a disappointment, overwhelmed by heat and lacking in flavor. Even the fried tilapia medallions, though cooked perfectly, were marred by inedible greens. Overall, the dishes felt Americanized and commercialized, lacking the flavors and authenticity found in hole-in-the-wall Cantonese eateries. While not a complete letdown, this restaurant failed to live up to expectations, making it an unlikely destination for a return visit.

Despite explicitly requesting a feather-free room multiple times during the reservation process and at check-in, I was given a room with feathers. This is unacceptable as I have a severe allergy that has previously landed me in the emergency room. Hyatt clearly does not take these requests seriously enough. On top of that, having to pay $29 per night just for parking is an outrageous rate, especially for a hotel in St. Louis. Empty apologies from the staff mean nothing when they fail to deliver on such an important requirement that was confirmed at every step. I cannot recommend staying at this Hyatt location given their inability to ensure something as basic as a feather-free room for medical needs.

This breakfast spot is a crowd favorite, so arrive early to avoid long wait times. We made the mistake of going on a weekend around 10 AM and faced an hour-long queue. Learned our lesson and visited again right when they opened – success! We were seated and served promptly. The butter pecan pancakes are an absolute must-try, heavenly delicious. The bananas foster pancakes were good too, but the butter pecan stole the show. Portions are generous, with pancakes accompanied by eggs and your choice of turkey sausage or bacon. Highly recommended place for a fantastic breakfast, just be sure to get there early and come hungry!

This restaurant failed to impress. The food was merely average, with the exception of the decent meatloaf. As connoisseurs of fried green tomatoes, my family felt let down by the subpar rendition. The entertainment was also lackluster, with infrequent music performances. Overall, an underwhelming dining experience that left much to be desired.

Tina's service was outstanding - attentive and efficient, making the short 15-minute wait on a busy Sunday morning worthwhile. However, the true star of the show was the huevos bruncheros, an exceptional breakfast dish that left a lasting impression. While words fail to fully capture its deliciousness, it's an absolute must-try that ranks among the best breakfast items I've had in recent memory. A culinary delight that demands a visit!
Rating: 2/5 stars

Computer Outlet (33 S. 43rd Street) is a hidden gem for tech enthusiasts. Despite its unassuming exterior, this hole-in-the-wall store offers an extensive range of computer accessories at unbeatable prices. From external hard drive docks to CD burners, they have it all. While there may be a language barrier with the older staff member, their patience and eagerness to assist make up for it. If you're in need of computer peripherals, this is the place to go. Highly recommended for its excellent value and selection.

The Clue game-inspired decor of this hotel in downtown Boise is a delightful touch. The staff, from the respectful bell boys and valet drivers to the efficient bartenders delivering drinks to our rooms, exhibited exceptional customer service. The phone etiquette was also commendable. Despite the slightly busy streets, my girlfriend and I had a great experience and would happily return next year. As visitors from California, we found the service phenomenal. However, be mindful of your spending as the area can be pricey. It's advisable to explore the surroundings for more affordable dining options. The only downside was the lack of an air vent in our bathroom. Overall, a highly recommended stay.

The strawberry flavor at this establishment was an absolute delight! While not overly sweet, it delivered the perfect balance of flavors, complemented by real strawberry bits for an authentic taste. At just $2 for a small portion, the price point is a steal. The only regret is not trying the other flavors on offer. If visiting Philadelphia/Atlantic City again, this spot is a must-visit for their exceptional strawberry treat.

Mrs. Doll's is a delightful gem where family traditions shine. The generous portions and delicious recipes, passed down from Mrs. Doll herself, are sure to satisfy. The warm, friendly staff adds to the inviting atmosphere, making it a must-visit spot for a hearty and memorable lunch experience.

Bridgeport Rib House offers decent barbecue at fair prices, but the takeout experience leaves much to be desired. While the food itself is satisfactory, on par with other barbecue options in the area, the poor service when picking up orders from the bar detracts from the overall experience. For those seeking quality barbecue without the hassle, there are better alternatives nearby that provide a smoother takeout process.

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. Despite introducing a semi-new menu with higher prices, the food quality was mediocre at best. As a beginner cook, I could easily tell that the dishes lacked freshness and flavor. The day after, the leftovers looked weeks old, which is a clear sign of poor food quality. The service was equally disappointing, with the waiter spilling wine on the table and failing to address the issue. While the hostess was friendly, the overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the money. Even during happy hour with friends, this place falls short of being a high-end establishment, despite its attempts to present itself as such. I would not recommend this restaurant.

Exceptional service and attention to detail! When I brought in my late grandfather's watch for a battery replacement, the staff noticed a missing pin and fixed it on the spot, free of charge. Despite a slightly longer wait for the battery change, their kindness and commitment to excellence made up for it. They even waived the battery fee. I highly recommend this jeweler for their professionalism, integrity, and quality workmanship. If you're in the market for fine jewelry or timepieces, this is definitely a place worth considering.

This unique eatery seamlessly blends the best elements of a Jewish deli, Southern comfort food, and a Mexican dive, creating a delightfully eclectic dining experience. The brisket is a standout, boasting a flavorful, non-tomato-based sauce. The latke, while not the traditional round variety, is an absolute delight. And the Jewish Apple Cake, despite being a tad overcooked on the bottom, remained deliciously moist and flavorful even after a three-hour flight. If you're seeking a culinary adventure that defies categorization, this fusion gem is a must-visit.

While the Chinese food itself is mediocre, the real draw of this establishment is its karaoke room rentals for large groups. The restaurant excels at accommodating and efficiently serving huge, rowdy crowds. The food is reasonably priced and arrives quickly, making it suitable for groups focused more on the karaoke experience than fine dining. The karaoke machines offer an extensive selection of up-to-date songs in various languages. If you're looking for a lively group karaoke night with decent, budget-friendly eats, this place delivers.

Khyber Pass Pub remains a top-notch destination even after moving further away. Their exceptional Southern barbecue offerings, including brisket, ribs, chicken, and pulled pork, are the main draw, accompanied by delectable mac and cheese and coleslaw sides. The lively yet comfortable atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, and extensive beer selection create a well-rounded dining experience. Despite its popularity, finding a table is rarely an issue, making it an ideal spot for casual gatherings with friends or a satisfying meal. Khyber Pass Pub consistently delivers on all fronts, solidifying its status as a neighborhood gem.

This bakery/cafe is a must-visit for bread lovers, with their German rye bread being a standout item. For breakfast, the perfectly poached eggs are a delightful choice. At lunchtime, the eggplant panini and Laurie's salad are highly recommended. The diverse menu offerings, coupled with excellent execution, make this establishment a local favorite.

Tony's in Chalmette, Louisiana, offers unexpectedly delicious Mexican cuisine, undoubtedly the best in the state. Their standout dish is the excellently prepared, generously portioned chiles rellenos. The menu also features the authentic Mexican Coca-Cola, sweetened with real sugar instead of high-fructose corn syrup. With consistently good food across the board, Tony's is a must-visit for anyone craving top-notch Mexican fare in an unlikely location.

Terrible experience. The business model is confusing and ordering was an ordeal. The staff lacked professionalism. One of the sandwiches was pathetically skimpy on ingredients, with hardly any sausage. Easily the worst restaurant I've visited in a long time. Avoid at all costs.
