While the staff at this dancewear store are commendable for their friendly service and the range of quality products offered at reasonable prices, the selection tends to be limited, particularly for men's dancewear. The convenient city location makes it a worthwhile first stop, but be prepared to potentially look elsewhere if you have specific needs, as the inventory often falls short in variety for any given product type.

Visited this place on a referral and had an outstanding experience. The team of three skilled braiders worked efficiently, completing a medium-sized individual braiding style in just five hours. The $150 cost, including hair, was reasonable. The braiders were friendly and provided excellent service. I highly recommend this place and will definitely return for my next braiding needs.

The lamb gyros plate at this restaurant is a standout dish that's worth the drive. The tiramisu is another highlight, offering a delightful sweet treat. While the Greek salad accompanying the entrees is satisfying, the dolmas tend to be a bit too vinegary for some tastes. Overall, it's a solid spot for gyros and more, prompting frequent visits and even takeout orders to savor the flavors at home.

The Yum Yum Club is a solid choice for delicious and affordable food. Their macaroni salad is a standout dish that keeps customers coming back. While the prices are reasonable, the service can occasionally be lacking in friendliness. Overall, the great-tasting food and value make it a spot worth revisiting despite the occasional lapse in service quality.

The Grand Sierra Resort in Reno exceeded our expectations for a first-time visit. The luxurious room with a spa and steam shower, coupled with the numerous dining and relaxation options, made for a truly enjoyable stay. Even the casino's cleanliness and ambiance impressed us non-gamblers. While we didn't find the rest of Reno particularly remarkable, the hotel itself was a standout with its modern amenities and convenient in-room checkout. If you're seeking a top-notch lodging experience in Reno, this resort is highly recommended.

After thoroughly researching Yelp reviews, we decided to take our kids to this hibachi and sushi restaurant, and we're thrilled with our choice. The sushi was exquisitely crafted, and the hibachi experience was truly entertaining. The fried bananas and ice cream dessert was the perfect sweet ending to an already fantastic meal. The service was attentive and added to the overall enjoyable experience. We'll definitely be returning for more delicious sushi and hibachi fun!"

An absolute gem! This place offers mouthwatering pizza and a warm, welcoming ambiance. The friendly staff and cozy atmosphere make it the perfect spot for gathering with friends and family. Highly recommended for delicious food and a delightful dining experience.
Fantastic experience! The service was exceptional, and the drinks were top-notch. Highly recommended for a great time with friends. Will definitely return!

Disappointing Experience at This Highly-Rated Eatery. While the lamb was flavorful, the garlic naan was merely frozen from Trader Joe's, and the portion size didn't justify the high price point. Moreover, despite advertising acceptance of American Express, the owner refused to honor it. With such inconsistencies, I'm unlikely to return.

Hidden in an unassuming strip mall, this gem of an ice cream shop offers a delightful surprise with its innovative and varied flavors. The pumpkin and whipped cream cheese flavors, when combined, recreate the delicious taste of pumpkin pie. The owner, Michael, is a friendly and generous host, happily offering samples and recommendations, and constantly creating new and exciting flavors. Despite its unassuming location, this is a must-visit destination for anyone craving a unique and delicious ice cream experience.

While the coffee selection could be expanded with an espresso bar, this establishment shines with its fantastic food and baked goods. The culinary offerings are truly spectacular, making it a must-visit destination for foodies.

Holly Grove is an outstanding local grocery store that truly shines with its exceptional selection of locally-sourced produce and products. With a year-round growing season in the area, the store takes full advantage by offering an impressive variety of fresh, locally-grown fruits and vegetables that you won't find at regular grocery chains. Beyond produce, Holly Grove also carries locally raised meats, breads from local bakeries, and other unique offerings, making it a one-stop-shop for supporting local growers and makers. The store's atmosphere is inviting, with staff tending to the on-site garden, adding to the overall pleasant experience. The only downside is its location, which may be inconvenient for those living across town. Overall, Holly Grove is a gem for anyone seeking high-quality, locally-sourced goods and a delightful shopping experience.

A family-friendly restaurant with fantastic homemade chips and tasty main dishes like burgers and blackened chicken (though the chicken could be a bit overseasoned). The service was a bit slow during our weekend visit, but the kid-friendly atmosphere with a kids' movie on TV kept our 3-year-old entertained. The seating layout could be improved as one table is awkwardly close to the restroom entrance. Overall, the delicious food and military discount make it a recommendable spot, but the service could be better. Rating: 4/5 stars.

This downtown Tampa hotel offers an exceptional value with its complimentary perks. The highlight is the impressive free breakfast featuring made-to-order omelets, a variety of hot and cold items, and even fresh pastries – easily the best complimentary breakfast I've experienced. The suite with a fold-out couch was clean, modern, and well-appointed with amenities like dual TVs and a strong shower. They also offer a happy hour with free drinks, though we missed it during our stay. Overall, a solid choice for those seeking a comfortable stay with great freebies in a convenient location.

This cozy downtown St. Petersburg restaurant offers a delightful homey ambiance. The flavorful burgers are a standout, especially with the addition of arugula on the chicken and potato gratin dish. While the cheese in the gratin wasn't to my taste, the burger is definitely worth returning for. The wine prices seemed high, but the friendly service and inviting atmosphere made for an enjoyable dining experience overall.

Cd Roma's is a long-standing Italian restaurant that has been a favorite for over a decade. While the new location has a more modern vibe compared to the previous homey and cozy setting, the food remains delicious. The Chicken Parmesan, Eggplant Parmesan, house salad, Alfredo pasta, and pizza are standout dishes, with the made-to-order Alfredo sauce being particularly noteworthy when paired with their breadsticks. However, some appetizers like the frozen cheese sticks and calamari could be improved with better quality ingredients. Overall, Cd Roma's continues to be a beloved choice, surpassing chains like Olive Garden, despite the nostalgic longing for the old location's ambiance and the "good old days" of the past.

While Waffle House's business model of shouting orders and cramped dining spaces isn't for everyone, there's no denying the consistent quality of their breakfast fare. Despite the chaotic atmosphere, you can count on a satisfying meal wherever you find yourself at a Waffle House. It's a love-it-or-hate-it experience, but for those who embrace the controlled chaos, it's a comforting and reliable breakfast destination worth looking forward to.

Henry was an exceptional storage locker agent - knowledgeable, professional, and extremely personable. He graciously accommodated our furry companion, Marley, during the process. Overall, a great experience in obtaining a storage locker. Highly recommended!

This phenomenal restaurant offers an unbeatable combination of great location, ambiance, food, and drinks. The star of the show is undoubtedly the bar, where Jared, a true mixologist, has crafted an impressive cocktail menu. Don't hesitate to challenge him with your preferences. The food menu is equally impressive, with consistently exceptional dishes, no matter what you order. Keep an ear out for the specials, which are always a treat. With hundreds of delightful meals under its belt, this establishment is a surefire culinary delight.

Contrary to the rave reviews, this vegan restaurant is just A-OK in my opinion. While the location is great, and the food is fresh with a good variety of vegan options, the overall experience is pretty blah. The crispy ranch and curry tofu were enjoyable, especially the chick'n in the crispy ranch, and the fries are decent too. However, for a specialty vegan place, I expected more. The green lemonade was overwhelmingly sweet and lemonade-y for my taste. At around $10 for a lunch item, it's not mind-blowingly amazing, but worth a try given its popularity and unique offerings.

A truly disappointing experience! The staff member at the counter was rude and unprofessional, while the premises were unacceptably filthy. The overall atmosphere was unpleasant and off-putting. I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a decent dining or service experience.

In a nutshell, Sweet Soulfood is an absolute must-visit for anyone craving authentic, delicious, and affordable vegan cuisine in New Orleans. Despite the pouring rain, this cozy establishment did not disappoint, offering a tantalizing array of flavorful dishes that left me wanting to try everything on the menu. The friendly staff, particularly Jamone, went above and beyond by providing generous samples, making it nearly impossible to choose just one item. From savory entrees to the heavenly bread pudding, every bite was a delightful explosion of flavors. The portions were incredibly generous, ensuring I left completely satisfied without breaking the bank. Sweet Soulfood is a true gem for vegans and non-vegans alike, offering an unforgettable culinary experience in the heart of New Orleans.

This unassuming vegan eatery is a hidden gem that won over even a non-vegan with its mouthwatering Philly steak. The flavorful curry tofu wrap and irresistible kale lemonade further solidified its status as a must-visit destination. While the cozy space may necessitate take-out for some, the food is worth the minor inconvenience. An absolute delight for herbivores and omnivores alike, this vegan heaven is a mandatory stop on any Philadelphia culinary journey.

An absolute gem! This sushi restaurant offers top-notch service and a delightful dining experience. The management's attentiveness and the excellent staff, particularly Billy, ensure a memorable visit. Don't miss out on their signature rolls, such as the Tiger Roll, Pink Lady Roll, and Tornado Roll, which are highly recommended. Among the restaurants in the area, this establishment stands out as a must-try for sushi lovers. Prepare to be impressed!

A must-visit spot for delicious Southern fare in New Orleans! This casual eatery serves up phenomenal fried chicken and lip-smacking red beans and rice at wallet-friendly prices. The friendly staff and attentive service make it a consistent highlight during trips to the city. A local staple that consistently delivers on flavor and hospitality.

As a local resident, Mint is my go-to spot for delicious and diverse offerings. Every menu item is a winner, making it impossible to make a bad choice. Their Taro Tapioca Smoothie is especially noteworthy, providing the perfect sweet treat to satisfy any craving. Mint's consistently excellent food and drinks keep me coming back time and again.

This Mexican restaurant stands out for its fresh and homemade offerings. The salsa, guacamole, and chips are made daily on-site, ensuring maximum freshness and flavor. The shrimp burrito is generously sized and delivers on taste and quality ingredients. However, the service from the wait staff leaves room for improvement, described as just average. Overall, it's a solid spot for those craving authentic Mexican fare, with the highlight being the freshly prepared staples like salsa, guacamole, and chips.

While I wanted to love this highly-rated calzone spot, my experience was just underwhelming. The costanza calzone had tasty fillings but a disappointing bread-y crust that lacked the desired doughy texture. The portions were decent but skimpy on meat. The apple pie calzone was the biggest letdown, with an odd spice flavor and a pureed apple filling lacking chunks. The vibe is nice and it's conveniently located, but overall it seemed overhyped. I might give it one more try, but my first visit left me unimpressed.

Le Bec-Fin is a true Philadelphia gem that offers an unparalleled dining experience. With an amazing view, impeccable professional service, and exquisite fare, it's a must-visit destination. The knowledgeable staff, like the stellar server Nick, provide exceptional recommendations, such as the lovely 2010 Bordeaux-Chateau Font Merlet, which perfectly complements dishes like the Tuna Tartare and Steak Tataki. While the nighttime view is fabulous, the promise of spectacular sunsets makes it a place worth returning to again and again.

The food is excellent, but the service is painfully slow during peak hours. Despite the hardworking staff, understaffing leads to excessive wait times for both seating and food orders. On a busy day, I waited over an hour to be seated and another hour for my breakfast, with tables remaining uncleared for extended periods. The long lines and frustrated patrons were a testament to the management's failure to adequately schedule staff. While the food quality is commendable, the inefficient service makes it an unpleasant dining experience, prompting me to avoid returning until staffing issues are resolved.

Breakfast at Terraza Cafe offers large portions at an affordable price. While the hashbrowns were undercooked, the eggs, bacon, and wheat toast were quite good - better than Cajun Kitchen on Chapala but not as good as their Goleta location. The well-shaded patio seating was a highlight, and the single server handling multiple tables provided great, cheerful service. Despite being picky about everything, the reviewer appreciated that all special requests were accommodated. The appealing outdoor terrace seating sets Terraza apart from other breakfast spots, prompting interest in trying their lunch menu as well.

While the all-you-can-eat option at $27 per adult seems like a decent deal for those with a hearty appetite, the quality of the food leaves much to be desired. The maki rolls, though passable, were chilled to the point of being pre-made and refrigerated. The oyster ponzu lacked the expected ponzu flavor and was heavily battered, resembling an A&W onion ring more than a delicate Japanese dish. The greasy tempura and mediocre sushi rolls might satisfy a craving for quantity over quality, but discerning diners should steer clear, especially of the squid. Overall, this establishment falls short in delivering an authentic Japanese dining experience.

Exceptional service! After a disappointing experience with another locksmith, I called this company, and they promptly sent someone within 20 minutes. The technician was efficient and completed the job in under an hour. As a bonus, I received four free keys. Their prompt response, professionalism, and complimentary keys make them unbeatable in terms of customer service. Highly recommended!

A disappointing experience at this overcrowded establishment. The unpleasant odors from patrons and dirty bathrooms were off-putting, while the mediocre food and service failed to impress. With Philadelphia's abundant dining options, there are far better places to spend your money. Skip this one and explore elsewhere.

The Pub Paradox: While boasting an impressive beer selection and knowledgeable staff, the dining experience fell disappointingly short. Inconsistent food preparation, with undercooked fries and burgers ranging from well-done to alarmingly rare, compounded by cold, hard buns, made the meals inedible. Even after politely communicating the issues, the lacklustre service persisted, leaving us charged full price for untouched plates. A great spot for drinks, but approach the food with caution – or perhaps inebriation – as sober disappointment seems inevitable.

Despite a rocky first visit marred by communication issues and an incorrect order, this establishment redeemed itself on the second try. While the initial experience was disappointing due to heavy accents of the employees and a mix-up with the order, the staff corrected the mistake, and the food was good. On the subsequent visit, their pizza steak impressed with its generous mozzarella cheese, well-stuffed roll, and balanced sauce. Although a couple more tries are needed to declare it a new favorite, the second experience has significantly improved the overall impression, suggesting this place deserves another chance.
Unfortunately, it's worth noting that IBP has recently closed its doors, leaving a void for those who enjoyed its unique blend of liveliness and relaxation in the heart of the city.

This popular hangout spot excels in providing a lively atmosphere, with a huge dog-friendly deck and generous happy hour deals on beer. However, the food leaves much to be desired. The pretzels with Velveeta cheese dip are disappointing, and the pretzel bun sandwiches, while pricey, are underwhelming, with soggy buns and lackluster accompaniments. The establishment would do better to focus on its strengths – serving beer and creating a vibrant ambiance – rather than attempting to compete with the superior sandwich options available nearby. Additionally, the allowance of smoking on the deck detracts from the overall experience. Rating: 3.5/5 stars.

Modern Laundry exceeds expectations with its exceptional cleanliness, friendly staff, and top-notch fluff and fold service. The impeccably folded and spotless laundry, coupled with their eco-friendly detergent, make it a standout establishment. It's a true time-saver, turning a tedious chore into a quick and convenient errand. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a hassle-free laundry experience.

The Spot Bistro offers a pleasant dining experience in the city center with its inviting atmosphere. While the back room can feel stuffy during peak hours, the raw oysters and burgers stand out as recommended dishes. However, the lunchtime prices are slightly on the higher side, so be prepared to spend a few extra dollars for the quality fare.

Excellent Local Gem! This small shop is an outstanding find, offering delectable wine cakes that make the drive utterly worthwhile. As a first-time visitor swayed by the rave reviews on Yelp, I was thoroughly impressed and can confidently say I'll be returning. The quality of their baked goods is superb, making this a must-visit for those seeking a delightful local treat.

The Love Restaurant exceeds expectations, truly standing out from the rest. Our Father's Day lunch was exceptional, with an impressive menu offering wonderful selections that made it difficult to choose. The professional and accommodating service, combined with the lovely and bright atmosphere, created a delightful dining experience. The attention to detail was remarkable, with surprises like the hot omelet filling and the roasted peppers and onions accompanying the potatoes. The inclusion of greens on every plate, such as the warm spinach salad, added a fresh touch. The corn meal Belgium waffles with blueberry butter were a standout, and the use of La Columbe coffee was a nice touch. From start to finish, there was nothing left to wish for – a truly memorable and satisfying experience.

Sushi House: Decent Fare, False Advertising

While the sushi rolls were satisfactory, the hibachi grill left much to be desired. The steak, despite explicit instructions, arrived well-done, and the chicken lacked proper seasoning. However, the most disappointing aspect was the false advertisement regarding their late happy hour. Despite being listed on their website as occurring from 8-11 pm, the staff claimed this applied to a different, unspecified location. The website provided no such clarification, misleading customers about available promotions. Overall, the food was passable, but the lack of transparency is concerning.

Lee How Fook, a small Chinese restaurant, offers a mixed experience. While the cozy ambiance and delicious appetizers like pan-seared pork dumplings and sui mai were enjoyable, the main courses disappointed. The sweet & sour chicken lacked balanced flavors and had undercooked vegetables. The pan-fried noodle dishes with shrimp and beef lacked the expected spiciness and flavor. Service was decent, but communication could be improved. Despite the promising start with appetizers, the underwhelming main dishes left an unsatisfying impression. Reservations are recommended for weekends due to limited seating. Overall, Lee How Fook falls short in delivering a consistently satisfying dining experience.

The hot chicken at this establishment is an absolute standout, delivering an exceptional fried chicken experience that even a Southerner would rave about. However, the small portion sizes come with a steep price tag, which may be a deterrent for some diners. On a positive note, the drinks menu is equally impressive and complements the fantastic food offerings.

Lee How Fook serves up some of the best General Tso's chicken you'll ever taste. Why waste time with a lengthy review when their delectable dish speaks volumes on its own? As the reviewer succinctly puts it, "Try it for yourself and get back at me." This no-frills recommendation is a testament to the restaurant's ability to let their exceptional culinary skills do the talking. If you're craving an unforgettable General Tso's chicken experience, Lee How Fook is a must-visit.

Chef John Besh's Luke restaurant, conveniently connected to the Hilton hotel on St. Charles, was a delightful surprise during our New Orleans visit. Despite initial reservations about trying a burger in the city known for its local cuisine, the raves about Luke's burger proved accurate – it was one of the best, huge, juicy, and flavorful burgers we've ever had. The traditional New Orleans dishes were also excellent, and the bread pudding à la mode was a mouth-watering, straight-from-the-oven delight. While the restaurant is often filled with business suits, the exceptional food made it a must-visit, drawing us back three times in five days. Luke's is a highly recommended spot for both local flavors and unexpected culinary gems like their outstanding burger.

Disappointing Visit: This restaurant has unfortunately closed its doors at this particular location. I had been looking forward to savoring their renowned fish tacos, but my craving will have to wait until they reopen elsewhere or I find another eatery offering similar delectable fare.

Review: When I lost my car keys while skiing at Squaw Valley, Alpine Locksmith's Jacob came to the rescue. He provided prompt service, accurate time estimates, and reasonable pricing. Despite the stressful situation, Jacob's professionalism and efficiency made the experience hassle-free. Within minutes of his arrival, he had my new keys programmed, allowing us to continue our journey without further delay. Alpine Locksmith's honesty and reliability are truly commendable. While I hope not to misplace my keys again, I would undoubtedly call on their services if needed. They accept AAA, which is an added convenience. Highly recommended for their exceptional service and customer-centric approach.

A disastrous New Year's Day experience at this restaurant. Despite being seated at 7:30 PM, we didn't even get water after waiting for 45 minutes. Multiple servers introduced themselves, but no one actually served us. The service was abysmal, and we ended up leaving without being attended to. In contrast, the hot dogs at Dat Dog across the street were excellent, making them the unexpected saviors of our evening. Avoid this restaurant for poor service, but Dat Dog is highly recommended for a delightful quick meal.

Disappointing experience. My order was a mess - around 75% of the items were incorrect or missing, including one of the main entrees (a burger). Quality control and order accuracy seem to be major issues here. I won't be ordering from this restaurant again until they improve their fulfillment process.

Farmhaus lived up to the hype during my recent weekend visit. Despite the crowded atmosphere and a slight wait for our table, the exceptional dishes made it worth the anticipation. The smoked fish dip and escolar with prawns were the standout stars, with the mushroom salad and tapenade also impressing. While the meatloaf was a tad dry and bland, the overall meal was excellent. The service was commendable, given the bustling small space. I eagerly anticipate returning to sample their acclaimed blue plate special lunches and to experience their outdoor seating, which promises an even more delightful dining experience.

While Dish's food might be enjoyable, the lack of customer service is unacceptable. Despite making a reservation for three people two weeks in advance, we were crammed into a tiny table that could barely fit two. The seating arrangement was incredibly uncomfortable, with another patron's back mere inches away from our table. When we politely requested a more suitable table to accommodate our party, we were met with rude dismissal and a "take it or leave it" attitude. This complete disregard for customer satisfaction is inexcusable, especially for a supposedly "special night out." Regrettably, Dish's poor service has led us to remove it from our list of dining options.

While the milkshake at this restaurant was praised as one of the best I've ever had, and the food and service were satisfactory, there was an unexplained odd feeling or vibe that left me slightly unsettled. The evening date with my boyfriend started off delightfully with his insistence on ordering the incredible milkshake, but something seemed a bit off about the overall atmosphere. It's hard to pinpoint exactly what caused the strange sensation, but it was noticeable enough to mention. Despite the excellent milkshake and decent meal, the peculiar vibe prevented the experience from being truly outstanding.

Highly disappointing new restaurant fails to deliver authentic Greek cuisine. Instead of the promised real deal, it serves up bland, Americanized versions that butcher classic Mediterranean dishes like skordalia and avgolemono. The food is a far cry from the genuine Greek flavors found in places like Greektown in Detroit or Toronto. With badly missed culinary marks like these, this establishment does not deserve any support from those seeking true Greek dining experiences. An overpriced, inauthentic miss - just say no to this place.

An exceptional dining experience in New Orleans! The set price menu was a fantastic value, featuring a fresh strawberry salad, incredibly moist and flavorful chicken with delightful cornbread stuffing, and a rich chocolate cake. The vegetarian selection plate was a hit, and the pork with sweet potato mash received high praise as well. The attentive service from Travis, Susan, and Caroline enhanced the overall experience. With an excellent location and undoubtedly the best meal we had in the city, this restaurant is a must-visit for anyone craving outstanding Southern cuisine.
I highly recommend this veterinary practice for their excellent customer service and compassionate care for pets.

This cozy gem truly delivers on its promise of farm-fresh, inventive cuisine. The flavorful dishes and perfectly portioned plates are sure to amaze. The warm, friendly atmosphere and attentive service create the ideal setting for a delightful meal with friends and family. Don't miss the unique and delectable Bloody Beet Steak! With its BYOB policy, bringing along a excellent bottle is a must. An all-around fantastic dining experience.

Based on the brief statement provided, it seems someone is offering a concise review or recommendation for an item called the "island bowl" at a place referred to simply as "Bomb." The exclamation "For your health!" appears to be attributed to a person named Dr. Steve Bruhle, though without more context, it's unclear if this is an endorsement of the island bowl's nutritional value or something else entirely. Without any copyrighted material present, I've summarized the relevant details as concisely as possible while avoiding potentially infringing content.

The burger itself was outstanding – juicy, cheesy perfection that stood out from the competition due to the high quality of ingredients. Unfortunately, the overly thick and fatty bacon detracted from the experience. While the ambiance and communal seating concept were major downsides, the burger's flavor alone makes this joint worth a visit for true burger enthusiasts. Just be prepared to potentially endure awkward dining companions. 3.5/5 stars.

LA Fitness offers a solid gym experience at a reasonable price. Pros include a convenient location, affordable membership fees that allow access to all their area locations, basic amenities like cardio machines, weights, lap pool, spin and aerobics studios, and complimentary personal trainer session upon signup. The staff is friendly, and they offer childcare services during limited hours. However, the gym opens late on weekends at 8 AM, and the only pre-work group fitness class is a 5:45 AM spin session, which may not suit everyone's preferences. LA Fitness is a no-frills gym without fancy amenities like a smoothie bar or high-tech equipment. Overall, it's a cost-effective option for those seeking a basic, well-equipped gym with a pleasant atmosphere and staff.

If you're a sushi connoisseur who values both the quality of ingredients and the skill of the chef, Hiro San is an absolute must-visit. This Santa Barbara gem is helmed by a true master, whose exceptional craftsmanship and attention to detail elevate each bite to a sublime experience. Beyond his unparalleled skills, Hiro San himself is a warm and engaging presence, making the dining experience all the more enjoyable. For sushi lovers in the area, treat yourself to a front-row seat at Hiro San's counter – it's a culinary journey you won't soon forget.

The theater may be dated, but it offers an unbeatable movie-going experience with its cheap prices and friendly staff. Despite its age, it's a hidden gem that rarely feels crowded, allowing you to comfortably enjoy a wide range of films, from major blockbusters to hard-to-find indie flicks. If you're willing to wait for movies to arrive here, you'll be rewarded with an affordable and personable cinema experience that's hard to find elsewhere.

The Brunch Spot offers a delightful ambiance with a welcoming interior and an inviting outdoor seating area complete with cozy couches. The brunch menu boasts delectable offerings, and the impressive beer selection is exceptional. However, the service fell short due to an unpleasant and inattentive waiter who seemed disinterested from the start. He lacked knowledge of the menu, frequently disappeared, and argued when orders were incorrect (despite the restaurant being nearly empty). While the food and atmosphere were enjoyable, the poor service was a significant letdown, preventing a higher rating. 3 stars.

This restaurant boasts a delightfully creative menu, offering an excellent dining experience. It shares a kitchen with the neighboring La Mulita, allowing patrons to enjoy both establishments' offerings. However, the lack of a reservation system can be a gamble, especially on weekends when wait times can be unpredictable. Additionally, the requirement for the entire party to be present before being seated means late arrivals could significantly delay your dining experience. Overall, the exceptional cuisine makes it worth the potential wait, but be prepared for some patience and flexibility.

On a busy Thursday night at Cool Springs when Bonefish Grill had a long wait, we were pleasantly surprised by the comfortable 15-minute wait at this restaurant. The food, as always, was amazing – a given for this establishment. Despite the crowds, the experience was enjoyable, thanks to the reasonable wait time and consistently excellent cuisine.

Hellas Bakery and Restaurant in Tarpon Springs is a must-visit spot for delicious Greek cuisine. Despite the crowds, the service is efficient, and the staff is friendly and attentive. The gyro, chicken souvlaki, and spanakopita (though slightly overcooked on top) are standout dishes, and the cheese appetizer is a delightful addition. While catering to all palates, including children, Hellas Bakery and Restaurant offers an authentic Greek dining experience that makes it a go-to destination for those visiting the area.

The Gryphon Cafe is a trendy, cozy coffee shop that draws in coffee enthusiasts with its intimate ambiance and excellent lattes. While the dim lighting and small space create a serene vibe, the cafe also supports a vibrant local music scene on weekends. The standout item is undoubtedly the strong, flavorful espresso used in their lattes. However, the baked goods can be hit or miss, with some items being disappointingly stale. Overall, Gryphon Cafe is a great spot for a quality coffee experience, but you may want to skip the pastries.

Metamorphosis Tattoo is a rare find that deserves a 5-star rating. Unlike other tattoo shops in the area that have canceled appointments, forgotten clients, or prioritized personal matters over scheduled appointments, Metamorphosis runs their business professionally. The artist Trevor provided an exceptional tattooing experience, delivering the desired design while maintaining a fun and respectful atmosphere. The prices are reasonable for the quality of work, and the non-refundable deposit policy is standard practice. Metamorphosis stands out for its skilled artists, professional conduct, and customer-centric approach, making it a diamond in the rough worth revisiting.

The lengua burrito was a satisfying and wallet-friendly option. It was prepared cleanly without excessive grease, and the plating was neat and presentable. A simple yet enjoyable dish. I'm intrigued to try their flan on my next visit.

Disappointing Dining Experience: The ambiance was severely lacking due to poor lighting, making it difficult to even see the food on your plate. Additionally, the cuisine itself was merely average, failing to impress. Despite having high hopes, the overall experience fell short of expectations.

The banana pudding at this establishment is simply amazing! While the additional toppings are a delightful option, the plain 'no-nana' version is equally fantastic. What truly sets this place apart is the genuine care they show for their customers, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. I wholeheartedly support this shop and hope it continues to thrive for many years to come.

My experience at Shepard's was disappointing and frustrating. After accidentally leaving my organizer/wallet at the restaurant, I called multiple times to locate it. When it was eventually found, $100 was missing from the organizer, despite having witnesses that the money was there. The assistant manager refused to investigate or even approach the staff about the incident, essentially telling me it was not their problem. This lack of concern for customer issues and unwillingness to address a potential theft is unacceptable. The poor customer service and dismissive attitude have left me incensed and hesitant to return to Shepard's in the future.

Disappointing Experience at [Restaurant Name]. The prime rib was extremely fatty and inedible, even for a dog. The fries were served cold, and simple requests like regular butter were ignored. Despite numerous negative reviews, the restaurant seems unwilling to address ongoing issues. Overall, an abysmal dining experience that highlights a lack of effort to improve and provide quality service.

While I haven't extensively explored their menu yet, this vegan pizzeria deserves a solid 4 stars. Their vegan General Tso's pizza was a standout dish – the crisp and fluffy crust complemented the flavorful, generously portioned seitan 'chicken' coated in a delightful General Tso's sauce. The service was commendable too, with the staff attentively addressing my dietary needs and pricing queries. The prompt delivery ensured the pizza arrived piping hot. With their homemade seitan being a highlight, this pizzeria is definitely worth a try for both vegans and non-vegans alike.

Rojo Mexican Grill, located at the Drury Plaza hotel, offers a convenient dining option for travelers unfamiliar with the area. While catering to large groups, the service remained decent, with only a few minor hiccups. The portions are generous, and the food is generally good, with standouts like the massive and delicious Cuban sandwich, the flavorful shrimp tacos with a kick, and the refreshing shandy. However, the margaritas, particularly the Patron one, are not recommended. Overall, Rojo provides a satisfactory dining experience, especially for those seeking large portions and a convenient location.

Tanti and her talented team at Papertini elevate wedding florals to an art form. Their creative masterpieces, adorned with unique elements like paper, wire, and luxe fabrics, are a refreshing departure from traditional arrangements. While they can accommodate classic styles, Papertini truly shines in their unique, one-of-a-kind designs that are far from artsy-fartsy. With their friendly service and artistic flair, Papertini is an invaluable asset for couples seeking a truly memorable floral experience on their special day.

While the prices were on the higher side, the friendly and efficient service complemented the exceptional cuisine. Mr. B's Bistro offers a truly memorable brunch experience, capturing the essence of New Orleans' culinary heritage. Highly recommended for those seeking an indulgent and authentic taste of the city.

Nice Steakhouse in St. Louis offers a pleasant dining experience with a view of the iconic arch. While the appetizers were decent, with standouts being the crab cakes and toasted ravioli, the main attraction is the exceptional filet mignon. Cooked to perfection and complemented by an impressive wine list, the steak alone makes this steakhouse a worthy destination for a special occasion or client dinner. Overall, a solid choice for a satisfying steakhouse experience in St. Louis.

My colleagues and I recently tried San Antonio Taco Company for the first time, but unfortunately, the food did not live up to its positive reviews. The sides of refried beans and rice were unsatisfactory – the beans were excessively salty, and the rice was clumpy. My beef enchiladas were a letdown as well, with the beef being cut with the grain, resulting in a stringy and inedible texture. While we generally give restaurants a second chance, this subpar initial experience has left us hesitant to return. The lackluster food quality and execution make it difficult to recommend San Antonio Taco Company based on our visit.

Cousin's is a budget-friendly grocery store in North Philadelphia that offers affordable prices on most essential items. While the produce selection is limited, as expected for a discount grocer, the overall value makes it a go-to choice for locals seeking to save money on their grocery bills. The store's major drawback lies in its inconvenient evening hours, which can be frustrating for those shopping after work. However, with its proximity to nearby residences and cost savings, Cousin's remains a popular option for neighborhood shoppers, especially when the weather or budgets prevent trips to pricier alternatives like Trader Joe's. Despite its flaws, Cousin's delivers on its promise of providing a cost-effective option for everyday groceries in the area.

Overall, this place shines when you order the right items like the Sausage and Pepper Pizza or cream puffs. However, some menu options are just average, and the service could use improvement. With its proximity and potential for more standout treats, I'll likely return but stick to their stronger offerings.

If you're seeking an authentic speakeasy ambiance with a classy yet casual vibe, this hidden gem is a must-visit. Step inside, and you'll be transported back to the Prohibition era, where the focus is on expertly crafted cocktails and a lively atmosphere enhanced by good music. However, be warned: this establishment stays true to its speakeasy roots by offering a limited food menu with just one appetizer dish that may not impress. Come with an empty mind but not an empty stomach, as the real draw here is the exceptional cocktail experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a unique night out with friends or a romantic rendezvous with a significant other.

Extremely disappointing experience. Despite spending a significant amount of money, more than half of our order arrived incorrect and with spoiled food items. An utter waste of money and a massive letdown. I will not be returning to this establishment ever again.

This restaurant falls short at 3.5 stars due to several disappointments. The advertised chicken slider on a biscuit was unavailable, despite the enticing photo. Similarly, the sought-after buttermilk bites were off the menu, yet mysteriously appeared in a sundae ordered by another patron. The glazed donuts were thick and dry, lacking the desired texture. On a positive note, the sliders (fried chicken, beef belly, and catfish) were enjoyable, and the sundae proved quite tasty. While not a complete letdown, the inconsistencies and unfulfilled expectations make this establishment unlikely to draw repeat visits.

Tucked away just a short walk from my apartment, this cozy cafe is a local gem for breakfast and brunch. Despite its popularity, I was seated quickly on both visits. The salmon scramble with egg whites was a delightful and flavorful choice, while the tofu with brown rice breakfast plate catered to a more health-conscious palate. Both meals were excellently prepared and left me fully satisfied. With its welcoming ambiance and delicious offerings, this cafe is a must-visit for any breakfast or brunch enthusiast in the area.

I visited this newly opened restaurant on a Friday evening, and despite my expectation of it being crowded, it wasn't. The staff's friendly demeanor and the charming Magnolia Journal-esque atmosphere left a positive impression. The food and drinks were delightful, though there were slight hiccups with the timing of drinks and appetizers arriving simultaneously with the main course. However, considering their recent opening and my own experience in the hospitality industry, such minor glitches are understandable. Overall, it's a promising establishment worth a visit.

This charming, old-school eatery offers a nostalgic 1960s ambiance and an excellent dining experience. The menu features a range of delectable options, including the standout risotto and the popular linguine with shrimp and lobster. The strip steak is also a hit among diners. What truly sets this place apart is the impeccable service – attentive yet unobtrusive, ensuring a delightful meal. Whether you opt for the full menu or choose from the bar offerings, you're in for a treat at this hidden gem.

This sushi joint is an absolute must-visit for roll lovers! Their massive, freshly prepared sushi rolls are the stars of the show, boasting excellent presentation and mouthwatering flavors. The Heat Attack appetizer (Korean-style jalapeño poppers) and the Sapporo and Honey rolls are personal favorites, but don't miss out on their deep-fried roll selection or the delightful Spicy Sashimi Bowl if you're feeling adventurous. Complementing the delectable fare is the outstanding service, making this spot a top choice for a memorable sushi experience.

While this establishment has high ratings overall, my experience at the bar on two separate occasions was extremely disappointing. The bartenders were outright rude and unwelcoming, making me feel like an inconvenience rather than a valued customer. On my most recent visit, I was completely ignored for over 10 minutes despite being seated at the bar. The bartender proceeded to promptly serve a large group that arrived after me without even acknowledging my presence. Basic courtesy and attentiveness seem to be lacking from the bar staff. The service left much to be desired, and I would caution others to expect an unfriendly experience if grabbing drinks at the bar here. Perhaps service is better when seated at a table, but the bar area is one I'll be avoiding in the future.

This place is an absolute gem! The atmosphere is inviting, and the menu offers a fantastic variety of options, with the lunch bento boxes being a standout. Their boba is a must-try as well. The beef braised soup is hearty and delicious, making it a personal favorite. Ignore the naysayers – this spot is a true crowd-pleaser. If you haven't been here yet, you're missing out!

An exceptional dining experience! The restaurant boasts beautiful decor and a great atmosphere. The food is truly amazing, offering New York-level prices but with better quality than most at this price point. The udon noodles and sushi rolls, particularly the Spicy Salmon roll, were outstanding – flavorful yet well-balanced. Highly recommended for a delightful culinary adventure!

The Lovely Hotel offers a delightful experience with its friendly and accommodating front desk staff. While rooms near the club can be noisy, guests seeking a quiet retreat may request rooms away from the lively area. For those seeking a fun and vibrant atmosphere, this hotel is an ideal choice. Overall, it strikes a nice balance between tranquility and excitement, catering to different preferences.

This charming, family-run eatery offers an authentic European dining experience right in the heart of Middle Tennessee. The pizza is an absolute standout, hailed as the best in the region, with a perfect crust and fresh, flavorful toppings. The gnocchi is another must-try, expertly crafted and bursting with incredible flavors. The menu boasts a nice variety of dishes, all made with high-quality ingredients. The cozy, intimate atmosphere transports you to a quaint European trattoria, making for a truly delightful dining experience.

Review:

This $16 haircut at a student salon exceeded all expectations. While expecting just a basic trim, I received a professionally executed haircut that flattered my face shape and left my hair looking healthier and happier. The attention to detail and thoroughness of the student stylist were impressive, and the shampoo experience was also enjoyable. The only downside was the extra wait time, but it was well worth it for the quality of the cut. The school's structured approach with checklists ensured a top-notch experience. If you have the time to spare, this student salon offers an exceptional value for a fraction of the cost of a professional salon, delivering a high-quality haircut in a relaxing atmosphere.

The Presidio Chapel is a truly enchanting venue for a wedding. Our daughter got married there in May 2015, and it was a magical experience. Rain Longo, the special events coordinator, was exceptionally helpful, patient, supportive, and enthusiastic throughout the process. The chapel itself is an outstanding and authentic venue, and the adjoining room provided a beautiful space for the bride and bridesmaids to get ready. The 6-hour rental period was ample, and the cost was very affordable. We are immensely grateful to Rain and the entire team for making our daughter's special day absolutely perfect.

Overall, while Miriam demonstrated expertise in certain areas, the quality of the service was compromised by excessive marketing tactics and lack of attention to detail, resulting in a less-than-satisfactory experience for the customer's pre-vacation waxing needs.

The Tasty Thai Restaurant offers flavorful and well-executed dishes, such as the highly recommended pad see ew and The King and I stir fry. While the portion sizes are reasonable, the excessive noise level is a significant drawback, making it challenging to enjoy a conversation. Despite the attentive service, the deafening ambiance overshadows an otherwise enjoyable dining experience. If the restaurant could address the noise issue, it would undoubtedly earn higher marks from diners seeking both delectable fare and a pleasant atmosphere.

Overall, my experience with [Rental Company] at the St. Louis Airport location has been disappointing, with subpar vehicle cleanliness and an apparent lack of accountability for lost or stolen items. I urge the company to review their procedures and take appropriate measures to ensure the satisfaction and security of their customers.

An absolute gem with a relaxed ambiance and dog-friendly seating on the charming wrap-around porch. The bananas foster French toast was decadently rich and generously portioned, while the vegetable omelet offered a delicious, healthier option. Though unable to finish the indulgent French toast, it made for a satisfying and memorable final meal before the long journey home. With plans to return and sample their famous juices, this exceptional eatery promises a delightful culinary experience that shouldn't be missed.

An absolute gem! The food is delightfully tasty, and the generous portions offer exceptional value for money. But what truly sets this place apart is the warm and friendly service from the delightful girl behind the counter. Her radiant smile and positive attitude create a welcoming atmosphere. The only downside is that it's not conveniently located near my workplace, preventing more frequent visits. Highly recommended for a satisfying dining experience.

This scenic nature trail offers a delightful outdoor experience. With its picturesque surroundings, it's an ideal spot for various activities like running, walking, hiking, and biking. The trail thoughtfully provides ample seating areas, allowing you to take a breather and savor the natural beauty along the way. A must-visit for nature enthusiasts and fitness enthusiasts alike.

Sluggish kitchen service. While the waitstaff performed well, the kitchen's pace was excruciatingly slow. It took a staggering 40 minutes to receive a simple pasta and salad order. Only recommended if you're looking to prolong your dining experience, perhaps for a marathon date night.

This downtown Mexican restaurant is a real gem! The chips, salsa, beans, and guacamole are delightful starters, while the chimichanga bites with their addictive sauce and the flavorful street tacos and enchiladas steal the show. Despite not having a full bar, they offer potent margaritas creatively brought in from their other location. The service is excellent, with a friendly and attentive server. Overall, it's a 4 out of 5-star experience, narrowly missing the top rating reserved for the absolute favorites. Highly recommended for delicious Mexican fare in a convenient downtown spot.

Holy satisfaction! This place delivers on all fronts. The rolls are deliciously crafted, and the service is attentive and friendly. The prices are reasonable, especially considering the diverse menu with plenty of healthy choices. The sushi is a must-try – it's worth every penny! A definite go-to for a memorable dining experience.

An exceptional dining experience! The restaurant excels in delivering flavorful and well-executed dishes, particularly their standout Gumbo Ya Ya, BBQ shrimp, and delicious crab cakes. Complementing the delectable food is the outstanding service, ensuring a truly enjoyable meal. Highly recommended for those seeking a fantastic culinary journey.

The 20-minute workout at this place is incredibly effective and intense. I was skeptical at first, but after trying it, I'm a complete convert. It has left me feeling better than I have in a long time, both physically and mentally. Chelsey, the trainer I worked with, was exceptional. She provided excellent guidance and motivation throughout the session. Highly recommended if you're looking for an efficient and challenging workout experience.

While the atmosphere and location of this restaurant deserve a perfect 5-star rating for their charm and convenience, the food falls short, earning only a 3-star overall rating. The smoked turkey club sandwich, though decent, lacked exceptional flavor in the meat. The creamed spinach side was enjoyable, but the mac and cheese, which came with an upcharge, was disappointingly dry and bland. Despite the average meal, the inviting ambiance and prime location make it worth giving this place another try to sample different menu items in the hopes of discovering a dish that truly shines.

A delightful brunch experience on NYE weekend! The cozy and inviting decor immediately sets the tone for a warm and welcoming ambiance. The Eggs Veney dish was an absolute delight, with every bite savored until the plate was spotless in mere minutes. Excellent food, coupled with a great overall experience. Highly recommended for a delicious and enjoyable meal.

Ali Ba Ba's in New Orleans offers sizable and satisfying gyros that outshine the competition in the area. While pricier than typical gyros in NYC at $6 each, the quality makes up for the extra cost, especially considering the limited demand for such fare in NOLA. The lack of hot sauce variety beyond rooster sauce is a minor drawback, and service can be sluggish at times. However, the gyros here are a cut above the nearby $5 slice joint or the overpriced hot dogs on the corner, making Ali Ba Ba's a worthwhile stop for late-night kabab, shawarma, or gyro cravings in the city.

This restaurant is a true hidden gem in the community. The food is absolutely delicious, and the customer service is top-notch and amazing. Add to that its great location, and you have a winning combination that makes this establishment a must-visit for anyone seeking an exceptional dining experience.

An absolute gem in West Philly! This charming spot offers an exceptional experience, from the delightful Turkish coffee to the mouthwatering veggie wrap and cheese steak. The cozy cafe section adds to the inviting ambiance, making it a must-visit destination. Highly recommended for anyone seeking great vibes and delectable fare. 5 stars!

Jones is an absolute gem, offering divine comfort food and exceptional flavors. From the indulgent mac and cheese and delectable sliders to the perfectly crisp and flavorful calamari, every dish is a delight. Their innovative take on classics, like the Duncan Hines cake and milk dessert, adds a touch of whimsy. The standout dishes include the succulent roast beef, beautifully cooked halibut, and the satisfying seared ahi tuna. With each visit, Jones continues to impress, leaving you craving more of their warm, comforting, and deliciously executed fare. An absolute must-try for anyone seeking a culinary experience that combines familiarity with extraordinary flavors.

The Penang chicken with flavorful white rice is an absolute delight and a personal favorite. Whether in Boston or Philadelphia, the quality remains consistently excellent. Despite the long line upon arrival, the efficient service ensured a relatively short wait of 15-20 minutes before being seated. The service was commendably quick from start to finish, allowing me to savor the juicy, amazing chicken without delay. Although tempted to indulge in a take-out order for the drive back to Virginia, I resisted the urge, only to regret it immediately upon returning home. Needless to say, next time, I will embrace my greedy side and ensure I savor this delectable meal both on-site and on the go.

Unacceptably long wait times despite ample vacant seating available. Poor management of table turnover and utilization of dining space, resulting in an unnecessarily frustrating experience for customers.

Screamagedon is the ultimate haunted attraction that puts all others to shame. The realistic haunted houses are so immersive they almost feel real. The haunted hayride is a spectacular experience with thrilling effects like fire, chainsaws, and a demonic priest. Walking through the haunted woods with just a glow stick creates an authentically creepy atmosphere. Unlike overhyped events like Howl-O-Scream and Halloween Horror Nights, Screamagedon truly delivers an awesome and genuinely scary experience that can't be missed. It's an attraction worth revisiting year after year.

Prompt and Effective Lice Treatment Service - Shanna's service was excellent. She arrived on time, provided informative guidance on prevention, and thoroughly treated both my daughter and me using specialized tools. While pricey, the professional treatment was worth it after failed attempts with over-the-counter products. The only downside was that the essential lice comb had to be purchased separately. Highly recommended for efficient lice removal.

The BBQ Chicken Sandwich at [Restaurant Name] is a delightful and affordable option, priced at only $5.75. The chicken is grilled to perfection, allowing you to customize it with your choice of toppings and sauces. The sandwich is served on a choice of grilled sourdough, wheat, or white bun, offering a nice variety to suit different preferences. For the quality and the reasonable price point, this sandwich is a great value and a highly recommended option for a satisfying meal.

Excruciatingly slow delivery time, despite being just a few blocks away. The shrimp scampi dish was a bizarre and disappointing concoction, trying too hard with odd flavors. The only saving grace was the delightful sweet potato cheesecake, worthy of five stars. Unfortunately, I wouldn't order anything else from this establishment again, as the main dish was a letdown, and the wait was unacceptably long.

Despite the pretentious service and agonizing wait times, [Restaurant Name] serves up THE BEST BURGER EVER. If you're a burger aficionado, this place is an absolute must-visit. The burger itself is simply unparalleled, making the downsides worth enduring. Prepare for a potentially frustrating experience, but also for burger nirvana.

Perms Plus is a great gym option, especially for those who travel frequently. During my visit to their Tampa location, I was able to seamlessly use my membership from the Atlanta gym. The Tampa gym is larger and offers more equipment compared to the Perimeter location in Atlanta. The yoga class was enjoyable, and the free parking for up to two hours in the garage was a nice convenience. Additionally, I appreciated receiving guest passes to share with local coworkers. Overall, Perms Plus delivers a consistent and accommodating experience across multiple locations.

Tuscan Kitchen is a delightful Italian eatery that consistently delivers fresh, delicious fare. The specialties are always a treat, and the rolls are a standout. Despite one negative comment, the friendly staff and owners clearly prioritize customer satisfaction. With their commitment to quality and pleasing service, this restaurant is a solid choice for an enjoyable Italian dining experience.

For a small, family-owned dealership, I expected a more honest and direct interaction. I implore Glanzmann Subaru to prioritize transparency and accurate vehicle condition reporting, especially for out-of-state customers who cannot physically inspect the vehicles before purchase.

Echoing the rave 5-star reviews, this boutique truly deserves high praise. Lori provides an excellent waxing experience, using the superior blue hard wax that leaves no desire to return to regular wax. The clean, comfortable environment and option for customized waxing make this a top-notch spot. I left feeling pleased and promptly rebooked. Kudos to Yelp reviewers for leading me to this hidden gem!

This Hyundai dealership is incredibly disappointing. Despite my family being loyal Hyundai customers, they have consistently found ways to provide terrible service and screw over their customers. I have given them multiple chances by writing several negative reviews on their site, hoping they would improve, but to no avail. They clearly do not value customer satisfaction or retention. I cannot recommend this dishonest and untrustworthy dealership to anyone looking to purchase or service a Hyundai vehicle. Steer clear and take your business elsewhere.

The Creole House restaurant left much to be desired. While the buffalo wings were reasonably good, the starters like bacon garlic oysters were average at best. The main courses, including jumbalaya pasta, blackened redfish, and canal street redfish, lacked flavor and failed to impress. Complaints ranged from skimpy portions to oversalted sides and a lack of promised garlic sauce. Even the paddle boat drinks were more juice than alcohol. The only saving grace was the attentive service provided by the server, Alexander. Overall, the underwhelming food quality earns the Creole House a mediocre 3-star rating, making it a place to visit only as a last resort when caught in inclement weather near the hotel.

Despite the hype and anticipation surrounding BlackFinn's opening, our experience was disappointing. The atmosphere and staff were pleasant, but the food fell short of expectations. My Cuban sandwich came with mustard despite requesting it without, and was missing the Swiss cheese on the second attempt. My boyfriend's Prime Rib sandwich had more bread than meat, and the au jus was insufficient. The fries were overly salty. The manager handled the situation professionally by taking care of the check and apologizing, but the repeated errors with our orders were frustrating. While the staff's politeness earns them two stars, the subpar food quality makes me hesitant to return, confirming my boyfriend's initial reluctance to dine here. BlackFinn needs to improve their attention to detail in the kitchen to live up to the hype.

Bob Evans Restaurant: Delicious Food, Disappointing Service. While the food itself was enjoyable at this Bob Evans location, the service left much to be desired. Upon being seated, we waited over 10 minutes without being acknowledged or offered drinks. Multiple servers seemed confused about who was responsible for our table. Despite the restaurant not being particularly busy, the service was unacceptably slow. The tasty food couldn't make up for the frustrating lack of attentiveness from the waitstaff. If you dine here, be prepared for potential delays and inattentive service.

I've been a loyal customer of [Company Name] for years, using their services for my business mail. Their outstanding service and exceptional team make them highly recommendable. The staff are friendly and efficient, consistently delivering excellent results. I can't praise them enough for their reliable and top-notch performance.

This small family-run pho restaurant in Reno offers an authentic and delightful dining experience. The ox tail pho is a standout, with perfectly portioned and flavorful broth. The homemade dipping fish sauce is a real treat, adding an extra layer of deliciousness to the dish. With reasonable prices and a warm, inviting atmosphere, this place has become our go-to spot for Vietnamese cuisine whenever we're in town.

This restaurant offers delicious gyros that are highly recommended, especially for takeout. While I haven't dined in personally, it's been described as a very Bosnian atmosphere with a diverse crowd. Cleanliness is also reported to be up to par. If you're looking for tasty gyros and an authentic Bosnian dining experience, this place is worth checking out. The flavors and cultural vibe seem to be a hit!

Sahara Hookah Bar is an absolute gem! From the authentic Moroccan decor with warm yellow walls adorned with evil eyes and intricate metal lamps to the cozy seating area with cushions on the floor and mandala tables, this place oozes charm and creates an incredibly immersive experience. The "Sex on the Beach" flavored shisha was smooth and enjoyable, and the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive without being overbearing. What sets Sahara apart is its tranquil and laid-back atmosphere, making it the perfect spot for a low-key and relaxing hookah session. With affordable water prices and a welcoming ambiance, this hidden treasure should be on every hookah enthusiast's list for an exceptional and authentic experience.

As an out-of-towner, I relied on Yelp to find a salon for a gel manicure, and I struck gold with this place! The salon is beautifully maintained, with a friendly and accommodating staff. My nail tech, Kim, did an exceptional job, leaving me with flawless nails. It was an absolute pleasure, and I will undoubtedly return on my next visit to the area.

This restaurant offered an exceptional dining experience, ranking as one of the top two during our New Orleans visit. The Cajun and Creole dishes were expertly prepared, with the jambalaya, shrimp etouffe, and seafood gumbo standing out as highlights. The shrimp were fresh, and the dishes had perfect textures and flavors. The bread pudding with praline sauce and Cafe du Monde coffee made for a delightful ending to the meal. Complementing the delicious food was the friendly and prompt service. Highly recommended for an authentic taste of New Orleans cuisine.

Decent Cheesesteaks and Cheese Fries - This place offers solid cheesesteaks and good cheese fries, but nothing exceptional. The food is satisfactory, but not worth going out of your way for, as you can find similar quality cheesesteaks in many other places around Philadelphia. If you're in the area, it's a decent option, but it's not a destination spot.

Overall, this Japanese fast-food joint provides a decent option for those craving a quick fix, but discerning palates may find the offerings lacking in finesse. Worth a try for the experience, but not a destination for the city's finest Japanese fare.

The winery boasts an excellent selection of wines and a picturesque location, but the lack of food options is a letdown. However, they earn major points for being dog-friendly, allowing you to bring your own food and enjoy the stunning views with your furry companion. A lovely experience overall for wine enthusiasts and their pups.

An absolute delight! The ambiance was inviting, and the service, particularly from Connor, was outstanding. The cakes appetizer, barley soup, and shrimp ravioli were all delicious, and the Malbec wine was the perfect accompaniment. As a first-time visitor, I was thrilled to learn they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Highly recommended, and I'll definitely be returning!

Breakfast at this eatery is a delightful experience, with their juevos rancheros being a standout dish. The complimentary chips and salsa are also noteworthy – the salsa packs a delightful kick, and the homemade tamale is an absolute must-try. With its flavorful offerings and warm hospitality, this place is a definite repeat-visit destination.

Burger Up delivers a satisfying upscale burger experience. While the burger patty itself could use more flavor, the aged cheddar, Benton's bacon, and artisan bun combine for a tasty overall package. The real star is the delightful truffle fries - an absolute must-try with their pleasant aroma and perfect texture for soaking up oil. The interesting beer selection with semi-obscure Southern brews is another plus. Burger Up makes for a decent change of pace from dive bar burgers, though not necessarily a destination burger joint. A solid option for Vanderbilt students and locals seeking a slightly elevated burger fix.

Mandala is a fantastic local massage supply store that offers an unbeatable combination of great prices, an extensive selection, and exceptional customer service. The owner, Lisa, is extremely knowledgeable and friendly, creating an interactive experience where she helps customers choose the perfect essential oils and blends. With an impressive aroma bar, you can test products in person before purchasing. Mandala's prices are highly competitive, often beating online retailers' prices, and you avoid shipping costs. Supporting this fantastic small business is a win-win, providing access to high-quality massage supplies while contributing to the local community. Conveniently located in a charming Victorian-style home on South Virginia, Mandala is a must-visit for all your massage supply needs.

This charming little shop is a delightful find. While the tasty food and generous portions are noteworthy, the real star is the impressive selection of alcoholic beverages. The ciders, in particular, are an absolute delight, with one proving so irresistible that I couldn't resist bringing a bottle back home across the country. Although the meads didn't quite hit the mark for my personal taste, the overall experience was thoroughly enjoyable and highly recommended.

Review: While this beignet shop in Metairie offers the famous New Orleans treat, it falls short compared to the iconic Morning Call. If you're craving authentic beignets, it's worth making the short 20-minute drive to the renowned Cafe Du Monde in the French Quarter for a superior experience. The extra travel time is a small price to pay for the genuine article at this legendary establishment.

The newly opened nail salon on West Chester Pike is a must-visit for anyone seeking a relaxing and modern pampering experience. The salon boasts a serene ambiance with calming colors, creating a tranquil atmosphere. The friendly staff ensures a warm welcome, and the competitive pricing makes it an excellent value. Additionally, the pedicure chairs are thoughtfully equipped with phone chargers, catering to the needs of today's clients. Overall, this salon offers a top-notch nail service in a comfortable and inviting setting, making it highly recommended.

Not just for feet, this place offers an incredible full-body massage experience. Simon's skilled hands work wonders on tense muscles, and the atmosphere is relaxing and desirable. While walk-ins are accepted, scheduling an appointment, especially during early evening hours, is recommended. The foot massages are also fantastic, and the prices are affordable, making it a worthy indulgence. This little slice of heaven comes highly recommended for its professional and rejuvenating massages.

Tuna Bar is a game-changer for sushi lovers in the city. During their soft opening, we were thoroughly impressed with the top-notch ambiance, attentive service, and exceptional quality of the fish. The owner/executive chef's passion and pride were evident, and rightfully so – they've created a must-visit destination for sushi and Asian fusion enthusiasts. We eagerly anticipate the official opening and the exciting culinary adventures that lie ahead at this outstanding new addition to the neighborhood.

The Dive Bar from Hell: This decrepit establishment takes the concept of a dive bar to an appalling extreme. With its dilapidated wooden walls, overpowering stench, and pathetically small drinks, it's an utter disappointment. Avoid at all costs unless you're actively seeking a miserable experience. There's no redeeming factor that warrants a return visit.

An absolute gem! The Cafe boasts an inviting atmosphere complemented by the hostess's warm hospitality. The food is truly exceptional, with standouts like the refreshingly tangy shrimp salad with lime chili dressing. It's a crowd-pleaser, leaving first-timers eager to return for more of this delightful culinary experience.
Rating: 2/5 stars

Excellent Professional Service! The stylist who did my haircut was incredibly skilled, delivering an outstanding result. Although I didn't catch their name, they earned my trust and confidence. Highly recommended hair salon experience.

Spiro's is a fantastic Greek restaurant that delivers an exceptional dining experience. The Greek salad prepared tableside was a standout, and the dolmades and moussaka were raved about. The combo plate with lamb was so delicious that my dining companion could not stop praising it. The service was exemplary, with our server Ben being knowledgeable and attentive. He even brought us complimentary dessert since we were first-time diners, which was a lovely touch. Despite staying until closing, we felt comfortable and well-fed throughout our meal. The cozy ambiance and delicious food make Spiro's a new regular spot for me, especially since it's conveniently located near my home. Highly recommended for an authentic and enjoyable Greek dining experience.

Disappointing experience. Despite being in severe pain from an accident, I had to endure a lengthy 2-hour wait, only to receive a mere 5-minute consultation and be discharged without any prescribed medications to aid my recovery. If you're seeking compassionate care, this facility falls short. The lack of empathy and minimal attention given to my condition left much to be desired.

Great dining experience! The food was delicious, and the meal box offered good value for money. Alessandra, the cashier, deserves a special mention for her polite and respectful service. I would happily return if in the area again.

While the establishment's move to ditch plastic straws is commendable for environmental reasons, the quality of their cocktails leaves much to be desired. The bartender lacked energy and enthusiasm, resulting in a lackluster Margarita that failed to impress. The drink itself was deemed too simplistic and unimpressive, likely due to subpar ingredients used in the mixers. Overall, the bar's beverage offerings and service need significant improvement to warrant a positive recommendation.

BarreAmped's Music Row location offers an excellent BarreAmped class with a family-like vibe and a hands-on, skilled instructor. The tiny, oddly shaped room can get cramped during full classes, but it was manageable with just a few attendees. Finding the studio can be confusing, as it's located within an unmarked gym house with no visible signage. Despite the lack of clear directions or signage, the class itself was a great workout experience, making it worth a repeat visit. With some improvements to visibility and wayfinding, BarreAmped could provide a truly top-notch studio experience.

The customer service at this establishment was appalling. The employee was incredibly rude, putting me on hold multiple times during the initial call. When the order arrived with mistakes, she refused to rectify the situation and hung up on me repeatedly. On top of the disrespectful treatment, receiving the wrong order compounded the frustration. With such a lack of professionalism and disregard for customers, I cannot recommend this place to anyone. Avoid at all costs unless you want to deal with horrible service.

Delectable dishes and a pet-friendly ambiance! The chicken and French toast were heavenly, though some additional shade on the patio would have been appreciated. Despite that minor quibble, the overall experience was fantastic. We'll definitely be returning for more culinary delights!

Late Night Lifesaver! This place saved the day (or night, rather) with their late-night pickup option during my visit to Nashville. Despite its unassuming appearance, the pizza was an absolute delight, leaving me wishing I had ordered a larger size. Kudos for catering to night owls with delicious eats!

A complete disappointment. The delivery service was terrible, with the order arriving an hour late. When the food finally arrived, it was a mess - items were missing or incorrect, and everything was poorly cooked, either undercooked or overcooked. An utterly unsatisfactory experience that I wouldn't wish on anyone. I will never order from this establishment again.

If you're in Nashville, this place is a must-visit for its fantastic drink deals on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The drinks are reasonably priced and make it a great spot for a night out. However, the food is just okay, so it's best to focus on the drinks. Overall, it's a solid choice for those looking to enjoy budget-friendly drinks in a lively atmosphere.

Delightful dishes and exceptional service! This eatery shines with their fresh and flavorful salads, perfectly brewed tea, and crispy french fries that hit the spot. The attentive servers contribute greatly to the pleasant dining experience. Having visited multiple times, it's a place I highly recommend and look forward to returning to.

An excellent brunch spot for families! The place boasts a clean and inviting ambiance with charming decor. The staff provided outstanding service, making it a delightful experience. Moreover, even my picky four-year-old enjoyed the food, which is a remarkable feat. Highly recommended for a enjoyable family brunch outing.

An absolute gem for tea enthusiasts! This charming tea house boasts an impressive selection of loose leaf teas and tea-related accessories. The artfully crafted beverages and desserts are not only delightful but also creative. The cozy ambiance invites relaxation, complemented by the owner's vast knowledge and passion for tea, evident in the well-curated collection of tea-related literature. Undoubtedly a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a truly exceptional tea experience.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience. The antipasto is a standout, hands down the best I've ever tasted. The pasta dishes are made with fresh, flavorful ingredients. Highlights include the Fisherman's stew, brimming with tender fish in a delightful saffron sauce. Excellent food and attentive service make this a must-visit destination for anyone seeking authentic Italian cuisine.

Muriel's in the French Quarter is a culinary gem that offers an exceptional dining experience. The standout dish is the heavenly goat cheese and shrimp crepes, arguably the best dish you'll ever taste. The rest of the meal lives up to the high standard set by the appetizer. The service is impeccable, and the venue exudes the charm of the French Quarter. While the ghost tours outside can be a tad distracting during dinner, the otherworldly cuisine more than makes up for it. Whether or not the rumor of Muriel's being haunted is true, the only thing supernatural you'll encounter is the heavenly flavors that will transport you to another realm of culinary delight.

While Taco Bell's operating hours indicated they were still open for another 30 minutes, the staff seemed unwilling to serve us. Despite the lights being on and our attempts to get their attention by pulling up to the drive-thru multiple times, no one came to take our order. It was only when we were about to leave that a young employee finally appeared at the window, seemingly in the process of closing up. Overall, the experience left much to be desired in terms of customer service and adhering to posted business hours.

Disappointing Breakfast Experience: While the restaurant seemed promising with good reviews, the breakfast menu was disappointingly limited. The omelet and biscuit lacked flavor, failing to impress. However, seating was swift during the weekday visit, but it's likely to get crowded on weekends. Overall, the breakfast fell short of expectations.

The gym is pricey but well worth the investment, especially with the convenient executive locker rooms. Although I'm easing back after a health hiatus, the facility is top-notch, offering a wide range of equipment and classes.
