A few minor downsides are the limited weekend hours and lack of class variety at convenient times. Overall, I'm thrilled with my membership and highly recommend it for its quality and amenities.

This place deserves an A++ rating! The bar staff, especially the bartender Ally, provide exceptional service even during peak hours. Ally's attentiveness and friendly demeanor make you feel like the only customer, despite the bustling atmosphere. The cool vibe, combined with ample indoor and outdoor seating options, make it a fantastic addition to the Funk Zone. Highly recommended! Be sure to say hi to the amazing Ally if you visit.

This place offers a pleasant lunch experience with a decent menu and perfectly chilled beer. The highlight is the friendly and attentive bartender. While the atmosphere can get crowded during peak hours, visiting during less congested lunch times ensures consistent and prompt service. Overall, it's a spot worth revisiting for a casual meal and drinks.

Despite the disappointment of not all pools being open during Memorial Day weekend, this hotel offers an excellent overall experience. The friendly atmosphere caters well to both adults and families, with ample dining options within the resort itself. While slightly removed from the city center, its location provides a convenient midpoint between Music Row and the airport. The hotel exudes an inviting old-world charm while maintaining impeccable cleanliness. The attentive staff and the captivating atrium truly enhance the stay. Highly recommended for future visits to Nashville.

This self-serve frozen yogurt spot in Manayunk is a delightful treat, especially on a hot summer day. With a wide variety of yogurt flavors and an impressive array of toppings, ranging from fresh fruits to decadent candy options, there's something for every taste bud. The ability to sample flavors before committing is a thoughtful touch. The clean and well-maintained establishment adds to the overall pleasant experience. Highly recommended for a refreshing and customizable dessert indulgence.

The Boise Riverfront Grill, once a trendy chain, now offers overpriced and questionable quality food. While not outright bad, the menu heavily relies on fried items with repetitive breadings, leading to a monotonous experience. The coconut shrimp and hush puppies were overcooked, disappointing for the high prices. The generous portions prioritize quantity over quality. The riverside location and decor are appealing, but there are far better local options more worthy of attention than this fading chain.

This dive bar certainly lives up to its reputation as a smoker's haven. While the dim and smoky ambiance may appeal to some, the overwhelming stench of smoke was a major drawback. The lingering odor was so potent that it disrupted a good night's sleep, necessitating an immediate hair wash. The bloody mary, though served promptly by a friendly bartender, fell short in terms of flavor and potency. If you're a non-smoker seeking a quality cocktail experience, this establishment might not be the best choice. However, for those who don't mind a hazy, smoke-filled atmosphere, this bar could be a suitable spot to unwind with a drink.

This friendly family restaurant just north of Gulfport offers a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Despite a moderate crowd during my mid-morning visit, I was promptly greeted and served. The attentive staff kept my coffee cup full throughout, while the golden oldies playing in the background added a nostalgic touch. The ham omelet with home fries and toast was cooked to perfection and satisfyingly filling. It's a place where you'll feel appreciated and leave with a pleasant dining experience.

An absolute gem! This place truly has it all - an impressive wine selection, hookah offerings, and hands-down the best Lebanese cuisine in the city. The ambiance is lovely, making it a perfect spot for a delightful dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking a taste of authentic Middle Eastern flavors alongside a fantastic wine or hookah experience.

Recommended by a local colleague, a group of us decided to give Red Mess a try. From the moment we were seated, our server Chris made the experience truly memorable. He was patient, knowledgeable about the menu, and provided excellent service throughout our visit. The entire evening was an absolute delight, with every aspect of our meal leaving us thoroughly satisfied. The chips and salsa were fantastic, the drinks were on point, and each of our entrees was absolutely delicious. Red Mess exceeded our expectations, thanks to the incredible food and outstanding service from Chris. Highly recommended for a wonderful dining experience.

The Brick House continues to impress, even as a chain restaurant. Having dined at three different locations across the country, I can confidently say that their food is consistently unique and delicious, with every menu item being a great choice. This particular visit was made even better by the exceptional service I received, surpassing my usual expectations. The Brick House remains one of the few chain restaurants I actively seek out and look forward to revisiting whenever I'm in town.

Siam is a standout establishment raising the bar for St. Louis. The sashimi is exceptional, and the outdoor patio provides a delightful atmosphere for drinks and conversation. The music caters to diverse tastes, with guest DJs delivering outstanding deep house sets rivaling top cities. However, the true highlight is the laidback yet sophisticated crowd seeking a quality night out without pretense. Siam delivers an all-around fantastic experience deserving of high praise.

16th Street Seafood is a no-frills, takeout-only seafood joint with minimal decor, lacking the typical display of fresh seafood on ice. Despite its worn appearance, I decided to give it a try. The large order of mussels in butter and garlic sauce ($9.50) was a decent portion, accompanied by a piece of bread for soaking up the unexpectedly spicy broth. However, the presence of 9 closed mussels was disappointing. The fried shrimp ($1.25 each) was decent but not remarkable. While the place excels in properly packaging messy seafood orders for takeout, the overall experience was underwhelming, save for the surprisingly flavorful mussel broth.

Utilizing a Groupon deal, we visited this seafood establishment, and were pleased with the delectable lobsters, despite their limited size availability that evening. Our server, Jessica, was attentive and accommodating, offering excellent suggestions. While the ambiance was unfussy, the quality of the lobster itself was commendable. A solid choice for those seeking delicious, no-frills lobster fare.

This cozy upscale cafe offers a delightful dining experience with its diverse menu and reasonable prices. While the variety of options is impressive, the lack of a lox bagel sandwich leaves something to be desired. Nonetheless, it remains a preferred spot for enjoying a leisurely lunch with company. Highly recommended for those seeking a pleasant ambiance and quality fare.

Animo in Haddonfield is a true gem, offering far more than just the best fresh juices in town. While their juice selection is outstanding, featuring real fruit and veggie blends like the hangover-curing "MD," Animo has expanded into a burrito bar with an impressive menu. Their burritos and "petitos" (smaller versions) are incredibly flavorful and affordable, with options like the stuffed "Haight & Ashbury" and the unique "Porky & Petunia" with pulled pork and pineapple salsa. The veggie-packed "Border Salad" with quinoa is also a standout. Beyond the fantastic food, Animo offers healthy extras like wheatgrass shots, yogurt bowls, and fiber-rich signature juices. With its fresh, creative offerings at reasonable prices, Animo puts other juice bars in the area to shame and makes it a must-visit spot, even if you're just passing through Haddonfield.

Wine Edventures provided an exceptional wine tasting experience in Santa Barbara for my birthday. Our guide, Sean, was knowledgeable, friendly, and entertaining, making the day truly memorable. Despite being part of a lively bachelor party group, Sean seamlessly accommodated our diverse group. We visited three wineries and a brewery, with insightful explanations and lessons at each tasting. The tour included thoughtful touches like bottled water and souvenir wine glasses. The vineyard lunch, featuring delicious sandwiches, pasta salad, and cookies, was a highlight. I highly recommend Wine Edventures for a fun and educational wine adventure in the Santa Barbara area.

While Tokyo Sushi may not quite reach the pinnacle of serving locally caught, ultra-fresh fish, it's undoubtedly the best sushi option in the area. Skip the newly opened Kooma and save Mikimotos for a special occasion – Tokyo Sushi is the go-to spot for an outstanding sushi experience, especially for lunch. The lovely owners deserve your support, especially in these challenging economic times.

Contrary to the negative reviews, this pizza joint is a hidden gem. The service is friendly and efficient, and the prices are wallet-friendly. While some have criticized the chicken fingers for being dry, my experience has been quite the opposite – they're deliciously moist, complemented by a scrumptious honey mustard sauce. The salads are generously portioned with plenty of fresh veggies, and the fries and coleslaw that accompany the chicken finger platter are equally delightful. Despite being a no-frills establishment, the food quality and value more than make up for the lack of ambiance. If you're seeking a convenient and affordable dining option with tasty fare, this unassuming pizzeria is definitely worth a visit.

Lazo's Cheesesteaks is a must-visit! Their cheesesteaks are simply fantastic, with high-quality ingredients and perfectly balanced flavors. What truly stands out is the friendly and efficient service, ensuring a delightful dining experience. Lazo's has the ability to turn an ordinary day into a memorable one, making it a go-to spot for delicious cheesesteaks and exceptional service.

Despite being situated in a mall and understaffed, this restaurant delivered an exceptional dining experience. The service was slow but the staff remained pleasant and apologetic. The vegetable samosas were delicious, but the chicken samosas were slightly dry. The standout dishes were the flavorful and rich chicken tikka masala and the amazing chicken tagine. The menu offered a delightful mix of cuisines with just enough choices. The BYOB policy caught us off-guard, but we'll definitely return, prepared with our favorite beverages. Overall, it's a hidden gem that's worth the wait for its out-of-this-world flavors.

The Scoop: This charming local ice cream parlor in Tucson serves up delectable, high-quality scoops that are sure to delight. With its cozy mom-and-pop vibe, it's the epitome of cute. While the ice cream itself is heavenly, be prepared for a slightly steep price tag – a single scoop will set you back $4.50. Overall, it's a delightful spot worth visiting, especially if you're willing to splurge a bit for premium, locally-made ice cream. Rating: 4/5 stars.

Unique brewery with a fitting edgy vibe. Despite being packed on a weekend afternoon, seating was easily accessible. Impressive imperial stout selection for beer enthusiasts. While no food is served, you can bring your own or grab a bite from the eateries across the street. A must-visit for those seeking a distinctive craft beer experience.

This BBQ joint is an absolute gem! With its vibrant and relaxed ambiance, it offers a delightful dining experience. The beef brisket and smoked sausage were exceptional, savored to the last bite. Undoubtedly, this place has secured its spot as our go-to destination for future BBQ cravings. Highly recommended!

If you're looking for an incredible breakfast deal, this place is a must-visit. Between 7am-9am on weekdays, they offer a fantastic bargain: two eggs, home fries or latke, toast or biscuit, and bottomless coffee, all for just $4! The food is delicious, and the service is amazing. I had a wonderful breakfast experience, all for less than the cost of a bus ride. Don't miss out on this unbeatable value and satisfying start to your day!

Despite the frustratingly long wait times, this sushi hotspot is worth the crowd. The sushi is simply outstanding - possibly the best I've ever had. And you never know who you might run into at the bar; on my last visit, I met two celebrities! If you don't mind the inevitable wait, this place is a must-visit for sushi lovers.

A fantastic stay! The room was beautifully appointed, and the location can't be beaten. With the streetcar conveniently running right outside, getting to top attractions like the Canal was a breeze. Highly recommended for an authentic local experience.

This restaurant is an absolute gem! From the mouth-watering and healthy dishes to the impeccable service and delightful ambiance, every aspect was perfect. The owners' love and care are evident in each bite, making this a truly exceptional dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking delicious, high-quality food in a welcoming atmosphere.

I've discovered my new go-to spot for delicious pizza! Instead of ordering from their menu, we customized our own 10-inch pie – the perfect size for two. We went with pepperoni, sliced red onions, and the star of the show: roasted garlic cloves. The toppings were perfectly balanced, with just the right amount of cheese and pepperoni, and the roasted garlic elevated the flavor to new heights. Even though we didn't try any appetizers, I'm already eager to return and explore more of their menu. Plus, I'll be completing their survey for a free pizza on my next visit. Highly recommended for anyone craving an exceptional pizza experience.

An outstanding breakfast spot! This place offers a delightful blend of tasty and healthy options, complemented by tempting indulgences. The atmosphere is inviting, the service is top-notch, and the food is simply delicious. Highly recommended for a satisfying and enjoyable breakfast experience.

Exceptional service at this auto body shop! The bodywork was flawlessly executed, and they went the extra mile by vacuuming the interior. Randy's regular text updates kept me informed about the progress on my car throughout the process. Highly recommended for their skilled workmanship and outstanding customer service.

Initially disappointed but redeemed upon revisiting. While the first experience was subpar with issues like poor sauce, wilted lettuce, long wait times, high prices, and lack of flavor, subsequent visits proved to be a pleasant turnaround. The reviewer caught the establishment on an off day initially but ultimately became a fan, particularly of their bubble tea offerings. If craving Greek/Mediterranean cuisine, this place is now worth considering, as the third time proved to be the charm for this reviewer.
I have proof of the services I requested, and I will be disputing the charges with my bank. Steer clear of this dealership's service department if you value honesty and fair treatment.

M.L. Rose is a beloved neighborhood hangout with a fantastic beer selection and enjoyable flight options. The atmosphere strikes a perfect balance, avoiding pretentiousness while still feeling modern. The service is consistently excellent. However, the food falls short, with inconsistencies in preparation and quality. The wings lack crispiness, burgers are often overcooked or undercooked, and the spinach artichoke dip is mediocre. Notably, the steak and Gouda sandwich was a disappointing failure, featuring an undercooked, fatty slab of meat, leading to its well-deserved removal from the menu. Despite this oversight, the lack of managerial attention upon its return was disappointing. Nevertheless, the establishment's strengths outweigh its culinary shortcomings, ensuring a continued loyal following, provided the kitchen operations undergo necessary improvements to match the exceptional beer program and ambiance.

If you're craving delicious chicken and flaky biscuits, this place is a must-visit. While the wait can be long, the mouthwatering biscuits and honey make it worthwhile. The biscuits are an absolute standout, cooked to perfection. Plus, with multiple locations, you can conveniently satisfy your cravings wherever you are. Prepare for a wait, but trust that the fantastic biscuits and chicken will make it all worth it.

Visiting this indoor water park during a mid-week off-peak period provided a relatively uncrowded and enjoyable experience. The facilities were well-maintained, with clean bathrooms and immaculate water areas. The lifeguards were attentive and friendly, contributing to a pleasant atmosphere. However, the water and air temperatures were slightly chilly, and the park itself was on the smaller side compared to others, with only two major slides, one group slide, a few areas for younger kids, a lazy river, and a simulated surf area. The periodic closure of the main slides to accommodate the surf area due to staffing limitations was a minor inconvenience. While the off-season pricing was reasonable, and discounts like AAA membership could provide additional savings, the experience might be less satisfactory during peak times when the park is crowded. Overall, timing your visit carefully could result in an enjoyable afternoon at this indoor water park.

Impeccable interior design, friendly staff, and exceptional food make this establishment a standout. The sauce and toss special for wings is a must-try, offering a unique and delightful twist on the classic dish. With plans to explore other menu offerings, this place has already left a lasting impression. Highly recommended for those seeking a memorable dining experience.

The food was delicious, but the service left much to be desired. Our waitress was rarely present, and she brought the check before we had finished eating, which was incredibly frustrating. While the other staff members seemed to do their jobs properly, the poor service from our assigned waitress marred an otherwise enjoyable dining experience. If the service issues could be addressed, this restaurant would be a real gem.

The squid steak at this restaurant was undoubtedly the highlight, with an amazing flavor that made it the best I've ever had. However, the experience was marred by extremely slow service and overpriced menu items. Despite ordering a variety of dishes, we had to constantly wave down the waitress for drinks, and the food took an excessively long time to arrive. While the culinary quality was impressive, the poor service and steep prices prevent me from giving a higher rating. If these issues were addressed, it could have easily been a four-star establishment.

An absolute delight! The entire experience was top-notch. The delectable food, combined with exceptional service from our fantastic waiter, made for a truly memorable dining occasion. The cheesecake was a standout dessert, leaving us eagerly anticipating their renowned cinnamon rolls on our next visit. We will definitely be returning to this outstanding establishment.

Meijer is a convenient and amazing store, but the in-store Starbucks kiosk leaves much to be desired. The employees seem inadequately trained, often having to refer to guides for pricing and drink preparation. The drink quality is inconsistent, and when a customer reported an issue with their drink, the employee's solution was unsatisfactory – simply diluting it with more milk rather than remaking it correctly. For $4, one expects a properly made beverage, not a improvised fix. While the store itself is great, the Starbucks experience needs significant improvement in employee training and quality control.

Dawn Patrol is a must-visit for their outstanding eggs, which are hands down the best I've ever tasted at a restaurant. Their hash is another highlight, generously portioned and delicious. While the burgers received praise for their flavor, they could benefit from additional toppings like melted cheese. On the plus side, all their pastries, bread, and jellies are homemade and absolutely delightful. Overall, Dawn Patrol excels in their breakfast offerings, but their burgers could use a little more attention to detail.

A late-night visit to this establishment left us with limited options, as most of the hot food items were already sold out. We settled for an individual pizza, which had a crust that was too thick for our liking. However, the highlight of our visit was discovering Scharffenberger chocolate while browsing the store, which was a delightful treat. It's worth noting that the staff appeared exhausted by 8 PM, likely due to the demands of the day. While the pizza may not have met our expectations, the chocolate saved the experience.

Delicious burgers and unique fry toppings make this a must-try lunch spot. The cheeseburger with avocado and the "ranchero fries" (fries topped with ranch, cheese, and tomatoes) were standout dishes. However, the slow service during a relatively quiet time was a minor drawback. Overall, it's a 4-star experience thanks to the tasty and creative fare, but the kitchen could benefit from a bit more efficiency when it's not slammed.

An outstanding dining experience! The food was excellent, particularly the crab cakes which were awesome. The service was top-notch, with a special shout-out to George for being super nice. Overall, it's just a great place to eat and highly recommended.

Winters Creek Lodge provided an exceptional wedding experience. The venue itself is breathtakingly beautiful, with stunning views that left guests in awe and resulted in amazing photos. Judit, the coordinator, was outstanding – organized, flexible, and instrumental in bringing our vision to life. While tastings are not offered, the food was delicious and a pleasantly surprising highlight. Pricing was also competitive for the area. We wholeheartedly recommend Winters Creek Lodge and cannot speak highly enough of Judit's exceptional service. An absolute rockstar venue and team!

Kanella, a cozy Center City BYOB, offers an exceptional Greek brunch experience that's a refreshing departure from traditional American fare. Their standout Cyprus Breakfast, featuring perfectly cooked sunny-side up eggs, grilled Greek ham, crispy fried halloumi, and fresh accompaniments, is a must-try. The menu showcases an impressive array of traditional Greek, Mediterranean, and Middle Eastern specialties like Avgolemono, Moussaka, and Shaksouka. While the service can be overly attentive at times, the staff's warmth and hospitality are commendable. Reservations are highly recommended due to the restaurant's small size and popularity. Overall, Kanella delivers a stellar brunch experience that's sure to kickstart any weekend on a delightful note, making it a top contender for the best brunch in Philly.

Subpar Sandwiches, Salvaged by Gravy Fries: This establishment earns a meager two-star rating solely due to their gravy fries being a saving grace. The sandwiches, however, are a dismal letdown. Poorly sliced, tough, and dry meat renders them borderline inedible, with the pork sandwich being a particularly egregious offender. The baffling meat preparation results in a rubbery, unappealing texture that defies basic sandwich enjoyment. While locals may sing its praises out of familiarity, discerning palates would be better served by opting for a more edible option, even from a convenience store like Wawa.

Avoid this place at all costs! It's a shady business that seems more interested in making a quick buck than providing good service. Red flags include cash-only transactions, difficulty with returns or exchanges, and selling damaged merchandise. They appear to discriminate against smaller customers while giving contractors preferential treatment. I discovered too late that I had been sold a defective product with no recourse for resolution. Don't make the same mistake I did - steer clear of this establishment. There are far better and more reputable options out there. Save yourself the headache and take your business elsewhere.

While the service and staff left much to be desired, this barbecue joint redeemed itself with its tasty offerings. The pulled pork, although more chopped than expected, was satisfying, and the brisket tacos and moist pulled chicken were definite highlights. The sides were decent but unremarkable. Despite the lack of ribs during lunch hours and the unacceptable state of the bathrooms, the flavorful food made our $60 bill for five (including one kid's meal) somewhat justifiable. If they could improve their customer service and cleanliness, this place could be a real gem.

While certain noodle soup and rice dishes at this Chinese restaurant offer an authentic taste, other items seem to cater more to an American-Chinese palate. The duck was disappointingly fatty with minimal meat. Additionally, some stir-fry dishes featured odd vegetable combinations that seemed out of place. As for the service, it was typical of many Chinese restaurants – efficient but lacking warmth. Overall, the quality is hit-or-miss, making it a somewhat unreliable choice for those seeking a consistently authentic Chinese dining experience.

With great prices, convenient online scheduling, and an overall fantastic team, Andre's Salon is a rare find that truly deserves your patronage. If you're seeking a comfortable, high-quality hair salon experience, look no further than Andre's.

The Bobba House offers an incredible and one-of-a-kind dining experience. Their standout dishes, the bobba (bubble tea) and the pork pancake, are simply outstanding. The flavors are absolutely amazing and will leave you craving for more. Highly recommended for those seeking something truly unique and delicious!

Prohibition Taproom is a delightful old-school bar in Philadelphia that transports you to the West with its long bar and laid-back vibe. The atmosphere is relaxed and conversation-friendly, though the jukebox might liven things up later in the evening. The service is excellent, with knowledgeable and attentive bartenders. While the beer selection is decent with a solid local IPA on tap, the wine options are limited. The small menu packs a punch, particularly the standout brat plate with delicious sausage, German potato salad, sauerkraut, pretzel, and a zesty salsa/relish. Other highlights include the elote (corn) and cucumber salad. However, the bar's location in a somewhat rough neighborhood might give pause to some visitors, especially at night. If you're seeking an authentic, unpretentious bar experience with fantastic food, Prohibition Taproom is a hidden gem worth checking out, but exercise caution when exploring the surrounding area.

On the Run is a convenient one-stop solution for refueling and grabbing essentials before returning rental cars at Lambert-St. Louis International Airport. Its prime location eliminates the hassle of searching for a nearby gas station. However, the unusual pump instructions, requiring customers to press the payment button before swiping their card, can be confusing for those accustomed to the standard procedure. Overall, On the Run is a time-saving option for travelers, but the unconventional pump operation may require some adjustment.

This historic site offers a delightful and personalized experience. With meticulous maintenance, the building itself is a highlight, and visitors may find themselves enjoying a private tour from the knowledgeable Park Ranger staff. An added bonus for National Park enthusiasts is the opportunity to collect unique stamps, making this a must-visit destination for those seeking an engaging and memorable adventure.

While the service was great and the restaurant was clean, the food left much to be desired. The linguine with marinara was fine, but the rotini primavera was a major disappointment. The sauce had a great flavor, but the vegetables were shockingly from a frozen bag, complete with ruffled carrots reminiscent of Bird's Eye mixed vegetables. In a city like Tucson, known for its abundant fresh produce, it's inexcusable for a restaurant to resort to using subpar frozen vegetables. Overall, the experience was a mixed bag, but the lackluster primavera dish was a letdown.

Fresh Market had friendly and helpful staff, particularly Thomas in the meat section, which was a positive aspect. However, the overall experience was disappointing. Issues included poorly sliced Swiss cheese that became a clump within two days, bad ricotta cheese despite being within the date, tomatoes that went bad quickly, dry and tasteless pound cakes, and inconsistent information about cash back limits from different employees. Additionally, the selection was poor, and prices were considered very high. Despite convenient parking and a clean store, the negatives outweighed the positives, making it an unsatisfactory shopping trip. The reviewer suggests sticking with other grocery stores like Weaver's Way, Whole Foods, or Wegmans instead.

If you're in the Fletcher Place area looking for a no-frills, hole-in-the-wall bar with a relaxed vibe and delicious fried snacks, The Dugout is a must-visit. This cozy spot offers a decent beer selection, including Sun King drafts for $4.50, and happy hour appetizer deals. But the real standout is their hot pepper cheese balls – fried, peppery goodness that will keep you coming back for more. With a nice, laid-back atmosphere, The Dugout is shaping up to be a neighborhood favorite, reminiscent of the beloved J Clydes. After just one visit, I'm already excited to return and indulge in those addictive cheese balls again.

While the service was efficient, the lone employee seemed overwhelmed handling most of the work. Overall, the Big Scoop earns an easy four stars, especially considering the lack of competition in the area for quality ice cream. It's a solid choice for satisfying your sweet tooth cravings.

Saguaro East: An Average Desert Experience. While the visitor center and staff were pleasant, the park itself lacked the wow factor. The hiking trails offered little more than flat, unremarkable desert landscapes readily available in the Phoenix area. If you're looking for a typical desert hike, it's acceptable, but don't expect anything particularly special or memorable at this location.

An outstanding shopping experience! The staff at this store is incredibly friendly and accommodating, even when we visited just before closing time. Their website offers generous 40% off coupons on regular-priced items, essentially ensuring you'll always get a great deal. The combination of exceptional service and fantastic discounts makes this a top-notch retail destination. Highly recommended!

Tucked away in a lively neighborhood frequented by locals, this coffee shop offers a versatile space for getting work done, people-watching, or grabbing a quick coffee on the go. With extended hours, it caters to early risers and night owls alike. While the food options may not be the cheapest or most authentic, they're a healthier alternative to greasy fare. Be prepared for fluctuating crowd levels, as the shop can go from bustling to quiet within moments. The service quality varies, but the staff remains accommodating, even during rushes. Settling in for an extended stay is encouraged, and ordering refills is expected. Notably, this New Orleans gem even allows patrons to add a shot to their coffee, embracing the city's spirited culture. And don't forget to try their tempting tall cookies before leaving.

A Disappointing Bouncer Experience: Unfair Treatment Despite Being on the Guest List"

In this review, the author recounts a frustrating experience at a venue where they were supposed to be on the guest list. Despite being invited by their friend who was DJing, the author was shoved through the front door before being able to show their ID or verify their guest list status.

When the author tried to explain the situation to the bouncer, they were met with accusations of trying to sneak in without paying, despite their efforts to clarify the misunderstanding. The bouncer's behavior was unprofessional and dismissive, as they belittled the author and refused to acknowledge their legitimate presence on the guest list.

Ultimately, the author was denied entry, despite being an invited guest, solely due to the bouncer's rude and dismissive attitude. This experience left a sour taste, leading the author to vow never to return to the establishment due to the poor treatment they received from the bouncer.

This review serves as a cautionary tale about the importance of proper training and professionalism for venue staff, as a single negative interaction can significantly impact a patron's overall experience and willingness to return

Nick's offers generous salad portions, with the Greek salad being a standout. Their rustic roast beef sandwich is highly recommended and sets this location apart from other Nick's spots. While the pizza may not be exceptional, it's decent, and ordering an extra-large size is advisable when hosting guests, as it's likely their best pizza option. Overall, Nick's is a solid choice for salads, sandwiches, and a decent pizza option for groups.

Overall, it's a highly recommended place with a cool atmosphere and fantastic pizza and beer offerings. The clunky ordering system is a minor drawback, but the positives outweigh the negatives. The reviewer backs this establishment and seems eager to explore more of the menu.

New St. Louis Wok is a reliable choice for Chinese delivery in the area. With prompt service, usually within an hour, and the convenience of online ordering, it eliminates potential language barriers. The food itself stands out as the best Chinese delivery option, with well-prepared dishes that are not greasy, and arrive piping hot. Extras like ample sauces and fortune cookies add to the enjoyable experience. For those rare cravings for Chinese cuisine, New St. Louis Wok is the go-to spot, consistently delivering quality and convenience.

Osaka Sushi is an absolute gem! It's my go-to spot for delicious and affordable sushi rolls that never disappoint. The flavors are amazing, and the freshness of the ingredients shines through in every bite. If you're looking to try a new sushi place, I highly recommend giving Osaka a try – you won't be disappointed!
In its current state, Kelly's is a mere shadow of its former self, a disappointing transformation that has stripped away the charm and culinary magic that once made it a beloved destination.

Highly recommended! This place is an excellent choice for a daily workout routine. The variety of unique and knowledgeable instructors offer beneficial classes that lead to noticeable improvements in strength and flexibility. The monthly membership is well worth the investment.

What was once a go-to spot for a quick and convenient meal has become frustratingly unreliable. The staff's inability to handle basic transactions, such as providing change promptly, has led to unnecessary 10-15 minute waits on multiple occasions. This was a minor inconvenience compared to the final straw – receiving the wrong order entirely. Despite providing exact payment, the food brought home was incorrect, with warm dishes arriving cold and sushi orders mixed up. It's a shame because the quality was once good enough to warrant weekly visits. However, the repeated mistakes and inefficiencies have lost them a once-loyal customer from the neighborhood.

Despite the restaurant's decent pizza and in-house service, the unpleasant encounter with the delivery driver casts a shadow on the overall experience. The driver's accusatory tone and unfounded suspicion created an uncomfortable situation for the customer, who was simply trying to enjoy their meal without being stereotyped or made to feel unsafe in their own neighborhood. While an occasional negative interaction can happen, this incident raises concerns about the restaurant's hiring and training practices for their delivery staff.

Cake Life in Fishtown is a delightful new addition to the neighborhood. The clean and inviting bakery showcases beautiful cakes, a testament to the talents of their skilled bakers. While the bourbon pecan cookie was a standout with its well-balanced sweetness and nutty bites, complemented perfectly by a hot coffee, the cupcakes were a bit of a mixed bag. The cake itself was moist and sweet, but the icings fell short of expectations. The chocolate chip cookie, however, received rave reviews from others. Overall, Cake Life is a promising bakery worth revisiting, especially for their custom cake orders.

The Rock Inn is a great spot for affordable drinks and tasty pub grub. The $5 domestic pitcher during happy hour is a steal, and the wings and gyro were delicious. Service was a bit slow initially, but improved after the initial delay. The free rock n roll bingo on Thursdays adds a fun, lively atmosphere, and the pool table and darts provide additional entertainment. While the portion sizes could be more generous, the overall experience was enjoyable, and we'll definitely be returning.

Johnny Tucci and his videography crew are simply outstanding. Their professionalism, punctuality, and immense talent shine through in their breathtaking wedding footage, which felt like a movie production. Their work is so emotionally captivating that it brought everyone who watched it to tears. If you're planning your special day, splurging on a videographer like Johnny Tucci's team is an absolute must – they deliver an unforgettable experience that won't disappoint.

Overall, Citizens Bank Park delivers an exceptional game day experience, combining a beautiful modern facility, affordable pricing, and an electric yet welcoming atmosphere that makes it a must-visit destination for baseball fans.

Once a beloved spot for their signature salads, this Cosi location is rapidly declining in quality. Despite being known for their salads, my recent orders have been consistently flawed. The signature salads have been assembled incorrectly and arrived without any dressing, which is unacceptable for their specialty item. I'm frustrated by the lack of care and attention, as accurately making their trademark salads should be a basic expectation. Unless drastic improvements are made, I cannot recommend this Cosi based on my latest disappointing experiences.

Rembrandt's, a beloved establishment in the quaint town of Eagle, recently reopened after a remodel under new ownership. Unfortunately, the remodel has stripped the place of its charming, cozy atmosphere that patrons had come to love. Instead of restoring and enhancing the beautiful old church building, the new owners have transformed it into a cold, modern, and impersonal coffee shop. The remodel has sacrificed the unique character and charm that made Rembrandt's a standout in Eagle. This is a disappointing loss for the town, which prides itself on preserving its historical buildings and quaint ambiance. The review urges local business owners, particularly those operating in Eagle's original buildings, to prioritize maintaining and restoring the town's old-world charm and avoiding cookie-cutter modern renovations that erase the distinctive appeal of these spaces.

Disappointing dining experience. The service was extremely poor, with inattentive and unknowledgeable staff forgetting requests. While the food presentation looked attractive, the taste was severely lacking, with stale waffles, rock-hard biscuits, and a subpar chorizo dish. The only redeeming qualities were the nice atmosphere and decent alcohol selection. Overall, the lackluster food and terrible service make this place difficult to recommend.

This restaurant offers a cozy dining ambiance and a diverse menu. While their burgers are a standout item, the pizza crust could use some improvement in terms of texture. However, the overall experience is satisfactory, especially if you're in the mood for a tasty burger. The comfortable seating area adds to the enjoyable dining experience.

Review: Disappointing Dining Experience at a Once-Beloved Local Restaurant

As longtime residents and patrons of this neighborhood eatery, we've witnessed a concerning decline in its quality and service. During our recent Sunday dinner visit, we were met with filthy bathrooms – one was rendered unusable due to overflowing paper towels in the toilet, while the other lacked basic toilet paper. Our server, Ashley, displayed a shocking lack of customer service, responding defensively to a simple inquiry about beer specials. When my daughter accidentally spilled her drink, an understandable accident, Ashley failed to conceal her annoyance, despite our sincere apologies. Moreover, the chicken quesadilla was a disappointment, containing more gristle and fat than actual meat, making it nearly inedible.

While we've cherished this restaurant's proximity and past excellence, the subpar conditions and poor service have left us disheartened. With numerous high-quality dining options available in the surrounding Northern Liberties and Fishtown areas, we are unlikely to return until significant improvements are made.

The [Bar/Restaurant Name] offers a standard menu with typical offerings for this type of establishment. While the food itself was merely passable, the exceptional service from the staff made for a pleasant dining experience. If you're looking for an average meal but great service, this place fits the bill.

Don't let the unassuming exterior fool you – this hidden gem serves up some of the best home-cooked comfort food in town. The BLT was a standout, packed with flavorful bacon and fresh veggies. The accompaniments were equally impressive, with crispy, delicious French fries and a tangy, top-notch coleslaw. Even the pies to-go were a hit. Despite its modest appearance, this place delivers a satisfying, down-home dining experience that will have you returning for more.

The customer service at this establishment was excellent, with friendly staff greeting me upon arrival. The wait time for my food was impressively short, and my order of a chicken bacon croissant with chipotle sauce was served promptly, just 20 seconds after being cooked. The meal itself was delicious, and the staff's attention to detail in cutting the croissant in half as requested was appreciated. Overall, a great dining experience with efficient service and tasty food.

As a Thai food enthusiast who has extensively traveled to Thailand and Southeast Asia, I can confidently say that this place offers truly great Thai cuisine, a rarity in Nashville. While the decor may be a bit dated, the food is absolutely fabulous and outshines any aesthetic shortcomings. If you're craving authentic and delicious Thai flavors, this restaurant is a must-visit.

An absolute must-visit for donut lovers and non-fans alike! Despite being averse to sweets, this place has converted me into a believer with their exceptional donuts. The apple fritter is a heavenly delight, and the chocolate long john is a surefire winner. Forget other donut shops in St. Louis – this establishment reigns supreme. Highly recommended!

This cozy yet lively New Orleans restaurant was an absolute standout during our visit. With exceptional service and a warm ambiance, it quickly became our top pick. The spicy fried chicken lunch special is a must-try, and for parties of two or three, the corner booth by the window offers the best seating in the house. Be sure to call ahead for reservations, as availability on OpenTable can be limited. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that shouldn't be missed.

This shaved ice shop near City Park is a real gem, especially during New Orleans' sweltering summers. With an incredible variety of over 50 flavors, it offers an affordable and refreshing respite after a visit to the park. I opted for the small regular shaved ice, which was surprisingly generous in portion for just $1.50 – an unbeatable price! Even with added toppings, the cost is unlikely to exceed $5, making it a budget-friendly indulgence. The shaved ice's icy coolness and sweet flavors provide the perfect antidote to the oppressive heat and humidity. If you're looking for a delightful and inexpensive way to beat the summer heat, this unassuming spot is an excellent choice.

Mr. X offers a delightful pizza experience with its amazing flavor and friendly staff. The hand-tossed crust, reminiscent of traditional NY-style pizza, boasts excellent flavor and texture. The carry-out wait time of approximately 20 minutes is a significant advantage over the typical 45-minute wait at chain pizzerias. Overall, Mr. X is a highly recommended choice for those seeking an authentic and satisfying pizza dining experience.

The Brass Tap was a nice, clean, and well-decorated bar with a good beer selection, but it lacked atmosphere during our visit. Despite arriving during happy hour, the place was practically empty with just a couple of other patrons. The attractive and friendly bartender did her best to provide good service. While there's nothing inherently negative about the bar itself, the lack of energy and liveliness made for a rather dull and boring experience. It could be a decent spot for a casual drink if you're in the area, but don't expect a vibrant, happening scene.

The in-store service at this particular Starbucks location is severely lacking. Over the course of a few weeks, I visited six times, and only once did they get my order right. On my most recent visit, a simple order of two tall decaf coffees took nearly 20 minutes, causing my bagels to go cold. The staff provided confusing and contradictory explanations, blaming the brewing system without offering any real solution or apology. When politely addressed, an employee offhandedly mentioned a bizarre policy of only storing two venti-sized decaf coffees at a time, seeming indifferent to the poor service. The staff clearly lacks proper training in customer service and resolving issues. Despite multiple employees present, they consistently fail to fulfill even the simplest orders accurately. Unless significant improvements are made, I cannot recommend this Starbucks location due to the abominable service and disorganized staff.

The Oceanfront Restaurant offers a delightful ambiance with a talented piano player and picturesque bay views at sunset. While we enjoyed the tasty crab and corn chowder, and the standout dishes like the scallops and crab-stuffed grouper, some elements like undercooked rice and potatoes fell short. The attentive service from Tim and the overall experience make it worth revisiting, but the kitchen needs to perfect the execution of all dish components to earn a perfect rating.

Hidden Gem Popcorn Shop - A Delightful Experience! This cozy, vibrant shop offers a wide array of delectable popcorn flavors to sample. The knowledgeable owners take the time to understand your preferences and guide you to the perfect match. Their passion for their craft shines through in the delicious popcorn and warm hospitality. Highly recommended for popcorn lovers seeking a truly enjoyable tasting experience.

The new coffee shop in town has a cozy atmosphere and offers a wide variety of milk and sweetener options for their beverages. While their iced coffee was refreshing and hit the spot on a warm day, the limited food menu – primarily donuts and a dense vegan banana bread during our visit – left something to be desired. The lack of dedicated outdoor seating was a minor inconvenience, but we managed by using a neighboring restaurant's patio. Overall, it's a promising spot with great coffee, but the food selection could use some expansion, perhaps with breakfast sandwiches or other non-pastry options. I'll likely return to try their fancier coffee offerings, hoping for an improved food menu in the future.

Highly recommended! This cafe lives up to its reputation as the best coffee place in Philly. The space is inviting and immaculate, with the added bonus of complimentary tap and sparkling water. The prices are fair, and the staff is not only friendly but also knowledgeable, offering expert tips on brewing the perfect espresso. An exceptional coffee experience that I'll be sure to repeat soon.

Carvey's Pub is a quintessential Villanova tradition that delivers precisely what you'd expect from a college-town bar. With a lively atmosphere, a solid selection of draft beers, and a menu focused on pub grub, it's an ideal hangout for students and locals alike. While it may not be an upscale dining destination or a prime lunch spot, Carvey's embraces its identity as a no-frills watering hole. Reasonably priced drinks, tasty bar bites, and a vibrant ambiance make it a reliable choice for a night out with friends or a post-game celebration. If you're seeking a sophisticated dining experience, look elsewhere, but if you want to immerse yourself in the quintessential college bar scene, Carvey's Pub is a Villanova staple.

Exceptional customer service! Mary was an absolute gem – knowledgeable, friendly, and helped me find the perfect frames. The staff greeted me warmly from the moment I stepped in. Highly recommend this place; I'll definitely be returning!

The store delivers on its promise of offering discounted furniture at prices lower than name-brand stores. While the staff is friendly and non-intrusive, their product knowledge could be improved. The furniture quality ranges from low to moderate, but if you're seeking affordable or unique accent pieces, this is a great spot. The real draw is the potential for significant savings – I found a sectional priced $1,000 less than at a brand-name store. For budget-conscious shoppers willing to compromise on quality, the deals here are hard to beat.

A reliable go-to spot for any meal. The friendly staff and delicious food make this place a consistent winner. Whether it's brunch, dinner, or a quick lunch takeout, you can count on a enjoyable dining experience.

This restaurant offers a truly unique dining experience with an exceptional menu and impeccable service. Our server, Adrian, was an absolute delight, contributing greatly to the overall positive experience. The endive and beet salad was a lovely starter, and the tongue dish, while a departure from traditional preparations, was spectacular. The wine list was impressive, and the dessert rounded off the meal perfectly. An absolute must-try for anyone visiting the area, this restaurant deserves high praise for its culinary excellence and commitment to delivering a memorable dining experience. Bravo!
A complete disappointment. The subpar food quality is reminiscent of a mediocre chain restaurant. Save your hard-earned money and avoid this establishment at all costs.

Cozy Family Restaurant for Special Occasions, but Mediocre Food"

This cozy, family-friendly restaurant was transformed into a private venue for an engagement party, with reserved booth tables for presents, wine, and homemade desserts. The staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was conducive for a celebratory gathering.

However, the food left much to be desired. The Penne Fellini, advertised as having prosciutto di parma, peas, onions, and a light cream sauce, turned out to be a disappointingly sauce-heavy dish with little flavor distinction. The bruschetta and salad were equally unmemorable.

While the restaurant did an admirable job of accommodating the special occasion, the lackluster food quality makes it difficult to recommend for a dining experience alone. If you're looking for a cozy spot to host an event with friends and family, this place could work, but don't expect to be wowed by the culinary offerings

Impressive service for a recall fix! The staff at this Nissan dealership were incredibly friendly and communicative throughout the process of addressing the recall on our 1999 Pathfinder. Despite it being a simple repair, we felt valued and treated with the same level of attention as a new car buyer. Highly recommended for their excellent customer service.

This unassuming hole-in-the-wall restaurant is a true hidden gem. Don't be fooled by its vintage decor and alleyway entrance – it offers a delightful surprise with its delicious and unpretentious cuisine. The chicken hot pot, a standout dish, is the best rendition you'll ever taste. The seafood platter, packed with shrimp, scallops, and squid, is a steal at around $10, offering a generous portion. The beef in black bean sauce packs a delightful spicy punch. While the ambiance may not be fancy, the flavors are authentic and satisfying. This spot is perfect for adventurous diners seeking a genuine culinary experience off the beaten path.

Although the description may not seem appealing at first, this festival is an absolute must-visit. The dance performances are breathtaking, and the food is worth the long lines. The gyros and spanakopitas are standout dishes, but it's best to come with a group and share various offerings. Arriving with an empty stomach and patience for queues is recommended, as the food stalls serve quickly. With menus available, you can strategize your orders. This festival is a fantastic way to spend Labor Day weekend, especially for families. Despite being a first-time visitor, the reviewer plans to make it an annual tradition whenever in town.

While the brisket and cheese grits here are undeniably delicious, the take-out experience leaves much to be desired. Three separate orders resulted in missing items, a frustrating blemish on an otherwise commendable dining establishment. Dine-in is highly recommended to fully savor the tasty fare.

Provi's warm hospitality and the incredible chipotle chicken avocado sandwich and chicken noodle soup make this place a must-visit. The exceptional service and delectable dishes are truly worth experiencing. Highly recommended!

The Fountain is an excellent choice for a quick, affordable meal. While the menu is not extensive, they offer a great selection of inexpensive sandwiches, salads, and soups. Their Cuban Sandwich, made with a crispy French baguette and well-balanced ingredients, is highly recommended, especially for those who appreciate a good Cuban sandwich. The Royal Grille grilled cheese sandwich, with its blend of cheeses and apple slices, is also a standout dish that satisfies cravings perfectly. Additionally, their unique "spicy carrots" side dish, consisting of raw carrots marinated in a tangy, slightly spicy dressing, is a must-try. The food is served quickly, and the service is excellent. Overall, The Fountain is a solid choice for a delicious and affordable meal, and with a few more standout dishes, it could easily earn a 5-star rating.

Burger Up is a standout restaurant in Nashville, offering an exceptional burger experience with a cool hipster vibe that manages to be trendy without being pretentious. Their extensive menu caters to diverse palates, featuring outstanding beef, chicken, seafood, and veggie burger options. Highly recommended are the Woodstock burger with its heavenly Jack Daniels Maple Ketchup and Benton's bacon, as well as the indulgent truffle fries. Vegetarians will appreciate the flavorful and filling Troyathalon. Complement your meal with the refreshing 12 South Lemonade. The attentive and knowledgeable staff provide excellent service without being overbearing. While parking can be challenging during peak hours, the short walk is well worth it for the top-notch burgers and overall dining experience that Burger Up offers.

The Melting Pot offers a unique fondue dining experience, but the long wait for a table without a reservation can be frustrating. While the cheese fondue was delicious, the entree selection cooked in oil was less impressive. The private booth setting provided a romantic atmosphere ideal for leisurely meals. Overall, it's a hit-or-miss experience - the fondue is worth trying, but the main courses may disappoint. Reservations are highly recommended to avoid the lengthy wait. If you have the time and patience for a slow-paced meal, the ambiance and cheese fondue could make it worthwhile.

Las Cazuelas is a fantastic Mexican BYOB restaurant perfect for celebrations or a fun night out. The cozy ambiance, attentive service, and the ability to bring your own tequila for tasty margaritas made my birthday dinner with friends truly memorable. The menu features creative, inspired cuisine with a traditional flair, far exceeding expectations for a reasonably priced meal. The fresh guacamole, beautifully presented spicy shrimp entrée, and delicious mole sauce dish were standouts. The accommodating staff happily adjusted my order to suit my dietary needs. While not your typical taco joint, Las Cazuelas offers an exceptional foodie experience that's a must-try for those seeking elevated Mexican flavors in a relaxed BYOB setting.

An Exceptional Culinary Experience: This restaurant offers an outstanding Pakistani/Indian dining experience that has converted even skeptics into ardent fans. The lamb and rice dishes are meticulously prepared, with the latter boasting the perfect blend of spices that caters to both spice enthusiasts and those preferring milder flavors. The delectable cuisine, coupled with impeccable hospitality, elevates this establishment to one of the greatest culinary destinations. Highly recommended, even for those willing to travel from afar solely for the exceptional food.

An amazing culinary experience! The food was incredibly delicious, showcasing their excellence in various dishes. While their Bloody Mary was disappointing, it didn't detract from the overall fantastic dining experience. Their mojitos, however, were a refreshing delight. Highly recommended for those seeking a memorable meal.

After repeated disappointments elsewhere, I've learned my lesson – Jones will be our Valentine's Day go-to from now on. This restaurant is a failsafe option that consistently exceeds expectations, making it an absolute must-visit for anyone seeking a truly remarkable dining experience.

If you're looking for a venue to host a private event or celebration, Black Sheep is a top-notch choice. The combination of their welcoming staff, cozy ambiance, and commitment to delivering an outstanding experience makes it a true standout.

Quack & Cheese is a fantastic restaurant with a delightful lunch menu and top-notch customer service. The duck fries are an absolute must-try, praised for their deliciousness. While there was a minor hiccup with my portabello burger order due to unavailability of the right mushrooms, the staff promptly offered a substitute and even graciously allowed me to order something else when I couldn't eat the substituted dish. Their willingness to accommodate and cater to our entire party was truly commendable. Despite the slight menu issue, the overall experience was exceptional, making Quack & Cheese an ideal spot for a romantic date night or any other occasion.

Casa Garcia's interior décor, featuring a soothing fountain, creates a pleasant ambiance. The complimentary chips, salsa, bean dip, and tortilla soup were standouts, receiving high praise. However, the entrees fell short, with quesadillas criticized for being overly cheesy and lacking in flavor. While the sour cream and guacamole were fresh, the main dishes were merely average at best. Given the nearby competition, there are likely better Mexican dining options in the area. Overall, Casa Garcia offers a delightful atmosphere and appetizing starters, but the entrees leave room for improvement.

Joe's is an excellent seafood restaurant with outstanding crab dishes and delicious clam chowder. The service is prompt and welcoming, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Highly recommended for those seeking top-notch seafood in a friendly atmosphere.

This Starbucks location failed to deliver a simple iced coffee order correctly. My drink was filled with an excessive amount of coffee grounds at the bottom, rendering it undrinkable and unappetizing. As someone who relies on their iced coffee to power through busy days, this oversight was a major letdown. Better quality control is expected from a reputable chain like Starbucks. An unfortunate experience that left me dissatisfied."

My first experience at Dunkin' Donuts was far from satisfactory. The employee was blatantly talking on the phone with a friend instead of serving customers, making no effort to take my order properly. Worse, the donuts I purchased were rock-hard and inedible, clearly stale and lacking any quality control. Between the unprofessional service and subpar products, I'm hesitant to return unless significant improvements are made. 2/5 stars."

An absolute gem! This restaurant offers a trifecta of excellence: impeccable cleanliness, stunning ambiance, and mouth-watering cuisine. The staff's warm hospitality and attentiveness truly shine, creating a welcoming environment even for families with young children. From the outstanding food to the delightful experience, this place has rightfully become my new go-to favorite spot.

A delightful dining experience! The food was delicious and served promptly. Lyndel, our exceptional waiter, made the visit truly memorable with outstanding service. While the space felt a little cramped, it didn't detract from the overall awesome experience. Highly recommended!

Moreno Bakery & Cuban Cafe is a fantastic family-owned gem in Brandon. This cozy bakery offers a delightful array of freshly baked goods, from bread to cupcakes, flan, and cookies. Their standout item is the authentic Cuban sandwich, made with their special sauce that adds a delicious twist. For those with a sweet tooth, the almond sticks are a must-try – bursting with almond flavor and generously loaded with nuts. Moreno's is a local treasure, serving up sweet and savory treats in a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

Disappointing Experience - 1 Star. What was once our favorite Chinese restaurant has now left us with a bitter taste. Quite literally, as both my husband and child suffered severe stomach aches after dining here. The food quality has clearly taken a nosedive. Additionally, the delivery service was excruciatingly slow. Regrettably, we can no longer recommend this establishment and advise others to avoid it altogether.

One star review. Outrageous pricing for a basic tire repair. The $35.99 charge for fixing a flat tire is way too expensive, especially in an area with low wages. This seems like an unfair price gouging situation that takes advantage of customers. I would not recommend this shop due to their unreasonable and overpriced fees. Shop around for a more fairly-priced tire repair service.

An absolute delight! With delectable fare and out-of-this-world milkshakes, this establishment left me craving for more. It's a must-visit whenever I'm in the area, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

The mobile grooming service is an absolute godsend for pet owners with multiple dogs. The convenience of having a groomer come to your doorstep can't be beaten, especially when the pricing is competitive or even better than traditional groomers. At $60 for a 65lb dog and $40 for smaller dogs, including a bath, ear cleaning, nail grinding, and anal gland expression, it's a steal. The only downsides are the lack of teeth cleaning services, the same pricing for dogs regardless of size, and the potential for self-imposed judgment over inadequate grooming. Overall, for those seeking hassle-free grooming at a reasonable cost, this mobile service is an excellent choice.

Cozy Thursday night at this delightful spot with a James Taylor-esque vibe. The live music was wonderful, complementing the delicious food and friendly service. Their red Sangria was a particular highlight, perfectly refreshing. A great overall experience for a relaxing evening out.

A complete letdown. The food was bland, lukewarm, and shockingly tasteless for Mexican cuisine. Overpriced for the meager portions and lack of quality. An utter disappointment that wasted my lunch hour. Avoid this place and instead support authentic, locally-owned Mexican restaurants like Mi Pueblo for a far better dining experience.

This place is an absolute gem! With an impressive selection of craft beers, a lively atmosphere enhanced by great music, and top-notch friendly service, it's a must-visit spot. Don't miss out on the fantastic experience this establishment has to offer.

This bar is poised to become a local hotspot, offering exceptional cocktails and an absolutely must-try bar burger that's touted as the best in town. The brunch menu is equally delightful, making it a highly recommended destination for locals and visitors alike. Whether you're a resident or just passing through, this establishment promises a fantastic dining experience.

Disappointing Experience at [Salon Name]. Despite a beautiful salon with a wide selection of polish colors, the poor service and lack of professionalism from the technicians make it difficult to recommend. My recent manicure was a disaster – inconsistent nail shapes, no cuticle work, and no hand lotion applied. Previous visits have also been hit-or-miss. While the salon looks inviting, it seems they lack skilled professionals. I won't be returning.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience with its delectable food, outstanding service, and vibrant atmosphere. Despite a lengthy wait for the formal dining area, we were pleasantly surprised by the option to enjoy the full menu at the bar, where a lively band entertained us with live music. The attentive servers ensured a seamless experience. Highlights included the promptly served firecracker shrimp appetizer and the perfectly cooked salmon and swordfish entrees. The massive fish tank, featured on the famous TV show 'Tanked,' added an impressive visual element, complemented by the stunning views. Highly recommended for those seeking a memorable culinary adventure.

This cozy brunch spot offers a charming atmosphere, but be prepared for a lengthy wait during peak hours. The spinach, caramelized onion, and goat cheese omelet is a standout, though I'd recommend requesting a lighter hand with the goat cheese to balance the flavors. The fresh fruit was ripe and delightful. Note that the restaurant is cash-only.

If you're in Tucson, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit for its unique and outstanding Native American-inspired breakfast offerings. The pueblo dish alone is worth the detour – a true five-star culinary adventure!

This unassuming Vietnamese restaurant in a strip mall is a hidden gem. The pho, a warm and fragrant noodle soup, is a little bowl of heaven that ignited my love affair with the dish. The BBQ pork sandwiches, with tender and flavorful meat, fresh herbs, and a yummy sauce, were equally delicious. Despite being cash-only, the food is very reasonably priced. While I've yet to find pho as good elsewhere in Nashville, this place remains a standout for its authentic and delectable Vietnamese fare.

If you're seeking a sweet escape and a true treat for the senses, The Cake Bake Shop is a must-visit destination that will undoubtedly captivate your heart and taste buds. Don't forget to capture the magic on your Instagram @jordanqjordanq!

If you're a lobster lover, this casual dining spot is a must-visit. The Lobster special, featuring a 1 1/4 lb lobster, mussels, steamers, corn, and potatoes for just $19.99, is an incredible value. The clam chowder and Ucon lobster roll, drenched in melted butter, are also standouts. With great prices, excellent service, and delicious seafood, this place is a true gem for those craving a satisfying lobster feast without breaking the bank.

While visiting solely to pick up my father after an outpatient procedure, I had a positive experience at this facility. The receptionist was warm and welcoming, easily locating my father despite his difficult last name. She even praised him as a great patient, describing him as funny and cheerful. After a brief wait of around 5 minutes, my father emerged happy and mostly pain-free thanks to the injection he received. Although I cannot provide a comprehensive review, the staff treated me courteously during my short visit, leaving a favorable impression.

This intimate Caribbean-Spanish fusion eatery is a hidden gem! Their mojo chicken sandwich is an absolute must-try, boasting flavors that will transport your taste buds. The laid-back ambiance, coupled with friendly and attentive service, creates a delightful dining experience. What's more, the affordable pricing makes it a fantastic value for the quality of food served. Don't miss out on this neighborhood favorite!

Underwhelming Experience at the Hyped Restaurant. While touted as a beer lover's paradise, this establishment failed to live up to the buzz. The food was mediocre at best, leaving much to be desired. Although they boast an extensive beer selection, it's nothing extraordinary compared to other local bars catering to the craft beer crowd these days. Overall, there's nothing particularly noteworthy that sets this place apart from its competitors. A forgettable experience that didn't justify the hype.

This brewery is an absolute gem! The atmosphere is inviting, with a lovely outdoor seating area perfect for enjoying their top-notch beers. The staff is incredibly friendly, and their IPA is simply the best in town. While the prices are on par with other local breweries, ranging from $6-$7 for a pint, the quality of their brews is unmatched. Whether you're a hophead or just appreciate a well-crafted beer, this brewery is a must-visit.
Disappointing experience. Pizza delivery took over 30 minutes longer than the estimated time, arriving barely warm. Unacceptable service from this location, will not order from here again.

This ice cream parlor serves up some seriously delicious, high-quality ice cream that deserves the "motherfuckin" descriptor. The freshly made waffle cones and the option to enjoy your treat in an adult-friendly environment are major pluses. The owner, a Harvard graduate with a down-to-earth demeanor, adds to the appealing vibe. While the location isn't ideal for combining with a movie outing, the ice cream is so good that it's worth making a dedicated trip. A minor quibble about convenience doesn't detract from the overall fantastic experience. If you're craving exceptional ice cream in a welcoming atmosphere, this place is an absolute must-visit.

Overall, Western Cycle is a top-notch bike shop that combines an impressive selection, knowledgeable staff, and a commitment to customer satisfaction. Along with United Cycle, it's one of the premier destinations for cyclists in the area.

An absolute gem! This restaurant consistently delivers exceptional service and delectable cuisine, making it our go-to dining spot. From the warm hospitality to the flavorful dishes, every visit is a delightful experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a truly wonderful dining adventure.

Five Star Pizza lives up to its name with delicious, generously-sized pizzas at fair prices. While the pepperoni bites are a hit, steer clear of the disappointing cinnamon bites. The online deals and reasonable wait times make for a convenient experience, but be prepared to overlook the subpar customer service. Overall, a solid choice for satisfying pizza cravings, though the establishment could use some work improving staff friendliness.

While this restaurant deserves credit for accommodating our large group on short notice, my experience was subpar. The black spaghetti dish, highly recommended by others, was a disappointment. It had an odd, plastic-like texture and taste, making it one of the worst spaghetti dishes I've ever tried. However, my colleagues found their meals acceptable. The saving grace was the impressive drink selection. Given the mixed experiences, I'd be willing to give this place another chance if I revisit Nashville, but I'd steer clear of the black spaghetti.

This restaurant is a true gem in the mall! The service is lightning-fast, and the quality of ingredients shines through in every bite. The staff is friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall pleasant experience. Best of all, it's likely the healthiest option in the entire mall, making it a guilt-free indulgence. Highly recommended for those seeking a delicious and nutritious meal without sacrificing convenience.

An absolute gem! This place excels with its warm hospitality, inviting ambiance, and mouthwatering dishes. The sweet potatoes and gnocchi with blue cheese are must-tries, bursting with flavors that will leave you craving for more. It's so good, you'll be tempted to keep it a well-guarded secret! Highly recommended for anyone seeking an exceptional dining experience.

An absolute must-try for ice cream lovers! This place offers homemade, seasonal flavors with excellent customer service. They generously allow you to sample multiple flavors until you find your perfect scoop. The quality of the ice cream and the friendly staff make it a delightful experience that you don't want to miss.

Ask for Phil – he's a chatty server, but provides stellar service and great recommendations. The octopus tapas is a highlight, though it was slightly overdone on my last visit. While you can keep it light, expect to spend around $100 for two people with wine, dessert, and multiple tapas. The lack of private dining space is a drawback, hence the 4-star rating. Overall, it's a enjoyable tapas experience that's worth trying.

If you're a fan of IPAs, Urban South Brewery in New Orleans is a must-visit spot, especially if you're from Cincinnati and know your way around hoppy brews. This casual and laid-back brewery serves up some of the best IPAs in the city, according to those who hail from the IPA-savvy city of Cincinnati. With its low-key vibe and top-notch IPAs, Urban South is a great choice for beer enthusiasts looking for a relaxed taproom experience and expertly crafted hop-forward beers.

While the restaurant's ambiance was inviting, the sushi rolls left much to be desired. The tuna tartare was passable, but the other rolls had an off-putting taste that fell short of expectations. Although the restaurant provided a discount coupon as a gesture, the subpar quality of the sushi raises doubts about returning for another visit.

During a weekend baseball tournament, we had the pleasure of dining at this establishment three times. Each visit was a delightful experience, with outstanding food and top-notch service. Whether it was breakfast or sandwiches, every member of our group was thoroughly satisfied with their choices. This restaurant proved to be an excellent option for accommodating groups and families, making it a highly recommended spot for those seeking a hassle-free and enjoyable dining experience.

My absolute favorite store! It's a true delight to simply wander through the aisles. Surprisingly, the prices are incredibly reasonable for such a large establishment. I never feel overcharged or ripped off. The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, going above and beyond to ensure customers make informed purchases. Last winter, an employee patiently guided me through selecting the perfect tree stand, sharing invaluable expertise that prevented me from making the wrong choice. Their exceptional service and fair pricing make this store a standout.

This Aloft hotel was a major letdown compared to my usual positive experiences with the SPG/Aloft brand. The entire facility appeared poorly maintained and unclean, falling short of expected standards. The neighboring guests were disruptive, engaging in smoking and loud behavior until the early hours of the morning. Despite complaints, the staff seemed indifferent and failed to effectively address the situation, exhibiting a lack of professionalism. Overall, this hotel failed to provide a satisfactory experience, and I would recommend exploring better accommodation options in the area to avoid similar disappointments.

After moving to Nashville, I was worried about finding a great vet at a reasonable price. However, Dr. K at Parker's Paws exceeded my expectations. She is incredibly personable, and my dog felt completely at ease throughout the visit. Dr. K is upfront about pricing and explores the most cost-effective treatment options first while thoroughly explaining all alternatives. I wholeheartedly recommend Parker's Paws for outstanding and affordable veterinary care. 5/5 stars.

This establishment clearly lacks proper training for their staff in handling identification and treating customers with respect. I will be filing a complaint regarding this incident, as such discriminatory and unprofessional conduct should not be tolerated. Avoid this place unless you want to risk facing similar mistreatment.

For those willing to travel a bit, this Market in Center City is an absolute gem! The ground beef and babyback ribs are incredibly fresh and high-quality, making the slightly higher prices well worth it. Despite being located outside of Southwest Philly, this Market is highly recommended for its exceptional meat offerings and overall grocery shopping experience.

El Limon: A Hidden Gem You Can't Miss

If you're looking for a restaurant that defies expectations and delivers an unforgettable dining experience, El Limon is a must-visit. This unassuming establishment has quickly become a personal favorite, with four visits in a single week – a testament to its irresistible charm.

What sets El Limon apart is its commitment to using the freshest ingredients and mastering the art of spice blending. Each dish is a flavor explosion, meticulously crafted with a harmonious blend of spices that elevates the culinary experience to new heights.

But that's not all – El Limon offers an added bonus in the form of a charming market next door, where you can purchase the very spices that make their dishes so extraordinary, at prices that are almost too good to be true.

Whether you're a seasoned foodie or simply seeking an exceptional dining adventure, El Limon is a hidden gem that deserves to be discovered. Treat yourself and make a reservation today – you won't be disappointed.

With tasty cuisine, generous portions, and a convenient location, this little restaurant is an affordable hidden gem. Despite the lack of visibility, the quality of the food shines. I'm already looking forward to my next meal here.

A blatantly condescending and judgmental statement that stereotypes individuals based on arbitrary criteria like their educational background, fitness regimen, and fashion preferences. This shallow attempt at humor perpetuates harmful stereotypes and promotes an exclusionary mindset. Rather than celebrating diversity and individuality, it dismisses and ridicules those who don't conform to the author's narrow-minded norms. A prime example of toxic gatekeeping mentality that should be discouraged in a society striving for inclusivity and acceptance.

The Appetizer Platter with cheese and honey was a delightful start to our meal. The combination of flavors was well-executed and delicious. While not the cheapest option, the prices were reasonable for the quality of food served. The overall atmosphere was enjoyable, making it a pleasant dining experience. Recommended for those seeking tasty bites and a relaxing ambiance.

Thai Crave in Brandon is a hidden gem that deserves more recognition. The food is incredibly fresh, flavorful, and well-prepared, with the pad thai being a standout dish. The prices are very reasonable, especially considering the high quality of the cuisine.
