What truly sets Thai Crave apart is its impeccable cleanliness – the restaurant is spotless, to the point where you could eat off the bathroom floors. The staff is friendly and attentive, adding to the overall excellent dining experience. If you're in the Tampa/Brandon area, Thai Crave is an absolute must-visit for authentic and delicious Thai cuisine in a pristine environment.

Disappointing Experience at This Salon. Encountered bugs during previous visits, which is already a major red flag. During my recent visit for a spray tan, it was clear they were using outdated equipment. I could hear a customer in another room getting a superior spray tan service, but I was not offered the better option. Instead, I was stuck with an inferior "VersaSpa" machine that only sprayed twice, while the other customer was still getting sprays as I left. This leads me to believe they tried to cut corners and provide subpar service to make more money. The room wasn't even heated properly, further degrading the experience. I will be taking my business to Shine Salon from now on, as they seem to offer consistent and up-to-date services.

If you've never indulged in the flavors of Mongolian BBQ, this spot is an absolute must-visit. The experience of customizing your own bowl with an array of meat and vegetable options, then witnessing the chef's culinary magic unfold before your eyes, is truly captivating. And let's not forget the heavenly sesame bread – so irresistible that an extra piece is a necessity. It's a unique and delightful dining adventure that deserves a spot on every foodie's bucket list."

This place is a true gem for Sno-ball lovers! With an impressive selection of delicious and all-natural flavors, it's a treat for the taste buds. The friendly service adds to the wonderful experience, making it a must-visit spot. I can't wait to return and indulge in their fantastic Sno-balls again!

An enjoyable dining experience at this restaurant. The General Tsao Chicken and Curry Chicken were both delicious, with reasonable portions and pricing. The staff provided excellent customer service, bringing the food to our table. While seating is limited, there is an option to dine in. We will definitely be returning.

An exquisite dining experience! The 3-course meal was an absolute delight, with every dish bursting with flavors that surpassed expectations. Special mention to our server, Jenna, whose exceptional service, knowledge, and delightful personality elevated the evening to sheer perfection. The staff's dedication to making my birthday dinner a heavenly indulgence for the taste buds is truly commendable. Highly recommended for a memorable culinary adventure.

Mellow Mushroom is a pizza lover's paradise, especially for self-proclaimed connoisseurs like my husband. With a visit frequency of around thrice a month, it's safe to say we've become regulars, drawn by their exceptional pizzas. The Maui Wowie, a unique blend of pesto, chicken, bacon, pineapple, and banana peppers, is our go-to order. The crust is always cooked to perfection, achieving that coveted crunchy texture. Complementing the delectable pizzas is a great selection of beers. The service is consistently friendly, and we've never had to wait for a table. Without a doubt, Mellow Mushroom serves the best pizza in the bay area, making it a must-visit for any pizza enthusiast.

The restaurant offers delectable cuisine and a commendable level of attentiveness to customers' dietary restrictions. However, the beverage experience falls short, with disappointingly small pours and seemingly watered-down liquors, detracting from an otherwise enjoyable dining experience.

This donut shop serves some of the best donuts around. The dough is perfectly light and airy, while the icing strikes just the right balance of sweetness without being overpowering. These high-quality donuts are an absolute treat that can't be missed.

We finally made our way to Taste of Havana, and we're glad we did! The Pan con Bistec and Cuban sandwiches were absolutely delicious, with fresh, flavorful bread that left us craving for more. The inviting atmosphere and friendly service from Diana (or Dayana?) added to the wonderful experience. She shared the heartwarming story of how she and her father opened this labor of love. Taste of Havana is a must-visit for anyone seeking authentic Cuban flavors and a warm, welcoming ambiance. We can't wait to return and bring more friends to enjoy this hidden gem.

Tiki Tolteca in New Orleans is an absolute gem! The ambiance is fun and lively, with a beautiful non-commercial tiki bar vibe that's perfect for groups of friends or a romantic date. The cocktails, especially the scorpion bowl and piña colada, are delicious, and the fried shrimp taco and Jell-O-Shots/gummy tiki cocktails are innovative and tasty treats. The friendly bar staff enhances the experience. With its intimate yet spacious setting, Tiki Tolteca is a must-visit for locals and tourists alike. YES, YES, YES, I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! It's sure to become a regular hangout for anyone lucky enough to live in New Orleans.

Disappointing experience at this breakfast spot. Despite the long 40-minute wait to get seated, the service and food quality were subpar. The hot breakfast items were served cold, and the orders were not prepared as requested, even after sending them back. The waitress seemed indifferent to the issues, and we had to repeatedly ask for coffee refills. To top it off, we waited over 10 minutes just to get the check, which was pricey at $40 for a simple breakfast for two. Overall, the poor service and lack of attention to detail overshadowed any potential positives, making it an unsatisfactory dining experience.

Sukho Thai may not be the most authentic Thai restaurant in the area, but it delivers consistent quality food and service. The owner is a hardworking and gracious host who waits tables herself. While the menu selection is limited, their red and green curries are standout dishes, especially when ordered "native thai hot." The quirky location next to a go-kart track adds character. The only drawback is the lack of Kee Mao on the menu, which is a personal favorite. Overall, Sukho Thai is a reliable choice for flavorful Thai cuisine and friendly service in a unique setting.

Muriel's: A Haunted Gem with Delectable Cuisine

Nestled in the heart of Jackson Square, Muriel's is a captivating dining experience that seamlessly blends rich history, ghostly tales, and mouthwatering cuisine. Upon arrival, be sure to inquire about accessing the second level, where you can explore the lounge area adorned with red couches and decorative pieces, and step out onto the wrap-around balcony for breathtaking views of the iconic square.

As you delve into Muriel's storied past, uncover the haunting tales that add an air of mystery to this historic establishment. Discover the story behind the eternally set table for two near the stairs, a poignant reminder of the restaurant's intriguing history.

Muriel's boasts two main dining rooms, but the true gem lies in the indoor patio dining area. This serene oasis transports you to an outdoor haven, offering a quiet respite from the bustling city. The pre-fix dinner menu is a true indulgence, featuring a hearty seafood gumbo, perfectly cooked Dijon mustard-encrusted salmon, and the decadent bread pudding, all for a remarkable value.

For lunch, the wood-grilled pork chop is a standout, bursting with flavor and cooked to tender perfection. While the accompanying red beans and rice may have been a tad underwhelming, the pork chop itself is a triumph. It's worth noting that the dish's presentation could be improved by serving it on a plate, as the bowl made slicing the meat a bit challenging.

Muriel's is a culinary gem that masterfully combines history, ambiance, and delectable fare, making it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a truly unforgettable dining experience in New Orleans.

A delightful dining experience! The fried green tomatoes and vegan barq were excellent, complemented by an impressive beer selection. The ambiance was inviting, with a great vibe and pleasant background music. The friendly and attentive staff added to the enjoyment. Definitely a place worth revisiting.

This smaller Walmart in Meadowlark offers decent prices on groceries, especially in the snacks and canned foods sections, though produce selection is limited to basics. While grocery prices beat nearby stores, other departments like household items can be hit-or-miss in terms of selection and availability. Customer service is lacking, with few associates available to assist, and some younger staff behaving unprofessionally. However, checkout lines move efficiently despite having only a few cashiers at a time. Overall, it's a convenient option for affordable groceries if you don't need much assistance or an extensive non-food selection.

Overpriced and Inconvenient Yoga Studio. This place charges exorbitant rates with no apparent justification, making it much more expensive than other yoga studios in the area. Their 'two-for-one' introductory offer is deceptive, as the second session must be used within a short 14-day window. Adding to the inconvenience, the studio is located off a busy highway, making it challenging to access. Unless you have money to burn and don't mind the hassle, I would recommend exploring other yoga options in the area.
